First of all, it's full price for a 4 year old, so they already robbed you there. Food quality is awful. Prime Rib was chewy, crab leg is too salty, and the rest of the food was barely interesting. What drove down the experience is our server Linda, accusing our nanny for drinking a glass of Orange juice and decided to call their manager on us. Can you imagine how rude and embarrassing that is coming from a server and they are suppose to represent a brand image of Aria Hotel? We had just spent $250 worth of brunch and they're going to lose that entire business over a glass of $.10 cents worth of orange juice.   Manager did come over and apologize but it's way too late to fix things.   Completely unprofessional! FAIL!!! Will never ever return!

KY-alDHwVXx-V3NoNGFD5w.text: After a late night, and not much sleep we all decided that a good breakfast was in order. So we walked over toThe Buffet at the beautiful Aria Resort and Casino which was right across from our hotel the Vdara.   I noticed many of the reviews listed are for the dinner buffet, keep in mind this review is for the breakfast buffet.   The moment we arrived, i noticed quite a long lineup which lead me to believe two things, either its a very good buffet and its super busy, or the service was going to be bad. Well has it turned out (luckily) it was the first point. We waited for about 15mins before we were seated, not bad at all. You have to pay first before you can enter and the cost was 15.95! I was stunned, that is an amazing price for the breakfast experience I was about to have.   The Buffet is an open concept and bright space. The decor was very " vegas" in that it was chic and the consistent elements from outside the hotel were carried inside. Since the Aria itself is quite new in Vegas it was very modern and this translated to the decor inside. The tables were spaced out well, so that i didn't have others staring at my plate to see what I got. :)   The service was excellent. The lady that served our table was very attentive, friendly, and made some great suggestions on what to get.   The buffet itself was laid out quite well. You had lots of room to maneuver around to get to the food you want. But with this place, trust me you will want everything.   The food was fresh, you had your standard fare of eggs, bacon, potatoes etc, but you also had many unique dishes. Too many to list here.. The omelets are amazing...the Portuguese sausage..yum...they also had some chinese items in the buffet..the cakes..the fruit..you name it..it was amazing.   If your in Vegas and want a great breakfast buffet..you gotta try this place...forget the Bellagio breakfast buffet..its over hyped..food not as fresh.overpriced...but that is for another review..;)

WGrfit4KPG4ZPPwM8TgIew.text: Wow, this was the best buffet my husband & I have ever been to. Bottomless cocktails for just 12.99, and the best selection and freshness I've ever seen at a buffet. I will come back whenever I'm in Vegas from now on. We had multiple people tell us that Aria's buffet didn't compare to others on the strip (namely Bellagio) so we went to see for ourselves and we were not impressed. The buffet at Aria blew all others out of the water! We actually opted to eat here twice during our stay because we were so happy with it. No obnoxious lines, friendly staff who kept the drinks coming and our table clean. We mainly filled up on crab, seafood & the meat carving station but everything we tried was great. Very fresh and very tasty. The dessert bar was impressive with some very unique and delicious gelato flavors to try. I can't wait to come back and bring my mom because she will be blown away. Much love to the buffet at Aria, you guys are the bomb!!

photos.caption: Photo of The Buffet at ARIA - Las Vegas, NV, United States. 2 flans, watermelon gelato and Thai iced tea gelato... One word, divine...

60kcMpfsS-bsf61Wbu0nlw.text: Lots of choices from Indian Chinese Mediterranean Mexican to American. Sea food and meat choices were great. Desserts choices were enormous and drinks were included too.

sWyHPLPuFRjNJ8Ykd4DrsQ.text: I love it one of the best buffet Id try in my whole life for real maybe I'm not as picky as other people or maybe because i don't have money to try the most expensive buffets but food is food and I really enjoy it :)

pfJmXPBnRy2GtIbfH5Yong.text: WTH. For being in such a nice hotel, you'd expect the buffet to be just as opulent. But, it's like some random buffet. In fact, for the price you pay, I'd rather go to "those" kinda buffets for half the price....at least, you're not expecting much.  I went for brunch. And maybe, I'm an idiot but, they should serve BRUNCH. All the brunch I really saw was the breakfast foods, eggs benedict, and mimosas.  The Chinese food was HORRIBLE. Might as well go to Panda Express but, the difference is Panda's beef broccoli tastes good. The broccoli wasn't fully cooked and the beef was cooked too much....practically fried.  Sushi sucked. Although what can you really expect from buffet sushi, right.  Pizza sucked. I'd rather have those frozen pizzas you make at home!  Even the desert bar wasn't too crackin'...I mean, you have all the flavors of ice cream/yogurt/whatevs BUT, CHOCOLATE. Ughhh, fail. You gotta have chocolate...it's a staple!  I normally take pics of the food for the sake of my Yelp...but, this wasn't worth the time.

XiiXFN7OyoZvkVK8lkLkOg.text: I can't usually do a buffet justice but I went back four times for more food. It had some of the best variety I've ever seen. There was sushi, endless shrimp and crab legs, muscles, clams, crawfish, oysters...all delicious. There was an olive, meat, and cheese area. Thought I died and went to heaven. I was able to try out some Mediteranian food which I'd never had before. The list goes on and on.  Our waitress was quick to replenish drinks and wisk away dirty plates. She was also very good natured which can make or break any dining experience.  The dessert portion was meh but I'm not a huge dessert person.   We had a 2 for 1 coupon which helped keep costs down. We ended up paying just under $20 each. It is a costly buffet but well worth it. I'm dreaming about the day we can go back.

MUDCVAFlnFmXiFK0EvNtWQ.text: Good , solid place to enjoy while taking a break from the gambling. Ok food, nice atmosphere, medium high in price.

WKQ-5tX7x1LRqM8X0F0KIQ.text: Food was decent for the price you pay, alot cheaper than wicked spoon in the cosmopolitan hotel. However service for drinks is really good and you can't knock the selection of the seafood. Sadly though regarding the Asian selection is very small. Would go back.

tAo_vPn8-ddafH4U5ap41Q.text: I'm usually not a fan of the Vegas buffet but this one is alright. Doesn't stand out or anything but it everything you would expect from a Vegas buffet and is tasty for the most part.   Seafood. Great selection. Includes king and snow crab legs. I like the ones that are still hot (snow crab). The Mahi Mahi was okay  Service: not the best. They had one poor lady attending way too many tables. She tried her best but she needed some help for sure.   Wait: takes way too long to get to the front of the line. Took like 45 minutes.

dX0x3GcoELhjnlUvKiov3Q.text: Used comps from MyVegas here, they are a great value for the buffets.    So with buffets, I like to do a wide sampling to start, which Aria was great for.  They have a stations featuring a selection of cuisines, all done well, Asian, Italian, Indian, Latin, etc.  Some really surprisingly good choices were things like the mushroom polenta, the Brussels sprouts with bacon, and the cured salami.    I then like the focus in on the seafood, which they have a nice variety of here.  They were grilling up mahi mahi and swordfish so I got both of these, excellent.  Also had plenty of NZ green mussels, and the crab legs - which are pre-split for you, saving a lot of work.    Save room for dessert!  A huge dessert selection, loved the raspberry panna cotta and the flan the most.  Also, the have a good selection of gelato.    It might be expensive for a normal meal, but glad we had the MyVegas points to use on this.

JdjtqHz6BZljCeX0914JdA.text: This place has A LOT of selection. They do the whole different types of cuisine thing with Asian to Mediterranean. They have this "gourmet dinner" on Fri-Sun where you get unlimited white or red wine and a whole lobster for two. But it's like $40 a person.    Nothing really amazed me at this buffet. The best part for me was the gelato bar. Butterfinger gelato was the best of the whole buffet. The made to order pasta bar was pretty good too.

photos.caption: Photo of The Buffet at ARIA - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Gelato selection
Photo of The Buffet at ARIA - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Desserts
Photo of The Buffet at ARIA - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Whoopie pie

xpZcLgjYf0liJW5Vh6PDPg.text: Something like $30 for dinner per person.  Depending on the time (around 6 it gets really busy) otherwise there's room/hardly a wait line. The staff is very friendly but when it gets busy they ignore you a bit.  Unlike what a previous review said you start off with king crab legs/shrimp now (I went a day before and the crab/shrimp were at the end)... the shrimp is what I expect it to be for paying $30 and the crab is just alright.  Ask them to steam the crab!!! Important! It tastes much better + the butter.  There's sushi... avoid the nigiri (or rice + very little sashimi).  The fish isnt really what I expected.  Some of the sushi is alright.  I really liked the spider rolls.  There is a carvery station with turkey, flank steak, and prime rib (depending on the hour/day) they mix it up.  An Indian section with goat/curry/hummus/etc.  Then there is an Asian section where you can get won-ton noodles upon request (not too bad but I could get one near my house for 5 bucks).  They have a good asian carvery (One night was good peking duck and the next day was cantonese BBQ Pork).    There isnt really much of a fruit selection.  Then there's the dessert section.  The best part, honestly.  TRY THE CARROT CAKE! It's pretty good, not too sweet and well presented.  The Gelato and Macaroons are pretty good too!  Overall, it's a decent place.  Not amazing or anything and a little pricey.

E_61-GjZKvDhdYFDB3xXIA.text: This was my second or third best buffet in Vegas (after trying MANY).  We went there for lunch.  The place was very clean, very stylishly decorated and it was a real fun eating adventure.  Plenty of meal choices including a LOT of gluten-free, which my wife loved.   There was a really simple nectarine salad that my wife went back for 3 times.  They had sushi, italian style pizza slices (the kind with an egg on top - so classic!), just about everything for every taste!  Excellent carving station  Aria was really an incredible lunch choice~!  It was a bit pricey but we went on a Saturday.  Great job by Aria!

ZOcFjKo2WyxeeYVH2vvcYA.text: Good variety of food. Love the Mediterranean and the Indian selections (fresh Naan). Alaskan crab and shrimp is really fresh. My only caveat was that they don't do a good job replenishing the food when it's empty. The dessert station is worth checking out.

U1_vttcIhTgmzfE7agr3MA.text: Mediocre at best.  Gave it 3 tries. Won't come back. Most of the hot dish platters looked like they had been sitting there for ages.

SXeUpNzvhLBWeoaa75uuNg.text: Always my go to buffet while staying on the strip. I've been here four time and have never been disappointed. Food is always delicious and fresh. I normally go with a 2 for 1 and purchase additional bottomless beverages for $12.99 each. A steal for two hours of food and beverages!

LsbsFvatre5yqvOzegQRsw.text: Just visited at 10:00am, had omelette bar, different sausages, corned beef hash, biscuits n gravy, waffles, pancakes, etc. Ehh. Okay. Small which was fine because the quality was good and they offered lots of gluten free foods. I enjoy lunch foods more so I appreciated the crab legs, seafood paella, steak picado, meats, olives, and cheeses.  They have pizza, salsa, and Asian food too.  Not sure it was worth 32.95 per person but that's the comparable rate for brunch buffets. For an extra $6, you can add bottomless mimosas or bloody mary's to your brunch.   The waitress was nice but our soiled plates would stay on the table for quite  a while.   If you're at City Center stop by during the week or lower prices. .   *no line when we got there

qY1sb80aO6WWK9gxa17lTA.text: ***Saturday Brunch review*** ...This restaurant is for the health conscious crowd...  OK, it is a beautiful buffet restaurant.  Honestly, it is one of the most beautiful buffet we've every been to.  However, the food selection is not worth the price.  Maybe it is because I'm not a very health conscious person...I don't know, we were not satisfied.  * Ambiance = beautiful...new...very resort like...  The layout of the buffet is not customer friendly.  It's just a line of food from one end to another...if your favorite food is on the other side of the line, you gotta work for it.    *  Food = VERY healthy....gluten free options available...  My main thing is crabs so I was happy to see the snow crabs.  The problem is...it is cold/frozen, and they have such small portions displayed that people line up in line...it's kinda uncomfortable.  The dessert was pretty good.  Not as good as Paris buffet desserts but I liked them.    * Service = Good.  Pretty attentive.    * Price = Expensive.  We paid $35/person.    If you want to gorge on crabs...don't come here...you will definitely be uncomfortable.

Cla6ZxkNsh7BgNv2AT0ESQ.text: one star is too high for this buffet. I have been here once before when they first open and it was great. they had jumbo shirmp, sashimi and everything taste good   however, came here for lobster night on new year day, I was disappointed. it's about $45 per person. you can only get half lobster per person for the whole meal. the worst of all, the lobster looks green in the center. I have never seem lobster that's green color. so I ask the waitress to change for a normal one. and she says it's all like that so I demand to have the price deducted from our bill. so after waiting 20 minutes she brought me a white one.(a normal one)  all the food is really bad tasting  for the price they charge. you even have to peel the skin of shrimp yourself!!!!! what the..............?  desert bar is very small and very limited selection.  I left very unsatisfied and stomach half empty.

HyIeJYA6l69STJGmZZ-kYA.text: Beautiful ambiance, spacious & great food presentation. The quality of the food is thus far the best buffet I have been to. Great dessert selections. I love the made to order salad. I like how you can chose to include unlimited alcohol.

fn0Tg7FtP0RKGhaDqiPWtw.text: There's no doubt that other than gambling, you can't leave Vegas without having a buffet. However, the heydeys of Vegas are long gone with the cheap AND delicious buffets. Now everything is classed up and they come with a hefty price tag. This includes the buffet at Aria. For $56 for a dinner buffet, I have to say it was most expensive and disappointing buffet I've been to in Vegas. The place looks like they have a lot of variety but half of it are not what I would crave for at a buffet. I ended up mostly getting stuff from the Asian cuisine but even that was lacking. The dumplings/ dim sum looked like they have been picked through. The shrimp pad thai didn't have much flavor to it. I didn't try it but the the tandoori chicken was overcooked according to my friends. The best one was probably the mac n cheese drenched in truffle oil. Comes in a little iron cast dish, which could be a meal in itself. But overall, it was not worth the money. I would have rather eaten at McDs instead if only we weren't starving.

8LVJgqU8o-mebTS5Bq2EsA.text: The food selection for dinner is amazing! And I mean, at first I was pretty skeptical since the price was so high ($40+ for one person), and they don't differentiate prices for kids. Ages 3 and below are free, every age above that pays the same price. Otherwise, I'm so happy that we payed the pretty penny to be able to eat here for dinner. The complementary lobster was amazing and all the adults had complementary merlot as well.   I personally enjoyed the freshly made naan (Indian sort of "tortilla"), the American side dishes including gluten-free baby carrots and roasted asparagus, and the Margarita pizza. Lastly, their dessert selection with their cakes aren't like most buffets I've been to - the presentation was gorgeous for each cake or pie. On top of that, the buffet in general had a wide selection of international foods which I really enjoyed. One thing though - fix up your sushi selection for us sushi lovers, please :) I only had one piece of a california roll and even that didn't even really suffice. I was a little disappointed but everything else made up for it!  In all, 4 stars because that price to pay if you're only 18 years of age such as myself isn't fully worth it. I had a great time though! Our server was so nice, and not to mention the moist towels which were aloe infused and reusable was a very nice touch.

UhPXO4H6TzIIzTa38u-mng.text: One of the worse buffet I have ever been to.  First of, the crab legs,  no tasteless  and it's seems like the crabs are old and might have been recycled from the previous nights.  Second, hardly any good selection of food# downer.  Third, the price, too much for what it is that it isn't there at all.   take my word for it don't go, there are plenty of other buffets in Vegas. Come on, its Vegas baby!

zwOtxYAGMiLSRRXqyIDttQ.text: If I can best describe the Aria real estate, it would be a frigid fortress of modern and industrial lines.  With that, I surmise that its open floor-plan buffet dining room is aptly designed, resembling a mid-sized Silicon Valley tech company cafeteria or a strip mall's Todai.  This is not a compliment.  The food here mirrors the aesthetic; nothing stands out.  Everything is rigidly assembled without any artful flair similar to lesser off-strip buffets.  The seafood and meat selections here are dry, while the salad bar is just average.  This is made exponentially worse by the fact that the buffet items are limited.    The stand-out section, however, is their dessert bar and gelato.  Though half of the pickings here are highly flawed to inedible, the other half may satisfy your sweet tooth to some extent.    Though I have only been here twice, I must say that the wait and bus staff are friendly -- but, unfortunately, understaffed to be fully attentive.

N6l1SRVQJlsZJ1JNAQ5McA.text: Good value for money ($25.99+tax). Decent vegetarian (and Indian) choices. The food was delicious.

3gxJT433aG5C08ZYSwwZ6A.text: Haven't signed on in awhile but decided to update just for the sake of this buffet. Took a girls trip to Vegas a few weeks ago and stayed at Aria. Lovely hotel! So you would think the buffet would be at least decent. NOT!  The selection is horrible and as starving as we were, we barely ate 2 plates. (Mind you, I can do so DAMAGE at buffets) They tried to be sneaky by making 10 different dishes with eggs but they were not fooling anyone.  I would have rather thrown $30 at a complete stranger than eaten here. You've been warned!  Sidenote: There is nothing special about previously frozen, cut open crab legs that looked extremely unappetizing.

UsXRcGYvzUGYhDQFSXNx7w.text: This is a pretty decent buffet. I've gone to quite a few and this one always seems to hit the spot. On Friday and Saturday nights they offer lobster for two and unlimited wine with your dinner so ASK about it if they don't offer it to you.   Food:  There are some stations like the meat carving station, pasta station, and the dessert station that I should just stay away from they ALWAYS have good stuff happening there. You can have any kinda pasta made which is a delicious carb nightmare. The desserts always seem so fancy but they also have an ice cream and gelato bar! That with homemade cookies or either bread pudding and cobbler hits it home.   Service: This is hit and miss. Sometimes you can be seated in an area where the waitress is cool and attentive. There are other times when you have to go on a search and rescue mission just to get a drink refill.   I will keep coming here because I have yet to have a bad experience. I always leave full and satisfied.

0fZrXlL6gF9JYsbNHSe8kQ.text: I had a very good experience at the Sunday brunch buffet and would go again. The dimsum was not excellent quality compared to dimsum in the San Gabriel Valley, it was just OK. The fresh naan was excellent, and the chicken curry could use a little more kick. I did like the pork belly. The waffles and red velvet pancakes were fine. For $29, I was happy with the experience. The server was prompt with drinks, but we sometimes had to bus our own plates because they were so busy. Prime rib looked good but I was already full. They had extensive desserts which I did not have room for.

M7QzV6jB0n8gbb8DXgfvGQ.text: Our seats were shaking from people walking past our table next to the handicap ramp and the food wasn't the best quality. Crab legs were dry and the fruit looked like it was sitting out too Long. There are much better buffet deals in Vegas.

dElyxBMffdv13MLPyV49og.text: More food than you can possibly eat....But we tried anyway :-P They have every type of food you could imagine - classic American, Continental, salad, sushi, Chinese, Mediterranean, and so on, and so on....We also added the bottomless Mimosas because we were in Vegas after all! Everything we tried was good and thoroughly enjoyed the experience

SkWtSYepLxr00LFTevIrAA.text: I've checked out this buffet about three times for brunches. Overall, I liked the quality of the food, in particular, the eggs benedict (I'm a big eggs benedict person...and you can always tell the quality of a place by the quality of their eggs benedict!) We were always seated pretty fast and the staff was friendly. Price was decent as well. Only downside (for brunches anyways) was that there wasn't a huge selection and this buffet definitely is not as large as others. But, if you are looking for quality over quantity (or for good eggs benedict), I recommend checking out this buffet.

_yaX2NZ1c_vzNXPVgH8Saw.text: We had brunch. Got pineapple and orange juice. Service once you got in were great. The line was long. Lots of selections to choose from. Shrimp and grits was so delicious. Dim sum were over cook.

DSIYwipbeNnxIJzgTUFEXQ.text: Waited at least an hour an a Tuesday night.  The food was so-so, desserts were amazing, that's the only reason this review is not a 1 star.  However I promptly felt ill and suffered from food poisoning for the next day... And no, it was not from over eating.

GnaXR1ZAYM7h-YCMyOQjTw.text: My wife used her My Vegas rewards for a BOGO brunch at the Aria. I had very high hopes coming into this experience. I had experienced other Vegas Buffets at this point and was so excited to see what the Aria had to offer. The buffet unfortunately did not match what i was expecting. They Hotel and casino are so nice! It seems so upscale and the buffet just wasn't. Our service wasn't Either. Our plates were never cleared from our table, we had to ask for refills, and our server was not overly pleasant. Don't get me wrong, there were a lot of things we really enjoyed. The buffet offered a lot of options from all over the world. The food just wasn't great. It was standard buffet quality food. If i sound crazy i apologize. I know that its a buffet, but the Aria is anything but standard. So why would their buffet be? My wife didn't seem to "love" anything. She had two disappointing plates with loads of wasted food. I tried sampling as much as i could to get the most of my experience and really was underwhelmed by everything, Besides the desserts of course. We both really enjoyed all of the desserts we tried. We left satisfied with our meal because of how great the desserts were. I think if i were to come back to the Aria's buffet it would be for dinner, hoping that they do a better dinner than they do lunch. But with all that Vegas has to offer i most likely wont return because I will be more inclined to try somewhere new.

__LT2hK7L3i6h2C1JAiCEg.text: Mlife comp.  Awesome buffet, fresh, hot, delicious all in one.  Line to enter the buffet moved fast with Mlife membership card, the restaurant staff was very nice from the cashier to the table bussers, and the chefs.

photos.caption: Photo of The Buffet at ARIA - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of The Buffet at ARIA - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Love the desserts &amp; the lady chef winked at me :)

kJqVNDdHyhNRP1veB-3xBg.text: I liked this buffet a lot. It's a bit cheaper than the Wicked Spoon or Bacchanal Buffet and the selection is a bit more limited but I thought the quality was still solid.

u6TwOYcXqId3hId1E1X0aA.text: Seriously?! I really want to give them 0 star. We'Ve been asking them for drink so many times, and none of them came. I walked to one of the server, and told her about my situation and seriously no apology ?! And she talked back as well! I would not recommend this buffet and would not come back at all!

ZKGAlp57VH8E-TpVT134Dw.text: The food is mediocre. There was nothing impressive. Most of the food and the food label didn't match. The only reason I gave 2 stars because our waiter was pretty nice and fun to talk to.  However, the guy at the door where you pay was a jerk. We got the bottomless deal from a lady cashier at the door. But she forgot to give us wrist bands( they can't serve us drinks without the wrist bands). When I waited at the table, our waitress informed us about the wrist bands. Then I went to the front again to ask for 2 wrist bands with the receipt in my hands. The lady cashier was gone at the time, and it was that jerk who was on duty. So I showed him the receipts, and told him what happened. He looked at the receipt and said: I can only give you one wrist band, you have to bring the other party to the front to get his. I told him we started eating 30 mins ago and didn't even get any drinks, and now you want me to bring the other party to the front when you guys forgot to give them to us in the first place?! His answer to me was hey I didn't sell the ticket to you, it was not my problem.   Umm I thought in Vegas is all about service. I understand it was you didn't sell me the ticket and it wasn't your fault, but you work here. You supposed to solve the problem, not make it worse just because it wasn't your fault. I probably would made my company to come to the front to get the wrist band had he said anything other than what was said to us.   I am a business owner myself, and I know if my employees ever make such comments, he or she will be the first one to let go when the annual evaluation comes up. It is not about making the mistakes, it's about the mentality/attitude after the mistake occurs.   To sum up, 2 things will not make me to come back. 1, the food quality does not worth the price, even with the crab legs and lobsters(you can get better quality seafood at Costco with the same price  you pay here, and steaks/lamb rack as well, or just go try Bacchanal at Caesar). Noted, I said food quality. The restaurant made me feel messy and unclean. I guess it was the presentation of the food, and the quality of the seafood and meat. The table at the seafood section appeared to be very dirty and messy. Compare to all other buffets in Vegas, I think they did a bad job at presentation and clean up. The soup is always luke warm, or may be because I was placed at the further end of the table and I walk slow. Who knows?  The Asian food section looks super greasy and unappetizing because they let the food sit there forever without stirring it over. 2, the service really left a bad taste in my mouth.  I regret I didn't get the name of the guy at the front, but I was there on 11/24 somewhere from 6pm-8pm. The older Asian lady at the cashier was very nice, and the jerk might be the the one that was taking over her shift.

ia79M760497O3IrkBj3R_A.text: My wife and I searched quite a while to find the buffet where we would eat during our short, recent stay in Las Vegas. We decided on the Aria.  Several reviews and sites state that on Sunday, the Aria offers a champagne brunch. This is partially True. When you arrive, you pay the $30.99 plus tax for the buffet. After seated, you are offered the "opportunity" to add the champagne - $16.99 plus tax for unlimited. So if expecting a champagne buffet, this one will set you back $48 plus tax and tip.  We arrived at 2:15 and asked FOR A SEAT NEAR A WINDOW WITH A POOL VIEW.  The food was average. The prime rib was good. The shrimp was victim to sitting too long at room temp - mushy. The paella was simply dreadful. I took 3 bites - all 3 included shells from crab. Definitely skip this! The gelato was decent - however, the oreo-type cookie I also had was quite tasteless, although it looked like it should be great.  Then came the worst part of the experience. After being there 30 minutes or so, the blinds were lowered so there was no longer a view outside. We asked it be raised as we specifically asked for a table with an outside view. It was raised a couple of feet. A few minutes later, it was again lowered to the sill. I asked for a manager. She "explained" someone complained that they were bothered by the sun. I asked that it be raised to just above eye level so we could enjoy our view. The manager declined. She told us we could move. ???????????? Why not ask the guests that came in after we did, and who do not want an outside view to move????????   ok - so we moved so we could continue to enjoy the outside view. While finishing our dessert, we were brought our bill and asked to pay at that time for our champagne. No - we could not finish our dessert first, we needed to produce our credit card and pay-up.  I am convinced this was age-discrimination on the part of the manager. She felt we, as seniors, should "go quietly into the night". That was quite apparent during our conversation and her "talking down" to us.  Well - guess what - that's not going to happen. I will do whatever I can to share our unpleasant experience with the Aria.  (Note that we stayed at the Aria in July - 2 months prior to this visit. We had a terrific experience at that time.)  There are many buffet options in Las Vegas. My strong suggestion is to find one elsewhere.  *********************************************************************** I have subsequently been in contact with the Aria regarding this visit.  That conversation was professional and fair.  I will revisit the buffet upon our return and hope the feedback has led to changes - particularly with the manager we dealt with.

Y_EobUwyhtqCOgwpz5mlzg.text: My friend and I had the buffet for dinner and we both agreed it's one of the best buffets in Las Vegas. It was definitely worth the price. They offer so many different types of food it really accommodates everyone.

-th0e0w0nt69b93wcCyKjw.text: We went for the dinner buffet. Indeed all the crab legs you could eat. Also a roast carving station. I didn't give it a higher review because the all you could drink service was a little slow. I definitely got my money's worth, but it's not the best buffet I've ever gone to. Solid. Get the Myvegas app for a good coupon for this.

Pc4XeanCaSQo6SCI3q9x3g.text: A little disappointed in this buffet because all my life I've been hearing how AMAZING the buffets in Vegas are, and this was my first buffet experience.   I had brunch/lunch here and it was mediocre at best. It was about $40 a person because there's a 18% gratuity charge for parties over 6 or 8 (I can't remember). If you wanted to do bottomless mimosas/wine/champagne, then that's an additional $16.99 from what I can remember.   Although the buffet itself has a wide variety of cuisines, the selection felt a bit limited and repetitive.   The wonton soup here is good! The wontons it self are delicious, and they don't skimp on the filling like regular buffets, however the broth itself was FAR TOOO SALTY. I felt like I was just gulping down spoonfuls of salt...so I just finished the wontons and left it at that.   I also really enjoyed the pizza, because the crust was thin, and the cheese to dough ratio was perfect. However, everything else didn't really stand out.   The best part of this buffet would probably have to be its desserts section. There is a rotating gelato/ice cream thing and my friends and I were so mesmerized by it. And the pistachio, carmel macchiato, and citrus flavors were sooooo good. I also liked that they had Thai Tea in cute little bottles and specialty juices like strawberry lemonade and pom juice.   Other than that, there's really nothing exceptional about this buffet. I have no point of reference to compare it to the other buffets in Vegas, but from what my friends who were there told me, they preferred the Wicked Spoon over this.

photos.caption: Photo of The Buffet at ARIA - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of The Buffet at ARIA - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of The Buffet at ARIA - Las Vegas, NV, United States

-QA_IRZ_NlAs0qaMKdyJ6w.text: Good selection of food including Indian, Italia, Latin, Asia etc.  Also crab legs ftw!

-gZydaBLWNaU87R3WgRueA.text: They made up pay the tip in advance.   No one came to bring us water/drinks till we asked.  Food was dried out or cold.  Sushi offering scares.  Chinese offering good.  Seafood was a bust except for crab legs.  Most people were lined up for these. Way over priced for the value... maybe if you get $60 all day deal it would be worth it.  Won't be going back.

Yt-Lpx3SmHyYo7uNue3MIg.text: They lie about the price on the phone so you could come to the buffet and give you a new price. Don't waste your time, there's plenty of better buffets in the city.

bDzee0trsfgE3d4OFcNs-w.text: I hate buffetes, I had to go to this one, I was going to make an "OK to Good" review of this place but then I got diarrhea...  I hate buffets

PXhdI2m7DpEiAexS4v61PQ.text: I came here for brunch one day with family and my experience was on point. We were seated quickly and even had our drinks ready on our table within 5 minutes. This buffet separates their food into sections, there's a dessert bar, seafood section, Asian food section, American food section, strictly meat cut section, and more! They had a "crest your own pho soup" station that I thought was really cute. Their dumpling station was fully stocked and I could see them rotating each batch every several minutes to ensure the food was still soft instead of hard/ unflavorful. The best part - CRAB LEGS, they always had a fresh batch out and I went for thirds! This buffet clearly keeps their food rotating and ensuring they're serving good food for the customers. The best buffet I have ever been to by far. You get discounts for being a local in Las Vegas or having an 'M Life' card.

photos.caption: Photo of The Buffet at ARIA - Las Vegas, NV, United States. I know not a justifying picture BUT I was hungry and this was my half eaten portioned plates LOL

hC7aLROnr708StR31cwwSg.text: It's a buffer in Vegas which usually comes shortly after a night of drinking so its hard to tell if the food was good or my body was screaming for some nutrients. I didn't get sick and for the price the food was good. All you can really ask for these days.

PN7KUqXC7bxr3kdJ5oY-yA.text: I had a MyVegas coupon for a 2 for 1 buffet, and another one for free unlimited drinks, so I used them both at Aria. The food was mostly great - I had a waffle, shrimp and grits, pho (which was amazing and absolutely the best thing I had), barbacoa, rice and beans, crab legs, clams, shrimp, and paella. The paella was the only thing not good - it had clearly been sitting for a while, so it had clumped together and wasn't good. The bottomless mimosas were delicious. It was my first time at a Vegas buffet and I had a great time.

ecUXasPfFPZNZ5Lyoaqspg.text: Nice and clean, good selection of food. The pastries are delicious, the ice cream is a must, specially the maple butter pecan. Our waitress Etenesh was very polite and attentive, I'm definitely coming back.

8lSI1_h6HxjaWnW_7TCA2A.text: For $45 this has to be the worst deal in town. Sunday eve. Crab was poorly prepared so it was hard to get out of the shell and was stringy. The book chow was good & Indian food mediocre. The deserts were good. Server was over extended. Overall a huge disappointment for the price & what you would expect from a high dollar property like the Aria.

i8X8rBeEjO8U3KI0Ps8kVA.text: whats going on here-  i see reviews being responded to by Aria management apologizing and vouching improvement and yet still negative reviews.  Patrons are paying a lot of money  $30+ per person for a quality meal and its so disappointing to hear that so many feel it is a waste.  Come on Aria- you are suppose to be one of the quality resorts in Las Vegas.  The restaurants in your establishment are a reflection of your business.  Please STEP IT UP.

y-YD-nWrCSsV98pCSGGGAA.text: The offerings at this buffet did not ease the sting of paying $45.99 for dinner. There was a decent selection, however the quality was very mediocre. At one point I thought I was lost and somehow ended up at one of the Station Casino buffets.  Good things: Lots of crab legs- served hot & cold. They also had mussels, clams, and shrimp as well.  The types of food they offered were: Diner- American far, Salad, Seafood, Mediterranean, Italian, Asian,  a carving station and dessert. Honestly not one dish stood out. The prime rib was dry and tough, the beef rib was pretty much pure fat, the asian food was just sad.  I would probably eat here again maybe for lunch when the price isn't as steep. But for dinner I would rather go next door to Wicked Spoon or drive down the street to Bacchanal.

sCXuf2tJ_vicSjMBayyh6A.text: Aria's buffet is definitely one of the better buffets I've had on the strip :)   On Fridays and Saturdays, the buffet comes with 1/2 of a Maine lobster per person plus unlimited house white or red wine. Best way to fill up your belly and your drinking needs!   Make sure you go with an empty tummy. The buffet line has a huge spread-- seafood, sushi, prime rib, pasta, pizza...and more. I have a sweet tooth so the their dessert section made me very happy--gelato, bananas foster, cheesecake and cream cakes...lets just say I was in heaven :)   Initially the service was really slow. It took us a good 10 minutes to pay and to be seated. They only had a few hostesses working with a line of 50+. I felt really bad for our server who was basically waiting on half of the tables in the whole restaurant. But it was amazing to see how she memorized all the drinks that the table next to us ordered (let's just say they were a very demanding group).   The food was fresh and very tasty. I would definitely go back on my next visit to Vegas!

photos.caption: Photo of The Buffet at ARIA - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Aria Buffet--1/2 lobster served per person on Fridays and Saturdays
Photo of The Buffet at ARIA - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Aria Buffet--SEEfood plate :)

C9zqH1NtSV1zpkMl2255aQ.text: The Aria buffet is my favorite buffet in Vegas! I love getting the Locals deal and I do enjoy it quite often. I've been to the buffet 3 times in the past 2 months and each time has been fantastic!  My favorites: crab legs, grilled prawns on weekends, amazing butternut squash salad, great carving station, etc. If I'm not too full, i'll help myself to a few desserts. There are around 20+ different desserts, and they have delicious gelato! Gotta Love it.  Aria, i'll be back soon!

iDQb024EvXeoRj08S2fs6A.text: Creme brulee at 11am. Yes.  I was really pleased with the Aria Buffet as a whole. On a Sunday morning, the line wasn't ridiculous and we were seated within 10 minutes of walking up. The presentation for the chicken and waffles was beautiful. There was a little fry basket lined with paper and it had mini waffles and chicken tenders/nuggets inside. Perfectly portioned and cute to boot. Did I mention the dessert station?  Minus a star for some food looking like it needed to be stirred. Also the person who is responsible for writing the food names on the signs needs an English class desperately.  Maybe it was purposeful, but I don't think so.

ly27KBxT6OyMCd8o6QwbTA.text: We ate here on 2/21/16 for brunch before a long day of walking around on the strip. After looking at everything they had to offer and seeing all of the seafood they had out I thought id get a plate of crab legs. I watched the chef bring them out and put them on the steam plate that they had so I knew they were fresh. During the day I felt fine and had nothing else to eat or drink (just bottled water). Fast forward to 8 p.m. when I knew I had FOOD POISONING and was getting sick on my hotel bathroom floor. After being up all night now I have to catch my flight back home. First thing I did when I landed was go to the ER for SEVERE FOOD POISONING where I had been overnight. It has now been 3 days and am on medications trying to get rid of whatever I picked up from this buffet.

DIcESpYR63dHVLnlFE2CQg.text: From 1 being horrible and 5 being awesome:  Food - 3 Service - 4 Price - 2  There are much better buffets than this one.  Food was pretty good, but the selection was not very good.  I'm not a picky Eater and it was hard to find food that looked good.  I would give it a 2, but I just didn't like the selection that much.

C2weWuAN-hwdKN8t6Vd4aw.text: Great selection of food for breakfast, including the seafood bar. Have eaten here several times and food is consistent in quality. Would give it 4 stars but for the variable service. Yesterday it was non-existent and today it was outstanding. Fresh fruit is wonderful and I love the cooked to order omelets. Vast selection of ethnic foods including Indian, Thai and Chinese means there's always something for everyone to enjoy.  Will definitely return.

ejBBGRteBhwGdaHVliJEvg.text: Great experience eating here although after eating 5,000 calories in one meal you get the feeling that you want to die.    Seafood is excellent.  The crab legs and cooked jumbo shrimp make it worth paying the premium prices here.  Dessert and gelato are also tasty so save some room if that is even possible.  The overall feel of this buffet is upscale and they are very nice about not rushing you to finish.  Other buffets try to get you out of there as soon as possible to make room for new people but I definitely did not get that feeling here.

0NqA_ZqrbfUUjrBZvjCUmQ.text: It was alright... The selection was not too overwhelming that you cannot decide what to eat. But the food did not look appetizing... Was not worth the $$$

cNOzpVaGoIoRwkz4Xn_L_w.text: Not extensive selection like other Vegas resorts. Labels missing or things were mislabeled on dishes, and no mention for ingredients. Most food was way too greasy, Indian station which is mentioned as authentic was a joke, only couple of dishes were good.

Cv1qPWwB5bIzCNRgd_e6NA.text: This was my second visit at Aria buffet. I came back the second day after Aria was reopened in Nov. It was a great disappointment. Is it just me? I didn't see much difference after reopening! All I knew was they took the lobster away!!!  And everything was either cold or lukewarm (except soup). Where the hell did they spent that 3.5 million dollars on? The only things I liked was clam chowder soup and desert section. For dinner buffet price of $40 per person during weekend,  I am so staying with Bacchanal and Wicked Spoon!

nb2HLkKPFcI72oILess6Ow.text: This place has a great modern look and feel; however, the food was nothing special.  It is a bit pricey.  I have been here twice since I was staying at the resort.  The food is just okay, but other places are the same with lower prices.

xh3kWnE8tRexCfTxHFGMyA.text: Compared to the buffet I had at the MGM where I was staying, this buffet was awesome! The set up and sitting area was very comfortable. The food options were great and there was too much to go around. The Waitstaff could be a little bit nicer. Ours was very pushy and never smiled.

QRlawK69l9vAPG3l1mzpAQ.text: It was ok, not too bad but not great neither. Food was....too boring. :-/

LNiNEmt1GE8oQwD2zY54jQ.text: This was a comp so I didn't pay for it... but in order to be able to afford the rest of my splurges & vacation we did try out 2 buffets... this was one of them. Really nothing to write home about, not much better than other buffets... some passable selections were the cheese/deli section with blue cheese & even Parmesan chuncks with Several nut choices, crackers, honey, dried fruits I thought that alone would do if I didn't find anything worthy, also the chicken curry was decent with jasmine rice.   Desserts were ok, not great, but better than average for a buffet

WQfRoFGanhcMs8sP4mF_1A.text: If I could leave this place negative stars, I would. My family and I decided to try this buffet tonight after hearing good things. I looked it up on their website and saw that tonight was 'gourmet dinner' night. I wanted to know more of what that was so I decided to call and ask what exactly consists of this 'gourmet dinner'. The woman on the phone told me it's the best buffet with the best prime rib and huge king crab legs. We were sold. We live on the opposite side of town so it took us about 30 min to get there. Get to the buffet around 5:30 and it's pretty empty. There was a large party in front of us of about 9 and they were busy getting their table ready. Meanwhile the hostess was just standing there. She could have sat my party of 3 while they were getting their table ready. So we finally get seated and go to get our food. First, there was no prime rib. Half of the food there is Indian themed, and to top it off. There was NO KING CRAB LEGS. They were snow crabs!! They were seriously so small that it was almost a joke. This buffet cost us about $140 for 3. I was furious. We drove 30 minutes for KING crab legs that they specified they had, and they didn't. So we get back to the table and we're waiting for the waitress to come and take our drink order. And we're waiting, and waiting. About 15 min later she comes by to take our drink order. I was so fed up I looked at my parents and I said stop eating. This isn't worth $40 a person. So I asked the waitress for the manager. Which took her a good while to track her down. The manager comes over and I tell her this buffet is not worth the money and you guys are Falsely advertising KING crab legs when they are in fact snow crabs. I told her we wanted our money back. She didn't even hesitate. She just said sure follow me. By her not hesitating to give us a refund makes me wonder how many other people complained. She must have been used to it. We should have known by how empty the buffet was. We were obviously mad, and starving at this point. So we get our car that we valeted and we're told we had to pay $13 for parking! We weren't even in there for 30 min and had to pay. They should have had a sign out saying this is how much parking is. Overall this buffet is horrible. If you're looking for a good buffet, bacchanal is where it's at. For $20 more a person at least you know you're getting your money's worth.

ywhaFWDHv90lDaR_fGGl5w.text: I came to eat here with my man friend on New Year's Eve night, but I am not to sure what they serve normally. The buffet had PRIMIE RIB, LOBSTER TAIL, and other amazing dishes. If you rarely go on food adventures you can definitely try it here. Mexican, Chinese, Mediterranean food they have it all. The dessert was defintely more artistic than anything. Not sure if I would come back again, because I do not really eat buffet's that often, but check it out! :D ENJOY!

_E04mobakEGp31E_-JvQBA.text: The lunch buffet offered a wide selection of food and dessert. They had meat carvings, Italian, Mexican, Asian, family style, sushi, as well as other lunch options available. The quality of the food was great and well seasoned, unlike the typical unseasoned buffet food other hotels offer. Their sea food is what really sold me as well as the huge dessert corner which includes creme brulee, gelato with multiple flavors, cheesecake, and other desserts. The service was good, other than having to ask the waiter for water three times. You get what you pay for.

BgV3B_7tMEUokOOOBbSmlA.text: I was not impressed. Flat out. I really don't have a lot to elaborate on this place... they've really got to step up their food selection! Had I known that the flavor would be bland across the board I wouldve just stuck with crab legs and dessert... those were the only things that I was actually excited about. Everything else could have been served at a Golden Corral and I wouldn't have known the difference. Bland...and/or dry... and/or folks trying to be clever with cooking foods that are better left keeping it simple.  The turkey wasn't too horrible... but it wasn't good enough that I felt the need to try the other meats they had to offer..which wasn't much if I recall correctly. The mashed potatoes were bland. I had been craving pots mashed, too... so that really got me down. They had some fancy macaroni that just didn't do it for me. Perhaps I'm too country for Aria's buffet... but come on... what's a buffet without good ol' macaroni and cheese?! If you want crab legs mid week...swing through here.. if you don't mind dropping about $40. We had a comp for a BOGO free dinner buffet (MyVegas game on Facebook) so that's what got us in...but I think that after leaving there...we will not be returning.

eROByiKB-hTU4XJS_QryBg.text: Went to the Aria buffet and it was horrible!I'm surprised that a high end hotel would have such an awful buffet.The crab was salty the oysters rockefeller was yuck.I'll  never go there again, what a waste of money.Also service was terrible.

5_ex13QiELyWsz1XRZjmyg.text: We ate here with another couple for Father's Day. The 4 stars are for the food and the ambiance. The service here was terrible. Our server was hung over, which was funny at first, until we all needed water several times and did not get any. Getting coffee was like pulling teeth with our server. When our check finally came, it was incorrect and we waited another ten minutes for our server to correct it. For $60 a plate I expected at least halfway descent service.

tr4qguVUNvQ5UsyAh4Xylg.text: I gave this 3 stars because the food selection and quality is very good.  The staff, however, has lots of room for improvement. Nobody seemed like they wanted to be there, the hosts were ill-mannered and rude.  They treat it like fort Knox or something.  We kept getting roped off into different areas, yet the place was less than half capacity, and waited too long to be seated by yet another unhappy, rude employee.  It was also very difficult to get a beverage, or even refills. If the staff were better, this would be 4 or 5 star.

1davXN_1hGdrAtuWJwPtrg.text: First time eating here and it was, sadly, a let down. The Buffet at ARIA has two solid things going for it. The price is quite attractive at $39.99 per person (not sure if that includes sodas as I've weaned myself off them lately and stuck with water). The other plus is the environment. It's simply a nice place to be.   The cons include the actual food and the hour wait. The pho wasn't very good. The "steak" was dry. The fish was way too salty. The pork buns were sad. The sushi rolls were like the ones you get at a local grocery store made by Bob or Bill. Nothing was very good.   I kept wanting to convince myself the food tastes better than it is. After walking around for an hour I wanted it to be better. Truly I did but... it isn't. To be fair, the Indian dishes were quite acceptable.   Overall, they're trying to do too many things - Chinese, Mexican, American, Japanese, Indian, Vietnamese... and so on. The end result is nothing is excellent and nothing made me want to take more than a couple bites. On the surface this place looks like amazing value but my recommendation is to skip the Vegas buffet dinner. Get yourself a nice delicious entree at a great restaurant.   Other notes: we walked from a different hotel so not sure how parking works if you're staying away from the main strip. I didn't try the Mexican food nor the desserts.

UswdR6C1DqKiXuO_qgUDMQ.text: Food is terrible, except for the desserts  You would expect it to be better in a place like this.

RllBYXy5A2PhgZoF_DUqrg.text: Review on service only since it is SO slow that I chose not to eat here.  The reviews are absolutely correct.  Horrifically slow service.  Like other reviewers already mentioned, I see a BUNCH of empty tables (the restaurant looked quite empty) and they said it would take 20 minutes just to get us seated because of the shift change.    Are you kidding...?  If it takes 20 minutes to seat people with empty tables, I dont even want to imagine how slow the real service would be.

vSvNK-dA4jS4UQcyEP71sg.text: Good for a Buffet!  Let's be honest, buffet food is mostly about variety and volume, not quality! When you are younger and can burn tons of calories by simply chewing a gum for fifteen minutes, then the "volume" may be more attractive to you. But when you are older and must run 5 miles to burn a couple of hundreds of measly calories, it becomes all about quality! Basically if you are going to take on more calories, it better be worth it!  With that said, Aria's buffet is one of the better ones I have been to in Vegas. You have your typical choices of Italian, Chinese, American etc. dishes, but the quality is somewhat better. Bon appetit!

Qubc44z3XctBkgSXQTockQ.text: Just ate at Aria's buffet last week. In 40 years of eating fine meat, my wife and I agree (The Best Prime Rib Roast ) on the planet Earth bar none. The taste is substantially better than Gallagher's @ N.T., N.Y. Caesars, Wynn's etc.  We've eaten everywhere and the Aria is the best hands down. Try it and you will agree. Daniel Van Fleet, Ca.

fwgS_VXJAXpMYhzBrlqSnw.text: Aria.  Yes, the Aria buffet is by far at the top of any Best Seafood Buffets in Vegas list.  If you go for any regular week-day lunch (around 26 dollars + tax) you will be delighted by the variety of seafood available, including good quality crab legs, craw fish, shrimps, high-quality & gourmet-style fish tacos, and several good fish dishes.  Moreover, the price of this Vegas all-you-can-eat is reasonable, especially considering the quality of most dishes served.    As per the actual food served, Aria tends to be a 'gourmet' buffet and not for everybody's palate. If all you care about is average hot-dogs, burgers and average Macaroni & Cheese, Aria may not be for you.  Not everybody has worldly taste-buds, not everybody wants to taste a variety of interesting, higher-end dishes from all over the world. For example, they serve the best Pho (Vietnamese soup) of any Vegas buffet and the best, most authentic pasta of any buffets I ate at in Vegas.  They also serve excellent Indian curries and great naan breads.  But not everybody appreciates 'Pho' and not everybody is even aware of what authentic Italian pasta dishes are like or taste like (but I am, and I can't stomach some of the garbage that's served at some buffets, as if the pasta came out of a can).  Moreover, health-conscious eaters will find plenty of great options.  What makes Aria one of the best 5 buffets in Vegas  if not the very best  is that the flavors and the texture of the wide range of dishes they serve is of high quality (for a buffet).  Aria Buffet Review: Ambiance. You'll find it outstanding, if you like modern, bright and airy!  It can be very busy, though. The whole resort is beautiful, huge, airy and modern.  aria buffet review vegasThe buffet is beautifully designed, winner of several 'eco-friendly' awards; what you would expect if you went to a high-end, beautiful, huge restaurant, which happens to serve all-you-can-eat dishes.  You will love the space, the huge glass walls overlooking onto the Aria's fabulous, eco-friendly pool and Jacuzzi areas, you will appreciate the brand new modern decor. You will never wait for a table to clear here, unless they close several sections.

photos.caption: Photo of The Buffet at ARIA - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of The Buffet at ARIA - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of The Buffet at ARIA - Las Vegas, NV, United States

FTrAMTUiokSoq86j3OZ5ag.text: We went here for my son's birthday on a Saturday night.  I liked that kids under 12 are free!  That was a great savings!  We went around 5:30 and the line was not bad at all to get in.  My son really wanted crab legs.  His favorite ended up being the sushi!  The food was really good for a buffet.  My other son really enjoyed the New York style pizza.  They had a ton of choices at the meat carving station including brisket.  They offer different types of food I haven't seen at other buffets.  That gave us a chance to try new foods we wouldn't have tried otherwise.  I also enjoyed the desserts in comparison to other buffets.  I would recommend this buffet!  I'm not usually a big buffet person, but I came out so full that I would have to say it was a huge hit!

dU2C3WKly3GjQMtnZesELg.text: Not bad for a buffet with limited hype! Had a great meal here with the selections at the Aria, and definitely didn't wait even a hot second before getting seated on the Wednesday morning we went. Had delicious selections of the meat and desserts; lots of other options but as with buffets, they tend to not be as "fresh". I'd stick to the meats the chef cuts for you and the roasted veggies for safe options

OytMLzRjh8kJkMdocskKOQ.text: Been standing in line waiting for soo long when there's a bunch of empty tables inside. We asked the manager why they wouldn't let us in and they said it's because they don't have enough waiters. Hold on, since when do we get served food at a buffet?? Why not let us in and let us wait for our drinks to be served from the waiter instead of waiting so long in line??? Not a good way to run a business. Ended up getting a refund and leaving. Going to Cesar's Palace buffet which is amazing!!

S353zt25afifmOikOOVebA.text: First time coming to "The buffett", at the Aria. Had a 2 for 1, pretty good deal. Food was hot and their was a lot of selection. Prime rib was great, dessert good. Service unfortunately was just so so

photos.caption: Photo of The Buffet at ARIA - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Meatballs ok.
Photo of The Buffet at ARIA - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Good prime rib.
Photo of The Buffet at ARIA - Las Vegas, NV, United States

dYzusPDeA4pgfUIKOueV2w.text: Definitely did not live up to what I hoped it would be! Let me start by saying there was nothing really wrong with my experience here but seeing as Aria is considered one of the nicer hotels and casinos to stay at, I expected their buffet to be on the same level as some of the other dining options located in the hotel. It unfortunately was not! Ended up coming right as the lunch and dinner menu was changing hoping to get a little of both worlds but didn't really see much of a difference in what was being served!  The buffet itself is very nice and clean but really just lacked variety. A good example was the Asian section. There were noodles and rice and soups and a few appitizers but there were no protein choices! Normally thered be chicken or beef or some sort of seafood but there was literally nothing to choose from.  Just thinking about each section is racking my brain trying to write about it but for as many passes as I made, it saddens me that I spent $45 to ultimately eat stuff that I could have eaten at any buffet in vegas for half the price.  Honestly what came to mind as I was walking through each area was...  "This reminds me of a fancy Home Town Buffet" And for that to come to mind at an establishment like Aria says a lot! I know buffets are a thing in Vegas and competition is fierce but just based off of what I experienced here, I'm gonna have to stick to what I know is good and go to where I usually go which is Wicked Spoon! Now that's a top notch buffet that will never disappoint!

photos.caption: Photo of The Buffet at ARIA - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of The Buffet at ARIA - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of The Buffet at ARIA - Las Vegas, NV, United States

7RRMJZvZUq1aK_j2QZTvdw.text: We came here Saturday night for dinner. It was $42.99 and there was no line at all around 6pm. The service was really good. Our server was very nice. She always refilled our water and I never had a half empty glass which are bonus points to me.  As for the selection. I was slightly disappointed that there wasn't more. There was no pasta. There were Asian noodles thou which were pretty good. The salad bar was a little boring. No sushi. There was salmon and that was pretty good too.   My favorite was the Mediterranean section. They had a lot of curry options to choose from. They had a good selection of ice cream with an option of the cutest small waffle cone.   Overall it's not super expensive for what they give. It's actually pretty good. I just kinda expected a little more considering its in the Aria and everything there is always worth it!

photos.caption: Photo of The Buffet at ARIA - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Mini waffle bowl

kXNdOqbdeTFAsJNoerYLRA.text: This buffet was awesome!!  At $45 per person on a friday night, it is a relative bargain.  There was lots of seafood and excellent roast meat, which is pretty much all I care about.  Surprisingly the prepared salads were fantastic, in contrast to bland salad offerings at some competitors.    The creme brulle is fantastic.  The Hawaiian poke bowl is the best I have had, including while in Hawaii.  Clams, 2 kinds of mussels, shrimp and crab legs were plentiful.  There were no raw oysters, which is ok.  There is tandoori chicken and middle eastern food, which is a bit unique.  There is dim sum and Chinese noodles.  There was no line!!!

o-XMFqC3ILuHntFbCmvB9Q.text: Had a good experience for my first ever vegas buffet. The variety and options weren't as opulent as I had expected but the food itself was quite good. My personal favorites being the seafood of course (snow crab over all others by far) and then the carving station which had amazing beef ribs and pork belly. The service was superb. Drinks were okay, the lemonade was great. Asian far was lacking in flavor imo but the Mexican food was good. Overall I'm happy with the experience. Would probably not recommend if you aren't going to either having seafood or the carving station though as it likely won't be worth the $40 price tag.

photos.caption: Photo of The Buffet at ARIA - Las Vegas, NV, United States

jwP2KgbyOfk3t0nsDcHDXg.text: Came here yesterday for brunch. We must have come at a weird time (10:15am-ish) because it was a odd mix of food. There was mac and cheese next to scrambled eggs, they had stuff out for the Asian soups but the soups had plastic wrap over them, etc. Everything was just okay. I'm thinking my $30 would have been better spent somewhere else. The best thing I ate here was the kielbasa and IPA sausage (bratwurst infused with IPA and cheese).   Also the hostess stand/cashier area was the worst. There were separate lines for M Life rewards members and the general public. There was a dedicated line for tier pearl and above. We stood in that M Life line since we have the platinum membership, and it was shorter. The line did NOT move. People walking into the general line after us were able to pay and get sat before us. Also they didn't even check to see if you had an M Life card at all. Why have separate lines? What's worse, even after we paid, we still had to wait. We watched while even more new patrons arrived, paid and got sat before us again. Now we know. Just get in the line that moves the fastest.  2 stars because our server was pleasant and attentive, and they had a lot vegetarian/vegan options for my husband.

photos.caption: Photo of The Buffet at ARIA - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Hours and Pricing (2-4-2019)
Photo of The Buffet at ARIA - Las Vegas, NV, United States. IPA Sausage
Photo of The Buffet at ARIA - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Holiday Hours and Pricing (2-4-2019)

qQFxN9lYT_ck3FCs-JmkcQ.text: Terrible!!!!!!There was a long queue. I asked them to explain that there were not enough waitresses. After waiting for an hour to come in, the waitresses were standing around doing nothing. I had a buffet. Half the tables are empty. They made everyone wait on purpose. I can wait as long as I want. But the food was not fresh, the service was poor and there was nothing to eat. I won't come back. I hope you don't come again. Parsley and Onions are black and dry. I never knew Las Vegas had such a bad buffet.n

photos.caption: Photo of The Buffet at ARIA - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Empty!
Photo of The Buffet at ARIA - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of The Buffet at ARIA - Las Vegas, NV, United States. not fresh！ I will never back! The waitress just stand over there talk. No service!

HDU5H7L2_6kYzu6T3shm6g.text: This is so hard - I want this place to be amazing but it keeps falling short.   We'll start with the welcome - or lack thereof.  We visited for Breakfast on Sunday morning where you pay a premium.  The dining room was maybe 1/4 full.  We charged the 2 breakfast's to our room at the Bellagio, which was extremely uneventful.  Quick with little conversation or acknowledgement.    Then we wait in a line with 1 person in front of us.  And we wait. And wait.  Looking at all the empty tables and a couple bussers who appeared to be taking there time cleaning off the tables where people had just left.  I could tell only one section was open.  There was a lady standing near us who seemed oblivious to the fact a line was growing on both sides (Premium and non-premium guests).  The guy in front of us finally had it, jumped over the rope to ask the lady less then 10 feet away when we could get seated.  She snapped (and I mean snapped) at him in a few minutes.  Another person asked - and again with very pissy attitude - came back with "we're short handed - just wait".  WOW!  Never seen someone so rude.  Put everyone in line in a fowl mood after witnessing that.  We almost asked for our money back to go somewhere else.   Finally though - we were seated.    Now our server was incredible!  She was moving with the sense of purpose and doing her best to accomplish what needed to be done to serve her guests.  Total 180 from before.  I had a diet coke (I'm not a coffee drinker so get my caffeine from other sources) and she brought a small pitcher knowing that they were busy and shorthanded so refills may not come as quickly as needed.  Good job.  Now onto the food.  It was OK.  But honestly - couldn't tell the difference between a normal breakfast and brunch.  There honestly was nothing special.    Overall, a disappointing experience compared to other MGM properties.

JwXtFuMmH4ETYvyGx4fYUw.text: I'm sorry but this is possibly the worst buffet I've tried on the Strip. At $52.99 a pop, I expected more and more so, better quality. For non meat eaters, this is not a good buffet. My husband and I eat fish but there was hardly any fish to speak of. I had expected grilled fish that they would make for you, but no one was at the counter the whole time we were there and there wasn't any such choices either. There was however, a really sorry looking poke bar which was a mess and totally grossed me out. With no condiments in sight, I gladly gave this a miss.  Asian food - Lots of meat, one shrimp option per the noodle soup which was actually pretty tasty after I spiced it up. Italian - no gluten or dairy free options on the pizza's but there was thankfully gluten free pasta. I don't think I've ever been to a buffet (as expensive as this - $134 for two people with tip) and eaten fish and chips and pizza. Indian food - 4 very messy and sorry looking curries with no seafood options. No thank you - I wouldn't eat that garbage if you paid me! Mexican - chips weren't refilled, there was again no seafood options and no tacos in sight. Other than the great desserts (none of which were gluten and dairy free, so my husband couldn't have anything), this buffet was a total cluster. Aria should be ashamed of themselves. Do yourselves a favor, and go elsewhere like Mandalay Bay or the Wynn. Or save your money and go shopping instead!

mVBpsjl8Gm48MP69ekAQVw.text: My Wife and I came here for an early dinner during the week and we encountered only a 5 minute wait at this time, very fast!      The food was really incredible! Fine Dining quality food served buffet style, nice range of selections (Mediterranean, Asian, Far East, American...) some of the stand outs were the Gelato dessert bar and the Unlimited Crab Legs!    Beautiful new and modern interior, one of the best Buffets in Las Vegas!

vqtEpUgylX6qZPca-FK3gw.text: We have visited the Aria Buffet many times and until this year have always had a good experience. This time however, the whole experience lacked customer service. We went for Mother's Day and there was nobody in line to pay. However, in spite of the fact that half the tables were available, we still waited 20 minutes to be seated and another 30 to be served anything to drink. The food was good but waiting for tables that were already empty??? We went again the next day and had the same experience. Many tables available yet there was a line of people waiting for at least 30 minutes to be seated. This makes no sense when it is a buffet.

pnQasFtYY1UBb2i31us_vA.text: The Goods 1. Steamship is great, beef at the cutting station 2. great selection; seafood sushi Asian dim sum Italian Mediterranean Mexican  3. Desserts are great with gelato bar; beautiful dessert/mini desserts.   4. If you are MLife platinum or higher, you get a discount  5. Taste can be bland but maybe try sauces  Service 1. Varies but overall pleasant.  2. Sometimes you get a really friendly server who will refill drinks constantly  3. Try the endless wine and mimosa add on yum   Ambiance 1. When it come to Aria it is glamorous and sparkly you'll feel like a million bucks in here  2. Beautiful presentation; you'll enjoy the above and beyond food art especially the desserts  3. Credit cards accepted  4. Can be pricy but comparable to other Vegas buffets of its type   MoJo 1. I'd say the strength is on their desserts, so many to choose from and all so beautiful sometimes you can find a macaron bar 2. Gelato flavors are abundant; this was always a must do  3. Ambiance and environment comfortable and beautiful

photos.caption: Photo of The Buffet at ARIA - Las Vegas, NV, United States. My favorites are always the desserts
Photo of The Buffet at ARIA - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Cutest donut among the dinner breads

Pri3wZ_Afte9VcnpuYm-NQ.text: I'm really surprised at the lower reviews so don't be shy about trying this buffet. We loved our buffet and I'm super picky! The food was quality and so much to choose from. It's a little spendthrift but we felt it was quality for a buffet. Prime rib and all meats were excellent.

iTXnyThiVsqh0rqsw8-uqw.text: Nice ambiance, very friendly staff, and clean! However, the food really isn't much to care about. For almost $60 I would have rather ate elsewhere. I tried everything except the salad bar and I would say two things stuck out the most with me. Pizza was good, and their poke bowls were absolutely delicious and highly recommend that.

us0TEip5z7jfR7UdbmUuGw.text: We came on Easter weekend (Saturday Brunch) and paid the increased price for the holiday, thinking there would be crab legs, but the only shellfish available was cocktail shrimp. We were very disappointed because crab legs were on ALL of the advertisements throughout the strip and even on the electronic display board located at the line to get into the buffet. If that's not False advertising I don't know what is. Shame. Other than that the buffet was decent, but we chose this one specifically for crab legs...

fLRKRIAuFJvdxplnH712ow.text: The pricing was confusing. All over the net it said that breakfast was from 7-11 am, and was $22.99  So when we arrived ta 9:30 and were charged $28.99 each we were a bit taken aback. Honestly that felt like a bit of a rip off.   But We have to admit the food was pretty damned good. There was a great selection of food from all over. Whether it be Asian or American or even a traditional British carvery, and the quality was amazing. I even went back for seconds.   The roulette wheel of gelato was amazing.

photos.caption: Photo of The Buffet at ARIA - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of The Buffet at ARIA - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of The Buffet at ARIA - Las Vegas, NV, United States

oz7IkX0HFBAUMo7JHymZRA.text: My family and I love coming to this buffet. There's never a super long line to the entrance and this buffet also has a locals' discount. This buffet is pretty big and has a wide variety of foods (Asian, Mediterranean, Carvery, Mexican, Italian, etc.). There is also a tiny section categorized as a Children's Table.   The Carvery section has lamb chops!! Other buffets at this price usually just have 2-3 types of meat to offer. They sometimes only give you 2 pieces at a time though, depending on how busy they are.  They have a large section for their seafood - sushi, baked seafood, shrimp, mussels, etc. The crab legs taste amazing and the cold crab legs are usually already broken in half so it's easy to get the meat. Unfortunately, the crawfish wasn't that good and didn't taste fresh. I have yet to find a buffet in Vegas that has quality oysters - this buffet is a hit or miss with their oysters. Tonight, it was a miss.  If you're going to make your own pho, definitely take advantage of the extra toppings that they have right next to it. The broth is very bland.  Lastly, desserts. My favorites are the creme brulee, flan, fruity pebble rice krispies, and the ice cream. They also have mochi ice cream too! I wish I wasn't so full already so I could have tried more desserts.

photos.caption: Photo of The Buffet at ARIA - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of The Buffet at ARIA - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of The Buffet at ARIA - Las Vegas, NV, United States

nzmlZwA-7jQkAaQSXTaGOw.text: I ate here last month. The buffet was good but the best part of the visit was our server Reina. She was funny, very interactive with us and she's the reason we'll be coming again once a group of us end up in Vegas again.

0krXoqbVj8wDJYe6FzzGrw.text: I came here with my Mom and best friend because it was walking distance from the Vdara. We should have taken an Uber somewhere else. There was a fly in the paella, and when the manager came over all she did was apologize and say I'll show the chef. No type of compensation whatsoever for a fly that was cooked into the food. Spend a few more dollars and go to a quality buffet in Vegas.

eOdoOkqll1PmU3Q-Y37NrA.text: We went on a Saturday and were extremely disappointed.  The food was appalling.  Don't fall for the all you can eat crab legs because they were puny and not replenished often.  The beef was impossible to cut.  The server consistently got the drink orders wrong and took forever to clear the plates.  Most of the food was inedible, honestly.  Save the money or go to Caesars or Wynn.  Desserts were the only saving grace, but definitely not worth the $45.

YH4srFqv2_qCFUKDMOBsFw.text: Excellent food with g f option enough to get satisfied eating, amazing customer service thank u Alfredo for being sweet and attentive I never had to ask for anything he always had it and checked on us

qPPOUSQ9fRTMgnU5tpf_YQ.text: Went there on Saturday didnt mind the price but the food was not that good and crab legs were small. Hotel was beautiful but would not even go back to that buffet not worth it.

0HKcrg8YaoBiKKTJr4B6bA.text: The buffet at the Aria was a huge disappointment.   I was hoping to get to the buffet at the Wynn during my stay in Vegas, but couldn't because of time constraints. I ended up at the Aria for lunch as a consolation prize.   There was no wait, and all of the staff were extremely helpful and friendly, including the checkout counter and the waitresses. They even let me in to look around before I committed to eating there.   My big draw was the fresh seafood. I went straight for the streamed crab legs, only to find them overcooked and flavorless. They had tools to crack the shells, but no crab forks meaning my hands got absolutely filthy.   The chilled blue crabs were better, but were extremely difficult to eat because they didn't offer crab forks. The cocktail shrimp were just ok, nothing special.   The rest of the food at the buffet was varying levels of mediocre, and the price was steep. I'd skip this place and go somewhere else.

vo1tbYbola-kakWG4FH0hw.text: Food is so disappointing, not to mention there were tiny flies hovering at our table. The waitress was good though.   Food trays were mostly empty and looked stale. The buffet counter tops are messy with food spilled over the place.  The Chinese broccoli were so hard to eat, can't even chew on it... too many buns, looked like they were left over from the breakfast this morning.   Interesting you might wonder if some left over food were being recycled and made into some other dishes... like steak, you will find at another corner, steak salad, but those meat were stale...  The Spanish rice and chili Verde were okay.  I am sorry to say all these but that was what I have seen.  We ordered ice water and sprite, and there was a weird chemical taste in them....  For the dessert, nothing much appealing that makes you want for a second round. No real great desserts, not even macaroons... sad, even the most simple cookies that I wanted to give a last chance were hard and tasted like they had been out for a while... seriously  I don't usually write review, but this is just too disappointing to see in a big hotel... I was looking for a great buffet, but ended up paying $45 per person for this kind of food service.

YDdomWzzFIvT7sYZ2fUN0Q.text: 11/12/18 Wait was over an hour, staff was slow to seat customers Worst service in Vegas the past 20 yrs

mqlwak9zZmiL_wRyQDF2pg.text: Poor management.  They seem to have no comprehension on how to turn over the tables.  Used/eaten tables sit uncleared for a long time and there is a long line that is not moving.  Need to get the managers retrained or replaced. Actually after paying, still not moved.  The special line where some privileged ppl are being seated continuously.  They don't seem to have concept of seating general lines at all.  And uncleared tables still all over the restaurant.

JMos5wweinj_Me6NV_p3Fw.text: Solid 4-star dinner buffet here.  Came here on a Monday evening, no wait.  Staff was friendly and courteous.  We opted for the unlimited booze package for 2 for an additional $19.99.  The rum punch and cranberry spritzer was pretty good!  We both enjoyed the food selection here.  They may not have the vast variety as other popular buffets, but I liked that what they did offer was well executed.  My favorite was the Indian chicken curry and naan bread.  The build your own pho was pretty good too.  We'll definitely come back!

8-F4GMFuQdVH98AAc5O31Q.text: As far as Buffets go I would give this a 6 out of 10.  By far I liked the M Casino Buffet better than here. The selection was not appealing as I have seen many buffets. Everything seemed so close together it was hard to maneuver around other guest.   I did however like their Curry Chicken and my husband said the lamb chops were delicious.
