The pastry bar seems to be the one solid offering.   Even for Las Vegas, you won't feel like you got much for your $40.

s9zzReMTCwHSp0snhrqMLA.text: Mmmmm... there was SO much food. I loved everything! I didn't like the wait though. It was pretty long.

YLvuubNKQZRYxWXKn5-e6w.text: After a 1 hour wait in the VIP line ( we kind of asked for it by going on Thanksgiving Day ),we were greeted by our server who took our drink order, delivered them then was never to be seen again.  I expected so much more for such a nice, new hotel. The offering was large, but not well maintained.   Each time I visited the dim sum area the steamers were near empty and what was inside did not look appetizing.   The sushi was hard from being out too long, again an issue with replenishment.  The salad bar was fresh and offered a great variety. Although I didn't indulge on the baked potato bar, it looked good.  The Carvery left a bit to be desired. The prime rib lacked flavor and was too rare for most.  Again I was scraping what was left in the pan on any of the hot items.  The dessert bar offered some really delicious treats.  I'm willing to cut them some slack due to the Holiday and the size of the crowd.  Hence the 3 stars....

GoCtq_-D7qn-fd6hmQ5GpA.text: I came here for the first time last summer and was truly disappointed. It's because it's overpriced even with myVegas reward. There is really nothing worth to eat there except the prime rib, which is in any standard buffets. There is an extra $10 if you want unlimited drink, which is a minus. In other buffets on the trip such as the Mirage, you pay $30 with unlimited drinks. But with the Aria buffet, you have to pay around $40 without drinks. Plus, you would have to wait a long time for the servers to come refilling your drinks. You also have to pay extra tips for those servers. In the Mirage buffet, you can avoid this uncomfortable and inconvenient thing. Overall, it's not worth the money.

5FhKggLF3o2TJGXDcUMgKg.text: I'm not a huge buffet (or breakfast) fan, but my BF loves them so we went for breakfast on a Sunday. Luckily, we are MLIFE members so we got to cut the line, which the lady was saying was an hour wait. Huh? I would never wait that long but I digress...  Their credit card machine was not working so they were having to call in the numbers which was a process. Plus, the lady that took my card was a total B____ and acted like it was OUR fault that the machine broke.   The best part of the buffet was the crab legs and shrimp. The crab legs, though, were cut/sliced, so you never got big pieces. I guess it was nice not to have to crack it, but it was not very fulfilling to just eat slivers of crab. The shrimp were big, and the cocktail sauce was good.   The rest of it was just ok...the eggs benedict were nice, but the hash browns were soggy and the sushi was mostly rice.   I don't think this is worth the $33 (with champagne...which only got refilled twice).

eJAMpm_b2s-bGpff0o8l-g.text: My first time in Vegas and I'm staying at the Aria which is a nice place. However the buffet is pretty average as far as food standards are concerned. We paid the $12 for the unlimited drinks but noticed they give you only a 2 hour limit to be there. The atmosphere is sub par at best but i think thats the intention otherwise people would stay and drink. If you want to maximize your drink money, be persistent with the waitresses. They avoid you like the plague in that sense which i would imagine is probably policy. The foods not bad but its not great. If you're hungry, it does the trick, if you want a good meal, go elsewhere!

Y_0DkYi8lJkCzTnOu1tR6g.text: We weren't sure if we wanted to try Arias Sunday Brunch when we love the Bellagio's buffet so much, but decided to try since we loved our stay at Aria. The Yelp's were all over the place so wasn't sure what to believe. Here is the real deal: Perspective: Bellagio's brunch buffet is 5x better. Wynn is 2x better.Paris is about the same. Aria's was good but not even close. Less selection, less variety, not glamorous looking, etc. For example, the cheese area consisted of 2, yes, 2 kinds of cheese...Swiss and Cheddar...really?? Granted, there was ethnic variety with Indian, Chinese, Mediterranean, etc. but it felt more like a buffet at a Marriott than Sunday brunch in Vegas.

OzfYAkRAIvIwqV53148Rdg.text: So the only other Vegas buffet I've experienced is the Bellagio and this DEFINITELY falls short.  For $45 a person I was expecting the same experience, but it was more like a food court with a few highlights.  I was really surprised at how small it was although I'm not sure more food would have necessarily been better.  The dessert selection was great and it took up about 1/3 of the whole place.  There were a few stations with about 5 foods at each station.  The Asian stop had some decent gyoza, a leak cake, some dumplings, and other fare that looked like low quality take out.  The seafood stand was the highlight with king crab legs that were already sliced in half.  You could easily just pull out the meat.  There were four different types of sushi which were okay and the rest of the fish was overcooked and low quality.  There was a salad buffet, Mediterranean, Latin, and American section.  One star for the crab legs and another for the servers who were very friendly.  Nothing else was really all that impressive.  I definitely wouldn't go back.

MEh7WVjah6wbAJHCjl05PQ.text: Was underwhelmed. I ate there twice while staying at the Aria and the only reason I went the second time is because I had a food credit. Wouldn't recommend it to an enemy. Most of the food wasn't at the correct serving temperature, some items tasted like it was cooked some synthetic oil, and the variety left so much to be desired!

ceAkt1kwvzkzx8mxE_648w.text: We went for brunch on Saturday because we had vouchers as part of our hotel package at Vdara.  The vouchers afforded us $20 each for a buffet at any MGM resort.  Honestly?  If I had paid full price for this buffet, I'd have been pissed.  The $25 extra we paid was really not even worth it.  Hot breakfast items were lukewarm at best and the dishes honestly just weren't that great.  The husband did enjoy the sushi portion of the buffet and I enjoyed the made to order omelet station.  Other than that, though...not a fan.

2glRQrqiThLoYoDB3vRTyw.text: My first Las Vegas buffet experience.. The spread is amazing, and to be honest I did not try even half of the food, but I was excited about the crab legs.. Crab legs were avg at best, although i did love that they put small cuts in them to make it extremely easy to eat. Prime rib was fantastic and surprisingly lean (the cut i got at least) Shrimp/Mussels and sushi selection was below avg. service also below avg.

g1XVlj-0P8IvlLQnEAVkiA.text: Huge variety, mostly all quality dishes, the Naan is awesome and freshly made in front of you, desserts were fresh also

HC83UKBCefgGawLUXPRwjA.text: super inflated price ($45) for a sub par selection.!  TIME SPENT 1 Dinnertime meal  LAYOUT spacious, comfy seating, upscale look.  SERVICE/FOOD perhapes the SMALLEST buffet selection i've ever had in my 4 years living in Vegas.   there is nothing on the menu that you can't find with a larger selection at other buffets...   and the limit of ONE small lobster tail per customer to substantiate the inflated price is seriously insulting...     my waitress was cheerful and attentive at least.^^  PRICING $45 for a $15 meal...  Aria, who's the marketing genius behind your buffet.?   drop the joke portion of lobster and double your buffet selection.    even the "taste" of the food items is average.  CLOSING rationalize this...   you're competing against MANY other buffets and you want to stand out how.??

YQVHD3m8Ws56wubAFq2-Sw.text: Yelp deleted my last review that kept it simple "Yuck!"    So here's the deal, we came here last summer about an hour and 15 minutes before switching from brunch to dinner.  The station for omelette's was closed, the rest of the options were old and bland.  I almost asked for a refund because the food items were not appealing and I couldn't eat it if you paid me to, but I thought I'd get my money's worth with dessert... To no ones surprise, dessert was just as bad as brunch, if not worse.  The service was also way below par for a resort such as the Aria.  Seeing most of the other reviews in here, I doubt I just went in on an "off day" . Quality dining establishments do not have off days.  This place needs to be on the show restaurant impossible, it lacks in every department.

AafxAQ4FVmLuBStzYthCDw.text: My son chose this Buffet as the reception for his small wedding. I had a few reservations about it but it sounded good. And it turned out to be a great choice. They put aside an area for us to all fit in. Two servers were there to help us along with a supervisor whose name I wish I'd taken down since she was very helpful. The food was great. Everything I tried, and I sampled a lot, was excellent. A wide variety of things that were all well prepared. It's not the cheapest by any stretch of the imagination. But I view it as one of my better dining experiences in Vegas. I'll be back.

MElbBrKv0ou4BD40j7aD9g.text: Very plain food. generic bland taste. At $40 each person it is not worth stopping here. Don't say I didn't warm you. Very bad food.  $80 total meal for 2 people and it was terrible.

kYeCFUTEKj16_i-HjvT0RA.text: Just tried this place recently for brunch on a Sunday. The price was about $33, which was more than I had expected. The place was okay. Nothing too special. I tried the brunch buffet at Wicked Spoon for $22 which I thought was a better deal. None of the food choices really stood out to me. They had a good amount of desserts but my favorite was probably the Butterfinger gelato.   Other than the food, the place was nice and clean. This buffet isn't that crowded. When I went there was no line. Though everything was just average, the service was pretty good.

fU2bycdtPcjW6WmXJzhBEQ.text: Definitely not my favorite or go to buffet but we always get free dining credit everytime we stay at Aria, so can't complain there! the decor and buffet itself is great, it's so bright and clean and really comfortable. however, the food selection is sparse, and the quality of the food is just so-so. i normally love the seafood bar, but i feel like the shellfish they have is just not fresh. their dim sum corner is pretty emo. their presentation is super cute, but even that is not enough to make up for how thick their dumpling skins are. everything else is just mediocre, nothing really stands out to me. oh! but they have a huge selection of gelatos and sorbets which is always a plus in my book! i'd keep coming back as long as i have that dining credit.

TESl_hR-K_OrpDv9MRUOCA.text: Hands down best buffet in Vegas. The service is what put it over the top. I have a major allergy and the server had the chef come out to talk to us. He walked me around the entire buffet pointing out all the things that were safe for me. I've never had that kind of treatment at a restaurant. And the bottomless alcohol option is well worth it!

VkmeKFWJnWrPJv4OMbJIvg.text: It's much better than I thought by viewing the previous reviews. The classes of food are not that much but the sweet and Asia ones are really good.

zyqKWi7isogZKUgeVJUb2A.text: Had lunch today,disappointed with the food and service, broth was not hot enough, noodles were undercook, staff were slacking,had to try to get their attention before getting your order, little words spoken and of course Not a smile on a face, from the cashiers to the server behind their stations ....saw a staff handling food with his bare hands! Yuck!

Jh2Ve5HsyhooIn7trswecQ.text: So- So   It's our first stay here at Aria so the next thing to do would be to try the buffet. Dinner price is usual around 40 bucks per person which includes half of a lobster lol. The buffet seemed to have 50% salad items. There's about over 10 kinds of salads and not enough variety for other things. I guess the best way to get your money's worth is loading up with the crabs. The sushi is buffet quality,( not the greatest)  rice was a little hard but I am very much fond of the dessert counter. Lots to choose from, but the best one would the banana cream pie.   TIP* I guess in any buffets here Vegas come a little early and beat the crowd. Preferably around 5:30- 7pm. Who likes to wait in line when you're starving right?

lCwwARX3KwpR6S5CmmlInw.text: I came here two times during my vacation in Vegas.  Once for brunch on Saturday and the following day for brunch again.  It was $28 a person plus an additional $6 for all you can drink mimosas.  I had a voucher for $20 off for staying at an MGM hotel so the price was definitely worth it.  Food was your standard Las Vegas brunch fare.  Crab legs, shrimp, breakfast foods, Asian dishes, made to order omelets, and a carving station.  The eggs benedict was a hit and miss for me.  The first batch had perfectly poached eggs, while the other batch I had was a bit overcooked.  Could have been the result of sitting out under a heat lamp.  The top round was mediocre.  I enjoyed the french toast with white chocolate creme anglaise.  The only dessert I tried was the strawberry cheesecake which I found to be okay.  The all you can drink mimosas were great.  My waitress kept filling my glass, and although it was some cheap champagne, who cares.  It got me feeling good at 11 in the morning so it fulfilled its purpose.  Even without a $20 off voucher like I had, I would say this buffet is still worth the price.

OuS_Y0lXyxE37I8hKAHPhA.text: Went here on a Tuesday morning for some breakfast noshings, and although there was a lot to choose from, the food just wasn't anything spectacular.    We DID get in at about 10:30am, and they were doing the switch-out for the lunch food, so maybe that was a contributing factor, however, as far as breakfast goes, there was nothing special about it.  You got your standard omelette line, fresh fruit, oatmeal, scrambled eggs, sausage, bacon, French toast, pancakes, etc.  All that good stuff.  Nothing really stood out for me, EXCEPT for the desserts.  The DESSERTS are another topic.  All their desserts come from Jean Philippe (downstairs), so you know it's got to be good.  The Oreo cream cake, and the raspberry cheesecake are delish!  They also have the gelato out during breakfast, which made me happy :)  Gonna have to check this place out for dinner, since everyone's ravin' bout them crab legs!!!  But as far as breakfast goes, not bad at all, just nothing spectacular.

iEtam5SoTpqZqFU_gbmAeQ.text: Good food. Lots of choices. Kind of pricey at $25 for a lunch Buffett. Nonetheless if you are looking for a decent buffet, check this place out. At the same time, you could get a great meal for the same price at a restaurant.

W8ciUvnRZHFAPqci5-jmwg.text: From the beginning 6 years ago no improvement in the quality. I see the cooking staff lack any enthusiasm and pride with the menu. This is sad for a 5 star property. Our Waiter Louis was great.

PtzRozpuSAikM1H7hCqVkw.text: Good food, and an excellent dessert selection, but not worth paying over $40/person for the gourmet dinner on the weekends. I was expecting quite a bit more selection or higher quality for that price.

e6SRTDaZBRNWk23RWF8v0A.text: 3 stars is VERY generous for this place, as previous low rating have said a few days/weeks/months ago, this place have terrible Asian food selections, particularly Chinese Dim-Sum & Japanese sushi/rolls. It is cheaper than Bellagio or Caesar Palace, but THERE'S A REASON WHY IT'S cheaper. Waitress services are less than satisfactory, I kept hearing different time in terms of when kitchen closes or when they stop refilling food or when they'll kick me out since I show up for dinner, I'd probably not come back or recommend this place to anybody else, honestly. #Disappointment

HDpUzfKCX1wrdEsifdf7AQ.text: We saw all the mixed reviews and were a little hesitant, but we were pleasantly surprised.  The nan station was awesome. Seafood was pretty fresh. Overall everything was pretty good. The only thing that wasn't great was some of the desserts were really dry, like the coconut macaroons for example. The two whoopie pies were really good though.  I wanted to try the gelato but was too stuffed!

ELmJAP338a94dY-i5Yshpg.text: This buffet is a little pricey, but so worth it!  The dim sum was good.  The steamed crab legs were very tender and so worth the work.  Sometimes with buffets the desserts look good, but disappoint.  That is not the case here all the desserts we tasted were good!

A2Kn4ZN5oDlwol09Res4jw.text: My favorite buffet in Vegas by far!! I have never been disappointed.  Why go to over-priced, overrated Wicked Spoon, where you can get cheaper, better food here?  There also seems to be a wider selection.  Seating by the dessert side is nice, because you get a view of the Aria pool.    Don't go to the other MLife Buffets; Aria is all you need!

CdJbfhCseDVS-wiASyZs3g.text: Definitely a step below Bucchanal, and 2 steps above Hometown Buffet.   more memorable items included: - thick pancakes stuffed with nutella - eggs Benedict with snow crab made to order - good brownies - variety of soups (butternut squash and clam chowder was nice)   less than OK items included: - low quality Ice cream  - dry fish - asian stirfry with a half inch layer of grease floating on top  FYI to all the people suffering from celiac disease: there is an INCREDIBLE RANGE OF GLUTEN FREE ITEMS (more than half the selection). there must have been a considerable amount of care when coming up with the recipes here.  good job Aria!  I'd rank this meal somewhere in between The Buffet at the Wynn and the one at Planet Hollywood

sWsG9nQJAbq1--0xLPIooQ.text: Went to Aria Buffet with some Indian friends because this place had a tandoor section. I have been to Vegas buffets a decade ago and the food was out of the world with a large variety for the price we paid. I dont know what changed now.They still seem to justify the price we paid but the food was not great. Every dish seemed to be good. The dessert section was great. There was 1 item that was good in the tandoor section and the other chicken, Veg curry were very ordinary. Ofcourse the interior was great.

photos.caption: Photo of The Buffet at ARIA - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Desserts

WX9FJlhBYDSGGP3RXtqFHg.text: Not worth the price and the food really doesn't taste good. Save your money and just go to a nice restaurant or save money and go to Golden Corral.

MgP9-NN1D17GV9ElEuqxIQ.text: What a mess!!! Waited in line the first time on a Saturday for 35 mins. Got to the front and still waited. When we asked why all the open tables were there, they stated not enough staff. Then we came back on a Tuesday and yet again this time we waited 40 minutes in line to be seated. Such Bullshit. You're paying that much money and you have to wait his long and deal with unhappy wait staff? Not ok Aria resort. Something needs to be done. Many people walked away unhappy. On a brighter note, they have a great selection of different foods.

UpJoXkL3Ve9r9cdkZMhSFQ.text: Great selection and watermelon juice is fresh squeezed! Asian food selection is pretty small however slightly better than the rest of the other buffets ok the strip. The seafood selection is great here, however does not have raw oysters. For the price, this is a great place

s_LnYiUtpmIP_OR9HK2Y3w.text: This review compares the Buffet at Aria vs. Bacchanal. Both are excellent. Bacchanal has an edge because it is bigger (with a higher price tag, even for dinner). But Aria is no slouch. We had dinner at the Bacchanal and brunch at the Aria (breakfast ends at 9am, brunch is from 9am-3pm and costs $4 more). Delicious seafood, meats, Asian fare, salads and desserts. Frankly, I don't understand the low reviews. Don't listen to them! My kids (ages 12 and 10) and my husband were completely satisfied. The coffee was awesome! We also enjoyed the smooth R&B, 80s and 90s music selection (and sang constantly while eating). Our server, Alicia, was excellent. She was very attentive and brought fresh drinks and cleared our table without delay. In contrast, our server at the Bacchanal was subpar and seemed overwhelmed. At the Bacchanal, our plates stacked up to the point that it was getting embarrassing, and our server was no where in sight. (I did mention I have growing boys who eat a lot, right?) Give Aria a try! We're so glad we picked Aria over the Wynn.

tE9BY7ygNFo7Bou0TigfGw.text: We loved this buffet. All the food was very fresh and delicious. The crab that was cut in half were cold but the man at the station took his time and offered to heat our crab legs up. Going that extra mile made me write this review. The meat station was spectacular. Prime rib cooked rare. Which is unusual at buffets. Our waitress was great. My wife and I have no complaints. Thanks my Vegas for your bogo coupon.

Y6fZRqey9M35aTHH0BhojA.text: This is the first time here and for brunch no less. Surprisingly it was good. Especially their crab legs.  Their crab legs was sweet and not salty but just perfect.  The only complaint I have was they don't offer wet napkin but other than that brunch here is way better than dinner at Bacchanal Buffet last night

photos.caption: Photo of The Buffet at ARIA - Las Vegas, NV, United States. More Lobster Bisque (it was that good)
Photo of The Buffet at ARIA - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Desert. Too sweet only had a bite of each except for the flan that I finished
Photo of The Buffet at ARIA - Las Vegas, NV, United States. More crab legs

ffWCxP87o2-tMbYBeD6Pyw.text: Lots of seafood options, both hot and cold. Meat section also provided some good choices from prime rib to sausages. There were a reasonable variety of desserts and I'd say most tasted good. My family and I came here for lunch and had a blast devouring plates of crab legs and mussels. Clean for buffet standard and service was attentive.

WPhKKZDqsHxHOtAZBICNCw.text: Terrible queueing line design, signs are confusing. It took us about 45 minutes to get a table and was told that we have to get back to the line because we haven't pay yet. There is no instructions says that you have to pay before getting into the line.

pzmjfhHSJayK456WWfxYSQ.text: I usually don't like going to buffet's anymore cuz I overindulge and end up feeling horrible about myself but this one actually felt pretty good afterwards. The buffet offered selections from hand tossed salads, various types of breads and cheeses, fresh seafood, and different types of meat cooked in every way possible. It's really hard to describe the whole dining experience in detail because of the overwhelming choices at this buffet but one thing I can say is that Aria did not spare on the quality of ingredients.  Highlights of the Meal: Diner- Mac and Cheese with Truffles and the Grilled Cheese with Tomato Bisque Seafood- Alaskan King Crab Legs Poultry: BBQ Braised Pork  Dessert: Lemon Bar and the Gelato!  Quite pricey compared to usual buffets at $45 per person for dinner but the two complementary meals for hotel guests make the bill a bit more reasonable.   Also, if you're planning to come here for dinner I suggest you wait until around 6pm so that the leftovers from the lunch menu are already replaced by freshly cooked ones. My family and I went around 4:30pm so the sushi and seafood looked like they were out for a while. Besides that, the food was delicious and the service excellent, so I give the restaurant 4 stars for giving us a great family dining experience.

photos.caption: Photo of The Buffet at ARIA - Las Vegas, NV, United States

NIT-VB0bwlEsxJbHF1TAKQ.text: At $100 for two including tip, a better meal would have been McDonald's and actually lighting the other $85 dollars on fire.  I would give zero stars if not for the friendly waiter. (And the fact I can't).  Everything was cold.  Cowboy steak which was the "premier" meat at carving station was marbled with fat.  Best part of the buffet was corn on the cob.  Worst. Buffet. Ever.

jkAvIkbpXxXjWbBx4IZBHg.text: I was really blown away by this buffet the seafood was very high-quality and fresh there were a lot of options a ton of variety the staff was nice everything was clean and delicious

QjkJ2mho-wWDmL3Olo4fYw.text: I went there on Thanksgiving day for dinner. The price is $53.99. The food variety is more than I expected. The seafood is fresh, esp king crab legs. The baked oyster is highly recommend. I saw there is pan roast and a lot of people ordered it. I haven't tried it but it looks good. My hubby loves the lamb. Also, their dessert bar is good, but not for ice cream. The waitress is nice and always notify what we wanted. She also cleaned up our plates fast.

75zuKyXLX8sbCS1BO5d-KA.text: I'm utterly confused by the mediocre rating - what the hell?!  This buffet is, by far, one of the best I've ever had.  The food is fresh, tasty, and overflowing.  Mmmm... crab legs.  Every time I visit Vegas I make sure to stop here.  Last time I was there the waitress was incredible - the unlimited Bloody Mary's never faltered.  In fact, before our waitress went on break she brought us another round of drinks while we were half-done.  No waiting whatsoever!  Delicious.... And making me hungry.... No fair! I want Aria buffet, and I want it now!

45R8MBxPjrq4H0yaTZAHNg.text: Why the 2 star wack? Well, 1st of all, the dim sum I raved about in my previous review has gone tumbling downhill.  At first bite of har gow (I got 5)...I grimaced and thought what? So I surreptitiously spit it out.  I said "it has no shrimp in it!"  So onto the next one...that must be a mistake of course. Har gow #2....what....?!!  I spit it out....less surreptitiously. This time I poked at it and tried to assess what was going on. It tasted like shrimp and seafood...but not completely like shrimp and it seemed mealy. Well these two must have been overcooked I surmised. Onto #3.....gag. What? This time I dissected this thing and the only thing I could think is that they have mashed up shrimp with fish cake or fish ball? #4 was the same...I couldn't even go to #5. By the way, the har gow was not disappearing off the buffett like last time. Aria, you definitely saved money by preparing it this way...please don't call it har gow!  The seafood saves this buffet though. We chowed down on snow crab legs which were surprisingly tasty for as small as they were...not too salty and seemingly fresh. We also feasted on well prepared shrimp, clams and mussels. They even have crawfish or "mudbugs" like they say down in Louisiana. We splurged on the all you can drink package for 13 bucks....quite a deal but it does take a little while to get your beverages.   While I still think they have one of the better seafood selections, not sure I would return knowing that they cheapened the har gow.

YqlPtB-lPS6OVygKuOu7_A.text: Love all the different variety of gourmet flavors.  With a bonus stare grazing view of a topical pool landscape.

BHyCKAAMqXfxpSB4Z9QtAw.text: Buffets are dime a dozen here in Las Vegas, but we really enjoyed the Buffet at ARIA. The food was fresh and tasty. They had a carving station, sushi, crab legs... but the dessert really stole the show. We will definitely be back!

KUmpjRshGer1Ly8FRddOQg.text: Pretty impressed by this buffet. Husband and I had a Buy-one-get-one-free deal for this buffet, and enjoyed it a lot!   They had crab legs for lunch..what's not to love? Def. wouldn't mind coming back. :)

uHtb3OyGIEc6xQW-LoCSHg.text: I'm a fan, but my wife is not. They have all the standard buffet food, plus the option of having your crab legs steamed (many places they are only cold). Their pizza is very good (and this is coming from a former NYC-area resident). They have some sushi (but not made in front of you like at Bellagio) and other international options that are only so-so.  Service is slow to get refills and clear away plates. They do have a nice pasta station, but like so many on the strip, be ready for a ton of oil in the pan.  For the price on a weekend, I wouldn't choose this over some other places. But among MGM, it's still one of the better ones.

IYZppmOPBDLtF0PvwyRb_Q.text: Convient for those staying at the Aria but not really worth it to come from anywhere else just to eat.   Breakfast was passable at $14.99 a person. In particular I thought it was interesting that they had 6 different types of sausages and veal bacon for breakfast.  Moreover the seating was very spacious (like the parking spots at the hotel). However everything else was pretty normal with your standard breakfast fare. Services was good and the place was extremely clean feel to it.

PhPLKQAeMIMlY0Fb90wDnA.text: Decent buffet but definitely not worth the $37+ per person on the weekend.

rPngDe1zIEYrgtjytwd-gQ.text: One of my fav buffet here in vegas! Great selection, attentive servers and they serve crabs in the morning too! Lol

67pVSO2OuSd_jXuQBhZHtA.text: Being, that I go to Vegas 3-5 times a year, for the last 18 years, I think I've tried just about every Vegas buffet out there.  This being said, I had huge expectations from the Buffet at Aria.  As I walked in, the buffet area looked pretty nice, but what really impressed me was the presentation of all the food items.  I mean, beautiful.  Unfortunately, it didn't taste the way it looked.  The food just didn't taste great.  The shrimp on ice, tasted a little funky, not sure if it was off, or just ...I don't know, but not good.  Omelet, was just ok, but they didn't have a huge selection of fillings for the omelet like at the other higher end hotels.    Very little fresh fruit.  Chinese food portion was totally lame, over cooked, soggy.  Wait staff, was slow as well.  Oh, one thing that was very good, was the dessert section.  It looked great, and tasted great as well.  Another thing that was amazing was their sugar free chocolate cookie, amazing.    Overall, if I were to spend $24 on a breakfast buffet, I'd go over to Bellagio or Paris.

fYsqWATzFJ_wV_kwdB0rrg.text: HORRIBLE! Oh god, where to start? They charged us the "holiday price" since it was 4 days after Christmas apparently, but had nothing "holiday" to serve us. The crab legs were gray and mushy, they told us there were lox and bagels--nope, and the meat was all fatty. It was a ridiculously overpriced cafeteria, oh and they charged us 18% gratuity for our group. For what? bring us a fork when we beg? Awful. Did I say that already? The only thing decent were the desserts, but they are probably shipped in. Oh and the line was over and hour for non-skysuite people. Ugh.

gu4zoJH83yQO9eQCY1YeRw.text: Ate here for brunch. Great deal for $17 breakfast buffet;-) Read previous review to come before 11am to pay for breakfast but stay for lunch. The breakfast spread was ok. Lunch was more desirable. They have asian, mexican, salad, and rotisserie sections. Tri tip was good. Crab legs were ok. Dessert section was lovely. Mixed several gelato flavors and used cookies for toppings. Creme brulee was silky... Yum! Yes I'm a fan:-)

zBuguezcfWiKx9rEV2fOAA.text: I love love loveddd the food here like everyone said alot of veriety and tonss of different options! i am returning in May to try it out for lunch and breaky!! their raspbery lemonade made my day!!  I think i remember paying $ 35.00 per person. Either way i will always come backk!!

yCIr2n4-IpJX9o_r2DumLw.text: I really liked that this buffet had such a wide variety. I think the factor that makes it not as great as the Wynn buffet or the Bellagio buffet is that their food is not 'top of the line.' Meaning... the crab legs are smaller (but tastier, in my opinion), the omelettes are made kind of hastily...   BUT. there is so much stuff... they had eggs benedict, eggs florentine, crispy duck, oysters, wonton soup, shu mai, sushi, pineapples, watermelon, fried rice, prime rib, lamb, chorizo burritos, waffles, french toast... there was nothing i felt like they were missing.  However, they desperately need to train their waiters/waitresses... We were waiting forever for drinks, we were brought different drinks (after she had placed them on a different table and realized that WE ordered it)... really really horrible.   I think that this place is worth it if you don't want to wait hours in line and if you want to shell out a little less cash. not for people who want thick crab legs.

N8KLp-79gToHl7hvYahU8w.text: Came here on a weekday morning. No wait at all, seated right away. Efficient waitress/ Buffet has a wide assortment of items, and tastes really fresh. Coffee is pretty good too, surprisingly. However, maybe it's because I came for the morning buffet, but the Wynn does it better...

J1SiZE6-1ixZKH7_jqANLg.text: Hanging out in Vegas with a bunch of college buddies pretty much guarantees multiple buffet trips, and True to form, we decided to check out the breakfast buffet at Aria before heading home.   $14.99 isn't too bad, plus we inadvertently timed it so that they started switching over to lunch about 20 minutes in.   Good:  - No wait (although this was on a Monday) - Breakfast choices were surprisingly good - large variety of sausages and meats and such.  Bonus points for having chorizo burritos.  - Prime rib was perfectly done. - Fresh crab, shrimp, and oysters.  - Great tasting (and rich) desserts.   Bad:  - Service was pretty lousy.  It took forever to get our drinks (coffee and sodas) and even that got messed up.  I think our waiter was more hung over than we were.   Overall, a pretty good buffet, and a great deal to boot.  Not sure about coming here on a weekend for dinner, but would definitely stop by for brunch again.

ByEcBlymi8WSBlVo2x2B_A.text: It's your typical Vegas buffet and if you were staying at Vdara this is the closest buffet you can walk to.  I love Vegas buffet so I'm a fan!  Their crab was cooked just right and their selection was decent.  Yum!

FlY89Mp_FrFZKnje0SrhjQ.text: $35 for brunch, fewer selections of food than Bellagio's buffet. The quality of food is Okay, Not that great of taste. Not worth the money paid.

oQaLCQ_gq10Sj8LWSF0txA.text: 2 Stars for the desserts. The choc dipped strawberries were great and the gelato was darn good!  The rest was kind of crappy. The food was sad looking which made me very, very sad.  I was pretty hungry and went around the buffet twice to find something that I actually wanted to put on my plate but just couldn't pile it on like I usually do at buffets. Everything looked dried up like it had been sitting there for hours.  I just filled up on green beans (best thing there), crab legs (skinniest  you'll ever lay eyes on), dessert and went searching for happier food some place else.

5cM2cdJ1yNq1vb0LAQ4dbA.text: While checking out Crystals at the new City Center, my BFF and I couldn't decide on what to eat so we decided to buffet it. Before deciding on staying we asked the very friendly cashier if we could "view" the buffet. They kindly obliged. We skimmed our way down the buffet, crab legs, shrimp, prime rib, pizza, chinese food and oooo dessert! They had us with the crab legs and dessert =)   They have all the basic offering of most buffets but I felt that they had a pretty nice variety of meats at their carving stations- Prime Rib, Ham, Chicken, Turkey, Lamb and I think Bison? A good variety and it definitely silenced my hunger. A couple of my favorites were the sauteed red snapper, the szechwan beef and dessert bar! Great selection for desserts ranging from fluffy pink marshmallows, chocolate dipped strawberries, brownie pudding, key lime pie, nutella tarts and assorted cookies.   Overall a good experience! Our server was friendly, kept our drinks full and didn't leave us with piled plates on our table. The food while not excellent was good and I felt offered a pretty good variety and quality.   With SO many great restaurants in Vegas it's hard to say I'll definitely be back, but I'm not against it.

N6BXLUjb830zIaQXq-IhtA.text: Cashiers and hostess were not so friendly.  You know, you get the feeling of,  I hate working here sort of thing.  However, our server was super nice lady.   When you walk in, it feesl too Cold.  Entire hotel and food court uses the Energy efficient lighting, that looks like florescent lights, which bring out the cold feeling. And majority of the flooring either a tile or stone finish.  Super modernized, but I think I am used to warmth of carpeted flooring.   Generally, food is Super salty.  Prime rib was Salty, Oyster was not so fresh, over all food quality is somewhat equal to Hometown Buffet quality.  I think, they should charge around $15 for it.    I think Mirage buffet down the street  is about 5 times better for the price that is similar to Aria Buffet.   Would I go there again... Humm, probably not for the food.

b7lUjcSRwQywiY4bySFDUw.text: I'm sorry, tried this place and I just can't get myself to have liked it completely. Call me a bit spoiled because I'm madly inlove with wicked spoon and the buffet at the Wynn/Encore with their wiiiiide selections. First of all it was way over priced for the food they had out for dinner. The buffet at the Aria reminds me of a hometown buffet back home. The food didn't look as fresh and appetizing. Seafood selection was poor and the sushi was just bleh. When you pay $100 you make the best of it. Thumbs up for the gelato only because I'm a huge gelato fan oh and their selection of meats & cheeses. Other than that you're way better off going next door to the Cosmo at wicked spoon where there's a huge selection of EVERYTHING. Not only fresh, but piping hot like it has just been made, and there's absolutely everything you would want in a buffet plus MORE. So dissapointed in the buffet at the aria. Presentations were horrible, food looked like it has been out for a long time, and it's just over priced when there wasn't much variety. Smh.

ziGKRiGxUjHdie7ziuVP8Q.text: Pizza Chinese for breakfast at 7 am??  No yogurt or bagels or lox... Hot oatmeal a joke.  All this with lousy coffee to boot !

fkGJ0KKrqpIraYs0edMscQ.text: Food was good. We had brkfst here. Not enough servers. I was poured coffee, it had some strange stuff floating in it! Asked for mgr. that took awhile.  Food tasted fine.  Went there the following day for brkfst & they raised the price, more than double what we paid the previous day.  They said the increased price was because it was "brunch" pricing, even though it was a weekday.  What the hell!!!  We left & ate a brkfst at a neighboring hotel's buffet

NUrcHPPiVAKzFrL_En5YLg.text: This was our first buffet in LV and let me tell you, everything was absolutely WONDERFUL. From the staff to the food, it was all good. Way better than the Bellagio! Must go! THANKS ARIA.

HnMy_uqNFURnlTa1JgDOHg.text: Good buffet, we were there for memorial weekend brunch which required a little higher price for brunch but I found it a bit odd there was not a lot of breakfast items. They had an omelet bar that made them to order, a crepe station but really that was it for breakfast. Rest was seafood, pizza, Mexican food, some dim sum items, salad bar, meat carving station, carb station (mashed potatoes, Mac n cheese, etc) and of course the dessert bar. No raw oysters just a breaded oyster that looked unappetizing so I passed. The crab legs were tasty and not a bad price for ayce crab legs. Our waitress was great too.

JO7LuGTtxu5AStf7MmQs0w.text: On the same trip as my previous review for the Bellagio buffet, we also had more complimentary buffet tickets for any MGM resort so we chose Aria. We decided to go here twice. Once for dinner and once for breakfast. Both times, we had a little bit of a wait to get in. Even with our Elite member line. We had to pay a little bit extra outside of our buffet tickets, for tax for the dinner but not for the breakfast. Once we sat down, a server came over to us and took our drink order. That was different then our experience at the Bellagio. They had a much better spread in general at the Aria buffet. More of a variety and better quality food. Their dessert bar was far better as well. We weren't sure how much to tip, since all they do is bring you your drinks and we only got water. We decided not to tip when we checked in because it's hard to tip before you actually get the service. That is, however, an option. It takes a while to fill your plate because there is so much walking around to do and choosing what kind of food you are going to commit to. I chose a variety and I tried to veer on the healthy side. I would definitely recommend this experience over the Bellagio buffet, I would skip breakfast and go to dinner. Breakfast did not have many options it was more like a lunch. Very similar to the dinner experience.

photos.caption: Photo of The Buffet at ARIA - Las Vegas, NV, United States. The entrance.
Photo of The Buffet at ARIA - Las Vegas, NV, United States. More dessert &amp;  toppings
Photo of The Buffet at ARIA - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Gelato/Ice Cream

36JlgcRbvi79Cjz2P3js6w.text: the food quality is just horrible, though asian section is ok. service is slow, i had to call a manager to get a cup of coffee. do not recommend for the money

b9mRz3CSPZiKk0mGS8xpHg.text: The food is very good at the buffet. The service is poor as far as getting into the restaurant, like you would expect in the caribbean. While the restaurant was half full, there were long lines waiting to get in. We unfortunately stood in the M-life line but had the wrong card. The cashier was extremely rude, refused to process our credit card, and indicated we wait at the back of the other line. Honest mistakes are not accomodated..Once we paid, it took another 10 minutes to be seated in a half empty restaurant. This wasn't Saturday night, but Tuesday at 3 PM.  Beware of the lobster ads, that's an additional $54.

d7nfO1M4-cBzTq40oL74eQ.text: I am still thinking about this food.  It has a small, but well done selection of food. There is chinese food indian food, seafood and several other choices. The meat selection is great -- I loved the crab legs and had some of the most tender lamb I've ever tasted.  Our wait was short; there was no line. We were seated quickly and given our drinks (you get them two at a time, which is nice -- less waiting for a refill).  My only criticism was I feel like the vegetable selection could have been better, but honestly, I was enjoying the food too much to really care at the time.  Also, if you are using MyVegas, be aware of blackout dates and holidays. I didn't consider that the Friday before Father's Day would be not only blocked out, but higher priced.  My only regret is that I didn't get to try more.

_aevLhfKubUHzhK3slw6bQ.text: Terrible buffet. I went their for brunch buffet and they literally had no breakfast. You had an option to stand in line to get an omelette but other than that they had no breakfast food outside of french toast or waffles. Burgers, turkey, Asian noodles etc. which is not classified as brunch was available. Very expensive for poor quality food for brunch. Will never go back.

vpNvk1gQAsTZrG8KjvI-2w.text: It's a nice place but for the money, I have a few issues. The crab legs are good but you are constantly in line for a plate.. Seems kinda strange that they don't have a larger area to serve crab legs when so many people are in here waiting for their turn. The sushi was horrible.. I've seen better sushi in a gas station... So, for 100 for two of us... Id probably pass next time.

G3mhHI6tHLlW9PIBqYB7Sw.text: They let us wait for 25 minutes, saying they have to wait for a free table. Please see the attached picture of the current "table situation".

photos.caption: Photo of The Buffet at ARIA - Las Vegas, NV, United States

wGaq9RPnPK0dgZWcBU-QDw.text: Extremely disappointed with the service and food here!  We came here on a wednesday night for dinner. There was no line and we were assigned a table quickly. We went to get food immediately after being seated. When we came back, there was a d-bag sitting in our table. We politely told him that he might have sat at the wrong table. But he was super rude and insisted that wad his table. (We had a good table which closed to the food). He ignored us and kept talking to the waitress Yassica on ordering his drinks. We were arguing with him and were about to get the manager involved. Yassica then checked the receipt on the table, which has our name on it, and informed thr dbag that that wasnt his table. He then said "Oops" and walked away.   We came here for the food, not to be insulted by other customers there.  In addition, the selection of the food is very limited. It is one of the worst buffet i ever had in Las Vegas. I WILL NEVER come back here again!  FYI, you will find Pho in the italian food section. WTF?

photos.caption: Photo of The Buffet at ARIA - Las Vegas, NV, United States. dbag in blue baseball cap
Photo of The Buffet at ARIA - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Dbag in blue baseball cap

zuDpRK4sNQcoowsbWWclbw.text: Food was good, service ridiculous!  We paid over $300 plus 18% gratuity waiter brought drinks then vanished.  I had to get up to request where I could get my own iced tea and another server told me our server needed to get it and that she would let my server know He finally came back I request a refill ... he left and  never came back...seriously !  Note to all ...don't give your gratuity up front!

w6ZiZbxIP8TUGaanuNyEpg.text: Cheaper than Wicked Spoon, Bellagio & Wynn. Not fancy or elaborate in terms of decor, but it's modern and clean. I like coming here for lunches.   Highlights:  -Pho station -Indian food -Decent amount of seafood, including the popular crab legs   Ask the waitress to mix all their fruit juices together. Makes for a delicious fruit drink!

photos.caption: Photo of The Buffet at ARIA - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Get your money&#39;s worth
Photo of The Buffet at ARIA - Las Vegas, NV, United States

TCsXE28dHwWuhAqzkUcTVw.text: This was one of my top picks of buffets Whenever I stay in Vegas. But I was very disappointed with them at this time. First of all, when I got to the buffet at 3:30pm Wednesday Hardly anyone were there it took at least 10 minutes before the hostess even look at our party and acknowledge us with no smiles on their faces. Then I ask them if it is possible to seat our party of 6 in a booth because my 4 yrs toddler is super active. The answer was just nope we don't have enough servers for booth you have to seat at a table. Seriously the tables are right next to the booth why can the server turn the other way to serve the customers. Again answer was short with a cold stares nope we don't have enough servers. Now our server came over and we ask her to give us some wet naps for the seafood later and response is nope we don't have that. How about Fanta for drink. Nope. How about some paper napkins then. Nope. Amazing service right! At least you can say I apologize but we currently don't provide them etc. Not just no for everything. We told her we are not very satisfied with her reply and she just says Oh pretty soon you won't have to see me no more I am going home?!?! Finally we are getting our food and my son was moving around the table and one of his shoe came loose and fell under the table. Another hostess immediately came over and yell at us. Yes people she was yelling you need to put his shoe back on it's a health hazard. Wow I was steaming at this point but I still managed to ask her politely May I speak to your manager. Rely was simply they are busy you have to wait. We didn't bother with all these horrible service any longer and we left without tipping. Yes this is the first time ever I didn't tip in Vegas. Now I know why MGM Resorts lay off all these people

ssZ_x6NblV1BesUOOxzKRw.text: This place gets a one star from me for being completely unprofessional and holding up huge line of people for no reason for over 30 minutes.  The place is half empty inside and seems like holding up people in a line is no ones concern in here.  Don't waste your time in here! We went to Ciezar palace buffet for a breakfast yesterday-and that place was amazing!

photos.caption: Photo of The Buffet at ARIA - Las Vegas, NV, United States

3HX3CRjEU8GFqR3QyP7zWw.text: Great ambiance, great food!  Loved the Poke!  Loved the cowboy steak a bit chewy, but that's what you get with a rare steak.  The cake pops though... oh those cake pops... and the gelato.  Red velvet cheesecake!  The Horchata!  My friend CJ couldn't stop with the crab legs!  Everything looked and felt worth every penny!  Wonderful buffet!  A few things looks eh.. not my style and I didn't try everything! But if I were to do it again I would get nothing but pizza, yes it was that good, the poke (lots of it), cake pops, and gelato!  Oh and the horchata is pretty killer!

photos.caption: Photo of The Buffet at ARIA - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of The Buffet at ARIA - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of The Buffet at ARIA - Las Vegas, NV, United States

LpU2A3cexWFBg6CnAoVvMg.text: Who are these snobs leaving bad reviews? I mean, the girl who gave a one star review because some guest took their seat? How is this the restaurants fault? Lol. Or the ones who say the seafood selection isn't enough? Are you blind?  I've been to so many buffets and this one takes the cake! Honestly a must try. I, personally came for the seafood and it didn't disappoint. The crab legs were on point and kept coming out fresh batch after fresh batch...their salads were perfectly seasoned and the meats were cooked to perfection. A very good surprise was seeing the bone marrow dish. I'm not exaggerating when I say my husband must have had a dozen of them. The crisp bread that comes with it was perfect. The service was good and our drinks were never empty. I wish I'd tried alot of the other dishes too but just couldn't stop with these!

photos.caption: Photo of The Buffet at ARIA - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Crab legs and bone marrow and meats oh my
Photo of The Buffet at ARIA - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Crab legs and bone marrow and meats, oh my

fMcrY0cnH1-SLvwgzhpPqA.text: Good selection, we took the unlimited drinks option and the mimosas were yummy. Would come back!

5eJSYYE8jEcEs_9DTZ9b_A.text: Came here on the 4th of July. It's best to avoid any Buffett on a holiday because they will add a special fee on to the already expensive meal. Ended up spending $90 for two people at the breakfast buffet. There was really nothing special. Basic items offered. I miss the chorizo and egg burrito they use to serve. They could have at least decorated for this special holiday.   Best part was the omelet. I would probably choose a different place if I was willing to walk.

U4fy1kjTjXZ1DuQM4zoRdA.text: I have eaten at many buffets in Las Vegas and Around the World!  It was OK, Little pricey for what you get, the presentation looked pretty, seemed like fine dining "buffet style", but the buffet was actually small in items you can pick from!  The food had some great tastes to it, but not all was great!  There are many better buffets in Las Vegas.  Examples are; Cosmo - Wicked Spoon, Bellagio, M Casino Buffet, Caesars Palace are a few Yum Yum Yum I've been to them all!  I do not recommend Buffet at Aria

tLn5rTvse8kWjk6JazGMnA.text: Service that I got from the cashier and other staff members was worse than what I got from McDonald's.  It does have pretty nice dessert, but everything else is just college buffet grade.

ut70lpRw0GkzIeMhlNoZhA.text: The food is so salty and king crabs are iced. It is not worth $53.99 on Christmas Eve.

3gSVC17IdZNZwkiIX4jcaw.text: got 2 free dinner buffet from playing on myvegas.com . expected better food . most things I tried , didn't taste good . the only good thing was the made to order pasta station. dinner was 34.99 $ mon- thur

photos.caption: Photo of The Buffet at ARIA - Las Vegas, NV, United States

kECfKhntW9_X5UppGWQTIA.text: Huge selection of fresh, quality food. Very appetizing and delicious. My favorite was the prime rib and chicken. Very juicy and moist. And fills you up.

photos.caption: Photo of The Buffet at ARIA - Las Vegas, NV, United States. It&#39;s food. Good food. Prime rib, sushi, crab legs, and dumplings.

eZFKdTQHILBBhbGLYb36Ug.text: I have read some of the other reviews that rated this poorly and am a bit shocked. We went for lunch and for $65 including tax and tip for two, this is a great place to eat. To be clear, it is not the best food ever...it is a Vegas buffet! There is tremendous variety of meats ( the fried chicken is awesome...crispy and spicy) salads, Indian...good nan, crab legs - pre split so you can eat lots and lots, shrimp, etc etc. there is Chinese dumplings and rices, some meat and veg and sushi. Of course there is lots of dessert - the sugar free strawberry sorbet is excellent.   Staff was friendly and the entire surroundings were very clean. We are not buffet people, but felt that when in Vegas....do a buffet. We were not disappointed. Great value for the money and very competently and tasty food.

H-FKi3dzQtB5jbdGa6I-qg.text: If you are looking for the high class experience of the Ritz buffet in Grand Cayman this is NOT it. However, it was a lot better than I expected with a huge variety of cuisines that would surely fulfill any desire. (at least on the weekend)  One strange fact I noticed was seeing breakfast items a bit scattered without reason. Why were there waffles and syrup next to the clam dish. Or the same comment for the pancakes near the carving station. I do not think it changed the quality of the food but it did leave me with odd feeling looking around trying to make sense of the offerings.

RHmQciYaFZnCPoHPF8tjYg.text: 3.5 stars  The bad thing about catching a 7am flight to Las Vegas is I'm SO tired. (I'm NOT a morning person!)  The good thing? breakfast buffet at Aria. (maybe I could be a morning person?)  After taking care of hotel stuff, we headed over to the buffet at 10am.  There was a long line of folks waiting to get in, all curious to see what Vegas' newest buffet has to offer. Breakfast buffet is priced at $14.95 (lunch is $30 and starts at 11am)  Despite having an ambiance of a modern day cafeteria, Aria wins extra points for: omelette station made to order, great selection of charcuterie and cheeses, fruit filled crepes (sadly, already pre-made) and a carving station (yes, breakfast!)  Since we timed it right, lunch items were being put out fresh. Mountains of crab legs and shrimp that will tease the eyes and satisfy your taste buds! Definitely the sweetest crab legs I've had in a while. It was nice to see the chef making fresh naan with a traditional oven right in front of you. The Chinese food selection is dismal, the sushi limited and the dessert choices weren't as plentiful as the Wynn Buffet. But the flan has a really pretty presentation and the cream puff with the raspberry sauce perfect.   Contrary to other yelper's experiences, service was prompt and our server worked hard -- he literally had sweat beads on his forehead from running around.  Aria buffet is a must try especially if you pay the breakfast price and stay for lunch!

photos.caption: Photo of The Buffet at ARIA - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Cream puff with raspberry sauce
Photo of The Buffet at ARIA - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Flan
Photo of The Buffet at ARIA - Las Vegas, NV, United States. crab legs!

b2lR88UCLc6Lf89AcOp-2w.text: Thanksgiving Feast was bomb, Caviar bar and the oyster bar was amazing. Long lines but to be expected on thanksgiving in Vegas.

fJq5u9hj6GzAF_OJA5genQ.text: ARIA ARIA ARIA...I thought you were you were doing everything right.  Your rooms, your other restaurants, your customer service...everything was up to par until I decided to try your Buffet.  Can I say, major sad face?  My tummy was very disappointed!  Came in for dinner on Sunday and expecting a WOW experience since the price tag was ~$39.  This was NOT worth it.  I thought a buffet was all about dining debauchery with vast selections of food bound to please the most discriminating palate.  I did not find one item I went back for a second helping.  Food was served on the warm side.  The selections were so limited I memorized what THE BUFFET had:  Chinese:  veggie chow mein (so bland), mongolian beef-ish item, spare rib, siu mai and pork bun.  A few cold chinese-ish salads.  (Seriously?? that's all you can come up with?)  Italian:  2 pasta dishes, a pasta bar, and 3 types of pizza.  WTH?  Indian:  Naan, paneer, bland and spice-less tandoori chicken, chicken curry.  Carving station:  Salmon, beef/pork ribs, lamb, prime rib  Chilled Seafood:  King Crab, jumbo shrimp.    The only 2 things that I gave a star for was the desserts and the prime rib.  The food here was very bland, few choices, and way to expensive.  If you're paying close to $40 for a buffet, may I suggest:  Wicked Spoon or Wynn's buffet.   Come to think of it, I'm beginning to feel very upset now...how a buffet can be so bad in a 5 star hotel. ARGH!

photos.caption: Photo of The Buffet at ARIA - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Prolly the only best part of the buffet...the desserts

3MAaGJOeBQobgurpc09mIg.text: This place was a lot better than I thought it would be..for the following reasons.  Naan bread station - AMAZING Scampi station - AMAZING King Crab legs AND snow crab legs Thai Tea ice cream!!!! YUM Carving station - AMAZING  However, like any other buffet there will be the downsides.  The dim sum was not that great, the scallops were tiny. But once you find what you like..just stick to it. Try a bit of everything..

HAxBTP7VyvCLiL5neLy1dw.text: We always come here when in Vegas. The restaurant is very spacious and the staff is very attentive.   Lots of food to choose from whether it be breakfast/brunch or dinner. Prices are fair - cheaper than Bacchanal and the food selction is better than Wicked Spoon.

bX833Z6EdmhHPOnrkmFX3A.text: I think I went to this buffet like three times in a span of a week while my parents visited, all during lunch because you really can't beat their prices while on the strip for a decent buffet.   We came here specifically for the seafood, it's probably a hit or miss with it though. There are times when I found the crab meat to be super salty, not sure why but then the next day it was just fine so I don't know who it is that's adding the salt, but stop it!   The rest of the food is alright, nothing too spectacular to note. They have a decent selection of dessert but I'll probably only stick to the gelato as the rest of it isn't THAT great at least to me.   So really if you love seafood and don't want to venture down to the M for their weekend seafood buffet, then the one here is just as good! Might cost a bit more, but it's all the time so can't really complain and considering it's on the strip too? I think it came out to $27 per person with tax and maybe tip? I forgot if that was including tip or not but definitely tax. So really it's not a bad price at all.   The service is pretty consistent, it's not bad but if they're slammed it's going to take a bit for you to get their attention. I, for one, drink a lot of water when I'm eating so I usually ask for two or three glasses so I know I'll have something before they get back to our table when it's busy.   I like it overall and will be coming back with family for seafood again.

DAxYVC13E1EUO-TyNLEQlw.text: BF and I came here for our last brunch during our 2014 Anniversary/christmas getaway. It was just alright... We came here on a Sunday around 11 AM. And while waiting in the regular line, patrons told us that if we are M life pearl card holders, we needn't wait in the regular line, we can join the "express line" instead. Which turned out to be a mistake.   As soon as we switched the line, all we saw was the people standing in the regular line moving along and being seated. Meanwhile M life pearl or higher members just stood there browsing through our phones, or debating whether or not if we're gonna continue the wait. Just right before we were ready to leave, we were finally seated.   To be fair, they do have better food quality than "wicked spoon." And for those looking for crab legs, unpeeled shrimps, or crawfish? This is the right spot! The dessert selections here were a bit underwhelming, and quite truthfully, generic. They served typical buffet style cakes and desserts, even the gelato were quite blend (other than the overpowering sweetness, of course.) And at $46 each person for brunch (tax, tips included,) I thought they can try a little harder.  I honestly cannot fathom why they were holding the M life members while letting regular line people in continuously, wouldn't it be fair to rotate? Overall, I'd say it's your typical Vegas style brunch buffet.

VSQxHGDmJGTUr9nvptCVpw.text: Good quality food and quite a large variety of different cultures. The service was really good. The decor and ambience is very nice as well. Overall, a solid breakfast buffet.

MFtNqAL4ru791lHgofUtig.text: I came here for dinner and i loved it!  They had Awesome variety of salads which was amazingly good! I ended up getting 2 plates of salads! Haha The seafood section was also quite good. Although it didn't have too many varieties but king crab, crawfish, mussels and shrimps were good enough!  I also loved that they had so many kinds of dumplings! So yummm.  The best part of this buffet is the dessert section!  I have particularly sweet tooth and it was a trip to heaven for me.  Their sugar free coconut cake was just melting in my mouth and the milk pudding(?) was just too good! Ahhh i want some more now! Haha  They had whole variety of gelato available but i couldn't eat no more!  Had the most wonderful meal on my last day in vegas! Woo hoo!!

x7e4SZVGMk-8QlN_0t_jTg.text: Not worth it at all, cold food, hardly anything is authentic, waste of money to be honest!

jD4aEBGAWs0CIH1LbkiB0w.text: We were so excited to finally get to visit this buffet!  Four of us went to dinner for my father in laws birthday.   $220 for the four of us.  They must have quite the spread for that price right?  Should at least include a beer, champagne, something? Nope..  Worst buffet we've encountered in Vegas hands down! Selection at the tiny 6 stations was a joke, food was old, "fresh crab legs" were grey.  I could go on and on... Highly recommend skipping this place all together.  Pure waste of money (& a lot of it) OH! And the real kicker is we all got to enjoy this meal all the way through to the next morning (if you know what I mean)....

fvbJrwIBNS1FjO19_05xuA.text: This is my favorite buffet in Las Vegas, I went here for the first time in August 14' and I couldn't believe the quality of food at this buffet.   They had surf and turf steaks with crab cooked on top. Awesome crab legs (I don't normally like crab) mexican food, Italian food, and awesome desert.   This place was the best! And we had a wonderful waiter, I wish I could remember his name. He was an older gentlemen spoke Spanish and English and was very polite and kind to our table.   :)

cz3hPZRSF2DlixPkNw1hGA.text: This is definitely one of the best buffet I have been to in terms of quality and choices. The price is also amazing for this quality, especially lunch price. The seafood is amazing both for lunch and dinner, including crab legs, mussels, clams, and paella.  There are roast beef, turkey, chicken and pork, indian, Asian, and Mexican foods too. The dessert menu is also huge and there are different options. I absolutely recommend it to people who want a great food with a decent price.

2F5cNQh4RMM5zpbE2iFq8w.text: As beautiful as Aria is, the buffet lived up to the aesthetics. We ended up eating at the Aria buffet for lunch the day we landed in Vegas, with anticipation to eat at the Bellagio buffet the following day. I was blow away by the selection at Aria. On any given day you can find, at least five types of dim-sum, fried rice, lo mein,  general tso chicken, assortment of sushi, piles of snow crab legs (already split for convenience), steamed crawfish, assortment of pizzas, Indian food, Israeli type mezze, a carving station, and finally a selection of comfort food.   We were pleasantly overwhelmed with all the options, considering it was only lunch. Quite a few items are still a bit bland and will need salt, but that is typical with a buffet and hoping to satisfy many palettes. I think the lunch buffet was around $26 (plus tax/tip), which I made up for with just the crab legs I ate. I kept flocking to the chicken shumai dim sum and shrimp dumplings. The curry chicken and tabouleh were also surprisingly good, but these items won't always be available. I completely over looked the soups, but I was informed there was also lobster bisque.   My only complaint is that the cashier wanted 18% gratuity for our party of 8 to sit together, which perhaps we should have just paid. I thoroughly enjoyed my meal at Aria buffet, which had a shorter line and was miles better than Bellagio's rendering. Eat here, especially if you're hungover.

swNQPAWEuiPPao1Mrl-LIw.text: Was staying at vdara when we decided to take a short walk to the buffet at aria. Woke up on a Thursday (August 3rd) around noon and got to the buffet line around 1pm for brunch. About 10 people already waiting in line, which isn't terrible because Vegas buffers usually have a long wait to check in to get seated. About a 10 min wait in line to check in and pay. Got seated next to the jacuzzi facing the pool. The buffet had so many options! I started in the Asian cuisine (which is the first station on the left next to the desserts) my eyes were bigger than my stomach! Pad Thai, rice in a cooker for self serving, pho with all the toppings you can add. Omelet station, pizza station, Charcuterie, multiple cheeses, middle eastern food with homemade naan bread, tahziki, mexican food with pozole! Prime rib, Mac and cheese, sliders, bagels and pastries, sushi, crab legs, salad bar, waffles with whip cream and fruit compote toppings. (Waffles were amazing, kept coming back for more), fresh squeezed watermelon juice, and more!! The desserts were amazing. The muffins were the same ones they sell at the fancy bakery in the casino. Tons of gelato options! Our server was great! Attentive and friendly. Removed used plates quickly to give us more room to get more food. Overall a great experience, can't wait to come back!

2xq_urd0QaB9s_Wscv9BnA.text: Great crab legs. Awesome waitress she had our drinks out before we finished the other.  I didn't think the food was that great for the price you pay. The pizza sucks. The or meat is pretty good. The other selections just are not that great and lack a little flavor. I do give 3 stars just for the service

Dc7d8JihNZgEaRvKptzUpQ.text: Should have looked here, instead of some of the ratings of the top buffets in Vegas. It's 2 stars to me. Value wise, it's not that expensive, and if truth be told you get what you pay for.   1) They have Mongolian, although the ingredients (vegetables, pineapple, water chestnuts etc) didn't look that fresh. The dish was just ok. 2) No shrimp, no crab, no seafood to speak of. Mussels in cream sauce, wouldn't prepare me some without it.  3) The rest of the buffet was nothing special.  Without wheels to take bus to eat here, was a waste of time. I'd rather spend a little more for better food. Will try Wynn tomorrow and report.

p5Zi7fzeItyylpY1C4u27g.text: Lunch was 40 bucks on a Sunday. The selections were great. Had lots to chose from. Seafood, Italian, vegan, Mexican, steaks..etc. Our waiter was great. Very nice and fast. I would definitely come back.

txk2cDssHToZUyRmYDDvPg.text: So I had heard about a locals discount that the aria offers, so of course my friend called first to make sure it was True which they confirmed it was. Well when I went I got absolutely no discount, the cashier that helped me was extremely rude and told me I was lucky he gave me any discount on my kids which I had to pay for 1 of the 2 that were aged between 5-12. The buffet was amazing and I paid $60 anyways because I didn't want to disappoint my kids but there customer service here is absolutely horrible. Even the server we had never tended to our table, we had no drinks the whole time there and dirty plates on our table the majority of the time. Bad customer service by there staff was just absolutely horrible. I wouldn't recommend this place to no one

vx25M3wPPli85v6x6egTKQ.text: I'm ranking 4 stars because this place serves crab all day!! All I wanted to do was eat crabs and other seafood items for lunch. A lot of places have seafood specials for Friday night or during dinner. I thought the 3 options for king, snow, and rock crabs were awesome. Fully enjoyed the carving station too.  Now with that said, everything else is meh. Especially the Asian section. I would rate all that 3 stars, but overall we had a good time and the staff was very nice.   Tip - Avoid shift change at 3pm. Line is forever long!

xHG3IEEtJHLXvynJNA7stw.text: This is my favorite buffet in Vegas! Every single item I tried was amazing! I have absolutely no complaints.... well, maybe just one. The alcohol isn't free! Lol.   The selection of food blew my mind. I wanted to go back for seconds of everything I tried, but there was absolutely no room left in my tummy. Our server also came around pretty frequently to check on us, which is a plus!   I thoroughly enjoyed this one and I think everyone should give it a try. It can be expensive though... I want to say it's $45+ per person. But you can get comped out or use rewards for discounts.

jgbA-a2gsgeppjzqSz9Ing.text: Our 2nd Buffet stop took us to Aria and their The Buffet restaurant. Being a holiday weekend, the waiting queue was expectedly long. It took us about an hour to get to our turn and another 10 mins to finally get a table. Suffice to say, this placed was jam packed!  Service : Excellent! From the lady who took us to our tables, to the cleaning staff, everyone was spot on with their duties, and despite the mad rush continued to be cheerful about it!  Food : A total contrast from the previous day's experience at Wynn! Variety on offer was plentiful and every dish we tried was perfectly seasoned and oh so sumptuous! Special nods to their Shrimp n Grits, Pork Belly, Mango Jalapeno Sausage, Creme Brulee and Customized Poke Bowls  End thoughts : This was arguably one of the better buffets we've had in Vegas and should certainly be on your list.

DQb06d41gJhFgZNXL5IIbg.text: I don't understand why this restraraunt has five stars. The place is super clean! The line moved swiftly and the waitress was really friendly. There were a lot of people here so I knew the food was going to be really good. To take the cake, they had one for two bottomless drinks for 19.99. I thought this meant that my husband I would have to pay $19.99 a piece, it turns out that we paid 19.99 for both of us to drink endlessly! We were so excited we gave the waitress a high five.  They had so many different types of food from all across the world! It was overwhelming and I could not figure out where I wanted to start. Everything was simply amazing.  They even have a pass where you can pay $60 and eat here all day. It is totally worth it. Also, I forgot to mention the drinks were really good and strong. This is my first time here. You would definitely be back.

E2b3rvxl9uxZCIv0Ggavvw.text: Surprisingly great time and plenty of food everywhere you look. Lots of variety, I appreciated the organization efforts as far as type of cuisines and having a lot of the smaller plates their own little bowls and saucers is so nice to just grab and go. We showed up about 10:30 AM, just in time for brunch and was able to be seated. We left around 1130 AM and that's when the lines started to pick up. Tons of desserts, ice cream bar and fruit parfaits; things like that. They had shrimp and grits, definitely recommend. Skip the pizza and go for the meat plates instead. We didn't get to try the meatball but they were huge. Loved the little jars of different juices to try. They have omelettes, waffles the usual ordering stands. Don't be afraid to make multiple trips. Only complaint is how people were as far as lines and cutting or reaching over you while you're trying to plate your own food. But overall we would like to come back if we stay at Aria again.

zH1aVpSfH9HdO7AYYDkSqQ.text: Simple review - and I have eaten at MANY on the strip - BEST BUFFET ON THE STRIP ! Others have gotten so old and stale and are not trying to compete or modernize or to find a niche - this location has done it ALL ! Can't wait to go back.

mBz5ZRHHcmPKgodbpuFxuA.text: Wife and I were very disappointed in the buffet at Aria. With such an incredible property we were expecting much much more, not to mention the $92 we spent! We had dinner on a thursday evening. There was no line at about 7:30, which is actually a bad sign (meaning not busy so not popular, we should've ran!). I have been to Bacchanal multiple times and there is always about an hour wait, for a reason.   Well the buffet at Aria was awful! We went for the crab, as the hostess on the phone said they had king crab that night, but turns out there is only king crab on weekends. The snow crab they had was the dinkiest tiniest puniest crab I have ever seen in my life! Several others in line were questioning and mentioning how tiny these crab legs were. Seriously go see for yourself the legs are absolutely minuscule I didn't even know they could be purchased in that tiny size. I asked the server behind the counter why the legs are so small he said "ask my boss, he changed them a few months ago to these small ones." It was hardly worth cracking these legs as there is no meat in them.   Everything else we tried was very average. Indian food was bland. Pasta station was cheap. Asian and mexican foods were not good. My tiny cut of brisket was dry and unappetizing. Poke bowl was ok. What a joke. I was embarrassed to have taken my wife here. Do yourself a favor and steer clear from Aria, go to bacchanal or just stay home.

8nM8cmOrFXaW8w2V-h2TOw.text: First off I want to recognize LUZ. This woman was busting her hump working our busy section by herself and all with a great attitude and smile. She had piles of dishes to take back but that didn't stop her from making sure our drinks were filled and our old plates were taken away promptly. I was thoroughly impressed and I hope to see her there again when I return.   Now to the establishment. I loved it. There was a good selection of food and it was all hot and delicious. I especially enjoyed the crab legs and shrimp! The Lamb was my other favorite. The desert bar was amazing, so much to choose from. Due to a medical condition I haven't been able to be out like this in roughly 5 years so this was a real treat and one of those little victories. I had just gotten Married on this day and we chose to have dinner at this place and it was worth it. Thank you.   LUZ, YOU ROCK GIRL! KEEP IT UP!

4_5LRk513JsNC2ultvVsnw.text: I LOVED this buffet! It was under $30 for lunch when we went. The line wasn't too bad and they moved people along quickly. They also have options like 2 for $20 if you and your dining partner want unlimited drinks.  The food was amazing! They had an entire seafood section that even included a place to get your own poke bowl made. Schrimp, salmon, mussels, and crab legs in unlimited amounts. Pizza, comfort food, pho, gelato, indian food... anything your heart desires you can find it here.   Service is a little slow for beverages.. but I still recommend this place for sure!

n--96L2rXgs4otQR0-UMqw.text: We liked this buffet.  Bit pricey, but it had a lot of foods that my nephew, son and I would eat!    Pork Adobo, some adobo had garlic rice in it? Yums, prime rib, pork belly, crab (was not king), poke, bread pudding, all sorts of desserts.  Lots to choose from.  I couldn't list it all.  They had a all you can drink for additional $19.99, but honestly we were there for the food!

9cBvlyxdnyFN5hDtbwLvfw.text: First meal in Vegas right after we got off the plane. We did a run through to see what items they had for dinner and everything looked very appealing, so we decided to dine in. The pho was pretty good and so was the clam linguini. The cowboy steak was also a favorite of ours. There were four of us so we tried just about everything but unfortunately most of the food fell below average. The worst part was all of us had horrible stomach aches after dining in and my stomach had a hard time recovering for the rest of my four day Vegas trip. On the plus side, they have bottomless select drinks for $20 and for those that love mimosas and bloody Mary's, you are welcome!!!

d9uMIMsSd7bSldp2F6VdDA.text: $50 pp for nothing but salty food. Almost as if I was eating a spoon full of it.  Only thing I like there were the spinach dip with chips & gelato ice cream.

UkYUabpvAQeyxbVMxM85Cg.text: Food was very fresh. Some of the foods could have used a little more seasoning and during the weekdays the crab legs are small and chopped into pieces. Aside from that, it was great. A large variety to choose from. Would recommend going!

IC22mLi-b54AEpH4P-wvQg.text: I liked this buffet in the aria it was about $40 plus if you want unlimited mimosas and drinks.. The food was decent, we did have to wait almost 45 mins to get inside, but other than that I would try to place again I was so full I didn't get to try everything, And it gets a plus for being extra clean!

photos.caption: Photo of The Buffet at ARIA - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of The Buffet at ARIA - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of The Buffet at ARIA - Las Vegas, NV, United States

Xiur0UGmXfJnoNiMw3LWHA.text: Out of all the buffets I've tried in Vegas, I think this has been the worst... I know it's new but nothing is good here. Came here on a Wednesday night and there was a very short line. Plenty of empty tables inside.  Service was terrible. We were a party of 9 and we had one server who rarely came over to our table. We wanted extra napkins or different drinks and flagged down someone else and the lady said you guys are not my table. Please wait for your server. Like what???? You can't fulfill a simple request like getting more napkins? I think it's ridiculous that a server can not help a large table if it's not her assigned table.   None of the food stood out to me and there was such a small variety of selections. Compared to other buffets on the strip, I would not want to come back to this one.

9hMW9GmG-JKztwIS_2iKUQ.text: Prior to going I was reading the reviews on Aria and I was like "No way! Too good to be True!"  You can get shrimp, assorted seafood and Alaskan king crab??!! Alaskan king crab by itself is enough to make me happy.  Then I saw the line! What??!!! Nonexistent??!! Then I got like a local discount! Let's just say it was significantly lower at a rate almost buy one get one free.  Literally waited at most 5 min! I was like OMG I found a new seafood place even if it's on the strip! Until I saw the quality of the king crab. Tiny, dry, salty, and they don't even open the crab leg for you! If you never ate Alaskan king you would know it's a pain to de-shell.  Nothing else really stand out as everything else you can get easily in any Buffett.  Plus no oysters????? Ohh the interior looks like late 80's mall cafeteria with glass cylinders that I'm assuming is attempting to pass for chandelier but cheapens the whole ambience.  Also the view of the pool might be nice if the back of the pool bar didn't cover up most of the pool.  So when you look out of the window it looks like storage shed.
