Try it and you'll see what I mean.  When there are more in your party, that amount should be more.  Yes, it's like a 50% gratuity, but it's totally worth it.  We will be back ARIA BUFFET!  We had a great time and great service!  GREAT FOOD, TOO! Thanks so much.

photos.caption: Photo of The Buffet at ARIA - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Eggs Benedict, yummy!
Photo of The Buffet at ARIA - Las Vegas, NV, United States. The chocolate mousse layered dessert is my favorite!
Photo of The Buffet at ARIA - Las Vegas, NV, United States

xonNxKY7Z0y53WAiGeNZaQ.text: Read the reviews, I understand people aren't impressed by lunch or dinner. However, I went for breakfast, and it was delicious with many diverse options. Their 'Latin' section had a wonderful single serving huevos rancheros. In the center part they had a single serving eggs benedict. I was really impressed by the pancakes because they had huge pancakes and would cut you a piece of your choosing. Plenty of fresh fruit toppings.  As it was breakfast, I did not have anything from their seafood collection. So I cannot comment on the freshness but it was a very impressive spread.   4 stars for breakfast. They had everything I wanted and more than I imagined.

hBzG1eluly2ROyPIDJ-2gw.text: Where to start? This place is a disaster... Salad section was good, but that was it.  Stay away from anything that is supposed to be hot.   Meats in the Carvery section looked like they had been under those hot lights for days.  Food looked crusty and dried out.  Short ribs and lamb ragu were under those lights waaaay to long.  Steak was tough.  As for the crab legs, they were tasteless, water soaked and over cooked.  The desserts were the best part.  Worst of all is the misrepresentation of "Bottomless Beverages" that is advertised.  This adds $20.00 to your bill if you are dumb enough (like most of our party) to not see in the tiniest of print: "includes endless offerings of the following beverages".  Bloody Mary, Mimosa, Strawberry Spritzer, Rum Punch.  All cheap fruity cocktails.  Very limited beer and wine labels.  The Cabernet was disgusting.  Service was mediocre as our "server" who was guaranteed at least an 18% tip for only bringing beverages, hardly cleared our table of dirty plates. That's it!  All in all, this came to $83.00 a head.  We left hungry, so disappointed and totally ripped off.  Stay away from the Aria Buffet!!!

3ng3wx_Ckq7DgdBLNihxrg.text: Always have a decent experience here as the food is pretty good. My only issue is that there was not one single dessert that didn't have milk or butter in it. They were kind enough to bring out some old, slimy sorbet that was probably from the bottom of an old container. Even some kettle corn would be an option, but nothing. I've heard several people complain about the lack of milk/butter free items available. Time to make a change for the better Aria, your buffet is one of the best so make it even better!

EBR4jCXa3cKS-lz_Fp8QHg.text: This is the WORST ever and I find Burger King acceptable so that tells you how AWFUL the food and service are.  I should have been terrified immediately (and turned around instead) at the sight of an osso bucco swimming in its fat and coagulated sauce. Ghastly!   Don't let the rich selection of international cuisine fool you--it's all gimmick. The Mexican and Italian dishes are interchangeable, the Japanese food tasted more like stale Filipino dishes...  I'm mad as I was robbed time and intestinal space--never mind the money...be afraid, be very afraid...

PvOKJ2Js_79c5pwmzDdMQg.text: Skip the Asian side,  it's no good.  Everything else was just okay or good.  I enjoyed the Indian side.  The Nan and Indian dishes were good.   Breakfast items were good. The seafood was not very good.   Not fresh!  They had an okay dessert section, the usual cheesecake, mouse, ice cream,  but not too many of my favorite pies. Such as pecan, cherry.

CicE7nUp2HmVeIYoloTvbQ.text: Ask for Mary Anne, she is the best sever they have hands down. We eat here at least once a month and never have ever received the level of service she just gave us. We will be asking for her from now on for sure. She maybe be the sweetest person working here too.   Chef: Shrimp was bigger and better than ever but mixed with other stuff. I was disappointed there was no mint sauce for the lamb and the chops were fatty. Over the last few years you've definitely improved everything. Good job.

mcypXbgXtDmZJEOQlUeLMg.text: Terrible buffet and overpriced. Not worth it. The food not tasty. Too many things cold when its supposed to be hot. Very bad experience.

IlVipkSgsdLHD9rig6GXWg.text: Oh...my...delight!!!!! This buffet is rated second three times in a row by several travel websites the first being an ultra expensive buffet also on the strip. We went for lunch on our way back to LA from Utah and this place DID NOT DISAPPOINT! Located in the swank and upper crust Aria Hotel, The Buffet is modern and decadent with several dishes from Indian, Japanese, American, Thai, Mexican, Italian...am I leaving something out?! They had a carving table with beef, pork, chicken...unicorn! Fresh crab with hot, succulent chunks of meat, barrels of fresh clams, sushi galore, a gelato station, to die for bread pudding, blondies... I wanna go back like...now!!!!! 36 bucks gets you entry into this wonder place of tasty delights and non alcoholic drinks! An additional 16.99 gets you unlimited Bloody Mary's and Mimosas etc. This buffet is worth EVERY FREAKIN PENNY. I wanted to eat, find a spot to nap and then eat some more. Beef so tender...it melts in your mouth. Seaweed salad so vibrant and seaweedy...one of the best I've ever had. There was no way I could sample EVERYTHING. Waitstaff is very attentive and nice, food was refreshed often. Bathrooms were clean!!!!!! I could go on and on about this spot like a schoolgirl crush but just know I will be back in Vegas to be here. Beautiful hotel, beautiful scenery...u gotta check it out! Forget the gambling...Aria's Buffet is the spot!

photos.caption: Photo of The Buffet at ARIA - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Devoured
Photo of The Buffet at ARIA - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Mosh mash of delicious yummy !!!
Photo of The Buffet at ARIA - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Crabs galore! Seafood galore!!!

xbYRqAj-GXU-NWUQ3UI0FA.text: This is a terrible buffet. Everything is cold,hard and dried out. The hostess is rude and won't sit you where you request. They used to have crab legs....no more. The choices suck! And are weird. I won't go back!

ruwAF-ZKoTx16YG98SYQzA.text: Let me just say now that I did not try a wide variety of dishes.  I had a lot of the King Crab legs with lemon and what was supposed to be 'clarified buttah'.  That was good.  Tried the mussels and clams - did not keep well on the buffet line. These mollusks are best served freshly cooked.  But had a good cut of the prime rib with creamed horseradish and au jus, and a lil bit of mashed potatoes.  That was good.  Also had chicken liver that I ate on a bun, added hard boiled eggs and thinly sliced red onions. For dessert had some gelato, cookie, brownie, butterscotch on a shot glass  - sorry  I am sooo full right now I don't want to get up to check on the name.  Food coma.  The service was great both on the buffet line and our table. We appreciated the attentiveness. Hope they keep it up.

photos.caption: Photo of The Buffet at ARIA - Las Vegas, NV, United States

ZfIP2rbdve71KAyRaK3Y0A.text: 2014 YELP 365 CHALLENGE - 84/365  For me, this was probably the best buffet I have ever been to. A little pricey but you get what you pay for. And what you get are RIDICULOUS options for your evening of buffeting and phenomenal customer service. We came in for a late dinner on Saturday night and were pleasantly surprised. First off, the decor and ambiance is modern and sleek, with a touch of home-cooked feel throughout. For example, the plates at each station were in fun home-cooked/already used looking pans and plates which made it feel as if you were grabbing some food from your mom's pots and pans back at home. The place didn't feel or look snooty or too fancy at all. One of the best parts of our experience here was the customer service. Our server was so attentive, clearing plates AS SOON as we were done and bringing us refills when we were half done with our current drinks. And our section was completely packed too! We were very impressed. The food was delicious. Macaroni and cheese was one of my top eats of the night! I went back for seconds and thirds for sure. Same with the mozzarella/spinach pizza. WOW, I've never had pizza that good at a buffet before. I thoroughly enjoyed the Indian cuisine. The chicken Masala was as good as I've had it at an Indian restaurant, but the naan was a little dry and tasteless. The Chow Fun was delicious, and the chicken potstickers were good too. On my last round, I realized that they had a sandwich bar that I completely missed with delicious looking options. The dessert bar was AMAZING! They had delicious gelato/icecream that was to die for! The red velvet whoopie was good! I got a pudding pie of some sort that was the best thing I had from the desserts. Overall, It was a great experience, and I'm already making plans to come back with friends when we are in Vegas again!

3XRki4KR2S9pQxfbuYsydQ.text: Came here for dinner twice and lunch once.  We had used MyVegas buy one get one free coupons so it was a pretty awesome deal for us.  But if I were to pay $35 for dinner or $22 for lunch I would have been extremely disappointed.    First dinner was on a Monday night.  Awesome thing is they had raw oysters on the half shell (love raw oysters).  The buffet however was dead.  This meant the turnover for the food wasn't that great.  The seafood stews had shriveled up shrimps and clams from sitting out too long.  Even the cheese tasted bad like it's been there since lunch.  The piece of blue cheese I had was hard for a soft cheese.  Dried up!  So I stuck to an oyster and crab leg dinner this night.  I had also tried the corn on the cob but the corn was so extremely mushy and gross with the caked on mayo I couldn't eat it.    We came again for dinner and I guess because it was a Thursday before Xmas week there were a lot more people at the buffet which meant the food was a lot fresher.  The crab, crawfish, mussels and seafood stews were really good.  But no oysters.  That was a disappointment.  I asked the seafood chef and was told oysters are only served on weekends but any leftovers are served Monday nights.    The Aria dinner buffet is I think $1-2 more than the Bellagio buffet.  If that's the case, Bellagio is much much better.  Fresh food and tastier.  I will complete a review on that buffet as well.    When we came for lunch the menu looked identical to the dinner menu.  We came during CES week so turnover was high and everything was fresh.  With the same buffet menu for lunch and dinner (incl crab legs) lunch is obv better value.    Before you eat just see how busy the buffet is first.  Higher turnover means fresher food.

WxTzMTuaetFZyV9i7onPMw.text: I think a review of 3 for a ok is about right.    The prime rib was pretty good vs other places I've tried.  I didn't try their other carved meats like their chicken, brisket, ham etc however they all looked delicious.  The mac and cheese and other sides were amazing.  Reason i only give it a 3 is because for a buffet to get anything higher i think the food should not taste like "buffet" food.   Especially when your dropping 40 to 50 bucks including tax and tip.   Some buffets do this.   Aria doesn't.   I think for less money you could go to any of the lower end hotels and still get the same buffet and same food.  Aside from the carved meat station and the seafood (crab legs and peeled shrimp) everything else wasn't even good it was average at best.   Mexican food stale.  Asian food stale and horrible.   The rest were standard things like fried chicken breasts potato wedges etc.  If your gonna come here go straight to the carved meats (rotisserie chicken, prime rib, brisket, etc).  Otherwise if your looking for the same quality but save some money go to planet hollywood or anywhere else its cheaper.  I still think rio buffet was one if the best I've had.

8cneNMHJhDwBKOOZcRe4AQ.text: The servers were nice and attentive. They always refilled our drinks. We used our rewards from the myvegas app and got the 2for1 deal. Crab legs were great. The Thai tea flavored gelato was yummy too.

photos.caption: Photo of The Buffet at ARIA - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Yummy

MH7OF8K-lKaBtw0_H_rfLw.text: I hate this stupid buffet. I end up here when I stay at Aria for one reason, pure laziness. I usually eat here right after checking and I am "already here" or right before I check out, and I figure it's quick and better than fast food on the road. Each time I have eaten here (at least three times now) it has been for the weekend brunch. I have disliked it each time.  They never have fresh mimosas. I never know where they come from, but no bottles of champagne in sight.  The food has been cold, and left around between the morning rush and the lunch rush, so keep that in mind if you come at an odd time. Hopefully, you don't come here at all.

n8CzJokGGha-1l92xC5_gQ.text: What a great buffet! We went around 10am so it was a mixture of brunch and more lunch food. I love how they had authentic tastes of everything, the masala, hot and sour soup, and country food to name a few. Everything was fresh, they were constantly making na'an bread, and the staff were awesome at clearing our table and refilling our mimosas. Speaking of, go during the week! The buffet with unlimited alcohol was only 40 bucks. And did I mention how amazing their dessert table was? You need to check them out.

_g5rCKfxDObVd1w3Enha0w.text: Thank goodness this lunch buffett was free for me, because the service and food was terrible. Small glass of soda and I only got 1 refill when my glass set empty for quite some time. It was not busy in my servers area, so no excuses. Food was not very good and was surprised that they had peel and eat shrimp for the prices they charged, and not shrimp already peeled. Crab legs for lunch but no tools to crack them. Not very many stations with different food being offered as other buffets. Asian gentleman at the dessert station was not friendly and does not need to be in a customer service role

v9RJ6mkdqnFfbTyebEpGDA.text: I have been to the Aria buffet many times over the past 2 years.  It's not bad ... but it's not great.   There is a decent selection of food.  Asian, Indian, Italian,  plenty of sliced meats, hot and cold seafood options,  huge salad bar, and numerous desserts and/or pastries.    I usually come during breakfast/brunch hours. During the week it's cheaper $20 per person... that's a bargain for Vegas. Most regular restaurants are $20 per entree, so I figure why not buffet it and have a variety of food and dessert.    Anywho... the food is hot and I always find something to my liking.  The coffee is surprisingly very good. Come early for the freshest options.

7UNz3K3Da6E8-aw0CeJDQQ.text: I wanted to give this buffet a try because it was one of the few places in Vegas I could find that does brunch during the week, and because of the unlimited alcohol option. The unlimited alcohol add on is $19.99 for 2 people which I thought was a steal. It includes mimosas, margaritas, rum punch, bloody marys, cranberry spritzers, champagne, beer and wine. The buffet itself was $28.99. The food was just okay. I really wish there were more breakfast options, but what they did have was good. I got a made to order omelet and had sausage, chicken & waffles, and shrimp & grits to satisfy my breakfast cravings. They had both regular and spicy crab legs, both of which were good. After two mimosas, two watermelon lime margaritas, and a Blue Moon, things got a bit fuzzy. We definitely got our money's worth on the drinks... not so much on the food. I've heard the dinner buffet is really good here so maybe we'll try that on our next Vegas trip.

7KjPzwAzl50f5TApvCRY9A.text: I've been to Vegas many times and always like to try a different buffet every time I come. When we landed in Vegas, we asked our Lyft driver which buffet he would recommended that was reasonably affordable. He suggested the Buffet at ARIA. This buffet was very clean, and modernly decorated. I was very excited at all the different selections they had to offer. I tried a little bit of everything! It was fantastic! One of the stations that stands out in my memory was the Vietnamise Pho station where you make your own rare steak Pho. Also, there was a large selection of crab and other seafood items which are my favorite! No matter what you like, Italian, Asian, seafood, mexican, middle eastern, they have something for you! Next time I am in Vegas, I will be coming here again.

ZCS_SPU5rGD6sZucS_Qi_g.text: I love how they have seafood everyday of the week!  It's pretty priced fairly at $26.99/person for lunch.  The service is good.

9aeTFHNlES8kGrHCJ_LVAg.text: Good Food. Fantastic Service. Unethical Business Practices.  We ate there every day while staying at Aria from 17-23 December 2013 due to a promotion where they provided a $68 buffet voucher per night.  The food variety is relatively small to other places but the quality is top notch.  The wait staff is second to none. They were super attentive and friendly and collectively made the best service experience I've ever had in Vegas.  So here's the bad part. Two days in to our voucher deal they nearly doubled the price per person for the buffet. They called it "Holiday Brunch" or something like that. Nothing changed (food or service) except for the price which went up $20 dollars per person. The "free" buffet deal turned out to be anything but. The place wasn't even more crowded than usual.  I understand Vegas exists to vacuum the cash out of your bank account but the gimmick pulled by Aria's management over the buffet price amounted to cheating their customers.   Don't treat your customers like complete suckers and they may just return with their business. It's no wonder MGM resorts posts billions in losses on a regular basis.

vjXeGK7b-hZqO5HFyjDh9w.text: $40 dinner buffet. Pricey but delicious. The crab legs were absolutely amazing! Unlimited, pre-cut and decent sizes. The sushi was limited but also very good. There were clams, shrimp and other seafood delights available as well. And they have ribs and steaks for meat lovers. The dessert was pretty bad though. A huge variety of garbage. If seafood doesn't interest you, I probably wouldn't suggest eating here.  12.99 for unlimited drink package

54jOTv51gLNmmqN34gAE4A.text: One of my favorite places to have a wonderful buffet on a cheaper side on the strips of Las Vegas. Been there many times and can't wait to go there again next week. The food selection is much much better than Wicked Spoon at Cosmo, and the carrot juice mixed with a hint of ginger is everything for a great kick start in the morning.

sRgUSYJ2Z85Gq-t_PcMx1A.text: For $45 not necessary worth the price unless you are a PIG that likes average to below average food.  The additional $12.99 for the unlimited drinks for (2 hours) is well worth it...probably more than the food itself.  Treat it like a bottomless bar with all the food you can eat for 2 hours.

BWdfhWXF3wk4zyHU9s2_oA.text: This is a great buffet place with great warm crab legs. Many food selections. Also children under 12 eat for free.

_NV-YE6CwYyL6ZWhjMUMnw.text: I tried a variety of dishes from the different stations, none of which were well-prepared. The Pork Bun was dried and leathery; the meats were over-salted; the "Asian" dishes were bland; the lamb stew had more bones than meat. The desserts were the only highlight. Certainly not worth the $50 price tag (which doesn't include a cocktail).

r-U58ScOzmdA3YqXOu-kww.text: My husband and I visited Las Vegas this past week for his 30th birthday and a friend recommended Aria Buffet.   Food was awesome, had variety of selections! Asian, Mediterranean, american, Mexican, tandoori  Food was great and desserts were fabulous. I had tons of crab legs with butter and it was to die for. Staff was always on top of our drinks and cleaning off our tables. Wonderful! What a great way to start a brunch!

TEWtngBucEoFZ7Y2h58elw.text: Not impressed at all. Very small selection compared to other buffets that I have been to in Vegas. The food looked like it had been sitting out for a while and tasted as bad as it looked. I love the dessert bars at buffets, if you are anything like me, prepare to be disappointed with their tiny selection of not so good tasting treats!! Overall, $40 is way overpriced for cafeteria food.

RhUa3-jDT27vlY8W3mnYhQ.text: Just had the holiday buffet brunch at Aria. It was a really good experience. We went at  3, so were able to eat their dinner selections too which start at 4. The buffet was pricey compared to the other ones around, is comparable to the one at Bellagio. The quality of the food was really good, they had some really  good tandoori chicken. All their food was great. They had one of the best collections of Dessert I have ever had. I would really recommend the buffet to everyone.

photos.caption: Photo of The Buffet at ARIA - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Few of the dessert options

ZD8sk140zKAOIwgxe-0PgQ.text: Worst buffet I have ever been to in Vegas. The hostess were just plain rude. My friends and I were just asking a simple question and one of them just turned to us and said, "why are you even talking?" We were applaud and will never return.   As for the food, we walked around and tried a little bit of everything but a lot of the food was old. Nothing stood out to us. Don't waste your time eating at this place.

GHgEG0ccM-Ykyr_qBGl00g.text: food is so so ...We went there since we read some reviews. A little bit disappointed. The food selection is really too few compared with other buffet. But the service is great. We spent 95 dollar for two people there. Not highly recommended.

37FXQwYnxd7-nSqG1iyqwQ.text: Crab legs, mussels, shrimp, Indian cuisine, Mexican cuisine, dim sum and all the buffet staples. This is one of my favorite buffets in Vegas. We visit Las Vegas several times per year and without fail you can find us at the Aria for breakfast or lunch.

BFkO3HCSmSt6_lGy2ZMTgw.text: The food is amazing: prepared to near perfection and visually pleasing. The poke and pork belly are must haves.   Service, however, is lacking. Buffett notwithstanding a guest should not wait a full meal for a cocktail. Absolutely unacceptable. We opted for the bottomless drinks option but could not exercise it on account of lackluster table side service. I spoke with the manager who graciously agreed to refund the beverage package. Her willingness to engage with customers and correct errors is to be commended.   I will visit again and expect that the service has improved.

ZR-BI8z54KKY8KowFbwjkQ.text: I'd say this place is almost as good as the highly rated Bacchanal buffet at Caesar's. I've eaten at most of the buffets on the Strip and think this is one of the better ones in terms of food quality and restaurant ambiance (for a Vegas buffet).   I went there about 30 minutes before their weekend brunch was over so there were no lineups to contend with and I could also sample some of their dinner items when they switched over. The food selection was not as extensive as the aforementioned buffet. However, what was there I would say was fairly high quality and authentic.  Even though it was during the switchover period, most of the food were still fresh-tasting.  Only a small handful seems like they were sitting for some time.   Some memorable items included the French toast with a creamy berry filling, prime rib cooked just right, nice sized tiger shrimp, moist baked salmon,  Chicago style pizza, grilled swordfish, and their yummy desserts.    I'll be placing this on my buffets to revisit list :-)

EorEtVCIhsy0AetzgzNl4g.text: Nothing special.  Actually a slight disappointment.   Paid $40 each for the dinner buffet, but where's the food???  Ok they had a station for prime rib and lamb, which was good. Not great.  They had King Crab legs, just good. Not too meaty.  Dessert had the most choices, but I'm really there to eat dinner and don't have much of a sweet tooth so I was disappointed. As for salad and pizza and soups , that's not my idea of a $40 dinner buffet.

C4z8FCTy36HKMN-HnSlpeQ.text: The decoration was nice, and the food were decent. It was nice touch that they split-ed the snow crab in half, so it was easy to eat.   However, the food were quite salty. I ate only few of the snow crab, and don't want to eat anymore.   The thing that bring Aria buffet to 2 star is their service  - the hostess was slow and not accommodating ( we had a large party, and they won't seat us in same table unless we paid the large party fee. No other buffet places had made us do that.)  - the waiters never brought over some of our drinks order

photos.caption: Photo of The Buffet at ARIA - Las Vegas, NV, United States. different type of cream cheese

f6wikU90-5yemcea7s_pXw.text: Goods- food quality is up there. had the breakfast buffet the first day and lunch on the last. Everything was fresh and well prepped, nice presentation and most was reasonably tasty for a buffet.   Bads- service was LAGGIN! I'm there on a Monday morning at 9am, probably 25 other people in the place. How long does it really take for coffee and a water?   WHEN YOU GO- lunch was the better option. More of a variety and the service was slightly snappier.

V-H9EpLlKMuhNWDxUNc8kg.text: We went for lunch on a Friday. There was crab, lamb, prime rib, etc. It was your typical buffet in Vegas. For 20 bucks for lunch , I thought it was decent. The crab was good as well as the salmon sashimi. Since I have now have a sweet tooth, the dessert bar is what I look forward to. The chocolate chip cookies were delicious, but the creme brulee was a bit of a disappointment.....a little overcooked. Overall, I will go back if I have visitors in town who want to venture out to see City Center.

photos.caption: Photo of The Buffet at ARIA - Las Vegas, NV, United States. creme brulee
Photo of The Buffet at ARIA - Las Vegas, NV, United States. seafood and sushi

nGMlWVki6rvJwKzGMJ-ojw.text: Overwhelming in quantity, underwhelming in quality. Good variety. Definitely not worth 50 bucks :/

Dc7PIzyrjtoGvYa8nJ_5Ow.text: On my last trip to Vegas, I had the pleasure of dining at both Bacchanal and Wicked Spoon, so my bar for excessively expensive buffets was set pretty high.  Before last night, I had never left a buffet hungry.  The quality of the food is the reason for my rating.  Not one single dish was worth a second taste.  It was more on par with Golden Corral than a high end Vegas buffet.  My specific issues:  -The king crab legs were still partially frozen.  Any thick part was a solid crabsicle. -The snow crab legs must have been salted after they were cut open.  It was like eating a salt lick. -The crawfish were completely unseasoned - just boiled.  Do you know what unseasoned crawfish taste like?  Mud!  That's why southerners Cajun them up! -The paella, one of my favorite dishes, was a complete disaster.  It was both overcooked AND cold, they didn't rinse the clams ahead of time so there was a sandy grit to it, and I'm fairly certain the rice was dyed yellow with food coloring, because there was zero taste of saffron. -The lamb was very dry -The grilled prawns were burnt. This was not just a one-off mistake, I waited for 2 other batches to be taken by others before actually taking one myself, and it was exactly as rubbery as I had feared. -The sushi rice was very old and dry -The dim sum, while edible, was a far cry from authentic  I would say the dessert station is the best feature of this buffet, but it's nothing special.  All the desserts are adequate, but nothing I couldn't make myself and certainly nothing memorable or worth the extravagant price charged.  The only redeeming factor was the service.  My waitress refilled my drinks with the speed and stealth of a ninja, and the bus staff was also very prompt in removing used plates.  I wish I could have taken my $43 back from the register and given it to them.  Bottom line - if you want high end buffet and want to pay a lot for it, both Bacchanal and Wicked Spoon are orders of magnitude better than Aria.  If you want a low quality feed trough, the food here is right but the price is not.

LynPLjDm1EQRVv0ajbsPvQ.text: Didn't eat here but did a walk through. As a preggie woman, there was a lot I couldn't eat. Stack of king crab legs amazing. Sushi. Deli section. Nothing impressive.  One of the smallest buffets I've ever seen in Vegas.  I'm glad we did a 'tour' first before deciding on where to eat that day. I wouldn't have been happy with the selection.

-Qd2Lsl3lV4J5_dK_1T-qw.text: I ate here for lunch today.  24 bucks, including my iced teas.  For unlimited beer or wine, it would have cost 12.99.  Let's see, the salad items were very good.  Great quinoa salad, antipasto items including mozzarella balls, prosciutto.  Some sushi rolls also. Then I moved onto the seafood items.  The king crab legs obviously frozen, boiled shrimp, and even crawfish.  They did have a nice selection of mussels, seafood stew, and chowders. Lots of hot items, pizzas, carving meats, some ok pasta dishes including butternut ravioli and veggie lasagna.  Fair meatballs and broccoli Rabe. They had a middle Eastern bar, including hummus and baba gannoush. The Chinese food was worse than Chinese takeout at home.  Dumplings looked mushy. Desserts were the best items.  Bananas foster, gourmet cupcakes, pecan pie, flan.....all high quality. Cookies, muffins, pastries as well So, if you are in the mood for a great big salad and great desserts, give it a try.  I paid 18 bucks for a mediocre salad at olives yesterday.  This a few bucks more, but much better value.

VrsKQCxt5SU1UGJvBEq0pQ.text: We came here for Breakfast/Lunch. The line we were at was fast. So we were able to get seated in a matter of 3 minutes. Went here armed with myvegas vouchers, we got 2 free breakfast/lunch buffet. So I had to pay 2 more for the party of 4. Its approximately $50 total. Service was prompt, good selection of food. My brother love the pork bbq. But compared to Wicked Spoon, foodwise, I like Wicked Spoon better. But will definitely come here again whenever I get a food voucher!!!

photos.caption: Photo of The Buffet at ARIA - Las Vegas, NV, United States

3VXhbDz9dPIX2fs9Mw3ubw.text: Had lunch here on a Wednesday at noon and I was highly pleased. Reading some of the reviews, I was a little hesitant, however my experience was quite good. My boyfriend and I were seated promptly upon entrance and our waitress was nice and attentive. Though not too many selections to choose from, there were many items that were delicious. Some of the highlights for me were the omelet bar (you can choose ingredients for your omelet and a cook makes it for you), fried shrimp, steam crab legs (sweet and fresh), turkey, and clams in butter and lemon. Lunch was $24.99/ person which imo is pretty reasonable since everywhere on the strip is expensive anyways.

fXV3-HJUeUiyrq122voghw.text: Food is great! The desserts were alright but that worked it because I could do without the sugar.

rmymqATHVRCeJYc1B_Gcpg.text: Immediately after leaving, I went back up to the room because I had the urge to throw up, which I did. And NO I don't have an eating disorder.  Friend who walked in on me as I was voiding my stomach contents into the guest room toilet: "Ew."  Not a doctor, so I can't say if it was because I had a spoiled sushi roll, or if some piece of prime rib I ate had gone bad...or if in True Vegas fashion, I just really did overeat and my stomach just could not hang.  To be fair, it wasn't garbage whatsoever.  Descent upscale buffet with better than average ingredients.  The selection didn't seem as varied or plenty as Bellagio's or The Mirage's buffet though.  The dining area is well decorated...nice and contemporary --- in line with the rest of the Resort's styling.  One really weird thing I have to mention! While eating at a banquette seat, you WILL feel a rattling vibration as you dine which I'm guessing comes from the CityCenter tram.  Terrible design flaw.  We could actually see the surface of the wine in our glasses shiver like the way in the first Jurassic Park film when the terrified kids helplessly watched the water in the plastic cup moving when the T-Rex was stomping towards them.  Other notes: Aria comp'd half our bill (thanks Players Club) and we went when they were serving unlimited red wine and lobster tail (only available Friday & Saturday for Dinner).  Best thing there aside from the lobster tail is the lobster stuffed ravioli. Mmmm.

photos.caption: Photo of The Buffet at ARIA - Las Vegas, NV, United States. (Friday and Saturday gourmet dinner ONLY) Half of a Maine lobster with some lobster ravioli on the side.
Photo of The Buffet at ARIA - Las Vegas, NV, United States. I threw this all up when I got back to my room.

AXlk2791iAtQPk2BY2nznQ.text: This buffet was great for the price. And by price, I mean the fact that our party of 4 paid $5 each, since we had two complimentary passes and my magic roulette fingers paid for a significant portion of the other two buffets (you do the math!).  I think if we had paid the full $38.95 for dinner, I would have been much pickier about this review.  That said, we had bottomless wine (of which I only drank a sip because of the heavy caloric intake*) and a 1 lb steamed lobster.  My cousins loaded up on all sorts of fancy meats (think, prime rib, steak, king crab, snow crab) and swore that the prime rib was the best they've had. I, however, had my life changed by one thing that night: the creme brulee.   I devoured six of those suckers. Best creme brulee of my life!   Anywho, if you have some sort of complimentary pass or discount, I'd go for it. If not, you might be disappointed just because of the competition from other buffets.  * "this doesn't make sense" , you're probably thinking. why are you complaining about calories at a buffet? Well, I tell you, the more you fill your belly with woozy wine the less space there is for the king crab. Duhhhh.

JqKvC2NFQPBHc4pwvNvLIg.text: The reason this gets 4 stars is I used myvegas points to go to it and you don't have to wait in line. Love plugging a facebook game that wastes 200 hours of time for a free buffet playing it!! Actually the more I think about it, I would probably give this 4 stars even without myvegas but  I would never pay full price for this buffet .Its missing a couple of things to put it to that elite, lets gain 40lbs for the night, level.  I went here starving after golf. So I tried a lot of things!  I loved  the prime rib and cut crab legs! I enjoyed the chicken at the carving station as well.  The sushi selections were awful. The Italian station had some great meats and I loved the mushrooms. The mahi-mahi was very good. Loved the sauce it was in. I cant stand most Indian food so I avoided that area as I didn't want to curry myself away in a bag. The Asian noodles were decent. The service was very attentive. Drinks always filled and plates quickly grabbed. Overall I would definitely come again and will probably waste more time on facebook building up to another free meal!!

u9EJXU9P7CiYL1P0JO7t7A.text: Such a good buffet. Our waiter Danny was awesome. He was so attentive and always there. We were never without a drink, sometimes he brought us to if you knew he was getting busy. The food was delicious. The only thing I had that I didn't think was good was the mac & cheese, although if I had put sold on it myself it would've been tasty. My favorite things I ate were the short rib and mashed potatoes, scalloped trouble potatoes, beef pho, cheesecake dessert, creme brulee, and naan. Husband's favorite things were the crab legs, cowboy steak, short rib and mashed potatoes, and for desserts the fruit tart and creme brulee.   We went at lunch FYI On a Tuesday just after Noon.

photos.caption: Photo of The Buffet at ARIA - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Dessert
Photo of The Buffet at ARIA - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Gelato
Photo of The Buffet at ARIA - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Dessert

Oe-pifBtJJyYBB3EyiIL3w.text: They have improve tremendously when it comes to seafood since my last review. They now have over 3 different types of crab they serve year round and it keeps coming.  Great job!  I guess Yelp reviews do work!!!   However, their Asian selection remains pretty bad.  Either extremely dry, wet, or salty.

e_eWRrMiZklNQJysqRk8PQ.text: The Buffet at Aria pretty much solidified my negative experience at Aria. 90% of the food tasted poor, was prepared poor, and was of poor quality. Except for the omelette station, the food didn't appeal at all. Of particular disappointment were the crab legs. They were small and had very little meat. A 3rd rate buffet. When did a Vegas buffet go bad? Aria, a part of MGM Resorts, was surprisingly bad on our short trip to Vegas.

UpwQKcooAa4n0Q7VjohSrg.text: Tried to go here for lunch on a Monday and the lines were very long and ridiculously slow. Now long lines due to demand are totally fine...however, at least a THIRD of the tables inside were completely empty. I was in the "VIP" line and they probably took only 3 groups of customers in a staggering 20 (yes, TWENTY) min period. Can't even imagine how slow the normal line was. Lots of people bailed after waiting 15+mins and I can't blame them, I did the same thing. It was a classic "this is why people hate MGM" moment.  Now I can only guess at what reason there could be for leaving people waiting outside when a third of the restaurant is empty. My main guess is that the buffet simply didn't have enough servers to serve drinks. This brings to mind a simple solution - either hire more servers OR get one of those automated drink machines so you can get by with less servers. The Bellagio has almost similar demand, but their lines go by much faster, very possibly due to their long-time use of the automated drink machines. Something needs to change though as this isn't the first time there's been an unnecessarily long line in front of the Aria Buffet.  So pay for more people or pay for more machines. Simple as that. Or don't pay and get a bad reputation, along with a loss of people who actually want to pay $$$ to eat at your buffet. Gee maybe you might actually make more money by packing in paying customers by spending just a few more $ on people or machines?  Two stars instead of just one star because the food here is really good - provided you have two hours to kill to make it through the line.

vZ8UUP8G0Mk7wCH_SfWdVg.text: What an absolute garbage buffet! The food is beyond bad so disgusting and dirty not taken care of nothing is filled Or cleaned when there is a lot of people there it is an absolute mass. Never again I am not a buffet lover anyway thank God I got it for free because I would never pay for this slop.

photos.caption: Photo of The Buffet at ARIA - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of The Buffet at ARIA - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of The Buffet at ARIA - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Seafood station

YTSC9mdLUeIc2SZrZDWWRA.text: One of the best buffets on the strip! We went around 9am, not too bad of a line. They kept bringing out new food items!!! So much cuisine and selection to choose from. I loved that they had a seafood bar with crabs, shrimp, seafood salad, smoked salmon and sushi. I also liked their little dim sum selections.  The dessert was amazing. At first, they mostly had pastries but they started bringing out cake and pies!!!!   When we left around 11am, the line was longer, so I highly recommend coming a bit early!

photos.caption: Photo of The Buffet at ARIA - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Dessert - They brought out new desssets around 11am!
Photo of The Buffet at ARIA - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Plenty of options
Photo of The Buffet at ARIA - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Dessert - more like pastries

LDUH35_CLxLfncOp9Uz1cA.text: Excellent, I went to this place multiple time and I kind felt this is the best buffet place in Vegas.  Their layout is very clear, so you will easily to see which booth is for which food style, and they have many cook to order section, so you can always get the hot/ fresh dishes. Also their dessert selection is pretty cool as well, a lot delicious items, I will come back next time when I go to vegas

OCDliIZl9HpOyi08gMDY3Q.text: I've decided that buffets are fun the first few times but most of them these days do not offer good tasting food. We had a late show to see Bruno Mars and this is the closest buffet to our hotel. We arrived before 6PM and it was not crowded at all on a Tuesday nite.   I skipped the carving section. Had a bite of Hubbys prime rib and it tasted flavorless to me. I skipped the Latino and Mediterranean sections but tried the Indian section and found the food tasty.   The sushi rice were sticky and mushy. Blah. Crab legs were good and plenty of it. The have crackers but the shells are soft and don't crack open, making getting out the crab meat difficult.   Hubby tried the Asian noodles. The soup didn't taste good to me. I went for the salad which was very good with topping options and 5-6 dressings.   Our wait staff was hard working and very good with refilling his coffee and soda. I skipped the desserts and was too full to try any of his selections.

Iz0vzA9gBiuYrvIr9FHRgw.text: We went to the Buffet at the Aria for lunch while visiting Las Vegas. I signed up for an MRewardsI card and played the free "Pop Slots"  App game for a few months  before our trip. I earned enough credits to purchase a Two for One buffet lunch. I kept waiting for the"Gotcha" but there was none. You download the game, play, earn points, purchase whatever comp you want with your rewards, use it before the time expires and stop by the Mlife rewards desk in the casino before redeeming your coupon. It's that easy!  Ok -- on to the Buffet. It wasn't crowded when we arrived so there was no line. The Buffet has a huge selection of upscale international food such as Hummus, tandoori chicken , pho, oyster bar, sushi , salad pizzas, carving station, pokey. The desserts were amazing and everything is made fresh, on-site st the Aria . We had a wonderful time. Definitely worth the price, at about $45.00 with the  reward coupon (normally, it's about $80.00).Very  good food and beautiful setting.

s2Pr7rR2FEVMXbfCdG2PmA.text: Line was too long. I have been in it like for almost an hour (still here) and there is clearly open seats and the line is not moving at all. The only way it did was when people left the line. There really should be a est. Time sign so they don't waste peoples time. Too bad, I wanted to eat at atleast one buffet before we left.  Updated from 1 star to 3 because once we got in (decided to stay in line because we were already too far in) the food was pretty good and the presentation was very nice. That line was ridiculous and nothing is worth that wait.

zxTSpvJoaixrvdk1YB2Q5Q.text: Not my favorite buffet but for the price we paid it was decent. $28.99 Monday-Friday from 9-3pm. We came here solely because we had a 2 for 1 coupon from Mlife and decided we should try it.  We arrived at 11:30 am and the Line was pretty long but moved at a decent pace. We probably waited about 30 mins.   The service honestly was terrible. We waited about 20 mins for our drink and our plates took forever to clear. Basically we were stacking plates as we ate. We had one server who took care of 8 different groups who seemed overwhelmed. Our drinks weren't filled and the tables around us weren't cleared for 30 mins after different parties left hence maybe why the lines were so long.   The food was okay. For the Asian section the shrimp dumpling was mushy, the pork Bao buns were falling apart in the steamer and  the only dim sum that was decent was the potstickers. They advertise dim sum on their menu but only have 4 types. Lol. The tonkatsu ramen was amazing though. The carving station was good. The steak tender and moist and the sausages weren't dry. The taco station was subpar, meat a lil dry and tAcos required more toppings that usual to be satisfying. The gumbo dish was amazing and so was the clams that was placed next to it. Overall food was probably a 3.5 out of 5. The best thing about all dishes was that they were seasoned perfectly.   Also remember to read the signs. Had no ideas they had made to order oysters!

photos.caption: Photo of The Buffet at ARIA - Las Vegas, NV, United States

gR6SV0l0q7g8Qr2tt8ZJgQ.text: Great buffet for an affordable price. Was a little over $40 per person for dinner on a Tuesday night, which is a really good value for the variety and quality of food available. I know there are some cheaper buffets out there, but trust me, it's worth it. You're in Vegas, so pay the extra money and don't waste your time at a cheap buffet that will just leave you disappointed. This buffet has everything you could want out of a Vegas buffet, such as crab legs, oysters, prime rib, etc. There's also lots of variety with Asian, Mexican, Italian foods and more. I thought all the food was very well cooked, with lots of flavor. The quality here really is high, and you can tell they actually care about the food they're putting out, which can be neglected sometimes at buffets. Overall, would definitely recommend this place if you love good Vegas buffets!

ze0Zu5I-KrzrsyfkMEpN_Q.text: Came here last night for dinner a sunday to get some king crab, and prime rib they still didn't have that stuff out until 330....if I dinner starts at 300 your stuff should be out there and ready at 3 pm.  Husband asked the people where the crab was supposed to be served how much longer and the lady was like that's only for dinner and my husband was like and what time does dinner start she was like 3 and said you know its 315 right so you guys are late...she then said you need to have patience.    No we don't if we are paying for dinner to have it ready on time I mean that is the main reason  people come to this buffet is for the crab so make sure to have that out on time.  We come for the crab not bad and rude service from the staff. We were not the only ones asking about it by the way They have a horrible selection for desserts it's all aimed towards children. They also didn't have prime rib until 4 pm.    Probably won't be coming back here for awhile.

1sRcOPYr8kN-tls8x0WEJQ.text: Very understaffed. Bad, limited food selections. Not worth the price. I've come here a couple times during my trips to Vegas and each time it was disappointing. The tables and surroundings were filthy. We had to wait in line despite the restaurant being nearly empty on a Wednesday morning.

hKymrtPupotLQa3v5BOj3Q.text: I thought this buffet was A-OK. It definitely had more of a variety of options than I've seen at any other buffet so far and the food was good, although I wish it was hotter. That's the thing about buffets. For about $28 bucks for breakfast, there were lots of staples including huge pancakes that they'd portion a piece out of for you, baked ham, delicious pork belly, French toast, shrimp and grits, an omelette station, fresh fruit, bacon and sausage and much much more. Everything tasted good for the most part. The coffee was a little weak and even the juices tasted watered down. I'm glad I tried it, it was a solid option but I wasn't blown away by anything.

photos.caption: Photo of The Buffet at ARIA - Las Vegas, NV, United States

QCNAP2NepdiXKZezPjNeSw.text: I had such high expectations based on just the overall ambiance of Aria. The only reason I even gave 2 STARS is because our Waitress Stephanie was so sweet and children 12 and under is free if your a local resident.    Almost everything we ate was sub par to poor.  They offered seafood on weekday which is what attracted us to go here.  Big disappointment, save your money!  You pay for parking on top of that they offer no validation for eating there which only makes it worse.    Presentation of food is great but doesn't match up with taste.  Food that needed to be hot were cold to warm at best.  Cheesecake tasted like spoiled watered down cheese.  Sushi was extremely terrible and felt like they went to 7 Eleven and bought up their week old inventory and put it on a tray.  Crab legs that were supposedly hot were cold / warm and surprisingly people ate it as bad as it was.  Guess they just wanted to make their monies worth...   I brought a large party with me of about 13 people with me and they all had the same reaction.  We were celebrating a birthday and this ruined it for us.  Hate to say it but definitely bad experience and won't be recommending or be back to this place.  Never left a buffet before not being full.

gTCMaQgs7MPcjzr78wto5w.text: The spread of food was pretty good, paying 30 bucks for breakfast should get you a certain level of options. The carving station and the poke stations were great. The shrimp were ok, but not great. Everything else was pretty tasty.   The biggest issue we had was table service, drinks came pretty often, but no one clears out plates the whole time. We had a pile of dirty plates taking up most of table to entire meal. For a buffet, this was a very bad sign.   I probably won't pick this buffet as an option again, but will go if family or friends are staying at Aria. As a local I'll probably go to the new Palms buffet for the price.

J6bgETbMCTmXgXURfnYHHA.text: The food tastes okay but isn't worth the price (I paid around $50) or the wait. Most items I tried were fine. The only bad dish I tried was the kimbap, which was very mushy. However, this buffet does have good variety -- Asian, Latin, seafood, and more.

photos.caption: Photo of The Buffet at ARIA - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Desserts
Photo of The Buffet at ARIA - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Buffet plate

B-J46AwV53ZD7r-a1mzEKw.text: The quality of the buffet is usually directly related to how many people are in it at a given time. The more people there are, the shorter it will take for them to bring out a new batch of food, and the fresher the food is in general. Aria felt a lot less crowded than somewhere like Wynn, so the food suffered as a result. The highlight of this buffet was the poke bar, and even though you had to ask for the stuff, the fish was at least somewhat fresh. Didnt care too much for the other stuff here, but I've had worse.

f4iWD3SOt4THa0F99nS6Ig.text: Food was good and well presented.  There is an ample variety appealing to a broad spectrum of appetites.  Breakfast selections were excellent but salad bar was a little thin.  The fruit was fresh and well stocked.

photos.caption: Photo of The Buffet at ARIA - Las Vegas, NV, United States

2vWj3-67CeXLqCWfRJf7JQ.text: The worst buffet I ever experienced in my life. We had dinner at 5 pm on Tuesday. The 90% of their items tasted awful... When I say awful, it's like garbage awful... Asian was the worst!!Mediterranean, the crab and the  clams were ok.    Menudo: The worst of the worst... I don't think they know how to cook menudo properly. It was stinky like a poop!  Pho: it was horrible and super salty like they didn't add enough water to the soup base or something....  Pork bun: the only thing I tasted was old pork fat and something weird taste from the bun... I'm not sure if that's coming from the old flour or something they are using to stream has the smell and transfered to the bun while streaming..  Egg rolls & shrimp dumpling: tasteless and unpleasant shrimp smell  Chow mein: tasteless   I don't understand how it is possible for the executive chef to approve that kind of food to be served to their customer who pays quite a bit of money.  The reasons I have two stars are because of the service and the desserts. I'll give 4.5 for the service and the desserts and 0 for the savory food. I think they have pretty good pastry chef. Don't waste your money and go somewhere else unless you are looking for a dessert buffet.

photos.caption: Photo of The Buffet at ARIA - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Pretty good desserts.

2Yj56-ZQcNihr0E8cSDHuw.text: This buffet is LEGIT!  We came here after a night out in Vegas for a Bachelorette Party.  It was about 10:30 and the line wasn't too long and we got seated fairly quickly.  The food options were great - there were bowls of pho and Chinese noodles (although first round soup was cold but they warmed it up later), very spicy pad thai, CRAB legs, dim sum, Indian food, Mexican food as well as a variety of meats, sushi, thai teas, smoothies, and clams.  The food quality was good as well.  The pho, although cold was really tasty. Since we crossed over into lunch, they added some sliders and some fried chicken to go with the waffles. They also had gelato and an assorted variety of desserts.    Overall a very good buffet. Only downside is parking is not validated and costs $7!

photos.caption: Photo of The Buffet at ARIA - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of The Buffet at ARIA - Las Vegas, NV, United States

LtXh_uGx-FSc6y9A6YVnmg.text: Not a bad buffet. I wish they would have had regular eggs on the brunch menu. A little pricey but worth it.   The service was amazing. Our waitress didn't skip a beat. Professional and accommodating.

k0ZtXcisqwWIXUisJvUkwQ.text: Very good buffet. Everything was tastey and fresh. I ate alot of seafood and it was all amazing.  I would reccomend coming to this Vegas buffet

photos.caption: Photo of The Buffet at ARIA - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Yummy cold shrimp. Hot cran legs. Oysters Rockefeller  so good !!!!

Cmz4gbSvqhHHsj-4dRbB4g.text: Ate here for breakfast. Great service, selection, & very good quality of food. Even at breakfast, you can choose from items such as Pad Thai, steamed dumplings, Brazilian, taco bar, pizza, curry, soups, crab claws, mussels, carving stations of turkey, prime rib, sweets, gelato wheel, individual baskets of chicken & waffles, huge salad/fruit bar, sushi, plus every breakfast item you can think of.   Buffets usually lack on quality, but this was some of the best curry & dumplings I've had. Shrimp pad Thai was SPICY. Love the Aria.

photos.caption: Photo of The Buffet at ARIA - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Shrimp Pad Thai, chicken curry, carved turkey &amp; mashed potatoes. No I didn&#39;t eat all 3 plates!!
Photo of The Buffet at ARIA - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Corned beef hash, croissant sandwich, biscuits &amp; gravy
Photo of The Buffet at ARIA - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Breakfast plate

pvzsVctJ9ICVd2QltrAsiw.text: I just ate here tonight and it was great !!! . We went around 430 and no lines at all . Plenty of food to choose from , I personally had 3 plates of crab legs and prime rib it was well worth the 43 bucks . The different food stations were great. The dessert bar was exceptional and the servers were excellent in doing there jobs. Next time I'm in Vegas and looking for hot crab legs I'm coming back here

photos.caption: Photo of The Buffet at ARIA - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Crab legs

dPnk_K7OcZmSfqNf-GmqWQ.text: We chose this buffet because of the great reviews. We were excited because they have poke, curry and crab legs. The poke wasn't that nice, the curry was good and the crab legs were great. The desserts were lovely, but everything else was sub par.  We bought the $20 unlimited drink service, but the cocktails were gross. Thankfully the mimosas were lovely and we felt like we got our monies worth.

photos.caption: Photo of The Buffet at ARIA - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Poke bowl

qW928acyFondB9Qtaeh1jQ.text: This review is for the brunch on Sunday.  There is no pay to skip the line option like other buffets. If you have anything but the basic M life card you can skip the line. We had to wait in the regular line. It was about a 35 minute wait, not horrible.   The price was $32 a person then buy one get one unlimited mimosas for $19.  The waitstaff was friendly and kept our mimosas full.  The food was divided by ethnicity and had a large dessert bar including ice cream. Some of the food options offered were crab legs, sushi, and prime rib. Food quality was decent.

photos.caption: Photo of The Buffet at ARIA - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Mimosa and dessert

3EqZ-WqYz6DYf8tTUYBsOA.text: We were looking for a great seafood buffet and the Aria was it! King, snow crab and oysters were fresh and the salad bar had many choices. Also their carving station had great options. My family and I will definitely return to the buffet the next time we're in Vegas.

hPRkP-GJb6_zM7RrTOoISg.text: So disgusting, obviously they don't wash their dishes! We complained and the waitress just offered another ice tea. LoL

photos.caption: Photo of The Buffet at ARIA - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Ewwwwww what the hell is in my ice tea??? Lost my appetite

-FeQGGsYGL_ExDV0fplLQg.text: Better than I expected.  The spread is nice...variety of selections.  Meat, seafood, Asian, salad sections, dessert, etc.  The area is spacious and big as well.  I enjoyed the crab legs and claws, beet salad, prime rib as well as the coconut macaroon and coffee.  I would come back if I was coming with my whole entire family so they can select what they want to eat!

LSEVn53fj8QA3Lz0gg0GQA.text: I am so not a fan of buffets. I feel like they trick you! They put out all this fluff and get you to navigate away from the meats and fish. This is so not the case with The Buffet at ARIA. Everything and I do mean everything was top notch.  Our hotel stay at the Aria gave us access to the The Buffet daily during our stay. I'm thinking, I have dinner plans, why would I come to an AYCE buffet? Our first day was a travel day and we had no dinner plans. We decided to hit up the The Buffet at ARIA.   We walk up to the register and ask for a table, no reservation needed. Once we're settled and place our drink order, now its on. I walk around the entire facility and scan each station very carefully. My wife starts making a salad. That's great. I come back with a hunk of prime rib with a dash of horseradish as well as a kielbasa link.  That's it. (For the first plate)  My wife pushes her salad to the side. Ooooh! That looks good, can I taste? Sure! What's that, I tell her horseradish and she dips in. Now she's abandoned the salad and ran over to the carving station.   After the meats, we hit up the crab legs. I don't like to get too crazy with crab legs, its a lot of work for little yield. They were pretty good regardless. There are many great items, from the Tandoori Chicken to the Italian station, The Buffet at ARIA has dinner down pat.  I was so full, I skipped breakfast the next day! The following day? Back to The Buffet at ARIA but this time for Breakfast. Fresh Salmon and cream cheese is how I started this buffet. Next, they make a Huuuuuuuuuuge pancake that is cooked perfectly. They cut off a square and serve it to the guests. Pretty ingenuous Aria. Then I had Eggs Benedict, a yogurt parfait and some coffee. I'm feeling pretty good! My wife had an egg white omelet with a bunch of healthy stuff mixed in. We both left stuffed but more importantly, the food being served was high quality. I didn't see any brown gravy with the skin on it. Everything was fresh and tasted great.   The Buffet at ARIA, very impressed with both breakfast and lunch. Highly recommended

photos.caption: Photo of The Buffet at ARIA - Las Vegas, NV, United States. I mean, I am The Duke!
Photo of The Buffet at ARIA - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Pancake anyone?? Insane
Photo of The Buffet at ARIA - Las Vegas, NV, United States. The Buffett is. On the house...

_5trAk4yZfNEwUpX_fHG3g.text: Went there when on a trip. We were a little late for lunch so ended up being the dinner menu on a weekend. Lot of spread for the meat lovers. Very little for veg. The few veg options were not bad but the meat lovers in the  group didn't like them much.   It was a disappointment for the 50$ price tag.

Hzcbp9a2MbIOR9ybmYvOhQ.text: They opened in 2009 and they remodeled in 2012 and we were impressed.  The modern and bright interior felt a lot more inviting than the Village Buffet or the Bellagio Buffet.  In general, I thought it tasted better than your average Vegas buffet.  I especially enjoyed everything from their carvery section and their whole steamed crab legs.  With the buy one get one free coupon, The Buffet at Aria is a great value and I would recommend it!  To get a free buffet pass or a 2-for-1 coupon, you need to earn points in the MyVegas app which is by MGM.  You earn gold chips for playing their games.  Once you get enough gold chips, you can use them for discounts and freebies at the MGM properties.  You need to be an Aria hotel guest to redeem anything that's completely free.  But, the 2-for-1 coupon is good for anyone to use.  Yes, even if you're not staying at Aria, you can still use the 2-for-1 coupon There are some restrictions and blackout dates so make sure you read the fineprint.  So once you redeem it, you have to go to the Total Rewards booth to get your coupon.  By the way, why does everyone name their buffet, The Buffet. - The Buffet at Wynn - The Buffet at Bellagio - The Buffet at Stratosphere  Anyways, I came for their weekday dinner which was $38 a person. With the coupon, it comes out to $19 a person, which makes it a great deal  When you pay, they give you a menu which shows you add-ons you can get - Unlimited alcohol for $19.99 - 3lb Lobster for $55 - Fish of the Day for $35 - Or a dozen oysters for $26  I don't understand why someone would come to a buffet and fill their stomach with food you have to pay extra for, but it's here if you are craving them.  - 18% automatic gratuity for 8 or more - There's a nice restroom inside the buffet - And stay away from the asian food

photos.caption: Photo of The Buffet at ARIA - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Interior
Photo of The Buffet at ARIA - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Crab
Photo of The Buffet at ARIA - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Menu

PDfTJU5R8bi8FTnPDf34jA.text: The food here was disappointing. I've been to the Bacchanal Buffet and the Buffet at ARIA, and it is very comparable. The selection of raw seafood was not fresh at all. There aren't a wide selection of food that tasted good. Although it is comparably cheaper than the Bacchanal, I think it is worth spending a little more to get better quality food somewhere else than here.

3Ml7bm-yDkeI1A6Kds1r-A.text: I am so glad I made the decision to try Aria's Buffet!  I had heard lots of amazing things about the Bellagio Buffet and Ceasers Buffet. I could not find so many reviews on Aria's Buffet. Since my Fiance and I were staying at the Aria I thought, why not just try it for brunch!   They have a GREAT two for one deal for brunch at $19.99. Perfect for two people trying to enjoy some bottomless drinks during brunch. They bring you drinks as soon as you ask and the portions are large per cup! The wait was short and we were seated right away. Our waitress took our drink orders as soon as we sat down and we had our coffee and mimosas right away!    The options at the Buffet were ENDLESS. Soooo many options I could've ate there all day! Everything I had was delicious and I cannot wait to come back again when I am in Vegas next!

hr7eK7tPNCbuOVQThmjNOA.text: It's Labor Day weekend and I'm not sure if the prices were a little higher on that Sunday, but it was $47.99 a person.  We got there around 6pm or 7pm, and there was a very short line, so we didn't have to wait too long.  I think the food looked better than it really was.  I wish they had a bigger selection of hot seafood.  The hot crab legs were a popular item and there was always a line for it.  I got pasta made from the pasta bar with pomodoro sauce, but it did not taste like any pomodoro sauce I've ever had, but it still may be the best thing I ate here.  I tried eating the chilled Dungeness crab, but it was still partially frozen; my fingers were getting really cold.  The Asian food selection was disappointing.   The hot and sour soup was salty, the potstickers had a weird aftertaste, and the fried rice was mushy.  There wasn't any item that excited me.  But at least our waiter was wonderful.

photos.caption: Photo of The Buffet at ARIA - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of The Buffet at ARIA - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Shrimp Fettuccine in &#34;pomodoro&#34; sauce from the Pasta Bar

Ts6TziAIfO1B1x2zIAReIw.text: We just found out they do an all day option for $65, so all you can eat, all day! Great deal   They don't have many options for no dairy, only soy. Seems weird since everywhere has almond milk or something.   If you have an Aria resort card you have a dedicated line that is shorter, so that helps.

tmJmPFbkaM10hFk7LgbRKg.text: We came here after going to a show and I must say the line was short to get in and I know why. Kids eat free here and the place was swarming with kids, they were everywhere. Dont get me wrong I love children, but I also like well behaved children. Not when their parents leave them to run around the restaurant and touching food with their hands at the buffet. The servers did a horrible job of keeping this place clean. It was hard for us to find a table to sit because the tables were not clean and filled with plates that needed to be carted away. The food was just ok. My favorite station was the Indian cuisine. There chicken marsala, jasmine rice, curry chick peas and naan were the star for me. The seafood station left much to be desired. It was almost as if these were the crab legs that lost the battle. They looked hungry and as if they were suffering. Most of the food at the Asian station needed to be refilled. There was a build your own soup station. I really wanted some fruit but after seeing kids touch the fruit and put it back there was little to be desired. This could have been a bad night but it actually seemed to be a regular theme here and for that reason I dont see myself returning.

photos.caption: Photo of The Buffet at ARIA - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Dirty tables
Photo of The Buffet at ARIA - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Making fresh naan
Photo of The Buffet at ARIA - Las Vegas, NV, United States

Ih0IkAXjYckDhd4H081X1Q.text: Very disappointed for $45+tax!! There was a reason why there wasn't a line there.  It was more like a $20 buffet. Food was just OK. Dessert was nothing great. Restaurant felt like a cheap cafeteria. Service wasn't great. We were left without drinks for a long time. Our silverware was taken away from us so we had to hunt for more silverware.  They served king crab legs that were almost frozen and hard to get open with no wet naps.  You'd think for $45 they'd at least provide wet naps. I'll never go back there again and would never recommend this buffet. For $45 you're better off going to a nice restaurant ordering a nice meal instead of a bunch of mediocre food that wasn't really worth the calories.  Update: I changed my review from 1 star to 3 star. I called the manager after our experience and they customer service from the manager was excellent. She said we definitely shouldn't have been left without water nor silverware and understood our frustration.

Q3TpZGdnpJlKpytJnJVhTA.text: Ate here about two years ago at lunchtime and there was no line.  What was with that? Should have left when I got a closer look and thought it was closed but with food left on this long winding station.  The food was OK and it was hot and well marked. Just seemed like a ghost town so I sat by a window near the only other human life forms there. It was fun watching a man pull the crab meat from the claws and put them on a plate for her. Turns out she had really nice nails and he was just a gentleman.  Since I had paid a lot for lunch.... I lingered at the desert station and did find some excellent hot deserts.  Honestly.... This is the most inhospitable and unwelcoming resort in Vegas. I can afford to stay anywhere so just checked out and into a suite at the MGM Grand. Better view and guaranteed vibe.  I did love the futuristic convention center but was stopped by guards for taking photos.

wwyWuqRrj1-72DGPFwo3LQ.text: Fresh crab legs, yes please!  Tons of fresh seafood.  2 people $45 and it was well worth it.  Pho station, Mexican food, Southern, Italian, Chinese, I mean all types of great tasting food. The dining room is open and looks out at the pool. For a buffet, we were impressed especially after wasting 3 bills at STK the night before.

fb9zXhG_GdesTxdZ09PaCQ.text: Wow the NYE food sooooo wonderful a lots of choice special steak and lobster and caviar bar and Chinese and all the crab legs and Sushi on pans on so Much Thank you

HpWtElPhvemtaS7XEinT9A.text: The Buffet at Aria is my second favorite buffet in Vegas, after Wicked Spoon at Cosmo. Aria is also much cheaper than Wicked Spoon, so it's the buffet I like to go to when I do not want to splurge.   The atmosphere is very clean and open, with plenty of comfortable seating. The servers were so wonderful the past two times I have been there, always filling up beverages and having the greatest attitude while dealing with so many people at once. You also never feel rushed to finish your food and leave, the service is so great. The sangria (red and white) is so good here, I still have dreams about it.   The food is solid quality and they have many vegetarian options (compared the Buffet at Bellagio, which had slim pickings for vegetarians). They had tofu marsala, miso soup, and your traditional breakfast items, like pancakes, waffles, and potatoes. Also, the man who works in the dessert section was so personable and knowledgable, it's so nice interacting with people who have such a great attitude.   I just really love everything about this buffet. The drinks are yummy, the food is solid, and the service is fantastic. The Buffet at Aria will always be my go-to buffet when I don't want to splurge at Wicked Spoon.

photos.caption: Photo of The Buffet at ARIA - Las Vegas, NV, United States

FK73GspkDCeg6b_b5mmOog.text: I came during late lunch time. The variety of food is good. The flavors are hit or miss depending on the plate. Most meats were well seasoning when others were blend. The desserts were good but not much variety like the Wicked Spoon. Service was slow it took forever just to get refills but he was nice Won't be my first pick but can return.

f1A_dUs9FOIX6fl8DPQGgA.text: I'm a little disappointed at the buffet at such an extravagant hotel. The breakfast buffet offered a lot with the options of fresh eggs, already cooked eggs, bacon, waffles, etc. The Asian station at the buffet had dim sum available along with some rice and beef with broccoli. The Italian station provided you with a variety of pizza and the carving station had chicken and steak available. While I felt this was to accommodate the international visitors, I wasn't sure whether the food was kept out until the buffet served at night and was just re-steamed.   I wasn't crazy about the buffet for breakfast or for dinner. The French toast sticks were very hard and some of the breakfast potatoes Weren't cooked all the way through. The coffee, however, was very smooth and tasted amazing.   although I'd like to give this place a 5 star, I can't because of the lack of variety in their food and the quality of some of their food. The carving station had steaks but we're either cooked medium rare or overly cooked to where it was just chewy. The pizza at the Italian station looked very dry and hard and the asian station looked like the food was re heated from the morning.   I would go to another hotel or an outside restaurant for your meals and save yourself the $25/person at the buffet.

WgMB9kS65-2jPngdZJ_stw.text: The lunch buffet is really great!   They have a large selection of seafood, from crab legs, clams, prawns, mussels, and much more. They even have the options of hot and cold, where you get the traditional seafood cold on ice or cooked in awesome sauces, still warm. Either way, both are fresh and delicious.   They had a lot of different stations: -meat carving station with selections of chicken, prime rib, and sausage -a make your own taco and nacho station with choice of cheese, sour cream, pico de gallo, guacamole, salsa roja, salsa verde, etc -Asian station with fried rice, soups, dim sum, general tsao's chicken, and more -cheese station with crackers and meats -small sushi station  I think the best part of the buffet was the dessert. They have a spinning gelato bar, with flavors like coffee, vanilla, peanut butter, Thai tea, and more. The cookies, brownies, cannolis, whoopie pies, and cake pops...everything was good!   Service wasn't an issue for our group. Our waitress was very friendly and attentive to when we needed more drinks or to clear our plates when we were done.   Will definitely come back just for the seafood and dessert!

photos.caption: Photo of The Buffet at ARIA - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Cheese station
Photo of The Buffet at ARIA - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Cookies, whoopie pie, cake pop, rice crispy, bread pudding
Photo of The Buffet at ARIA - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Dessert bar

e7rn5oQg5Ta9VthInlnHhw.text: Not tried the food yet but definitely disappointed with the management of the buffet here. The hotel has increased the prices for the holiday time but not bothered to spend an extra penny to make sure there are enough people to cater to the crowd that is expected around the holiday time. There are only 2 staff people at the front while over 200 people are in line. Also, apparently one of the queues is for line pass only and they probably have a tiny sign somewhere that says so ( which you will most likely miss) when there is huge crowd. We stood in the other line for 40 minutes without knowing it was for line pass only and now got transferred to this other huge line that is never ending. If you care to increase the prices for the buffet, make sure you also go the extra mile to make sure everything is running smoothly with enough staff members to assist.

CSFeLMW8Po70EjlYR-Ek_g.text: We decided to try the buffet at Aria, since we had seen some sites online that have stated that it has been pretty good lately. We were pleasantly surprised that it lived up to what the sites were saying with some caveats. Everything was well prepared and there were a lot of items that were good, unlike most of the other places around where there is a large variety of items but each is mediocre. On the other hand, if you want variety, there are limited options, compared to places like Bacchanal at Caesar's Palace.  The buffet here is more seafood focused and the warm snow crab legs here were very good, better than the other places we've been to including Bacchanal, Wynn and Bellagio. The cold crab legs were less flavorful, so we ended up sticking with the warm snow crab legs. The prime rib was also very good, again on par or better than the other places we've tried. Other good items included the sliders, and all the desserts we tried were very good. The desserts are larger than the typical offerings elsewhere. They also had a gelato section, which was also very good.   While the spicy tuna hand roll was good, the sushi section was limited compared to other places. There was a small Chinese section with several steamed bun/dim sum options, but we didn't sample these. In addition, they also had a pho section, which we also skipped since we've had disappointing results elsewhere. There was a section on Indian food, including a tandoori oven which made tandoori chicken for dinner. We tried a piece of this, as it was interesting to have this option. Alas, while it looked like tandoori chicken, it was missing much of the flavor in authentic tandoori chicken.  As an interesting aside, they score the warm snow crab legs in the middle which makes it very easy to crack in half without any crab eating tools, then you can pull the crab meat out very easily.  All in all, if you go in knowing that the options will be a bit more limited than some place like Bacchanal, then you will be pleasantly surprised at how many items are actually very delicious, with the seafood, prime rib and desserts all being very strong. This has become my wife's favorite buffet in Las Vegas, with Wynn and Bacchanal to follow in that order, though we understand that things may change in the future.

TP410aD2Qfmg1uudu3a4aw.text: Nothing special about this buffet. It doesn't meet the standards of a typical buffet at a high end Vegas hotel. If you are a vegetarian, you will be disappointed. They flatly refused to customize any dishes for us, unlike the Wynn where they happily made us delicious entrees as requested. The good things about this buffet were the desserts, tortilla chips/salsa bar, and the freshly made naans. Everything else was average and can easily be found at any other buffet. The Wynn buffet was way better.

PD8OR-hTBM7JjYFaiKqEvA.text: Went there on Sunday and price was $48.99 since it was Thanksgiving weekend.  Good sampling of various cuisines including Indian, Korean, and Chinese.  The Korean beef short ribs were good.  No king crabs, but they had snow crab legs.  Japanese sushi / rolls selections are limited; Tonkatsu ramen was not good.  Decent dessert choices including ice cream and leche flan.

ezj5MUpF1Xyjce8QR2lfog.text: This place is a borderline 1 star for me. It wasn't like as if I found a bug or anything atrocious. But it was shockingly disappointing.   The Buffet, along with the rest of Aria, seem immaculate. We've stayed at the Aria before and was impress with the rooms. So it would seem logical that the food was equally impressive. When I took a quick look around, the presentation of the food looked nice.  However looks can be very deceiving. I tried the orange glazed ham. It was dry with no hint of orange. The grilled vegetables were also over done. The clam chowder was ok but nothing a can of Campbell's soup cant replace. I tried the Mexican clams. It was underwhelming and the taste did not go well together. Got a couple of warm crab legs but the meat on it was rather dry. Since we came in the late afternoon we were also able to sample the dinner menu. I was actually looking forward to the King Snow Crab legs but they were equally disappointing.  The only good thing I can say about this place is that the gelato was pretty good.   The service was a bit of a disappointment as well. Since our regular waitress couldn't be found for a good 10 minutes, I flagged down 2 passing servers asking them for the tool to crack open the crab legs. They hardly acknowledged me and as they were walking away one waiter says to the other "Why me?" before hesitantly coming back to get me what I needed.   Definitely would not be back here. Living up to its name, this is THE BUFFET to avoid.

JU4UrcKQYq0r_Nhnmz2Xew.text: This used to be one of my favorite buffets on the strip but no more :(.  For the price for two of us $90 + with tax) it was so not worth it.  We came on a Friday night and it was rather slow (that should have been a hint) so the wait wasn't long.  The selections were subpar, a lot of the dishes weren't even marked so you had to take a guess at what some of them were.  The paella had a lot of broken shells bits from the clams & crab, the crab legs were cold and there were only scraps of it left in the pans but the biggest disappointment was that there was no prime rib!
