bQBPlJKNu0ZDJ6QRkX7S8A.text: Since I spent my last trip in Vegas staying at the Aria, I figured I might as well check out their buffet for dinner one night.  Overall, there is not much to say- it was a good buffet, but for Vegas it seemed pretty standard and was nothing special (note: I did go on a Monday night and have heard that weekends might be better).  For the most part, the food I had was good.  I spent most of my time downing roast beef, shrimp, and snow crab legs.  I also tried a variety of pastas, pizzas and other dishes.  But again, although all of it was good and tasty, none of it was special enough to say it was really amazing.    On the service side of things, the wait staff was a little slow at first, but as the meal went on it seemed to pick up a bit, so I'm not sure there's really anything to complain about.  In essence, the Aria buffet was simply unremarkable.  I don't really have anything bad to say, but I don't really have anything good to say either.  In Vegas, I would expect better.

zrg1-AJ1p02iRf_zrwBeIg.text: The Buffet at Aria lacks variety. It has the typical "international" fair: Chinese, Mexican, American grill, seafood, Italian, Sushi, etc... one nice addition is the Indian cuisine. This may sound like a lot of dishes but really there's only two or three dishes per style. They do prepare the dishes well but there's just not enough choices. Their desserts however offers more choices than the cooked foods combined.

PBLbaST12TtRmHAfBw0fvw.text: For all appearances, it looks good.  We literally fasted from breakfast so we could have an early dinner at the Buffet - Husband and I both ended up with the worst (*crab smelling*) upset stomach ever.  The crab/shrimp were previously frozen, very watery, bland and - BAD. The only thing the husband and I both ate (and a small quantity) and both are 100% certain we got sick from. We eat a LOT of seafood and know some serious quality when we find it.  I'm not saying that the seafood at this buffet is always bad - but this was enough the first time so we wont be back and advise others to think twice before eating here.  Cant remember anything else about this buffet apart from the fact we got the sh*ts!

4RLi7taXggHG4FapiYi3zQ.text: @ $50/person, I expected more for their dinner buffet.  You only got one lobster portion, and the rest of the foods were good, but nothing special.  Things were fresh, and there were people there to serve you up with whatever it was that you needed.  Their red and white wine selections that came with the meal were simple, and once again, nothing jumped out at me.  The only thing I enjoyed was the lamb...  The only thing I do remember jumping out at me were the little cups filled with an oreo chocolate cream/mousse kind of thing.  I'd prepare a tub full of it and consume face-first if I could...  We should have went to the Bellagio's buffet...  =(

rfFRUHg8zrUnnV2gV4-mGA.text: I don't know why this place got a 3 stars, but I'm giving it a 5!  I'm not a buffet person, but this buffet surely surprised me. For 30 bucks it was unlimited of yumminess!  The meat (which I judge really hard on, considering my background) was tender, VERY TENDER. It was easy to cut, and easy to choose. I had NO complaining.  They make the kind of pasta you want. The drinks (soda, raspberry tea, etc) are for FREE (well, with your meal, but free refills!. I know it sounds silly but there ARE places where they don't give you that option)  They had king crab, asian food, salad, etc etc. I thought they made the asian food non-salty though, which was a plus for me.   They just have so much to offer! We sat there for 3 hrs and ate so much. I was truly satisfied. Oh, and if you must know, the bathrooms are clean!!!  The staff was extra extra nice. You can do the valet parking at arias and just provide tips.   OH! and a BIG bonus for me was that they actually SCOOP the icecream FOR ME!! :] This ain't some lame icecream either...it tasted homemade. Oh, and their flan was delish. I went back to my hotel, SATISFIED. Now I wish I could go back :[

J60Vjr3M8sxbHS2QW-N-qQ.text: Chinese New Year buffet cost about $40 and was worth at best $10. Seriously this was the worst breakfast I have ever had. The pancakes were dyed red and looked unappealing. The omlet was meh and while the wait staff was fantastic the food servers/cooks were not remotely friendly or helpful. Perhaps because I am not a meat eater I did not find many things to eat to but my dining companion who is a meat eater also found the food to be sub par at best. Perhaps there are better meals throughout the day but a breakfast buffet should at the very least be tasty particularly at the price point.

U-ZHLvgT4K4-iwkufecFJw.text: The other buffets in Vegas must be out of this world if this one only has 3 stars.  Everything was fantastic; the service, the atmosphere, and the food. Everything was fresh and beautiful.  Yes the crab was great, but so were the clams, salmon (perfectly cooked), tandoori chicken, naan, and the absolutely perfect desserts. There's this macaroon bar thing that I could live on. And the chocolate things on a stick? OMG.  The only thing I didn't finish (I took SMALL portions, and I'm still stuffed) was the pizza. Kind on soggy. I didn't try the deli, Italian, Asian stations. Only salad, seafood, Indian, pizza, and dessert (did I mention the macaroons?!?). If you play myVegas, there's a bogo deal. Oh and spend the extra 12.99 for the bottomless drinks. They have an ample amount of alcohol and worth the money. We had the dinner buffet tonight (Monday) and it was 34.99 per person plus the drinks. Happy eating!

U1gLdbYPFEQwOWTNTi-UTg.text: I loved this buffet! As locals we tend to avoid the strip but this was so worth the traffic! I love that is almost more tapas style, than buffet style. There were a couple things that were "meh", like the WAAAAY over cooked saffron risotto , the tepid fish and chips, and some dried out dim sum. However on all of those the flavor was good, especially the risotto, but they were just sitting out too long. The mushroom polenta was mind blowing, and the dessert were phenomenal...really everything else was amazing. Also by pre-dishing most the stuff you waste less food and get to try more dishes. I will most definitely be going back!

OglEnpgsZbxyg58uezMCuw.text: Straight up this Buffet kinda sucks...sorry Aria, I gave you 5 stars as a hotel/casino but your Buffet  blows...  Food was all kinda over cooked and crusty, sushi was gross, they have some kinda Indian tandoori station that was awful....the only saving grace was the desert section. Next time I will just hit the cafe or one of the other 7 restaurants in the place....or even just order room service.

_t6J6Askd88tbHO8mlKiGw.text: The quality of food was very mediocre.  Not worth the price.  Maybe for under $20/buffet but definitely not worth $40/buffet dinner.

jgVAvh2u-yPGcx3p1eZncQ.text: My gosh you failed me. Lunch and Dinner sucks. Overcooked fish, meats and mushy grilled veggies :(  Its only been 6 months since I visited, what happened?? It was recommended over Wicked Spoon and boy was it correct 6months ago. Not sure about know. Go off of recent reviews because these place can go down hill in just a couple months.  A plus, the restroom is in the same section as the buffet area. No need to exist and come back. And so far I haven't experienced any lines or wait. But some servers are pretty disgruntled here.

Gi3CaNcqWbjElVprNdU4aQ.text: This place has quickly become my favorite buffet in Vegas.  I used to be a fan of the Wynn but I have to say their quality has dropped in the past couple of years, moving this place to first on my list.  Obviously the food usually changes from time to time, but always top of the line, well seasoned, well cooked, and the desert bar is just a heart attack in waiting!  I cannot come to vegas without visiting this place.  Highly recommended.

4dQr5u9Y_8LwwaG_NcaAZA.text: Five stars! From all the buffets I have eaten so far, this buffet by far is the best one! Lots selections of different type of food such as Chinese, Mexican, Indian, American foods. If you are someone that looks for strong flavored foods this buffet is must go!

sAhnAn9MV2vJXVUgrwaLiA.text: Crustacean scum 0 : me 1  Just your typical buffet with most of the selection of food being old and nasty. Nothing special. I spent most of my time ripping apart crab exoskeleton while shocked bystanders stared at the barbaric sight.  THEY CAN JUDGE ALL THEY WANT BUT I HAVENT HAD ME SOME CRAB IN A WHILE

photos.caption: Photo of The Buffet at ARIA - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Crustacean scum 0 : Me 1

VMSKrcy6SD19HQ_thMjDGA.text: While the Mirage Buffet had gone downhill from my last visit there, I actually felt like the Aria had upped their quality and game a bit from my last visit.  While I don't think the food is fantastic there are a few things about it that keep me coming back.  The first thing I really appreciate is the fresh fruit on the Salad Bar.  I also love their Crab Legs.  They use King Crab instead of tiny Snow Crab like many other Buffets these days.  I also like the fact that their Crab Legs are served warm with drawn Butter instead of Cold with Cocktail Sauce!  If I am going to a Buffet the main thing I like to eat are Crab Legs and Shrimp.  The Prime Rib was fine but not great.  The other thing I love about the Aria Buffet is the desserts!  I guess Jean Philippe make their desserts and they are fantastic!!!  I love French Macarons!!!  Probably one of my favorite desserts.  They also always have Gelato and other great desserts as well.

photos.caption: Photo of The Buffet at ARIA - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Best thing about the Aria Buffet is the desserts!!!
Photo of The Buffet at ARIA - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Desserts are great!!!
Photo of The Buffet at ARIA - Las Vegas, NV, United States. I love King Crab and a bowl of Butter!!!

l4ZyXsumzbtNN2j00cM-Gg.text: During our stay this past weekend, my lady and I visited the Buffet at Aria about twice and we found the selection of different cuisines to be more than suitable. The staff was great, friendly and very helpful.

n0ML4gb95jbAk0lOjjfU1g.text: This is still my favorite buffet in Las Vegas. The staff is very friendly and attentive (shout out to our server Debbie for being awesome). The crab legs are a must try. They have a variety of different foods for everyone, whatever your mood may be and there always seems to be something new every time we come back. Keep up the good work!

_QcYTRQeMIps-6HAqlz_9g.text: I have never been a huge fan of buffets because it is impossible to ever get my $ worth because of the amount of food i could eat in one single meal, however i must say 4/5 samples i picked where all good. The only problem i had was the high price and warm temperature food.   Very clean, very stocked!!! I wont be coming back here anytime soon!

x-nCVgMtfmtpx8NmbYQNtw.text: This is an over the top buffet. You can have anything from New Zealand razor clams to crawfish to tandoori to an omelette for your breakfast and it's about $20.   I only had breakfast here a few days and though the service was inconsistent and the omelette bar was inconsistent.   Fortunately, I never arrived when the insane linens were happening and I wish I could find a good quiet, breakfast spot in Vegas.

k4wzlQJhqZopK_Pw-PznGA.text: This time we were disappointed due to the fact that many food labels were not in place so we had to guess what was what. Since we went for the dinner service we were expecting king crab, unfortunately they only had "split crab", which not very meaty and quite salty. The crab claws tasted a bit bitter and not very meaty. To top it off the gelato machine was broken so only one third of the flavors were available. Not many customers led to the food "aging" and food items being soggy (fish tacos were falling apart, the cannoli shells were soggy, etc.)  On the other hand, everyone was very friendly.

LSfFweRmcmUJagqVMPfIYg.text: I am not sure how some people rated this place three+ stars.  Perhaps the food on those days were actually good but for me and my wife, the food here was terrible.  We had two complimentary meals here so we came here for lunch and were underwhelmed with all the food we tried.  When the fruits are the uncontested best food, something is seriously off; and I am pretty lenient with food quality. Shrimps were... limp, dim sums tastes like flour(?), mussels were dried up, and sausages were tough to chew. At least it was free for us, I would be pretty mad if we paid any money for this.

11B1DgcXH8aYXZIPWI56Bg.text: If I could give this place negative stars I would.  Not only was there little food selection but it was also poorly made and especially for the price you pay but that's not why I'm writing this review. I've dealt with high priced, poorly made food before and I just don't go back. I actually got sick off their food, so sick that while vomiting I actually busted blood vessels in my eye and now I may have to go to the hospital. I did call and inform them so we will see what happens, hopefully they will work on improving the quality of their food and establishment. My goal is to make sure that nobody else gets poisoned like I did.  It's not a pleasant experience. So please think twice before you go here. I'm highly disappointed and what made it worse was I was on my honeymoon. Oh well live and learn.

eF-vdhzD5VH8aHkBOFkuzA.text: Yes I would come here again . kids 5-12 eat free. The food was good not "omg this is the best" but I enjoyed the selection they had.

V3ESTAcLGQNGSe_hqnjxiA.text: Came for the brunch buffet and stuffed my face! Crab legs were huge and plentiful, steak was juicy, desserts were fantastic! Bit of a line when we first arrived and the guy taking the drink orders barely circles around, that would be my only complaint.

gI9XIeWtu0EHUkiLVCT2hg.text: Food was great, for 30 dollars the prime rib and the fried rice were my favorites here, everything was great BUT the service. Never came to collect our plates or give us more water had to call them over

I39pqLQHPrm7kvEkwybn0Q.text: Food was just alright. Came here for the gourmet dinner on Friday and really didn't like how it was setup.   Grilled jumbo shrimp and scallop on the half shell: I didn't like how you have to wait in line to be served one serving. It's not like it was custom made or anything. For them to not just "put it out there" makes them look stingy.   Bone-in prime rib: They won't serve you the cut near the bone or even the the rib itself until after a certain time, like 6 or 7 pm. What's that about?!  Sashimi: I think they had this, or at least it was on display, but it was hard to figure out how to get it.   Even though you pay the difference for the gourmet dinner, it doesn't seem like they want to provide the gourmet food. But at the same time, you can't exactly say that they didn't either.

zZI7nh-qYuwZc9K4BtMDlw.text: This is the best buffet I've been to in my 24 years of living, they had every kind of food u can think of from every culture I was very impressed. Next time I'm in Vegas i will definitely come back.

OVUKFNQooobQbidfr_hfRQ.text: This is by far my favorite buffet in Las Vegas. Love the crab legs! They have so many delicious desserts.

PiLUW0fovxu048uKem6jCA.text: The best one around this area. Cause it has the best Asian foods. Appreciated! The desert is good I can't stop stick on ice creams.

photos.caption: Photo of The Buffet at ARIA - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Oh my! This is the 4th one! Today!
Photo of The Buffet at ARIA - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Deserts
Photo of The Buffet at ARIA - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Cheesecake

PHfsuWoyGJMmvXIGLakCxQ.text: My friends and I made a reservation for this morning at about $36/person plus $8.50/person for unlimited drinks (they were having a 2 for 1 special). The selection was amazing, all the food was delicious, and our server Reina was friendly and amazing. Definitely glad we made a reservation because the no-res line was really long. I'm very glad we came here for hangover brunch and pitchers of mimosas. Party on, yelpers.

ANnzVeeBrVMhcPzDvh7CtA.text: Good buffet with several different stations such as sliced meats, crab legs, salad bar omelet stations for brunch etc.  If you have a large party then this is a good place to go, because there's something for everyone.    Their dessert station is okay it has a bunch of mini pies and cakes as well as someone scooping ice cream. Honestly your better off using your calories elsewhere for the desserts.

oMf2oMksTYogLer2jifSag.text: It was OK. Not what I want to see in a Vegas buffet in a five star resort. It should be great! not ok.  I've dated people like this....looks great on the outside, but then when you try to have a bit of True discussion...it's just a big blah. Nothing really there.  The food looks great, but has no real taste.  I had a $75 food credit at the Aria, so my wife and I used it for this. Not worth it.  If I paid real money, would have given it 1 star.  Oh! Also two plates I picked up in the clean dishes pile had food residue on them. Yech. Had to get an extra napkin because I put my hand in something squishy and yellow under my plate. Ok, yeah, this review is one star now.  Choose somewhere else to go.

URMasm7PApYRVC_1IN55sg.text: It's not bad per se but this place doesn't even bother to try to keep up with the competition. You would think a nice hotel like Aria would try to up their game for buffets to compete with every other hotel but no, they just bank on people coming here because it's convenient. While the food wasn't bad---it just wasn't anything special. Nor was it very good. The buffet selection is just okay--but most things that they made were either over/under seasoned, over cooked, sitting out for too long, etc. LOL  That being said though, our waitress was extremely friendly and nice and accommodated our dozens of drink orders and consistently always cleaned up our table. She was a big win for me.

tqw8y2-LuM2uiNdaJEsysQ.text: If someone happened to look across the floor and saw me eating... They were probably thinking "Damn that little woman can eat!" I basically tried everything, and was pretty satisfied. I'm not really a buffet person, but it's the best choice to make when you go with a group that has picky kids. I can say, I actually enjoyed here very much. Good selections, food was good, servers were nice. I never expect super high quality food in a buffet line from the start, so I have no complaints. Best part- the cleanliness, and big space. Give it a try.

photos.caption: Photo of The Buffet at ARIA - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Buffet here I come
Photo of The Buffet at ARIA - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Awesome ceiling decor..

dmZpXs9HTHhSOrzAx-z8Mg.text: This is probably even a one star because there is very little I liked about the food. I've been to most of the buffets on the strip and this was one of the worst. The quality of food is poor. We only ended up going here because it was complimentary with our hotel stay. My suggestion for people reading this is to go to Caesar's. Far better...  The food just wasn't very good. I did like the pizza and it was fresh. Everything else just wasn't to my taste or to anyone else in our groups liking. I wouldn't pay to eat here, seriously not worth eat.

oIhn5y3NOOIISEofBFxayA.text: I love that they serve seafood here like crab legs, crawfish etc. (Lunch) The service was awesome. We ate here this week twice and never get tired of it. Unlike the Bacchanal Buffet I got tired already eating there.

kunLIVaSG3PgxXKVpZP_PQ.text: Meh. That's my impression. The crab legs were over cooked. The shell was rubbery.  There are lots of choices. The quality needs to improve or the price needs to drop.

5S9ztdkay36nN_1Rvq9pQg.text: It was amazing!!!!! My two kids loved it, it is the most talked about subject since we came back from Vegas. Totally worth the money.

-8fHxlyju1aaGq32CbNaag.text: This was honestly one of the best buffets we've been to on the Strip. We had kind of a terrible experience because we were short on time and stupidly chose to eat there despite that, so by the time we paid and were seated, we had 30 minutes before our Cirque du Soleil show. I mean, yeah we're idiots.  However, the quality of food was overall really excellent (and not in a "for a buffet" sort of way - it was just really fresh). I sampled food from the Asian section (rivaled Chinese restaurant quality except for the fried rice), almost all of the seafood (wow - so much good seafood, prepared well, and super fresh, unlike other buffets I've eaten at), a little Indian food (the Dal Lentils were as good as my favorite Indian restaurant at home, but the basmati rice and Chicken Curry were only average), and just a bit of the salad bar (I grabbed one wedge salad).  I know, I know, you're wondering how I managed to try so much in so short a period of time, but when I've spent $90 on a meal for my husband and me, I want it to count.  The desserts were really good and plentiful - I tried the key lime pie, which was really good, and stole three macarons (WE HAD TO GO I'M SORRY I'LL NEVER DO IT AGAIN). I ate them the following day, and they were pretty good, albeit a little stale.  My only complaint was the extreme lack of service. Our server came by once, maybe twice right before we left, so we were thirsty most of the 30 mins we were there. Because we were there pretty early, it wasn't particularly busy, so I was quite dismayed that we were basically ignored.  But I'd go back, if for no other reason than to eat there like a normal person who has all the time in the world.

oJPfLOcNPLT1o_VONMbQbQ.text: Delicious!! Lots of delicious choices- enormous carving station with plenty of different types of meats and proteins available, including bone marrow ,and the sea food stations were an avalanche of assorted seafood. The bread pudding is to die for!

9AfavSZ0axa489_gZgWRTw.text: Typical Vegas big resort buffet.   They have everything expected.   Nice amount of seafood offerings.   Good variety of stations.   Dessert was sort of boring, except for the ice cream station, hand dipped.   Plenty of seating and clean.    Late dinner on Friday night, 9pm and wasn't crowded at all.

KCcGKSvvuRDV1qLksM69wQ.text: Went a second time, wasn't half as good as the first.  To bad the consistency was not  better.

S80LGAA3pMVAtSRYHVnN7Q.text: I went here the first day I was in Vegas because I stayed at the Aria hotel.   We went around 4 in the afternoon (that was already their dinner time). It was pretty dead. But we're talking about a good dozen of tables were filled at the time. But that's understandable because that's super early for dinner anyways. I have to say it's not a bad thing cause we haven't had a meal all day so we were hungry and no line up. That's already a bonus.   The food was kinda meh even when I was super hungry. That was surprising to me. I don't know if I had high hopes or something or did it really not stand out for me. What threw me off was the shrimps. It said peeled shrimps. So, of course you expect them to be peeled already and ready to be eaten. That wasn't the case. There were still shells on them and it look like the chef just put a cut down the middle so it would make it easier to peel off the shells. Which I thought was funny. The shrimps were kinda small too. Variety of food was alright. Enough for us to choose from or sample from. The dessert is always my favourite and I love how they have a variety of gelato to choose from.   Service was kinda meh. Our server may have been a bit old and had some hearing problems or something cause we had to repeat ourselves over and over again. Oh and we found a rotten lemon in our drink. Don't think it was the servers fault considering the lemon looked fine on the outside till you looked inside the lemon.   I don't think this buffet would be one I would recommend to others when they are in Vegas considering there are more on the strip to try out. But if you are lazy and you live in this hotel then sure give this place a try. My friends did say their prime ribs were really good. My piece was just slightly chewy for my liking.

MCKeZaGsWYP9J1voqaR0mA.text: Seems like the premier Vegas buffets are going down hill. Spending 40.00 for dinner I would expect a lot more dishes that justify this cost. I can count on one hand the number of dishes worth this cost.  King Crab legs Prime Rib Pork Belly Creamy mashed Potatoes.  That's about it. The set of the dishes are just average or below average.

Fq2GBdxVnGIfsluRyBImAg.text: Went for thanksgiving dinner.  A little pricey but the food was good.  Lots of options, there is something for everyone.  The service was good and the buffet and eating area is clean and modern.  The food was good, had some turkey and it was juicy, prime rib was delicious, seafood selection was outstanding, and dessert was good.

WbH1apSzLj0pTEPP5hsYCA.text: Spacious and overlooking the pool, should you decide to, Aria's Buffet is about as lavish as you can go without going overboard. Exceptionally well-presented and prepaid, the mix runs from bean burritos to pizza to prime rib and a sushi selection rivaling any good restaurant.   The desserts are very good and handled by a cut-above of staffers. We spaced and timed our consuming to go back for several plates, shared a few things just to try them and had two hours of careful sampling. The big portions went to carved prime rib and the sushi, but not all at once. Tip big; if you're half-smart, the casino will give it back and for our staffers, well-deserved.  Oh? You didn't look for incentive programs to eat here on a two-for-one or comp? That one's on YOU. Cut the cost to at least half and you've scored bragging rights.   Las Vegas fare runs from damn awful to sublime, so how you eat is on you: bad nutrition is plentiful; cheap chow and sloppy consumers are plentiful outside, so why not dress a bit nicer and enjoy the Aria's Crystal area? Vegas top name places offer wonderful dinners ad lunches that run from $16 hamburgers to $35 chicken. Forgetpizza anywhere but Chicago, that's a given. It's a getaway: get away from eating the same stuff that you went on vacation to escape.  Leave the goddamn kids at HOME; this is Vegas and intended for adults, and the Strip outside willgladly eat stupid tourists without a second thought. Avoid most of the food out there. I recommend the Buffet as an overview of cuisine... all well done.

pAUwJYEsT8DLcUMjEUzB4w.text: NEWLY RENOVATED Buffet at Aria. For those who have eaten here in the past, Let's me tell you The Buffet at Aria has undergone a huge overhaul of its old buffet and it now looks better and fresher than before to try and compete with Wicked Spoon and most of all The Bacchanal Buffet. From what I read online, they spent nearly 3.5 millions to makeover their old buffet. Here's a Full Steady HD Tour of the Newly Renovated "The Buffet" at Aria that I recorded over the past weekend. or just go on youtube and type " Newly Renovated Buffet at Aria." or click on the YouTube link below to watch my video that I recorded of the buffet youtube.com/watch?v=tYpI... The video was recorded during the dinner rush. It costs 40 bucks for dinner. This is the only buffet I believe to have Alaskan King Crab legs on the Strip. Even Bacchanal Buffet at Caesars Palace doesn't have King Crab Legs. They have a varieties of Sushi rolls to choose from. They even serve jumbo shrimp that I don't see at other buffets on the strip. They even have a cool rotating Ice Cream Bar. Overall, I have to say this Newly Renovated Buffet is definitely up to par with Wicked Spoon and Bacchanal Buffet. Like I said above, If you guys want to see how the newly renovated buffet looks like I have recorded a HD video of the newly makeover Buffet at Aria: youtube.com/watch?v=tYpI...

aDG8quG53k2PJMy_ew0wmg.text: After eating at two other buffets on the strip, we were pleasantly surprised by the buffet here. We came for lunch and the price was decent, and the ambiance was light, airy, fresh and welcoming. The food was of above average quality and plentiful. My husband got excited when he saw the 'Tandoor' section but it left a lot to be desired... Was hoping for korma, briyani, or nihari but to no avail in that area. Anyhow, it's a great middle of the road buffet in regards to price and location.

fPJDro0VE8219shWhoLggQ.text: Service was good cleared the table quickly and kept the drinks refilled. The food was horrible  came at the end of lunch and beginning of dinner. Tried many different things and couldn't finish anything because of how bad it tasted. Would never ever ever ever spend my money to eat here again.

photos.caption: Photo of The Buffet at ARIA - Las Vegas, NV, United States. This was my bent knife at my table. Maybe this is the new trend lol

bYXZ2ulv9E3z3UCCdDlk2Q.text: Alright I have stayed at Aria a few times but never really wanted to eat The Buffet when I was ever in Vegas. During my last trip here we actually got free buffet dinner so we decided why not!   The inside and the look of the place seemed pretty nice but in general the food was just not that amazing. Some of the plates were empty most of the time even though I got up about five times and went and walked around.   I thought the service for the ladies that got us drinks was pretty nice and she was quick about it! But food wise I would say go somewhere else and it is not worth it to eat here!   I didn't really think they had a lot of variety and the food wasn't tasty or something that I could even remember.
