Photo of The Buffet at ARIA - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Mixed plate
Photo of The Buffet at ARIA - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Clams

CbjAHv-N94JQcPrRQOCohQ.text: We went for lunch at 2pm. Was told it was an hour wait to get in however there were many open tables. They will only holding the line until 3pm so everyone could pay more. Very disappointing because like I said there were MANY available tables.

AAurQoF7z3-gcnxwkyNXhw.text: We got in line at 8:40 when they close at 10. They sold unlimited drinks to the people in line at $20 a piece. The line was SLOW but moving. The group in front of us went and asked if we would get in and they said no. People at the front of the line had waited an hour and 15 minutes. There were LOTS of open tables. We left and went somewhere else, it was terrible!

memEtxVkQsYgvy_FT1v1fg.text: I usually come to The Buffet at Aria when I have a free buffet voucher or the 2 for 1 buffet price. I believe MyVegas still has the free lunch buffet from Mon-Fri (most other places it's til Thursday). Decor is great, place is clean, selection is not bad. They have gelato/ice cream for dessert! So I usually skip the line if any with my Gold Players Card (you can skip most buffet lines with Pearl and up). Because I don't feel like paying full price, I've never come here on a Friday night or a weekend. I've read that they have lobster on the menu then? Not sure. I always start with the prime rib, grab maybe some turkey, and get some soup. Afterwards I go around for my second round and get crab legs with melted butter, take a look at their Latin foods, and Asian foods. In the middle area they usually have something sort of fancy looking, so I get some of that. The Pho noodles and soup isn't great, but if you add sauces you can alter the taste a bit. Dessert selection is not bad, and as I mentioned earlier, you can get gelato or ice cream. I haven't been to every single buffet on the strip, but my order goes something like the following based on taste/price/variety: 1) Rio Seafood buffet (I think they just combined the 2 buffets now, but have 2 different price options, not MGM) Unlimited New Zealand lobster tail at dinner. 2) Wicked Spoon (Cosmo, not MGM) 3) Bellagio 4) Bacchanal (Caesar's Palace, not MGM) 5) Le Village (Paris, not MGM) 6) Aria 7) The Mirage 8) Planet Hollywood (Not MGM) 9) Mandalay Bay 10) Harrah's 11) The Excalibur 12) MGM (From here on down, it's not worth your money to go) 13) Luxor  14) Monte Carlo (The only place I didn't feel full when I left)  I've also been to the buffet at "M", but you would need to drive to get there or take a cab/uber. That one is ranked up there with Bellagio. I'm just going to list that in all of my reviews for each buffet.

photos.caption: Photo of The Buffet at ARIA - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Crab legs
Photo of The Buffet at ARIA - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Prime rib is good here!

8YWXUuKj5K5ljD-wyAJv7g.text: It was just fine. Nothing spectacular. The food was fine. It was REALLY busy and our server (basically a drink server) was eh. For the amount of money we spent, I had higher hopes but it IS just a buffet.

Lk025AtICcj4-ewgdcPC7g.text: Place has decent food such but for the price the service is horrible. When the resteraunt is 80% empty they still make you wait an hourm. From the time we paid at the cashier to the time they opened the rope to let 2 groups in was 25 minutes. We even saw the VIP line being forced to wait and there were a few arguments with the staff asking why is there a wait at a self serve buffet that is basically empty! It makes no sense for an expensive buffet.  Also there are no steamed crab legs at lunch and they'll wait 20 mins into dinner to put out a small bowl which you better time right if you want to get some. The waitresses are hit or miss as they are obviously understaffed. There's a lot better choices in Vegas. Skip the aggravation of the Aria buffet.

KsC1xsWqIn0k6UEmv9o0TQ.text: Aria is known for having a pretty popular buffet, so we were excited to try it half off using a myVegas reward. We declined the inexpensive addition of all you drink alcohol with our dinner. We wanna survive and remember this trip!  We were expecting more for how popular the Aria buffet lines are during the weekends, (we came on a Thursday).   The crabs that were warm weren't cut in half, the ones that were cut in half very obviously were just barely thawed.  I was very excited to see they had one of my favorite sushi rolls, which has cream cheese and isn't that common.  The nacho cheese sauce they had gets dry and hard really fast.  Not a good selection of premade salads. I thought I saw a picture of kale salad on Yelp, but I must have been mistaken. That definitely wasn't here.  Their jalapeno sausage was just ok, more of shock taste than actually yummy.  My boyfriend liked the rib eye, though a bit fatty.  They had this cool mini cup with colorful miscellaneous vegetables in a veggie dip. Except.... the veggie dip wasn't really a dip, it was a thin liquid consistency. Yuck.  The pork dumplings and fried rice were alright.  The desserts were ok, but nothing special compared to other buffets. I liked the oreo whoopie pie the most.  Servers were pretty attentive about our waters.  Kind of done with Vegas buffets.

Cx-kJVbImzsPROIZS2QFcA.text: Took my daughter for her 28 birthday here.We both have celiac Disease and this place is  safe as long as I stick to meats and seafood. Giving it 3 starts cause  .the only side dish I could eat is mash potatoes and it was cold. I had a lady server and she was very slow and had to chase her down for refill on drinks. Traismu gluten free very good.We went june26 2018  around 2 pm crab legs were  good. Had to wait a while to get guy in kitchen to cook gluten free pizza  when I got him he said be ready in 10 mins went back he said he had to go to store to get crusts and making it now. Seem like to me nobody really wanted to work there today! I wanted to try  the gluten free ravioli but nobody was around to make it.

lM2wSMc-q-oQqAJ6YkBJxw.text: Hand down the best buffet I have ever been to everything is super fresh. They have the best tasting crab legs than anyother buffet. A lot of variety. They serve thai tea and horchata and its amazing. The desert is amazing too. They have Curry goat omg no one has that.

m6K9lc3OzWAMXkIoCMOS5g.text: Small selections, beef was dry, crab not taste at all. Chinese food section was looked like messy.   Not recommended!!!!

7wYPj2u5v9_PMBsfc42OaQ.text: A nice buffet that is not as packed as other buffets with a nice range of food items.  The food is good and atmosphere is laid back.  It is hidden away a bit located near the pool entrance.  The place is bright with a lot of windows unlike other Vegas buffets.  The selection of food is good. They seemed to have a wider choice of different food than other buffets. The meat selection is good.  I was mildly surprised at the non meat choices available.  The dessert selection is OK but I was surprised to see popcorn at a buffet dessert bar.

photos.caption: Photo of The Buffet at ARIA - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of The Buffet at ARIA - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of The Buffet at ARIA - Las Vegas, NV, United States

yV7yg264k9ISPobzygIrUQ.text: This was the most okayest buffet.  I am on the My Vegas (slot game app) Facebook group and everyone raves about this place there.  I'm not very particular especially with buffets, but I was not very impressed for $42 a person.    The sushi was nothing impressive the rice was a little dry the rolls weren't wrapped nicely.  They had spicy tuna roll and I think some sort of Philly roll.  I didn't even want to touch the salmon sashimi they had out.  Not sure if it even was salmon sushi.  Could have been cold smoked salmon.    I thought oh I'm headed to the Prime Rib since you can't go wrong there.  I assumed there would be prime rib.  There was no prime rib.  Not sure what beef I got.  It tasted okay.   The snow crabs were the star of the show.  If it wasn't for the snow crabs I would have been upset.  They were easy to snap open and remove the crab meat, weren't too salty and tasted delish!  King crab was meh.  They split it open for you so it's easy to access but it dried out the meat and it wasn't tasty at all.    I tried three of their mini dishes.  I tried some braised beef over mash and it was super salty.   I then tried their clams and most of the clams were dried out sitting under the heat lamp.  And I tried the salmon.  That one was pretty good.  Not as dry as I thought it would be.   I was so confused about their asian noodles.  They had pho noodles and ramen noodles.  The noodles were without their broth in a small bowl.  There were two broths but one was all the way in the back and looked like it was hard to access.  I thought oh well maybe it isn't pho and there is just one broth for both noodles.  That was not the case.  I accidentally poured pho broth in my ramen noodles.    I had some of their dim sum items.  They were pretty decent but about the quality of any other cheap Chinese buffet anywhere.    Our favorite dessert at our local casino buffets are the creme brulee.  They had it here and we were so excited.  My son got his and said, "where's the brulee?".  There was no candied sugar on top.  It still tasted good but come on now!    The best part about this buffet was that kids 5-12 were free.  If it had just been my husband and I eating here I think I might have flipped out.  But since our family of five ate for less than $100.  I was okay with it.    This made me appreciate my local casino buffet so much more!  I might update that review soon.

8deAERoabjqkONa057cS0A.text: This place has the best tasting and priced crab legs in Vegas. The other meats and fruit taste great too. 4 star because the Pho is not good nor are the desserts. But if you want all you can eat great meat this is the place!

qGcKdjNUX2TPa1sz7TPVjg.text: Very nicely done family friendly and classy Buffet. There's all types of food including American, Asian, Latin etc. It's all fresh and well prepared. Nothing tastes pre made or imitation. I would recommend to anyone looking for a quality Buffet plus for an extra $16 it's bottomless alcohol!

photos.caption: Photo of The Buffet at ARIA - Las Vegas, NV, United States

5d-VTlJT-7Krzz2OaOLoiQ.text: The food is really good but we waited in line for an hour and thirty five minutes. We wouldn't have if one of them hadn't been comped. We keep hearing it is because of shift change   Mgmt shows no concern at all.

photos.caption: Photo of The Buffet at ARIA - Las Vegas, NV, United States

CdrtoaFkC0f2r2Xk1s5YIA.text: Arrived at 7:30pm on a Tuesday night to wait for about 35 minutes before being seated.A nice selection of various cuisines including Indian, Mediterranean/Middle Eastern /Chinese/Mex etc. I had no complaints with the food. Service was ok although I would not recommend the additional money for unlimited Cocktails.... the server was so busy with several tables that she was hard to catch. The verdict on the cocktails was that they weren't very good. The dessert area is not the most impressive I've seen at a buffet but was nevertheless filled with a nice selection.

Q_zXBOtKCDQppxNx3VCYDg.text: This buffet is insane. We went for the crab legs, and oddly enough, I was less impressed with the crab legs over everything else.  There was a very wide variety, our server,  Flor was very attentive, and we all left full and satisfied.   There is an Asian station, Indian station, Italian, seafood, salad, meat station, and desserts amongst others.  The price was comparable to others in the area.  Brunch was the best value, and we added on the bottomless drinks option  (it was buy one get one).

spOSTqRGsME0uOFJqwsRoA.text: Went for dinner on a Monday night. Had about a 30-40 minute wait which wasn't bad.  Food was okay, nothing spectacular or terrible. However, the selection was pretty limited. Mainly attended for the Alaskan crab legs which were all right.  Overall, mediocre experience considering the price and location. Do not plan on visiting again.

UD3iIkrleExioS2dZ_a0Ag.text: I had high hopes for the ARIA buffet being that it was a 5 star hotel... but it's absolutely terrible. There's nothing good here. Everything tasted bland except the mac n cheese, which i ate 2 plates because nothing else was good. The sushi roll offerings are limited, not even a california roll was there... the seafood and chinese food sucks. The fish tacos are bad as well. They could've at least offered some fries, but they didn't even have that... don't come here.

2deMyZ4CwRCKwf6Km4zseA.text: The worse buffet that I have ever been in Las Vegas. We call on 02/14 and double check with price on 02/15. Two of Aria stuff told us this buffet would be the regular price with local discount about $30 on 02/15. However, they charged us with their Holiday Price on 02/15 (Thursday) about $50. Also, all dishes look not good and fresh. Our kids are very hungry. Therefore, we gave it a try. After we sit inside, we feel their waitress must be have a very bad day because they look like you own them million dollars and very mad. Also, some of dishes did not look very fresh. We can spend $25 in local casino buffets and get better service with similar dishes but more fresh. Next time, we rather pay a little more to go Caesars Palace Buffet. This is not the buffet should be in Aria.

yTCL48veKT_cTqyn__Pasw.text: This is one of the top buffers on the strip with a great selection of cuisines.  The seafood was good and they had a great selection.  The carving station is good as well.  Service and ambiance were good.  The dessert station is also particularly good.

photos.caption: Photo of The Buffet at ARIA - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of The Buffet at ARIA - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of The Buffet at ARIA - Las Vegas, NV, United States

FEwIB7XT6R_Lh-NNSVjJUQ.text: The food was hot & fresh and the crab was perfect. They offered a variety of foods from different regions which I think was pretty neat plus the little extra paid for the bottomless drinks was on point! It was worth price, the walk, and the wait. THANKS BUFFET at ARIA!

Cg_e5aYNEbKQP-iCYqh3QA.text: Was super hungry so we decided to eat at the Buffet within Aria.   I've already been to the buffet at the Cosmo, Bellagio, and the Ceasers.   We also opted to get bottomless drinks for $10 per person, which was an amazing deal!  The service was great and the selection of food was plenty! Unfortunately, the food itself just tasted very mediocre. I tried the pasta, the poke bowl, the sushi, the Indian food, the dim sum, desserts, and the meats. Only the meat section was satisfying - the roast beef, the steak, and the jalapeno chicken sausage.   I would say out of all the buffets, this was probably the least tastiest. However, it did have more selections to choose from than the Cosmo.   Overall my ranks thus far:  1. Ceasers 2. Bellagio 3. Cosmo 4. Aria

HOKp8E-s5IALn9GWudn8pw.text: I came here over Super Bowl 50 weekend eager to try it out because I just had the Bellagio Buffett the day prior.   The dinner experience at The Buffett at Aria left me wanting more. It costs more $ to eat here than it does at the Bellagio, but the Aria offers a smaller collection of food and dessert. I enjoyed the King Crab legs and the Prime Rib here but the sushi, chinese and dessert sections were lackluster. I saw a whole aisle of Chinese dim sum steamers but was disappointed to find that they were all filled with buns and some yucky potstickers, no other dim sum. The sushi rice was also really dry too. There were not a lot of patrons eating at 3pm on Sunday, but the servers were very slow in taking away used plates and refilling drinks.    I like that the buffet space is very spacious and the interior looks beautiful. Unfortunately, I rather go back to the Buffet at Bellagio or Bacchanal Buffet because they offer much more in terms of selection at a comparable cost.   REMEMBER to present your MLIFE card to get Tier Credits for your buffet purchase!

photos.caption: Photo of The Buffet at ARIA - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of The Buffet at ARIA - Las Vegas, NV, United States. King crab legs
Photo of The Buffet at ARIA - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Mint mini chocolate cupcakes

Q_gtLzA__mgbO8OryOS7OQ.text: As part of our hotel package we were given 1 free buffet during our stay.  Boy, were we glad we chose the BRUNCH buffet.  B/c we were still on east coast time, we arrived at 7:30am and we pretty much had the buffet to ourselves.  The buffet offers an international menu and gigantic spread of food.    They have Chinese, Japanese, Italian, Mexican, and American.    Highlights: -Red velvet pancakes -Carrot cake pancakes cinnamon buns -Eggs benedict -Egg Tacos -Corn bread -Southern biscuits -Corn beef hash -Dim sum - pork buns, sticky rice wrapped in leaf, dumplings -Fried rice with eggs and chinese sausage  -Thai ice tea -Chilled seafood - crab legs, shrimp, crawfish - huge selection of desserts including mochi and gelato  I don't do buffets typically, but was amazed by the assortment and diversity of food and good quality.  If you stay in the Aria, the Brunch buffet is worth it.

NWiGD7ainPz40Xzjp3DCHQ.text: I have nothing good to say about this buffet experience.  First of all they have 3 lines: general public, M Life rewards, and one for people whole get in line on their room tablet. We stood in line in Mlife rewards line bc we are members. I did not have my card with me, we waited 30 min in that line only to be told we had to have the card and that they couldn't just input my number. GET YOUR CARD. so then we got out of line and used our tablet so we could get in tablet line. Tablet said "no wait" and we just saw there were no people in the line earlier. We get down to tablet line and there's at least 5 people in the line now and it's moving just as slow as others. I tell hostess about what tablet said and she said "sorry" There were tons of EMPTY dirty tables with nobody cleaning them off. The buffet itself was mediocre unless you're a huge seafood eaters, and even then it wasn't that great. Wasn't not worth the $$$$ that you pay to eat at this hotel. Aria need stop get more hostess help and staff help to move the lines and help people know what to do/which lines to go and what you need. And to be such an automated hotel and not be able to input the card # without the card is ridiculous.  Skip this buffet.

0CimjssknAZfQC6DLoIL1w.text: Do not eat here.  You have been warned.  Dumb staff, long ass wait and wait and wait.  I m not kidding.  I regretted even coming here and you will too.

6xFzaYPYgyAItK91jR808A.text: This is probably the worst buffet, I've ever been. I don't suggest it to anyone. The only thing I can say good about it, was sweet. Their food gave me upset stomach. Paid $40 for the worst buffet in the town. Burned pizza, worse sushi, I think Gordon Ramsay should visit your buffet and he will be all pissed off.

CKq9mmPG0p5RZoqNvNUIzg.text: I've only eaten at a handful of buffets in Vegas, but the Buffet at Aria is my absolute favorite. The team at Aria excels here at creating a buffet full of international flavors. The food is nicely varied, well-made, and totally worth the price.   From sushi and Asian dishes, to Mexican favorites and seafood, you really can sample food offerings from across the globe. Your typical American faire is here too, with sandwiches, cheeseburgers, etc. But why eat that when you can have crab legs?! They have a plentiful fruit selection, and a great dessert area complete with ice cream by the scoop.   I left this buffet feeling completely satisfied, and would come back in a heartbeat. I would point out that the line can be a drag, especially when you can see large sections of tables available. We got in line and were maybe 40 people back, and it seemed to take about 30 minutes. So come early, and be patient :)  I'm also a fan of the simple decor here, and the layout. Its multilevel, which is more interesting and deflects the sound better than one big room with table after table. There are also huge windows nearby that look to the pool, which gives the buffet welcome ambient light.   Pace yourself, and don't just choose the first thing you see, there's so much here to love!

OjRGshPBRutR0QnNk0-ofg.text: I'm so excited to update my review for the Buffet at Aria! We went this past week twice for holiday brunch and both times it was excellent. The first time we went was on Christmas Eve and we only waited about 10 minutes in line, but the next time we waited about 20 minutes, which wasn't bad at all. Since my last visit at Easter, they have upgraded a lot of their food selections including a made to order omelet station, red velvet crepe station, and a seafood station with oysters Rockefeller and seafood boil. Other highlights for me were the goat cheese and mushroom pizza, the tonkatsu ramen, fried chicken and waffles, and menudo (my boyfriend said it was really good!). We ate at several buffets during this trip and Aria had one of the best prime ribs we tasted! I was disappointed that they didn't have mochi like during Easter, but they did have some great apple cider sorbet and delicious Black Forest cake. I'm also happy to share that during both of our visits we had great service and all of the servers seemed to work together to clear our plates, refill drinks and make sure we had everything we needed during our meal. If you're a Vegas buffet fan, make sure that Aria is on your list!

Ed1n2N39Bkq4-_L5YWW1Eg.text: We had free buffet meals as part of our Aria room reservation with Orbitz. We went around 5:30 on a Wednesday night before a concert.   We were seated quickly, but unfortunately right below an air conditioning vent which froze me and cooled the food. .   Our server Kyle brought drinks while we got food. He kept our dirty plates cleared and our glasses full. He had many tables to care for.   Lots of fresh salad items--pears, goat cheese, roasted pumpkin, beets, wheat berries, melons, several dressings, etc.   My favorite entree was the pot roast with mashed potatoes and carrots; it was cooked perfectly with lots of flavor. The masala and chicken curry with basmati rice were also delicious with naan bread, hummus and cucumber sauce (I can't spell the correct name).   Creamed corn was a good side.   My husband loved the tomato bisque soup, prime rib, crab legs and steamed clams with melted butter, Brussels sprouts, rotisserie chicken and sushi.   The chicken taquitos and cheese lasagna were bland.   They had a nice selections of desserts, including gluten free and sugar free pies, cakes, gelato, cookies, flan, pudding, cannoli, etc.   We probably won't eat here again as the M resort south of the strip has a better, less expensive buffet.

photos.caption: Photo of The Buffet at ARIA - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Just a few of their desserts. The gluten free oatmeal raisin cookies were yummy.

HmMpk0ymcjzceJqrNAmboA.text: Brunch: Food appears to look good. But this buffet must be a meal and a magic show because it did not taste like food. I cannot recommend this place to anyone even families because it's not worth your dollar. Two stars for service. Drinks and cleanup were both fast and friendly. If you like decent food, try anywhere else.

MGRUC0X42IAgeao5SmQZrA.text: Aria you are doing the darn thing! My family and I snuck into Las Vegas, not expecting to go out onto the strip, but my parents insisted that we go and eat dinner. Needless to say, the buffet is always the best time in Vegas, so we tried Aria. We absolutely loved their selection as well as their BOGO endless drink special they had that night! Both my dad and I were able to enjoy some yummy drinks while we gorged on the food that the buffet had to offer. I personally enjoyed their poke station and the gelato! Everything was great, however they did not have fried shrimp which disappointed my parents. When my mother asked about the fried shrimp the head chef came out and said they don't make that, however they instead made her a custom shrimp and butter noodle dish. It was delicious and she was happy that they went above and beyond for something as small as shrimp. It's the little things that they did to make us comfortable which will keep us coming back. Thanks Aria! :)

5rCiFmerN6Jj7CtWmkpv4g.text: After visited Bellagio, Cosmopolitan, Wynn, and Aria buffets, the last one is so far the worst. First, if you're not the  member you have wait over 1h, that is fine with me when all the tables are occupied, but almost have the tables were empty, nobody was cleaning them. Second, there is time limit 2h, and we saw a waitress  who was pushing some couple to move due to 2h limit. I've never seen something like that in other buffets. Again, almost half the tables around us were empty. Third, we have to wait around 20min so the waitress brings us the drinks. Fourth, we saw some lady who dropped  the spoon on the floor and I believe she put it back to the food section. Fifth, the food was average. The only positive thing is that during dinner time kids eat free.

tUrEvUf5_gSmJjhyTCpzzg.text: Man how much difference a year can make.    Aria has stepped it up and now is head and shoulders above the Bellagio.   I was with a Carlos Sr who believes in second chances so we went to the Aria again, mostly thanks to Myvegas video game comps hahahhaha. Man oh Man was I happy to check this place out.  Everything was delicious.  And after the Bellagio disaster I was sooooo happy to eat a quality meal. Chinese food was on point, ate 2 plates of it.  Vietnamese soup was amazing had 2 bowls.  BBQ was really good.  Brisket was great.  The chef even cooked me 3 plain oysters because I ain't the biggest fan of Oysters Rockefeller.   Crab legs were very good for being cooked (I like chilled on ice better).  The deserts were great.  Hand scooped Ice cream.  Very nice touch.  Bellagio is soft serve ice cream, yuck. Aria great job, I will be back.  And Myvegas game players.  Save your comps you would spend on Bellagio and spend them at Aria instead.  P.S kids are FREE for dinner.   Thank you Aria.

C91EIDty2tSrUh73QKZTjw.text: ONE WORD, EPIC!!!!!!!!!!!!!  This is the king of buffets. I've never seen such a big buffet in my life.  We came here on Monday for brunch. The fee was $22.99  for two hours of unlimited food. If you wanted unlimited mimosas, bloody marys, and champagne for extra $16.99 extra, though.   Honestly, it was worth every penny.  I think you need to go on an empty stomach in order to enjoy everything lol.  It's so amazing how they have multiple sections for different foods all over the world. Some of the sections are Mediterranean, Asian, Latin and Italian. They also have seafood, desserts....honestly, anything you can think of they had it.   The craziest thing I saw that made me label them the king of buffets was that they had two specific items one was corn- Mexican style with mayo and cheese. I honestly never seen a buffet have something so specific and authentic. Another was red velvet pancakes- with nutella.   What I also like about the buffet that it is very spacious and you never had to wait to get anything!   Our server was also very sweet and attentive.   I would never think of going to any other buffet in Las Vegas besides this one.

photos.caption: Photo of The Buffet at ARIA - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of The Buffet at ARIA - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Breakfast
Photo of The Buffet at ARIA - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Hummmmmus

A2CSdb3klu5g58FqvYaxLw.text: Since we were staying at the Aria, we decided to come here to eat and I was very pleasantly surprised. We paid the holiday brunch $38.99 but since it was towards the end of brunch, we actually got to enjoy dinner there too.  Similar to what other Yelpers say, the highlight of the place is their King Crab legs. If you're a super seafood fan, then you'll definitely have a food coma out of this place. But other than that, they do have various selections of different cuisines (Meats, Asian, Mediterranean, American, Italian, etc). They're all pretty good.  As for drinks, I really liked the watermelon lime juice and Thai tea (they're dispensed near the meat area). Both tasted really yummy and the watermelon juice was super refreshing. Overall, food tastes great for the price you pay.

P3kZin4dT6XaI2t43XiC5Q.text: The brunch was so so. Eggs tasted fake, French toast was good, Indian food was good, lo mein had curry in it?, the wait was ridiculous. It was too pricey for the quality.

n4rk9UjoySh8WD6VE-rrAg.text: Excellent quality seafood, better much better than Stations or Rio. I went midweek so not their gormet the version they serve on weekends.  Negative Cowboy steak was tough and fatty. The prime rib was much better. Note some of you may not like the rare cut of beef. The dry rub ribs were great. I didn't try pork, chicken, sausage as Ibwas indulging in seafood.  Pho broth very sweet. Should be simpler and allows consumer to add hosin. Also basil wasn't available and had to ask for it.  Positive  Seafood was awsome. Shrimp were not the small tasteless peel your own variety. They were cleaned and more like U20. The cold Mussles , clams, and snow crab legs were very good. The hot varied was even better. Never tasted misled like this before. It was great. Also on the plus I only came across 1 clam with a broken shell and another barely opened. RRMEMBER don't eat those, especially ones which haven't opened. This is a sign the mollusk was bad.  They have Indian food and fresh naan. The shrimp and grits was fantastic. I would have preferred halibut over salmon in the fish tacos but they were good as well. I can imagine how good it could have been with Copper River Salmon.  Bottomless drinks were good and plentiful I recommend the Rum Punch.  The selection of desserts was excellent.  Desserts were more plentiful with greater variety and quality than Rio of years ago.   All in all a very good buffet. The one I hold in highest is at the M. I'll get a review of that out shortly.

L6mSi7nessrXamaK6Si_-Q.text: This is probably one of the healthiest places in Vegas - buffet wise, which is what I was ideally looking for. I wouldn't call it a 5 star or a 4 star but if it's value mixed with quality you're going for, then I'd highly suggest this buffet as one of the top picks. They have a great mixture of salads, proteins and carbs. A bit greasy on the day I went but the fresh shrimp made up for it. Seafood selection wasn't much - shrimp and crab legs only. For the price you're getting it's a decent meal if you're famished.

photos.caption: Photo of The Buffet at ARIA - Las Vegas, NV, United States. One of the healthiest buffets in Vegas in my opinion. Has a good decent salad bar and plenty of side options.

4FoBmr4_mNMHd3e4DC0cng.text: Ahhhhhh the famous Las Vegas buffet.....yeah doesn't exist here for me! I have had umpteen and I mean umpteen Las Vegas buffets at probably every hotel on the strip and the one at the Aria is truly forgettable.   My first grouse....the long line...we waited for close to 45 minutes to get into the buffet and when we got inside....there were empty tables everywhere!! The ladies that were checking people in and collecting the money were painfully slow and were too busy talking on their cell phones. Plus inside the area is pretty disappointing...come on Aria spruce it up!!  My second grouse....food labeling....it is terrible! They have food sections and in a particular food section there will be a plaque telling you all the dishes that are available there. The problem is sometimes I don't know what dish is what....how about putting the label in front of the particular dish!!! Ain't that a brilliant idea!! Example....I picked up a type of salad thinking it was a potato salad....nope turned out it was tuna salad....now if they had just put the label in front of each dish...would have made my life much easier!   Also I am not vegetarian but I noticed that the labeling made it very hard to tell, which dish was vegetarian or not. Example, it says vegetable fried rice....but its full of pork and beef...fabulous Aria!! You just ruined some poor vegetarian's day!!  My third grouse....food taste...overall not impressed. Yes I know its a buffet and I should not expect Michelin star rated food and to be honest I am not. But I do expect there to be flavor in the dishes and for them to taste different! I tried almost everything they had there and the best thing was the "vegetable fried rice" and the Parmesan bread....all of which I don't need to pay $25 bucks for!  My last grouse....variety....Las Vegas buffets are famous for their lavish spreads and variety in food. I felt a distinct lack of "lavishness" here. If you are going to do less than you had better make sure that the quality of the food is high. Unfortunately, Aria fails in both the variety and the taste department!  The servers were nice and the dessert bar was decent...but that's about it. So if you're looking for a Vegas buffet, don't come here, save your time, money and energy and walk yourself over to the Bellagio or Wynn yes it costs more but at least you leave feeling full, satisfied and happy!

o_YiJPlhaY5NfWfBqi3d0w.text: I don't like buffets.  There... I said it.  Long lines. Mediocre food. IKEA tables.  So why review Aria's buffet?  Because I can do what I want.  This is America, pal.  I also visited several buffets while on a recent trip, so... I'll give you my worthless feedback.  I tried the lunch buffet at Caesars, Cosmo, Aria, and M Resort.  This was, by far, the worst buffet I've ever visited.  Every dish was overcooked.  The steak was impossible to cut.  Bland flavors.  They did have Indian food... which was ok, but man... I couldn't get out of here fast enough.  Even the desserts were crappy... which is usually pretty hard to mess up.  If you're staying at Aria and they offer you a free pass... skip it.  Would I go back?  They couldn't pay me to eat here. Ok, they could... but still.

SHf8wf674qRZv3dXgSDEjw.text: Well this was way better than the buffet we had at Monte Carlo the other day. The selection was very good especially the desserts! The staff were also friendly especially our server who was very attentive to us. We went at dinner time on a weekend so it was a bit pricey - the price was  worth it.

e8_vfsuXro8y-ECbOAocAA.text: Meh........ too expensive   wasnt the best or worst buffet but i really wouldnt do it again

ctneqvhJ8A5F-EjfRlB5_g.text: It was my first time coming and eating at the Aria Buffet . We paid $45 a person for my lady and I. Food was gourmet and there is a huge variety so much food to choose from so many flavors definitely worth it if you like gourmet food and buffet style. Also you get a waiter/waitress

L7OVvaYFvNBpkINUgW_nnQ.text: Great buffet in Vegas.  The best thing about this place is they give you KING crab legs and they steam them up for you hot so you can eat LOTS of delicious crab meat....SO GOOD.  When I went, they gave you a free lobster and a glass of wine for every two dinners purchased, and we didn't even get around to eating the lobsters!!  They have a good dessert selection (their apple pies were my favorite) and everything else was just OK.

RTzceB4noifdmBOHv-1PTg.text: I enjoyed the buffet. The crab legs, prime rib, and Indian selection was good; I would've like a wider selection. The desserts were great! It was more than I expected ($86 for 2) but I got my money's worth. I would eat there again.

UcU9wwch7-g22lCZvfyavg.text: Just ate there, threw up everything.  They have a good variety but very few things are worth the price that you pay. Some food just tasted bland, old or just plan odd. Also did the bottomless drinks, and All I can just say is don't order the mimosas or Bloody Mary. It was terrible. Usually I can have 3-4 mimosas, but I couldn't even finish one. Only reason I gave it one more star than it deserved was because the service was pleasant.

SP2TRtHfYMt7aUG5QsLC7A.text: I don't understand how the average rating is 3 stars!!! No way!! This is my 2nd time in Vegas and their buffet is, by far, my favorite in the city!! Great variety and different types of cuisines! Highly recommended!

PTdSRzP25gPH-6ybT1rQwQ.text: My husband and I are staying in Las Vegas for the week at NY NY and we were so excited to come here, as we usually frequent this buffet every time we visit and are never disappointed. However, today caused me to never come back here again. We arrived around 4:30p today and we're promptly seated by our friendly host. Our waiter was friendly and very quick with our drink order. I come here strictly for the cold crab legs and the carrot cake. The carrot cake here is to die for and it comes with a small serving of a pineapple puree that is just divine. I walk by the dessert bar to get a view of the lovely carrot cakes and what do you know? It's been replaced by a disgusting Black Forest cake. I say it's disgusting because I tried it and it has some type of cherry jam in it that is reminiscent of cough syrup. YUCK! Ok, I'll move on to the crab legs and I'll feel better. Welp, no cold crab legs, just shrimp and muscles. I'm just striking out left and right at this place. I walk around the seafood bar and find steamed crab legs. I guess this will do, they look good. I sit down with my husband and begin cracking open and eating the crab legs and OMG! it's like someone just dumped salt all over them. They're completely inedible! We wasted money on this buffet and there is nothing I want to eat. It's so disappointing. I try the beef steamship and it's cold and hard. I give the beef brisket on mashed potatoes a try and it tastes the way cat food smells! C'mon, Aria! What happened? You used to be so good! You won't be getting my money anymore, or any recommendations.

Epf5tnoDjyF4iGGHA0lL1A.text: The Buffet at Aria was sheer bliss; An orgasm for my tastebuds indeed. It is by far, the BEST buffet in Vegas. We went on a Friday night with my boyfriend, and I think it was about $42 per person. This includes bottomless wine, and a complimentary lobster tail for two.   The food was amazinig! Everything was fresh and the meats,fish, pasta, chicken, and some other entrees were cooked to order. The sushi selection was amazing, and the grilled salmon was like butter in my mouth! Ahhhhh I wish I there was something comparable in Los Angeles!  Filet mignon, New York steak, roasted lamb, and grilled chicken....oh my....my mouth waters at the recollection. Dessert selection is truly endless! They carry the tasiest cakes, pies, chocolate mousse, and ice cream any sweet-toothed person can enjoy.   By the end of the night, I was tipsy, full, and happy. I cannot wait to go back!  If you are in Las Vegas, you MUST do The Buffet at Aria. No questions asked!

gb_mOO63zWjTRUi6MAnuJg.text: There are buffets in Las Vegas much better than this...I'll start by advising you to go somewhere else.  There are "international" stations to choose from for different dining options. I tried their pepperoni and veggie pizzas, which were very bland. I also wanted to try the Middle Eastern/Mediterranean food, as I am Chaldean, but was sadly disappointed. The hummus was too "rough" and the tabbouleh was more brown than green. I tried a curry chicken dish which was pretty good, but ran out quickly and was never put out again in the time I was there. I had the same experience with the mac and cheese...which was delicious. It's the best thing I had there. They have a lot of desserts to choose from. I tried the mini mint cupcake and a mini gummy bear strawberry cupcake, not only are they cute, they were good too. My husband tried the cinnamon bread pudding and loved it, he said its the best thing he had there.   The flow pattern was odd, which made it confusing for everyone walking around. There was no order, just people aimlessly walking up to stations and in your way the entire time. Granted, I understand it's Vegas and it's busy, but other buffets I've been to had a decent flow of the restaurant allowing people to take want they wanted, walk past what they didn't, and keep the line moving. People had no direction and were all over the place.    There is a long line at all times, but the wait isn't worth what you're getting. Our "waitress" Danielle brought us water and coke then disappeared for about 20 minutes. We watched her serve and attend tables that came after us, but even after being flagged several times, she wouldn't come to us. My husband asked another server named Samantha to start taking care of us and our experience got a little bit better after that. Overall, I wouldn't recommend it.

p1YCEbTYHUac4HLm4vQ5vg.text: We stayed at Aria and I didn't take time to check Yelp. Could have saved a bunch of money! Breakfast buffet is $27 per person during the week and $37 on weekends. I only wanted breakfast foods and the buffet serves foods that one would eat for breakfast, lunch and dinner. For this amount of money the food should be hot by the time one returns to their table but it's between barely warm and room temperature. My last day here I went to Denny's and got a GrandSlam for under $5. I could kick myself and wouldn't go there again.

7JlsQUv_e9EVyEfkTwIeEQ.text: Disappointing buffet. Not worth it if you have to pay full price. Over $45 per person. For that price I should have gone to a sit down restaurant.

O7UzeXDwVicCV4xqW1ebeQ.text: Aria...oh sweet Aria. I loved my room and the entire property however your buffet was a dud!  I had high hopes after waiting an hour in line :(  Mediocre at best, small selection of oddball food options.  Nothing stood out except the dessert macaroons. The dessert section is good, however not enough to warrant a repeat visit. Word of mouth is important and the words that will be coming out of my mouth regarding this buffet are not good.   Is not a good sign when the one memorable item is a freakin macaroon cookie! For shame!  No second chance will be issued, I am one and done!  Food was cold, that was a huge issue.  Don't waste your time!  GO TO THE M RESORT...STUDIO B BUFFET...now that is a buffet worth talking about!

GqxXSp9NrFqy3sP4FYIZag.text: Food is always Great. The quality and variety of food make the price reasonably priced. I have been here at least 10 times and I have always left extremely satisfied. Seafood is always fresh.

Tm3a9Po9lPIOcupDAMht-g.text: The service provided by our server, Meraf, was second to none.  I spent three times the cost of this evenings meal at lemongrass last night and Meraf ran circles around the server at lemongrass. Many thanks to Meraf for making my last night in Vegas a memorable dining experience.

qy7YNRpIAfOmd8bRqg8F8Q.text: Terrible buffet for $40 Prime rib , beef rib are dry as hell The fish was rock hard The lasagna tastes horrible, sauce was watery , feel like it have been sitting there forever and no one want to eat it The naan bread was a little burn The crab leg taste dry with no favor No sashimi Sushi roll sucks The only good food there is gleato and ox tail Food just terrible And for beer you have to pay extra $17 Compare to the mirage  This place is just not worth it

P6yGdpwksLPyXgn3eWEEVA.text: Where is the damn negative star here.   The food is awful, like really awful. I will never go here and will never let my friends go either.  I tried pretty much all cuisines at their lunch buffet. EVERY SINGLE ITEM IS TERRIBLE!! including desserts (except those cake lollipops). I like the concept where you pre pay for your buffet and drinks (we can include unlimited drinks for extra charge). For table of 6, 4 of us bought unlimited (other two were already hungover from last night). They checked our ids again at the table (I get that since two of us didn't buy they want to make sure they are not minors). They take ENOUGH time to come to the table and take drinks order (I think we had 4 almost non-alcoholic drinks (more mixers and sugar and very less alcohol) each out of 2hrs). The 1st waitress shift was over after an hour and the 2nd waitress came and checked our ids again (I get that too) and she said "the previous waitress told me, only 3 of you on your table bought unlimited and she is checking how much time we'd left to get drinks". I told her "please go to the buffet frond desk, check how many of us bought and add the 20 min time you are wasting to our table for drinks". She was like "oh no, I trust you"!!  Service is Awful, food is awful, drinks are awful Period!!

lN8U4YZY-VOM-G23uDMFVA.text: We lived in Aria and had our breakfast here. $18.99 for weekday breakfast excluding tax. Not many seafood, only quite a lot sausage and ham. Benedict egg was not bad. Desert was always of good quality. Not comparable to Caesar.

OEXEvC-w11gcuUj-Vgo4IA.text: The first time we tried this place when it first opened, they had more exotic choices such as rabbit. duck etc that very few buffets offer. Maybe because it was also a weekend at that time. Recently my husband and I tried it again since we had a 2 for 1 offer (from myvegas slot games promotion) we also have tried it on a weekday and it wasn't the best I had. The selections/varieties are much smaller than much other buffets for the same price).   Generally, the flavors are not bad and of the selections they have they still yummy but for the price you pay, I have had better and again with more selections as well. I would come again only with the 2 for 1 promotion. Otherwise, there are much better buffet options at other hotels.

RR1_QUo67Nz9PCDD_OMtcg.text: Oh man, where to start this sad story? The only thing worth mentioning are the dumplings in the Asian station everything else was lack luster. The fried rice tasted more like paella than fried rice and the noodle soup might as well been a carnival game since there was no way to get any noodles in your bowl.   The carving station offered a brisket that could have only been prepared by a rookie since it had no smoke ring and was as tough as a rubber sole.   Stay clear of the Latin station everything was over cooked.   Didn't try the fish market but seeing crawfish on ice told me everything I need to know.   Desserts were good.

WsjLgjS1dsAx3qx0D4As2Q.text: Don't get me wrong. The food is good and thers a variety. My review is for customer service. I was there the last weekend of August (the 21st). I went to the cashier and told her I'm only paying for myself. She charged me for 3 ppl. Ok accidents happen I worked retail I know the game. She had trouble cancelling it. Had me waiting 20 minutes while she tried to cancel it. Finally called a manager to come fix it. She had no idea how to fix it either.   While I was eating she came up and said she had to call the supervisor who was off site cuz he/she the only one who knows how to fix it. Weird. You'd think the manager would know how to cancel a transaction. The manager kept me updated about how things are going but I got the feeling shr just wanted to get rid of  me. My feelings turned out to be True.   She finally waz able to cancel it told me to sign the void and left. No offer of any compensation no coupon for  free meal just a thank you and go. And I was stuck with a $145 hold on my account from the whole weekend till Tuesday the next week.  Now if only I could get ahold of the corporate office I still have the managers card.

gRe2T7PRN4H19Fxz5dH00g.text: The amount of options here is truly diverse  Some of the featured items are;  Fish Market - LOVED the unlimited crab. Certainly a favorite with my fam. Asian - They had a really tasty chicken and broccoli dish I tried. Italian -didn't try their Made-to-Order Pasta section but glad they had the option. Pizza - Gluten free pizza dough available! Mediterranean - The hummus in this section was basic  nothing really fancy.  Tandoori -Naan was decent and a host of other stations I didn't try like Latin ,Carvery,and a Diner section with burgers.   I did like the breakfast items such as the hash browns. I did find a hair in my food so that wasn't appealing.   They are sort of expensive especially during the holidays. Regularly brunch is $29.99 but during the holidays its $34.99 and they don't even offer any holiday-ish items.... The Aria is a nice hotel and the buffet was clean and loads of options. If it wasn't for the hair in the food then it would be 4 stars. ..

gu-jWoGe8NalDFkdN0FhYA.text: I was so disappointed for the food at The Buffet inside Aria Casino & Hotel.  If there is an option for negative stars, I would definitely give it NEGATIVE infinity stars.  First of all, it was very expensive comparing with other buffet restaurants at 5-star hotels in town and their "holiday buffet" courses was not even 1/100 at other places.  Food was not fresh at all.  It is very salted and stale.  Food counters were not cleaned, neat, or organized at all.  Looked very dirty.  Their seafood section looked like food was dropping on the floor and being putting it back on the counter to continue serving customers.  Never eat noodle soup there.  It was very salty and spicy and didn't taste close to what it called "pho."  Desserts were not good either.  Rum raisin ice cream tasted like drinking rum directly from the bottle.  Strawberry ice cream had no taste of strawberries.   So disgusting of the food here.  My boyfriend took a dump immediately after the meal.  I should have complained it to the hotel.  Never dine here ever again.

photos.caption: Photo of The Buffet at ARIA - Las Vegas, NV, United States

BcPtlujDK4Pvqf6Eg9wWmA.text: We probably should've read the reviews first, but the diversity of Asian food attracted me to this buffet, so we went on a whim. Unfortunately, the quality (of both the Asian and non-Asian food) was not that good. They do have a lot of different options, but for the price, I expect higher quality food in addition to the variety. Most of their entrees were forgettable. A few things make it 3 stars vs 2.  The good:  + The crab was good, but steamed crab is pretty common at this type of buffets.  + The made-to-order pasta. My husband liked the (red) sauce and the sun dried tomatoes. + The french toast was tasty. Fluffy and with the right amount of sweet and syrup - not overpowering. + The sesame balls! Cute sized, good texture and taste. + The nachos. Not really paying for an all-you-can-eat nacho bar though.  The meh: - Oily stir fry. I liked that they used wood ear mushrooms, but it was too greasy to enjoy. - The leaf-wrapped rice & chicken. While a unique offering, it tasted bland.  - The Indian food. Back home, we can get all-you-can-eat Indian buffets for $12 that taste better, so I didn't bother filling up on stuff that wasn't at least equal. - Non-distinct seafood dishes. It seemed like they put out two different clam/mussel entrees to look like they offered more, but in reality, the sauces didn't taste that much different. - Not that many interesting vegetarian dishes. All I can remember is a broccoli and cheese dish. Maybe some snap peas too. - Unsatisfying desserts. Neither my husband or I wanted to finish the ice cream. We tried a couple other things (flan, cookies, cannoli) but nothing did it for us. (I was excited about the flan too!) It sucks to spend a lot of money and leave still wanting to buy something else.  Everything else was forgettable. Sure, it filled us up, but I left feeling unsatisfied. For the price, I would prefer to eat somewhere else with higher quality and more creativity.

XrdfTqxa5ij20saZ3jPxsw.text: Welcome to the Old Country Buffet of the Aria. For the Aria being a five star resort, it is shocking the buffet is expensive (around $50 a person with tax) for the poor quality. Aria has many great options, sadly the Buffet at Aria is no longer one. The food is mass produced and has little attention to detail. Desserts taste as if they might be the day over left overs from the higher quality options onsite. If you are looking for a much better option- walk across the street to the Cosmo with Wicked Spoon. Aria could learn a lot from their buffet.

r6By0XGLfBW-ICVflBw4gw.text: The boyfriend and I were here last week. I would rate this a 6/10 honestly, in comparison to the Bacchanal at Caesars and Wynn buffet. To begin with, when I called them to check for vegetarian options they told me they had plenty, with a dedicated tandoori section. Umm, not really :/ the tandoori section (which was just alright, nothing special Indian food) has a rice pilaf, couple curried and overcooked chicken tandoori. Other vegetarian dishes included quinoa salad, Asian soup, made to order veggie pasta, bread and cheese selection, Mac and cheese and salad and corn on Cobb. So, not worth the $28. If you enjoy sea food and meats in general, then maybe this place would be 7/10. The problem wasn't only the selection of food, but also the taste. It wasn't upto the Vegas standards, not bad just not good. Their dessert section was the saving grace. Lots of good desserts and our favorites were key lime pie, the chocolate cake, carrot cake, ice creams and the star was the pomegranate meringue which was absolutely yum!!! They also had tea, coffee or sodas and juices included in the price and you could add unlimited alcoholic drinks at $15 or something. Lastly, the staff was nice and courteous and i, by chance, met the chef, who was so sweet and polite.

oS7iKnd03aSBmX4pdWSuZw.text: Brunch was EXPENSIVE. 30 something a person. For that much money I'm expecting food to be refilled quickly. I finished the last two eggs Benedict which was delicious, but then they stopped making more! Ugh disappointed! Other than that, brunch options were fair, although mediocre for the price. The dessert baked treats and the gelato wheel was a highlight. Very clean eating / serving areas. Probably won't come back for a brunch.

yoMxosH5GKCBRRtJTkVpaw.text: What a disappointment!  Foods were mediocre at best, contrary to some reviews, it has a very limited selections for vegetarians!  it us not worth $28.99 pp for lunch!

A_L9IgSULT7GXxfommJF8w.text: Disorganized line, rude server & bad food. I would recommend you spending your money at a nice restaurant then come here. The food is not worth the money you spend here.

uojYq1P1i9lniRVa6FUzUA.text: I LOVE this place. I'm so glad I'm part if myvegas because it allows me to purchase a coupon that let's me buy one meal, get the second for free. Even at original price, I think this buffet is still worth the money.  As every Asian does, I get my fill off the expensive things during their lunch/dinner "menu". They have things like prime rib, king crab legs, and gelato. King crab legs are my go to. I grab a plate full of lemons. Create a king crab leg mountain on another. And just plop right back at my table to make my lemon/salt/pepper concoction. (The salt and pepper shakers can be opened from the bottom to make things easier on you)  I came here with my boyfriend and another couple. My friend really LOVED their flan. He says its the absolute best he's ever had. My personal favorite dessert from here would be the chocolate gelato. Every chocolate lover's dream! Nom. Haha.   Parking is easy to find in the structures. Service can be a bit iffy. Some servers are nicer than others and will serve you with a smile while others give off an attitude or kinda bitchy vibe. But that comes with all restaurants, so I let that slide.   Overall, this is a buffet I always find myself coming back to. 4/5 would come back (:

PkjCaiUFlpihefJ6dJ-peg.text: Possibly the worst buffet I have ever had.  Grilled shrimp tasted like charcoal. The scallops on a clam shell were gummy and tiny.  The Lobster Bisque must have been mislabeled, as there wasn't any lobster, it was just bisque.  My lobster Mac and cheese was also missing lobster, and was cold.  On the plus side, the prime rib had good flavor, as did the peanut butter and pretzel gelato....so there's that.  All in all, I would definitely not recommend the Aria Buffet.

PoQEFdgwMd23XrGQX3n_PA.text: Had dinner here. The roast beef was one of the best at buffets that I have had in Vegas. They even have creamed corn to go with it.   I have tried almost everything, a bite of each and only a few items that I did not care for, but overall a very decent meal in taste department.

0Q9FwuQOhJudntAwWXThRA.text: Finally got a chance to try out Aria's the buffet with my MyVegas 2-for-1 reward.  Cost: 38$ for lunch When: Monday (1:05 PM)  Cons: long line wait (1 hour wait, so started eating at 2PM) and bad service originally (our server Mary Ann messed up drink orders, showed up only twice the entire time we were there (but we spotted her chatting with other servers on the side), etc. Other waitress rudely told us she won't help us because "it's not my section" when I asked if she could get us something to drink after we waited 16 minutes from first being seated).  Pro: cool food setup (gelato dessert rotating wheel and stone oven cooked tortilla), new server (Yugasov?) extremely hard working, decent variety of food, AMAZING tastes (nothing was overpoweringly seasoned or sauced, etc. It tasted like restaurant quality cuisine), and aesthetically pleasing layout.  Bathroom layout and cleanliness: 3.5 out of 5.  Overall: think it's worth a trip on a less busy day (use MyVegas or discounts). As other reviewers say, it's no Bacchanal Buffet, but it's still a delicious visit. So 7 out of 10 for me (due to wait and initial service).

photos.caption: Photo of The Buffet at ARIA - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Meats and cheeses.
Photo of The Buffet at ARIA - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Salad bar...box?
Photo of The Buffet at ARIA - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Derricious meats!

O7xdmYnvDmYXoz0L3-0eiQ.text: This buffet sure did improve! The first time I tried it years ago... it was not good, despite being fancy looking and all... I forgot when they reopened this buffet, but it sure did taste much better this time around.   First off, HOT crab legs for lunch???? I'm so there!!! No other place have I seen warm crab legs for lunch... not to mention even having crab legs for lunch!! I had a plateful and they were sweet and juicy... drenched in butter, I happily set myself up for a heart attack, lol. The beer battered fish was also very good! The amount of food is not as numerous as other buffets... but the food they had was good. I also had clam chowder - very tasty and creamy. The curry from the Mediterranean station with the basmati rice was delicious.  The prime rib was well cooked (other places it was medium rare) and very tender and tasty. The thing I did not like was the BBQ pork bun... I'm Vietnamese and we are big on dim sum... and this did not hit the spot. It tasted weird to me. They also had har gow (shrimp dumplings)... average tasting. Dessert selection was a bit dismal compared to other buffets...not a big selection and nothing really stood out. They do have waffle cones for your ice cream!  Lunch was $22. A good deal actually since it includes seafood!! I left at 2:30pm, dinner starts at 3pm and did not see a line really... maybe because today is Tuesday?   In the end, a BIG improvement over the old buffet here... for the price, it's a pretty good deal, especially if you want more seafood stuff during lunch! But if you are looking for the vast selection at some other places, it's not really here. Service was good and my drink was always filled.

photos.caption: Photo of The Buffet at ARIA - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Plate 4. Dessert
Photo of The Buffet at ARIA - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Plate 3. More crab legs and clam chowder for lunch!
Photo of The Buffet at ARIA - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Plate 2. Steamed crab legs and seafood... for lunch!!

MxdOhjtk5GU26WMtIF_UYg.text: I've now been to three Vegas buffets for dinner and my ranking is:  1. Wicked Spoon at the Cosmopolitan 2. Bellagio Buffet 3. Buffet at Aria  I expected a little bit better. Everything reminded me of what I'd get at an all-inclusive resort. Everything was just a little bit off.   However, I really did appreciate the warm crab legs and had a boatload of them.   There's a sign at the beginning of the line that says the wait is ~1.5 hours from that point. Luckily, the line only took 45 minutes.

7GDohKCMPjzEG2iX24Ct4w.text: Not bad  more selections please, this is like a fancier home town buffet. Food is very good though.

J9UXOkrwjmeMXsi7fOKyVQ.text: Maybe it is not the best buffet in Las Vegas, but it is my favorite buffet in there. After I tried all the famous buffets in Las Vegas, Aria is fittest buffet to me. It have reasonable price, sufficient seafood and attractive desert. The most important benefit is that you don't need to wait too long time to the line compare with the other buffets. Highly recommend.

MPpUTIQHMYM4k9eZi9j9ow.text: The food and price were alright, but our server, we think her name was Flora, was the sweetest. She kept bringing us drinks based on what she thought our taste was, and was always there to fill water and coffee and answer questions.

MLa7DZBfj4EXtREkIM9HvA.text: I was really looking forward to enjoying the Las Vegas buffet experience but I was let down by the buffet at the Aria. We visited for breakfast on Memorial Day, so we were surprised by the extra cost just for breakfast, which was called brunch for the holiday. It feels like we were tricked into eating at an overpriced buffet - $37 per person, when we were expecting $20. French toast sticks were cold and the smell of seafood that early in the morning can be nauseating.   Wish it was better. Finished the meal with a scoop of gelato that was delicious!   If you're looking for breakfast at the Aria, order al la carte from somewhere else. Cheaper and probably warmer food.

photos.caption: Photo of The Buffet at ARIA - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Deal or no deal?
Photo of The Buffet at ARIA - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Carrot cake and a scoop of vanilla gelato

7XgrFkVAKrxZrfB3m_Csug.text: Came here with a BOGO for lunch with my friend. The food was okay, but not being a buffet person, everything was just okay to me. Some stuff was way too salty or heavy, as usual. The best thing was their garlic mashed potatoes and their selection of meats. Their asian food is not good, crab legs are extremely salty. Indian, Greek, and Italian selections are small. Their desserts were pretty good, and loved the spinning ice cream wheel selection. Service was good here though, very attentive.

photos.caption: Photo of The Buffet at ARIA - Las Vegas, NV, United States

h7xuzmt0t7oVdRehVSIq2w.text: This was the worst buffet!!! We spent about 90-100 dollars for two persons, we got there around 8:40pm and everything was dry and looked old. Although most of the food looked unappetizing we gave it a try. When I got to the seafood I was craving the shrimp. There was about 15 shrimps left and I asked for more, and the lady working in that section told me there was no more because it is 9:15 ish and they would be closing soon. I was so disappointed since I am pregnant and shrimp is probably the safest while expecting. I literally cried because I spent almost 100 dollars only for shrimp, and a piece of carrot cake. My boyfriend tried other items, but he agreed this buffet was garbage. BAD PLACE we went back to our room and ordered pizza .

678qdcUXlTQjPFPpo7Tm4A.text: I just can't get over how awful this buffet is.  The best entree is the dry lukewarm crab legs and the almost expired tasting oysters... Thank god for the amazing host the magician and the balloon artist!  They distracted us from the almost edible fare and mediocre steak.  I tried a bite of almost everything that looked edible and yes I'm full but I am far from satisfied.   If we had paid full price I'd have been pissed!

tB2DYx0URPHI1maDtGttGw.text: The One Where Sandy Was Warned to Not Eat Here.  And we still did.  Le Sigh.    Our first night in Vegas, we decided to have a group dinner here.  My local friends all warned me against it saying that "only virgin Vegas goers would eat here."  However, since I wasn't calling the shots, I went with my friends to have dinner with bottomless drinks (for an additional $15, which I didn't get, but my friends did).    Anyway, just don't come here and waste your money.  The food was horrible.  I sampled basically everything and the only thing I liked was their gelato (I mean, if they messed that up...).  I'm not the type of person who would eat her money's worth since I'm all about quality of food.  The quality was nonexistence.  I just can't stress enough about how poorly their food was and we were here at a normal dinner hour.  The fact that the place was not happening said a lot.

2bBXt-sK71YuSY-gfiUeRw.text: Okay just got to give a positive review for this place after all the negative ones I saw. My husband and I came here on Friday for the brunch buffet and guys it was so good! There was a bit of a wait but hey, I don't care. The service was fantastic! They have so much food! Literally I tried everything (judge all you want) and it was so good.   They have everything. The desserts are incredible, the pancakes were so good, they had fried chicken and waffles, tons of salads and fruit, so much fresh seafood, Mexican station, Italian station, omelet station, carving station, sushi station, dumplings, egg rolls, pho bowls, cereal, muffins, bagels, you name it they have it!  This place wins over Wicked Spoon just cause they have so much variety! The only con is the plates are too damn small haha!

GmlLelfhfNkD0kG9qgplCA.text: This buffet has gone DOWN HILL!!! We tried this place last year and it was great. We went on 05/15/18 and it was DISGUSTING!!! The food was all dried up and I mean ALL the food was old! Meats were like rubber and the Italian section looked like it had been there for hours untouched. The mac and cheese had a skin over it and the Asian section had a weird smell. Dinner rolls were like 5 day old hockey pucks. The service was terrible and when we asked for a manager the server told us the manager was "tied up" and we really needed to talk to the chef because he is the one who cooks the food. We went up to the cashier area and finally a manager met us with the chef. The manager was rude, nasty and when we explained our concerns she ripped the check out of my hand and rudely told the cashier to refund our money. Then, the chef implied we were crazy because he stated " we were the only ones today to complain about his food". After we received our refund, the manager said "have a good night and please leave".  So we were asked to leave because we did not like the buffet. Save yourself the agony and go to the buffet at Caesars Palace. We ended up going there the next night and fell in love. It is twice the size and $54.99 per person and WELL worth it!!!! Aria needs to listen to its' guests and reviews. Their ego is too big to accept they need to improve!!!!

LxlAVZ5GBpRKk0KxhDJFPg.text: Well my wife decided that we would try the buffet while staying at the Aria hotel and having dined at their restaurant the Pub the night before and enjoying the food.  Absolutely the worst buffet I have ever been to. Not even sure where to begin. I am not even sure if a real Chef is running this place! To start it off they did not have any Prime Rib the entire time I was there. Mind you we came for dinner at 8 pm and they are open until11-12 I believe. The person carving the meats said some would be coming out, but none was forthcoming and I checked many times. Very limited selection of food. Most of it looked like it had been sitting out for a while. They did have crab legs, only problem was they were placed out in a small wok sized pan that only contained enough for maybe 4-5 people and then they were gone again. There was one lady throwing a few in a pot of water next to the display counter but the pot was too small and there was no way she could keep with the demand. I have never seen anything like this.   I mainly came for the prime rib and some mashed potatoes. With no prime rib I did try the mashed potatoes, no gravy anywhere to be found, with some beef something that they were serving up. The potatoes were very bland and dry.  The beef was Ok, nothing to write home about. After passing the various stations and seeing nothing that looked appetizing, and a very limited selection at that, I decided that maybe this meal can be salvaged with some excellent desert. WRONG!!! Even they were tasteless.    Save your money and go elsewhere. We had room service the first night here and it was excellent, including the desserts we ordered.  Maybe stick with that out of convenience.

RcAUTMdZi7JddYWi-CPq8Q.text: I come here once in a while cuz my mom likes to eat crab leg for lunch.. As usual we pay for breakfast price (10:40) and get to eat bf and lunch ..$20 per person and child 4 yr. and under eat free. I don't really like it here, they don't have much selection.  The Chinese sucks, Indian is blah, sandwiches were alright. The only good thing is hot crab legs!! Their Dessert is really good... Flan is one of the best, my favorite is square coconut macaroon to die for..hehe.. I still think Bacchanal buffet is my #1 pick

photos.caption: Photo of The Buffet at ARIA - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of The Buffet at ARIA - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Dessert
Photo of The Buffet at ARIA - Las Vegas, NV, United States. ONLY thing good here

ziFD70XfIpvftFfQ_7Pp2A.text: Weekday morning breakfast buffets for $17.99 is not too shabby!    Keep in mind to go around 10:30AM so you can hit the breakfast as well as the lunch items.  If you decide to go earlier, you may end up running out of things to eat.  For me, I love variety so that was a huge bonus.  The lunch items come out at 11:00AM so everything was freshly prepared and hot.  Tips: -Go for the warm/hot snow crab legs (much better than the cold ones) -Clam chowder was great and you can put in some freshly cooked clams from another section of the buffet too.  They're in a big pot. -They have congee that you can add preserved eggs and bbq pork -Fresh naan bread made in front of you -The dessert section is big and have a variety of sugarless items -Loved the gelato and sorbets -Washrooms are located inside the restaurant, -less walking

photos.caption: Photo of The Buffet at ARIA - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Our 3rd round of food
Photo of The Buffet at ARIA - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Dessert!

kiRWfrptgPh65L-fHbHH1g.text: I guess I expected a better buffet because the casino is so nice. We went to a lunch buffet at Aria at 1:30 pm. The selection was good. Most of the food items were mislabled (they were in front of the wrong item or signs leftover from breakfast, like french toast, when it obviously wasn't french toast or didn't have any labels at all - they had some generic sign that said something like EFT-1 (or something similar). So, there were a lot of items that we weren't sure what they were. The quality of the food was decent. It wasn't a buffet that I would go back to or tell people that they need to eat there.   Our server (I think her name was Linda) was awesome.

KT6MYgQSOdauwo-FU7KqPw.text: This is the best tasting buffet in Vegas so far. Crab to order, fresh and great flavor. A nice assortment of choices and everything was delish.   The staff is courteous and efficient. Love it, can't wait to go back

cd5fXQ4_L5anuSWU1sgExA.text: I was here for the brunch buffet and thought it was excellent, I liked the eggs Benedict and added guacamole. The pizza was good too.  I didn't try the Chinese station of the India and Middle Eastern station

gV-pt7kCbfTrX8xR8KsbRA.text: It's a good buffet located at one of my favorite properties. It has a little bit of everything & I especially enjoyed the hot crab legs & cook your own steak stop! The quality of food is good.  It's a very modern setting & they also offer unlimited cocktails with your meals if you would like to pay extra. When my friends are in town it's a good option so everybody can get what they want.

photos.caption: Photo of The Buffet at ARIA - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Nutella whoopie pie! Strawberry oat bar, caramel bananas!

paVkoBtDxWxEw6wvvFx64Q.text: I really enjoyed this buffet. It reminded me of Caesars buffet although Caesars is a little better. I liked the crab legs and the shrimp the best there meat selection was on point I loved the prime rib! The lamb and the ox tail soup were disappointing though. The deserts were really cute and and I loved the ice cream. The line was out the door but if you're a platinum m life member you can skip the line. Overall I give it a B I'll be back.

KqMAKIdyzhLSMnQDbkhkaw.text: I was hesitant to go due to the reviews but decided to try it due to convenience. I'm glad I did, it was pretty good. Chinese section was my fave, even had shrimp pho. So delicious. I was so full and only got a chance to try the flan and it was very good. I liked the seafood section better than the one at the Bachanal in Ceasar's palace. Overall, a great experience.

QU0zvwOcVdxJltcNN9lx5Q.text: Given that the Aria Hotel and adjacent Crystal Shops are jaw dropping in their design, the buffet is especially disappointing.  Not much that you want to eat and, I am sorry to say, the seating area was quite dirty.  The tables remind me of the waiting area at the local auto club.    The extra star for this otherwise two-star review belongs to the Naan -- it's just awesome.  Made by hand as you watch and cooked in this heated earthenware pot ... oh man.  Who needs dessert?    However, should we be spending $40 for a casino buffet just for the Naan?   Nein.

YI35IIf8HWG5bFqNwnjPgA.text: Not a bad buffet at all, just not a great one either. Being the skinflint that I am I came for the lunch at 3:30 so that it would bleed over into the dinner service. Worked like a charm!  Carving station was alright. Not as good as The Wicked Spoon, but the effort was there. Dessert area was OK, but I wasn't impressed with their overall selection. I love red velvet cupcakes but they didn't have any. Just red velvet macaroons. Salad bar was blah. But let's face it you don't win friends with salad.  The dim sum selections were OK for the most part. Clearly not as good as a dedicated Asian restaurant but not awful like a $10 Asian buffet either.   So overall I sum this place up as being OK at everything. Nothing sucked really bad but nothing was amazingly awesome either.

photos.caption: Photo of The Buffet at ARIA - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Meats. That is all.

XDXqu4xxav9bSkDXezUMqw.text: As far as the food is concerned, 5 stars all the way. Absolutely delicious. I enjoyed everything I put on my PLATES! I loved the creativity the dishes had. Indian was divine, brunch was fantastic & the best carrot cake I've had in many years. Everything had a little pizazz and I loved the cheeses and fresh fruits. Great selection for vegetarians as well. Yummy desserts, lovely ambience and moderately priced. You can spend more elsewhere for less satisfying food.  The only reason I didn't 5 star this establishment is the service is a bit poor. The workers don't really want to be there but to be fair, who does? Our server, Sonny walked up to us and said, "What do you want to drink?" That's it and when I asked for our table to be cleaned because there was syrup on it, he dropped two beverage napkins over it and said it's good. And that was that. We never saw him again, even to get a spoon. Had to steal it from another table. Other than that I would revisit this buffet. Definitely one of the better ones on the strip.

YAciulDOIYVHTQIXG7Pq6Q.text: The wait was ridiculous. We waited two hours (!!) for lunch and I'm really not sure it was worth it. Some dishes was delicious, curry and salads were great. But there was not a lot of variety and the staff at some of the stations (meat and pizza especially) was very rude. Also, there was no fish, to my amazement. There was sushi (which was warm, literally melting and not fresh), mussels and later crab legs, but literally no fish, like salmon or whatever. Also several dishes ran out, naan bread and pizza, no chicken in sight. My total impression was that the staff was overwhelmed and couldn't keep up. Some were nice and polite, like the lady at the deserts counter, but overall not great. Deserts were wonderful and delicious, that I must admit.  I wish someone had told us we could check in from the room. Or at least have check in stations like the Bacchanal. If we hadn't waited a ridiculous amount of time, we might have enjoyed it more.

5DXw5ruHrKScm8THbNGR4A.text: Wait was about 45 minutes for Saturday dinner. Once inside, it wasn't very crowded. Ate here for free. Quality is still great but many items were not seasoned or tasted just ok. Ended up eating only crab legs, fresh salad bar & gelato. Service was attentive & friendly.

mMctmKGi67jNqazlI6Rb_Q.text: We came during brunch and was immediately seated. Customer service was ok, but they kind of slow with cleaning up the dirty plates at our table.  Buffet lacked a bit of variety, however their desserts were delicious. I also really enjoyed their sushi station as well and their lemon grass chicken (tom yum) soup.
