Photo of The Buffet at ARIA - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of The Buffet at ARIA - Las Vegas, NV, United States

cbwEd9ZjtJAGTYPOabRN3Q.text: Terrible!!!! Trust one of the worest buffet in Vegas Terrbible food and unreasonable price 51+tax for dinner.  Bad service If have zero star i will never give one

PDkkIyA56ezzs0-ej64mxg.text: The food was ok at lunch on a weekday - it was overpriced for the quality of food.  Quality is mediocre. Variety is good. Service is ok.  So many options but nothing sticks out.  The indian and chinese food options were stale and the fish in the sushi section did not taste fresh nor did the crab.  Italian included pizza which was basic  I found the sushi/sashimi/poke bowls to be a good option but again nothing special  My favorite item was the carved turkey breast (lean and flavorful with the gravy) There was a carving station with a variety of meats (beef, pork, turkey breast, deep fried chicken, whole chicken) pancakes ( carrot cake, regular and red velvet flavor)   The pancake was super sweet, moist and delicious (but definitely filling and should be treated like a dessert)  Dessert was delicious! From the ice cream to the pastries... so many varieties. mmmm. save room because it's a sweet treat!  I enjoyed the cake pop - it was moist with a chocolate nutty coating. I also liked the variety of ice creams and enjoyed the coffee flavor.  Wait staff were a little slow on drinks and refills but overall not a terrible experience.

LT1nxYFdcwJks10qq71RpQ.text: The buffet is not worth the price and the wait, there is no King Crab and sashimi and only two kinds of sushi roll.  The prime ribs were the only good dish.  The people work there look so unhappy.

fEklYz1nVsHDj0RwBfre5Q.text: We decided to give Aria Buffet another go with myVegas comps for breakfast. They still haven't figured out how to staff the dining room as our drink order was not filled correctly or in a timely manner. The breakfast food was "meh" at best. I will not be returning.

2aoSIAkusXmaSsyT0PmqKg.text: This was by far the best buffet I've EVER been to... The service was great and the food was fresh. So many different varieties to choose from. And to top it off our server was amazing we left her a very nice tip'

Bc7BjDzFfj7b3krd_qKnmg.text: My number one pet peeve at buffets is when the food isn't hot. We came for dinner tonight around 5. It wasn't extremely busy and we went in without much of a wait. The service was good. Drinks were refilled, plates were cleared, etc.  But the food was a whole other story. It wasn't even warm, but it sure was old and dried out. Even the food that was just put out looked old. I've given this buffet many chances. Sometimes it was good, but mostly it wasn't. Today was the last chance. I will never come here again. More old, cold, dried out dood for everyone else.

KlxXx_8jQJU2v3x4qiPxSA.text: It looks beautiful but just want you to know what happened with me.   I just got out of the hospital in Vegas where I spent the night, and diagnosed with food poising.   That came from under cooked mussels from the buffet.   Someone made a mistake that should be understood just be aware that it happened to me.

o6z6b1IoGectGgaCUbrwIg.text: I had dinner ($38.99 per person) with bottomless drink ($19.99 for two people). Only thing I can recommend is the made to order pasta and shrimp.... I ordered rum punch for drinks and it tastes as if there is no alcohol in it. If you like crab legs, they have steamed one. I dont think I am going to come back..

ExjmOCV7_Eq7ZdwCf-72xA.text: After contacting lot of other buffet places, we decided to go with Aria for its wide selection in  vegeterian options. We were not disappointed.So many good options in each cuisine or counters. They have gluten free pizza and desserts too. I took one star off as gluten free and vegetarian options weren't marked at all and the staff was always busy to attend the customers. Food wise it was good but service wise okay

VH62-wniMsV_ARitvUPHlw.text: Vegas is one of the best places I have ever been too. Many places to explore, but eating has been an amazing craving for me. In particular, the buffets. I know that it is important to eat healthy, but this place will make anyone excited.   Aria has the most convenient buffet out of all of the Vegas buffets I have tried. I have experienced wicked spoon, buchanel, the venetian buffet, flamingo buffet and Bellagio buffet. None of these are convenient although the food can have better selections than aria. Aria has many desserts of high quality: creme Brulee, muffins, Gelato, macaroons, pie, cobblers and Panna cotta. The food is of highest quality: crab legs, sirloin, prime rib, oysters, clams, rib eye steak and sushi.    There are booths all around the place. Waiters and waitresses are friendly and give you the best service money can buy. The good thing is that I'm telling you that this place is heaven on earth, but there are also some bad things like any place. However, the bad things are not so bad. The price range for each person is 30-45$ unless on Saturdays and Sundays. This could include holidays being on the 100$ range. The food can be hit or miss on lunch, but dinner has all the good stuff.    If you are wondering where to eat, aria buffet, buchannel and Bellagio buffet are my favorite. Hope this helps!

wJgtLGD_SGcOW7znumutUA.text: There were plenty of choices to satisfy any taste. Food is pretty average tasting, nothing really stood out. We went to this buffet on 3 separate occasions for breakfast or lunch and had pretty much the same experience every time: lines were too long, servers were indifferent, drinks were too weak. It was pretty convenient though as we stayed at Aria. I suggest you look at some other breakfast/lunch options even within Aria (the crepe place was pretty amazing). Overall I won't recommend this place.

H2xmx7QzHDHdueIDg6MnnQ.text: All of the MGM resorts buffets nowadays tastes well mediocre to horrible. As this buffet may look super appetizing it does not taste as great as it did when it first opened years ago. The buffet has a more limited selection versus other buffets but that means there should be more quality integrated into the food but they failed to do that. This place is all looks no flavor for a robbery of $35   Plate 1:  - "cowboy" steak / the carver asked me how i wanted the steak and I said medium and gave me a dry piece of shit cardboard oh and they just pile 4 different meats in one cutting board so yeah I'm that's mildly gross.  - mac n cheese / tasted okay as in edible  - mini burger slider / dry like the desert outside  Plate 2: - self grab Thai tea / the best thing I've had here and that's sad  - rotisserie chicken / tastes almost like Costco's which is great and it wasn't dry  - shrimp fried rice / felt like I stuck my tongue in the ocean .... so much salt  Plate 3:  - pepperoni pizza / nothing special but decent  - spinach dip w chips / my favorite thing here food wise as there is an even ratio of chips and dip but such a cheap food to create.  Plate 4:  - prime rib / not bad but pretty small to a point you won't notice it compared to the other meats ( i guess they don't want you to find it because it's the most expensive meat there )  - iced crab legs / decent but very small and not super meaty  ( THEY MAKE THE EXPENSIVE FOOD SEEM LOWKEY) Plate 5 desert:  - banana fosters / so sweet that you can't taste the bananas  After that I left feeling well upset that this place is housed with various fine dining options yet I couldn't at least eat one thing that tastes super great. If you want a modern buffet experience with great taste I recommend the M resort's buffet !!  ( 2 stars for the interior design of the buffet because it's very appealing and simple )

lzEfj_QyU0WiwQTmfGFt_A.text: So we had super high hopes seeing all the videos around the hotel and in our room.   Positives: steam clams, poki and chicken tandoori and dessert bar   Negatives : everything else -- seriously everything is cold and difficult to eat  I didn't do the meat section so can't rate that.   You would think we such an elegant place like the Aria that this would be out of the world .. sorry to be let down with such a beautiful place like the Aria

CtfSbRQ8Gr2hfPnyVSfp0Q.text: DO NOT COME HERE!  Came here for my best friend's wedding. I'm assuming you're coming here for the selection of food to feed many people with different taste buds. If you're looking for quality of food for the price you pay, this might not be the best place to go. It's about $50 for a weekend dinner and the food was OK and I don't think I would be coming back. I think we should've spent slightly more and went to Wicked Spoon.   Also, a couple of people from the wedding party weren't able to join us for dinner because they got sick but the host still got charged for the missing people. What a rip off. Will never be coming back. Sorry not sorry.

S287tOlhp1SHM1uuGrEXmg.text: Not too impressed with this buffet...Jan 2, Wednesday midday, arrived at 11am for the brunch buffet ($28.95 each) and stood in line for 40 minutes. The seating hostess seemed a bit overwhelmed and unorganized.  Once seated, our server met us right away, was very pleasant and took our drink order and invited us to the buffet. The room was very spacious , attractive and comfortable. Many selections in all areas but those tending to the stations seemed not to be able to keep up with the dishes..many serving trays were depleted and unclean...all of the Asian dishes were so salty that we couldn't eat them...pho, chicken gumbo, shumai, Asian noodles/pancit...terrible!  Even with these observations being corrected, the price of this buffet is too high; as well, you're gonna pay $7.50 an hour to park after having your vehicle inspected by security...not worth the hassle.

FEp7pNbPNYFIf_em255rww.text: Was ok, not really worth the $90+ for two people (including tip) for breakfast. Normally, a buffet does not warrant an 18% tip, though when you check out before dining, that is the minimum recommended level.

mFP95T3Zc0RfYbD40WESQA.text: All the food are dry and not hot at all...... I was like eating a $20 buffet .... that was crazy. Generally a very bad experience in Aria .  Not recommended period.

QNylg2D2zaOriTXckuA-tg.text: Came here on Easter before 4pm, the line was okay... the food was so so... once you see the meat, you just don't want to eat it... the Chinese section, it was really salty. The roasted duck is not fresh, the meat had a weird taste. The crab legs are got but kind of salty but it taste better than the buffet at Wynn. Their buffet menu needs to update, many items are not at the buffet.

li6B596dfyikev7vLtmTMg.text: More like 3.5 stars. $40 + tax for a "gourmet dinner" buffet. Pretty typical rate for a Vegas buffet.   The buffet at Aria does come with a serving of lobster and bottomless wine (between chardonnay or merlot). Yes, the Vegas drunkenness continues through dinner! Anyway, we came right around 4pm which was the start time for their gourmet dinner and there wasn't really a line. Didn't really fill up until about 6pm. Yes, I ate for over two hours and I'm damn proud of it.  The lobster seemed overcooked and tough. It was too dry which made it pretty tough to chew. Oh well. Not bad still. Prime rib was amazing. Perfectly executed.. Great outer layer of spice and nice and bloody...just how I like it. There was also a lamb roast that was also really great. It was really tender and had just the right amount seasoning on it. Crab legs were fine. Very fresh and easy to pick off its shell. The lemons suck though. You'd be lucky to get 5 drops out of them (I need my lemons!). They also had Indian dishes like Tandoori chicken and various curries, but I didn't really try it. Pizza and pasta bar, etc. etc. Nothing special. Not too many other options.   Dessert was okay. They didn't have creme brulee :( The gelato was nice. Mixed berry was my fave. Banana creme was probably the best cake there. Other than that, nothing else worth mentioning for the dessert.  Service was decent. I think our original server was pretty good at checking in for taking plates off our table and refilling our wine. The whole plates thing got annoying though because I wanted a plate to keep my crab shells on there. Oh well. Lastly, I think after her shift was done, the person who replaced her didn't really check in with us. I guess I just ate for too long and they got tired of us lol  Overall, I'd probably still choose Bellagio over Aria. More options, better desserts, and better lemons lol. If I do come back to Aria, I'd make sure to ask my server if they could give more servings of lobster!

FA_UdbzfdwfmtmVKx6xzfA.text: Great selection!   Carving table, Tandori with naan, bottles of Thai iced tea, hibiscus tea, and pink lemonade, dim sum, king crab legs (cold and steamed), steamed clams, huevos rancheros, tacos, biscuits and gravy, breakfast items and more.  I went twice on my most recent visit and both times I had 2 servings of huevos rancheros!  Delicious!

_9_Fs4Q7TkjBGJN4mO1T5A.text: As far as Vegas buffets go, I was quite a bit disappointed with the food. We came for brunch and was seated promptly. As I expected, the level of service was pretty good. The food spread was quite diverse with the sections being divided into several types including sweets, Chinese, Mediterranean, Indian, Carvery. However, the quality of the food was quite disappointing. The Chinese dumplings, soups tasted like it was heated from packaged products. The potatoes and sausages seemed quite oily and salty. Even the Mediterranean and indian food was pretty bland considering the typical spices that go into them. For 20 bucks, I think it is ok but certainly didn't impress me at all.

azpJpYqJmIw-n6IP1f6EGQ.text: As far as buffets in Vegas go, I was less than impressed with The Buffet at Aria. Their food and presentation is about as "creative" as the name.   For $30+ (Brunch on Saturday) I would rather grab something smaller, not AYCE or hit another buffet. Vegas has too much to offer to settle on this place ... unless you're too drunk to scurry elsewhere, then you're screwed.  The scarce highlights include:  - The company - if you bring good company, apparently, you can spend HOURS in this place picking at food and sucking up all the champagne your body can handle.   - The Service - For the most part, the cashiers and servers were friendly.   - Breakfast Pizza - it has sunny-side up eggs on it!  - Mint Whoopie Pie - I only picked it up because it was the most attractive thing I saw on the food line. The center cream stuff was good. I didn't eat the rest if it.

photos.caption: Photo of The Buffet at ARIA - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Mint Whoopie pie.

ssiTqRtpEzTfJEG64RpNSA.text: I ate here for dinner the other night with three other dining companions.  The buffet itself has lots of different foods as many of the Vegas buffets do.  I think that the standouts of it for me were the beef brisket and the already cracked crab legs although I wish the latter would have been served warm and not cold.  What I was disappointed in was that there was no traditional salad bar.  In its place was an area with many different pre-made salads.  The desserts were good as well although one of my companions had a hair in his butterfinger gelato.  The bottom line for me is that I would probably not come back here in the future.  The food was solid but I believe that I can do much better for the price we paid on the strip.

CViM5kH_DkIlXasEzl6HHA.text: My favorite buffet in Las Vegas is at the Aria. The dinner buffet is excellent with a wide variety of meats and seafood.  Their crab legs were delicious. Various nationality foods are also available. Our server Eva was excellent.  Unfortunately she went on break and her replacement Joe was lousy.  We complained to the manager who was very helpful and friendly.  Kudos to her as well. The lunch buffet was good although not as outstanding as dinner.  They seemed to be slower keeping the food stocked. The rum punches were great at dinner.  For some reason, they didn't taste that good at lunch. Different bartender I guess.  I look forward to returning.

FIa3y03n4N-_zun9_DZK7g.text: Great food! Loved the variety in cuisines ranging from Asian and Italian to Mediterranean even! All the food was good and our server was awesome. He was friendly, constantly checked up on us and made sure our drinks were full.   The best part was the huge variety of sweets! Tons of carrot cake, flan, cheesecake, pies, ice cream, it literally had every sweet imagineable! This place is sweet tooth heaven.   Would definitely come back here on our next Vegas visit.

oPPfHir2tJhWogOPHMFhWg.text: Remember This is a 5 Star BUFFET REVIEW!  Breakfast Buffett at the Aria $15.95 per person includes unlimited coffee and soft drinks as well. Large square layout of food in ultra modern setting with spacious seating.  Our server was good about keeping up with our large party but I'm stunned they would not put the coffee pot down on the table. Guess to much waste is take on it.  Either way she was pretty good about it.   Starts on one side with an impressive array of pastries, cookies and pies and every other baked good known to man.  Followed by a Asian display of various items I normally don't eat for breakfast.  Then you move around and stage 3 is blintzes and crepes and various cold cuts.   You make the turn and it's your standard breakfast fare with eggs, bacon, sausage.  Keep going Pizza 4 types including an egg breakfast pizza.  And on to pancakes and waffles. OH WAIT Mexican Station, with breakfast burriottos etc.    OK not full yet omelets station and carving station with giant fresh sausage and ham.  throw in some free range chicken being carved right there as well.  Undaunted and want more how about bagels various crazy type creme cheeses and spreads followed by a large fruit display along with country biscuits and gravy YUM!  GOD HELP ME I'm about to burst.   I know I know all buffets are like this.  Well maybe so, but place was laid out nicely food was hot and fresh and tasty and service very good. For $15.00 how can you go wrong especially since a coffee and one pastry at the take out coffee shop costs about $9.00.  I don't understand the negative reviews at all. remember you are reviewing this as a buffet not comparing a $16.00 breakfast extravaganza against Smith & Wolenskis.  Your reviews need to reflect the type of business and compare it against other similar types.   If comparing to Buffets well Top Shelf folks. A definite repeat

c8yBeMxLJvpxgU55_KuCnw.text: This is my favorite place to come to eat every time I come to Vegas. We come every Sunday for brunch when we stay out here. Food, service and drinks are always spot on.

X5cpAiYZfjeVK0oCBtQ9ag.text: $50 for AYCE? Awesome. I got everything I wanted: american, breakfast, asian, indian, and sweets. There was even more than this, but my stomach just couldn't take any more! So happy I went. The wait was too long (and there were plenty of tables available), but I was happy once I got inside. HIGHLY recommend it!

vZ5qYZwKzZM0hzhPx12JqQ.text: The aria buffet is just dreamy! I loved it and well worth the cost! I would have given 5 stars in a second but was upset I paid for 2 hours of bottomless drinks at 8:43pm and was told (after 1 drink) at 9:40, the bar was closing at 10pm!!! I was spending my time enjoying the buffet! Very upset I did not get more than two drinks. But the buffet was just wonderful!

photos.caption: Photo of The Buffet at ARIA - Las Vegas, NV, United States

rzbPqhLYbr0Ql2Eb6VXoBw.text: Good value and great food.  Smaller buffet than most, but I found it better since it wasn't overwhelming and the options were great!  Lots of seafood.  The brisket was my favorite.  If you want the super large too many options Buffett - This s NOT it.  Its smaller scale yet the options available were HIGH  quality.

mUVOi8pTrsNrBnGhdz9UAQ.text: I went here for lunch and to my surprise it was actually pretty good with lots of great selection. They had unlimited crab legs! they also had pho (Vietnamese beef soup) wow! how cool. Overall, was a good buffet, I especially loved the mini donuts that they had, it had a nice raspberry or strawberry filling inside..what a sweet surprise!

photos.caption: Photo of The Buffet at ARIA - Las Vegas, NV, United States. has a nice raspberry or strawberry filling inside, what a sweet surprise!

dilcVnZwMmr-sQzkjlyKCg.text: I had the worst meal ever.  They use rusty pots.  It seems like I went to have a meal in a friend's house,  pots don't match.  Looks unprofessional.  I was directed to the chef and dissmised all the comments I made. He said everybody comes and eats and I'm the only one complaining.I spoke to MGM resorts and they promise to get back to me.  It's two days later and I'm still waiting for a phone call.  FYI I'm a Cordon Bleu chef.  #cordonbleuchef

photos.caption: Photo of The Buffet at ARIA - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Different pots, same buffet
Photo of The Buffet at ARIA - Las Vegas, NV, United States. The rusty pots

FZrHu6h-IWW3T01IGukb0w.text: Food was good! Service was very slow and cold. This is the 2nd time I've come here. The 1st time my daughter 7 at the time she was 6 had a very large piece of glass in her juice and I felt like they only cared about if I was trying to get something for free. Foods good but I don't know if it worth the money or the wait.

photos.caption: Photo of The Buffet at ARIA - Las Vegas, NV, United States. No clue what they call this. But it was like a pancake with red velvet in the middle. Yummy!

gyWahCs6eWsy2Vf3UJFQaQ.text: Went for the brunch and it did not exactly dazzle me.  First, no king crab legs.  Second, no oysters.  The clams were good and the dim sum was excellent but other brunch items were standard.  Our server gave us attitude at first but eventually came around after we made it clear that we noticed his negative behavior. Overall it was a decent brunch, but given the plethora of brunch options in Vegas.  Next time i will pass.

TNE8VdKg2Wnpuw0H1uSwyg.text: Amazing! One of the best meals I have ever had. Love the crab legs, potato dishes, shrimp, tri tip, stuffed cabbage, bread pudding, to name a few. This was my second visit and it was as delicious as I remembered. The only thing that disappointed me were the cupcakes, but there were plenty of other dessert options.

photos.caption: Photo of The Buffet at ARIA - Las Vegas, NV, United States. A few desserts...didn&#39;t like the cupcakes or whoopie pie..loved the bread pudding, rice crispy treat, and macaroon!

JZMsNKv0ngYmoz1mvHvoBQ.text: For only $20 for breakfast, this buffet is actually pretty good.  Good food and good selection. Of course since it's breakfast, there won't be as much selection as the dinner menu so that is understandable. For the price, you can't beat it. Everything tasted pretty good from the savory foods to the dessert. Nothing really stood out, but I think you get your moneys worth.  The customer service was friendly and nice.  The environment was modern looking, a bit plain, but not bad.  I would want to come back and try the dinner menu. Hopefully it will be just as good if not better than their breakfast menu =]

BZdoPy3lGb-FHrtAaBnNEg.text: This is BY FAR the best buffet in the Strip! Decently priced, wide variety, and excellent food!!!!!!!!!!!

photos.caption: Photo of The Buffet at ARIA - Las Vegas, NV, United States. S&#39;mores
Photo of The Buffet at ARIA - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Carrot Cake
Photo of The Buffet at ARIA - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Tiramisu

WWCIM8SZb0zNfh9KwBInwQ.text: The food was good. But a guy in the fish station he looks like a Latino he was very very rude even a women was in the other side and saw how he talked to me she came and told he is very rude. I don't think I will go back.

pQV42txGvnU6hRZ1M6aLag.text: I was surprised to find out that the buffet at Aria was less than $40/pp but I know the reason now: very mediocre food and presentation!  They have a special line for Mlife members which is way shorter so make sure you get a free membership card and save some time!  As for the food:  They have an Indian, Chinese and Mexican sections  *No raw oysters. They only had some grilled and they were meh *Crab legs were good *Everything else is meh *Display was very boring *Fresh naan is good *Sushi was very bad, rice was hard, it hardly had any fish *They also have a Poke station but I didn't bother *Paella was very salty *Prime rib and steak were hard and lacked flavor *Pho was actually not bad, just noodles but the soup was nice and sweet  For Desserts, they had gelato, carrot cake, pumpkin pie, berry tart, caramel puff and lots of cookies and pop corn. So basically a lot of the cheaper options.  Overall, not impressed and would not return.

photos.caption: Photo of The Buffet at ARIA - Las Vegas, NV, United States. 2nd round: crab legs, grilled oysters, sushi, clams
Photo of The Buffet at ARIA - Las Vegas, NV, United States. A bit of pho and custard bun
Photo of The Buffet at ARIA - Las Vegas, NV, United States. First round: prime rib, ham, Mexican street corn, creamed corn, deviled egg, clam chowder

NewkIY5ci8pqODVrvhXk_g.text: The bf got off work late, but wanted to grab some dinner with the co-workers so we came over to the buffet. We really only had 45 mins till closing to gather our food, but that was plenty of time for me.  I would give more stars but they had no gluten free items, besides a cookie I saw in the dessert section. They did however had a bunch of vegetarian options, which I was surprised since most buffets cater to the 'meat and seafood' eaters. What I did find was really good and I went back up for seconds. I also found every desert that could be GF minus the chocolate cake and red velvet cookie. And for the dessert, I don't recommend that strawberry cheesecake they had, it had the consistency of a pineapple upside down cake as the 'strawberry' glaze on top. Unless you like the 'fake strawberry' topping I'm sure you'll love it.   Food was good, wish we had more time to eat. Note that the pricing is outrageous to eat.. but you're in ARIA so the name goes with the price tag, I suppose ??!

photos.caption: Photo of The Buffet at ARIA - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Dessert

FTo_ktIE5LACCaSyUY9JeA.text: Was just there last month and must say that I was not happy...at first. It was evening and I had a buy one get one from MyVegas. First I tried to make a reservation from the room but no luck. I let the person in the reservation line about this and she was going to bring me in but I would have to pay full price. Um, no. I was then told to get in the line next to where I was (they all held some sort of cards). I stayed in that line which was long. I got to the front when I was then told that I was in the wrong line so had to go to this insanely long line. If we were told to go there first, at least we would have been 1/2 way through by this time, but the line only got longer.  I did talk to the  manager who came when we were at the front of that extremely long line. She only said that I had been in the wrong line. Um, obviously I knew that by this time.  She eventually comped us drinks but an apology would have been okay to start with.  Once in, the food was D E L I C I O U S !!!! There was no issue with the food.  Service: A bit slow and we had to wave our person down a couple of times.   BTW, not that we paid for our drinks, but we did learn that they no longer have the Pay $13 for all you can drink for 2 people. It's now per person. Keep that in mind when deciding on this.  So, food good, service, meh!

TD2NVWZqW2mPoLif-EpaOQ.text: Came here Friday night around 6 pm and surprisingly it wasn't busy. The buffet cost me Around $50 each. This place was massive and had different types of food from Chinese, Japanese, italiana and of course American.   I was disappointed they didn't have a lot of sushi options, but they did have an option for a poki bowl and that satisfied my craving for sushi. I was craving for Asian food that night so I mostly just stuck with that option.  I thought the food was great. My GF didn't think the crab legs were all that .  She said they weren't a good size.  Desert was also good. They had ice cream and different assortment of cakes.   It was a happy visit and will certainly return again.

MvAAKvNesVYVOXWOUmOKTw.text: I ate there 4 days in a row and they had same dishes every single day. Only reason I ate there for 4 days straight coz I stayed at their hotel and got the buffet for free. Can't complain since it was free but I was disappointed compared to the last time I ate here. Upon checking in, I asked for a window seat since I spotted many empty seats by the window and the mean lady named, Hope had a cow. She was acting as if I asked for her paycheck or something. She said no and quickly started putting reserved sign on all the tables by the window...Rude!!!!  Food is ok but I got tired of eating same thing every single day. They don't change their menu. I hoped to see some lamb dishes, fish and fried chicken but none of these items were there.

PjuXoXAHLZCw4D_bBXVrZA.text: Want to start by giving props to our waitress.  She was hauling rear back and forth  try to take care of everyone in n her area. I think her name is Wendle.  Also the gentleman in the omelet station Elizandro I think. I might be off on his name since he was moving so fast.  The line was long but the wait was minimal.  Great job to all that work their butts off and have great customer service.  The buffet at the Aria to me is the best. I've tried a few others and I'd come here over the others.  Today is Saturday so it a brunch. I'm a breakfast buffet person so, my opinion is based on breakfast only. Some of you are may be more of a dinner buffet people. I've eaten here for the last 4 years. Its great.

photos.caption: Photo of The Buffet at ARIA - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Lady is awesome look at how she stacked all the dishes.  1 trip instead of 20.  The guy next to her was like ???? (Amazed)
Photo of The Buffet at ARIA - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Pastries were great. The breakfast was better

2kNvKxBLVCS6zsDANPurgw.text: Excellent!!! Great variety , good service and super affordable!!  Ethnicity in food is a plus!! Any palate will be satisfied . We will go back again

photos.caption: Photo of The Buffet at ARIA - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Delicious infinite variety salads
Photo of The Buffet at ARIA - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Other Angle of beautiful Architecture
Photo of The Buffet at ARIA - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Salad bar

RFxoN2zIjpJ-ePN3zk-r9w.text: Came for the crab legs... just make sure that you get the fresh steamed crab legs and not the ones that were near the end of the barrel.   I asked for my soup to be heated up, and she came back with it mediocre hot but said I to just come back and tell her next time I want more.  Kids ate free but was 44$ a person for 2 adults.   Oh, make sure you get the rewards gambling card for free parking

2v6wpUv1GgF-VzcMyfnlAg.text: Came here for a weekday dinner in June 2018 with my boyfriend around 4pm and we were immediately seated. I used a 2-for-1 offer from myVEGAS so we only paid $42 for the two of us, excluding tip.   Pros:   - Seafood! They had chilled crab legs, mussels, clams, and peeled shrimp, but the best part was that they also served steamed crab legs! Yup, that's right, you don't have to ask them to steam them for you. It's already been done :) My personal favorites were also their steamed mussels and steamed clams! Both dishes were perfectly cooked and their accompanying sauces were HEAVENLY. (The clams were in a white, butter/garlic sauce, and as for the mussels, well, I quite honestly am not sure, but it was pretty darn good.) They also had a poke bar, which I did not try, but it looked like their fish was pretty fresh.   - Meat! Well, at least according to my boyfriend, the self-proclaimed king of meat. He made multiple trips to the carving station for their brisket, which he would not stop raving for hours after our meal. Their beef ribs were also cooked perfectly, with the meat falling off the bone. He did note that a couple of their meat dishes were overseasoned.   Cons:  - Selection was pretty limited. It's not a huge buffet. I mainly stuck to eating the same few dishes, since the rest of the buffet didn't appeal too much to me. Besides seafood and meat, there was Asian cuisine (pho, tonkatsu ramen, dim sum, etc.), a salad bar, desserts, classic American food, Mediterranean food (basically just some dips), and Indian food.  - I likely wouldn't pay full price to eat at this buffet. Unless they had more quality dishes and fewer average ones, I'd return only if I had a discount offer again.

21SH93FCpnv1rQ869J4cEg.text: Today I had the opportunity to try two buffets for lunch and dinner. I went to the buffet at Aria for dinner. I arrived about 8:30 the wait was about 10 minutes. I paid double for this buffet compared to the one for lunch. 2 adults = about $85. The food was very delicious. The restaurant was clean and staff were friendly. There was a great variety of food from different cultures. The food was good not overly salted. I think that the price was fair because the food was good. I will come back.  I went on a Thursday night.

2OakO6j4Eu9VgfwWSRg-5w.text: We went for Sunday brunch and paid the additional 19.99 for bottomless mimosas, rum punch, and bloody mary. Most the food I sampled was very flavorful and tasty. There were the traditional brunch favorites, omelettes, breakfast meats, carving stations with roast beef, turkey, pork loin, ham and brisket. In addition there were grilled vegetables pastas potatoes as well as a variety of difference cuisines such as Chinese Italian and East Indian foods. There was also a good selection of both hot and cold seafood, an extensive soup and salad bar, and a good variety of fruit and desserts. The only food I did not find satisfying was the creme brulee which had no flavor!

photos.caption: Photo of The Buffet at ARIA - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Great buffet with excellent selection of foods

N0IC2gcfnNt81srk2Hui-A.text: I love this buffet. The only other buffet I've been to in Las Vegas is the Bellagio Buffet, and while this one is smaller and has less selection, I think the quality is better. I also like the more modern looking interior. Everything at the meat carving station was well seasoned and the meat was very moist, not dry at all. The scalloped potatoes and short rib were also so good.   Of course the star is all the seafood and it didn't disappoint. The poke bar, king crab, snow crab, and stone crab were all excellent although the shrimp cocktail and oysters Rockefeller weren't my favorite. One small complaint is that at the Bellagio, the crab legs are sliced open so it's exceedingly easy to just indulge in crab, but here you need to crack it open yourself.  The desserts were also very good. Plenty of options and all of them that I tried (7!!) were done well.   Service is also friendly and, for the most part, prompt. Nothing that I had tasted bad - overall, very pleased!

photos.caption: Photo of The Buffet at ARIA - Las Vegas, NV, United States. All the crab was good, but not sliced open like at other buffets. Shrimp and oysters were okay.

krzSNWSnbebAmH4URBRB0g.text: Came here on Wednesday during CES for breakfast, as I had gotten two free buffets with my room. Here is my quick review:  Pros: - Nice staff - Lots of food options and variety  Cons: - Long lines, even though there was plenty of seating. See photos and video.  - Food I got was cold or lukewarm: hash browns, eggs benedict, chicken fried steak - Coffee was weak  I still have another free buffet on my room reservation, but probably not going to use it because this was such a disappointment. Just not worth the time.

photos.caption: Photo of The Buffet at ARIA - Las Vegas, NV, United States. There is a theme...
Photo of The Buffet at ARIA - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Long lines but plenty of seating available!
Photo of The Buffet at ARIA - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Long lines but plenty of seating available!

nXbl_bgw4exrg6RcapH5zg.text: I am pissed that I had to wait in a long line despite the fact that there were so many open tables. I took a picture of the empty tables to prove a point. The person managing this buffet should be FIRED!!!  That's not fair that the buffet doesn't make an effort to seat customers in a timely manner. There was so much variation in the food as well. Some of the food was not kept at a safe temperature as my food when I brought it back to my table was cold. The majority of the food items that I got were too salty. I liked the variety of ethnic food, but the wait for the buffet was unacceptable especially if there were such an abundance of open tables. Who wants to wait in line during their vacation? I certainly don't.

photos.caption: Photo of The Buffet at ARIA - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Lots of tables unseated but of course there is a long line due to inefficiency

g04bK-vLxWZFjuJu7hDoUg.text: Always been a fan of buffets, but instead of the major ones such as Wicked Spoon or Bacchanal, went for one off the beaten path. That's where I ended up at Aria.  It was brunch for father's day so it was slightly more expensive then normal ($38.99 / person) but drinks were included (non-acloholic of course). No line when we got there around 3 PM, so don't expect the same wait as the bigger vegas buffets (unless the timing as just off). The waitress was very nice, but seemed understaffed since it took 10 min for her to get to us and get our first drink orders in. She quickly learned to bring us double of drinks so she doesn't have to run back and forth everytime.  The food selection was fairly extensive (even though it doesn't seem it from a first glance). Easily 100+ menu items with every kind of sauce, guac, topping, you can think of. The meats were all very delicious (special shoutout to the BBQ brisket, prime rib was good, and rotissere chicken was surprising). Standard comfort foods were good (mashed potates and mac and cheese), grilled veggies were a nice surprise. Indian and Mexican food was ok, probably your average indian buffet level / average mexican joint. Seafood was good as well (mussels, clams), though they ran out of gumbo for a demerit. Asian food wasn't that appetizing.  Desserts were the highlight, each of them were delicious and I had to stop myself from going back for more. Definitely wouldn't mind coming back if I was in the area, but wouldn't go out of the way.

rGdyPwolpf4gG4_EckQOBA.text: Not a bad breakfast buffet for $25, but come early at around 8.00a.m. Lots of choices here.   Lines are unbelievably long after 9.00a.m. and becomes unworthwhile to eat here. New year weekend is a really busy time in Vegas. Lots of waiting and no doing.

photos.caption: Photo of The Buffet at ARIA - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Line for buffet after 9.00 a.m.
Photo of The Buffet at ARIA - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Coconut macaroons
Photo of The Buffet at ARIA - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Apple turnovers

3cukBF7EmDsC3glmOY6rOg.text: One of the best buffet on the strip. Came here a few times and they never let me down. Love the atmosphere in the restaurant. Restaurant is Very clean. Servers attend to you often even during busy times.  You can find quality food here, never does look sloppy like some buffets here in Vegas. Restaurant is pretty big but still have some wait times. Never waited longer than 30 minutes.

h05wi7OgloteqmuPY0eYUA.text: Unfortunately we were quite disappointed with our experience with the Aria buffet, not because of the wait (we are M life members so our wait was less than a few minutes as we got to skip the lines, which admittedly were quite long), not because of the food (we thought there were plenty of good options), but because of the service. Not sure why, maybe because you actually give gratuity before you're seated so it's a done deal, but the service was absolutely horrendous. Like so bad that all the delicious crab legs in the world couldn't convince me to come here again (ok maybe they could, but I would need to be specifically craving crab legs)!  So why did we think the service was terrible? Well, our drink orders were not taken for a good 15 minutes, our waiter actually never cleaned our plates until I personally had to find another waiter and ask for them to clear plates, and when I ordered soft drinks a second time around after we had been sitting for less than 1.5 hours, the waiter said we have been there for more than 2 hours so he cannot give us any drinks. I had to convince him that we had been there for less than 2 hours (which is easy to do since you have the check with a timestamp on it, but I shouldn't need to do that), deal with his attitude, for just a glass of water. It was just annoying when we are trying to enjoy a long lunch. If I had been there for more than 2 hours then yes I could've understood where he is coming from, but i wasn't aware that the buffet came with a side of attitude.  As to the food, there are plenty of options here. The underrated section is the Italian one where they have bone marrow and a delicious lamb dish, that I personally thought was the best food item they had in the entire buffet. As other reviewers noted, the lines for the crab legs can get quite long, so beware. The dessert area looks like it had plenty of food, but nothing was that impressive.  Overall, crab legs. Bad service. But tons of food and variety, so if there's not a long line (or you're an M life member and can skip the lines) and you want to eat a variety of food and you think the cost is worth it, give it a try. Just beware that your plates may never be cleaned, you may never get a server to come to your table, and you may be told you can't get a drink because you've exceeded their 2 hour limit even though you obviously have not (again, good thing you can prove this to the server very easily with the check, but why do you even have to deal with this when the server has never once stopped by your table after the initial drink orders and you want another soft drink).

photos.caption: Photo of The Buffet at ARIA - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Bone marrow and half eaten lamb

Py6vCW_bBftCD4YibAjVMQ.text: When in Vegas, you have to try one of the many brunch buffets. Our original plan was to check out the Bacchanal Buffet Buffet in Caesar's but one of my coworkers recommended this place because while it doesn't have as many choices (there are still tons to choose from), its more affordable compared to Bacchanal Buffet.   I came here with the parents on a Saturday morning around 9am. Surprisingly, there was already a line formed. If you want to avoid any lines, you probably have to come earlier.  Inside, the place is extremely clean and well put together. We were kindly shown to a table by the windows so we got an excellent view of the outside pool area with the palm trees.  Now, onto the food! After you get a table and walk over to the buffet area, you will be shocked by the choices of dishes available. They include Asian, Mexican, steak, seafood, breakfast food, Spanish food and even a gelato station. If you're into fresh seafood, they have these amazing clams and mussels as well as crab legs and really fresh cocktail shrimp.  The service here is excellent as well. We came around the holiday time so we got the $39.99 holiday brunch per person. For the experience of a Vegas brunch buffet, this was definitely worth every penny!

Photo of The Buffet at ARIA - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Fancy yogurt

xz_18f328PdVwTdiGozeXQ.text: Went to the famous Bacchanal Buffet at Caesar's and the experience was so bad we were worried about trying the buffet. We were staying in the Vdara and decided to walk over to the Aria's The Buffet one night. We were both extremely hesitant to try another buffet and I was almost nauseated waiting in line for crab expecting the worst after our other buffet experience (it was dry and had no flavor). We were very pleased.  The food was fresh and amazing even down to the minutes before closing. The arrangement of the food was also much easier to access and the variety was great (Indian, Chinese, Italian, Japanese, etc). The meat section and even poke bowl sections were great. The desserts were good but I will admit the only thing at the Bacchanal that was great were the desserts. There was even a pasta station but we were too stuffed to try it.  We enjoyed the food so much we actually returned for brunch which was amazing as well. The French roasts and omelette station was great.

gOnWKflFcJCpHt8HjWrk1A.text: we waited very long time even we arrived quite early. and the food didnt justify the wait, this place is definitely overrated. the food was arranged by different type, which is good, but there was very few choice for each cuisine. the mussels and crab legs tasted god damn salty. dessert part was very nice.

Dw1MZDUOy_s_UOKqPDW-gg.text: Beautiful dining area, representative of the rest of Aria - lots of blue/turtoisiness, glass, and natural light. That alone put me in a good mood. The food was aaaite - better than the Bellagio lunch buffet that we had just eaten the day before.  We went for brunch/lunch on a Saturday.   Things I liked:   - The fact that they had crab legs at lunch (Bellagio didn't) - The nice servers - The carving station (better than Bellagio) - the chicken rope sausage was pretty good - The creme brulee - The cookies (though Wicked Spoon's desserts are still better)  Not so good:  - Dessert selection in general

photos.caption: Photo of The Buffet at ARIA - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of The Buffet at ARIA - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Lovely

d58XYqmKZfdBr6wA1SjIuw.text: I thought the buffet was very average. There was nothing special about it.  I received complimentary buffet passes since we were staying at the Aria. The dining area is clean and well kept. The food is divided into sections: Asian, Mediterranean, Italian, seafood, etc. They have the typical peel it yourself shrimp, steamed king crab legs, and mussels. I didn't find any of the food to be good. It was all very average. I thought it was cool how they bake their naan fresh. Having dined at the Wynn and Bellagio buffets in the past, I can say this buffet is behind in many ways.

aNeLj02P1ezfpX4wXjlKHA.text: Breakfast review. the food is good and there is a large assortment. I was MAD today when they charged me $40 per person !!!  no typo there... yesterday was $20 but today $40 because it was Valentines Day.  Well what a nice way to say Happy Valentines to your customers than doubling your price and giving them the exact same thing as when it was $20.   I should have walked away but we were starving.

rlqxtjOlCJk19YivxkXhCA.text: Very good!  Went for breakfast.  First thing i see is a red velvet pancake the size of a tire covered in Nutella.  Need i say more?  also had several deserts (cinnamon roll, chocolate coffee cake, peanut butter ice cream) which were all great.  They had pizza and croissant sandwiches - which were good.  Scrambled eggs with HUGE curds.  Best hash browns EVER.  Lox, bagels, and 3 different kinds of sausage.  Only thing i did not care for was the biscuits and gravy.  Price was very reasonable for what you get.  Good coffee.

K1g9BEklebrC9wwjrlgKHw.text: We came here for Saturday Brunch ($29.99). I came in with pretty low expectations from Yelp, but it is one of the few buffets I haven't yet tried on the Strip. Since our weekend was full of trying new things with familiar faces, we all decided to try it out. The wait went by fairly quickly; we came around 12:30pm with a group of 4 and were seated within 15 minutes of when we arrived in line. The place itself is pretty open; it seems updated, but has a fairly simple design.   Service was pretty great. Our drinks were never empty and our plates were cleared quickly. As for the food, I thought the variety was pretty exceptional. They had tons of seafood (mostly cold, which I wasn't a super fan of)-- crawfish, 2 different types of mussels, crab legs, sushi, smoked salmon, smoked cod, and a bunch of cooked fish. The crawfish was pretty gross but the other cold seafood dishes were decent. I preferred the cooked fish dishes. There was a bread section, a carving section, Mediterranean, Asian (dim sum), charcuterie, Italian, Indian, breakfast foods, salad bar, seafood station, and dessert station (I may be missing a couple here). My favorite part of this buffet was the made-to-order eggs benedict station! You can choose a traditional benedict, a smoked salmon benedict, or a snow crab benedict-- it definitely makes a difference when made fresh! The creme de la creme was the dessert section! I was so full by this time that I was only able to get a scoop of the mint chip gelato from the rotating ice cream display, but the other desserts looked on point.   I thought the price was well worth it here. This is one of the few buffets in Vegas I wouldn't mind revisiting!

-eZsAwF8tYXWXc-b5jQS3A.text: This place definitely needs more stars.  For $23 you get the buffet plus an additional $6 you can get unlimited mimosas/bloody mary's.   The food is amazing and they have crab legs- pretty sure me and my friend probably ate a mini aquarium lol.. Service is great and the food is fresh and delicious. Perfect place to go for a hangover cure or family outing.

H-KuT7UkihWepUas_IocPQ.text: I've eaten at the Aria Buffet on two consecutive Vegas trips, most recently at the end of September. Both times, the buffet was a home run with myself and everyone in my party.   The setting is beautiful, with a view of the pool complex and a lot of natural light. I love the trend towards using natural light that is in the newer Vegas properties.   Both of my experiences have been with the lunch selections. I love that for an extra ten dollars, you can add on bottomless Mimosas or Blood Marys. This is a bargain and the servers keep your glasses full. Services is great here.  The food is high quality and I although I felt like it had a smaller selection that other similar buffets (Wynn/Bellagio), I still found plenty to enjoy. Aria, like other high end buffets, has crab leg already cracked. As far as I am concerned, this is the only way to eat crab legs. I don't like fighting with my food! My boyfriend's mom found plenty of vegetarian options that she enjoyed.    My only complaint is the that the shrimp cocktail comes in little cups of two. At most buffets, this is my favorite item and I can eat a bunch. Granted, you can technically take as many cups as you want, but it seems that the demand is higher than they can keep up with. The presentation is nice in the cups, but they should just put it on a platter and let people help themselves.  This is a great buffet in a beautiful hotel and I'm looking forward to my next visit!

8g53A2s5Tn2NxB_WSMbAHQ.text: Buffett was moderate at best - absolutely not worth the $50 per head we payed and 60 minute line we stood in.   Crab legs were the best part, although some of the meat was caked with ice. Everything else I tried was average to below average.   No self serve beverages and service was terrible. Didn't bring drinks til we were on plate #2 and no refills.   Would not return.

704ZR0hxOGlq6cHkQY-19w.text: I actually enjoyed the buffet here.  I was a little apprehensive because of all of the mediocre reviews in here but I thought it was great!  I've eaten at many buffets in Vegas over the years including Rio's Seafood Buffet, Paris, PH Spice Market Buffet, Bellagio Buffet, Mirage, Wynn, ti, Main Street Station, etc...lol, I guess I'm no novice when it comes to buffets out here.  Anyway, it's a Saturday night and we got there at about 6pm.  i expected to have about a 30 min or so wait but there was no wait.  The place was about 3/4 full.  They had a good assortment of dishes including Alaskan king crab, snow crab, salmon sushi, smoked salmon, rolls, Indian food (garlic naan, vegetable curry, etc.), chinese food, soup, prime rib, lamb, pizza, etc.  The dessert section was excellent.  I loved the flan, gelato, cookies, etc.  I think the quality was good because there was a good number of people eating so they were turning over the food pretty quickly.  At the same time, it wasn't so packed that you had to wait a long time or other people would take all of the good stuff as soon as it comes out.  In short, it was great.  Each person gets 1/2 of a lobster and the size and quality was pretty good for that as well.  I liked this experience more than the Wynn or Bellagio which are the 2 other notable comps.

2vnvHS5kOlApk9w8wMfamw.text: You know the buffet is doing an awful job when it's customers leave hungry.  I went to the omelette station and ordered a vegetable omelette with fresh eggs. I noticed Leopold put egg beaters in there, so I told him that I wanted fresh eggs. He gave me the stink eye and said "it's the same". I said I didn't want egg beaters, so he dumped it out and put some vegetables in the pan again, but this time he didn't let it cook, resulting in a very runny omelette. Also the eggs were undercooked, salmonella anyone?  I think we had a server, but it could have been the abominable snowman cause I never saw them. We didn't have spoons to stir our coffee with, so made do with the handles of our knives.  I was really not impressed with the selection of food, the ones that I did try were disgusting. I thought, I'll just have a bagel. It was a brick!  My wife and I had only taken a few bites and decided to leave and go somewhere else to eat.  The only reason I'm giving this place two stars is because I complained to the manager on the way out and she was genuinely concerned about the experience and refunded our money.

LAU6FKotjOH6_ZP9KmHycw.text: So I'll admit that I had high hopes for "The Buffet" but it failed flat in my opinion. The food was not unlike the food you would expect to get at almost any buffet in America and the service was slow.  Very disappointed and not worth the money.

FFzbHPihyxMM0-Y6eDt-qw.text: For the Aria, you would expect an exceptional buffet. But instead you get a below average buffet. The food was something you might expect to eat on Fremont street.   They have a variety of foods, Asian, Italian, Mediterranean, seafood. All of it was blah. Nothing to come back for.  Definitely not. I do not recommend this buffet.

up7HhXW2mwKT82znDF567g.text: The meat selection was very good. Everything else was average. The service was horrible. we have ordered bloodymary and it took them 45 minutes to bring it to the table and we were full by then. We only had 1 coffee and the refill took more than one hour. Overall the service change the rating from 4 stars to 2 stars.

28noqHkcwm2vW6AiMPW91Q.text: I'm honestly surprised this buffet only has 3 stars because everything was so good! I'm a picky eater and thought this place was great. I've been to other buffets on the strip but they're not as good as this one.

rlB5_lkoAsxwXFccbP46-w.text: ***For the lunch buffet only***  With good reason, I'm not usually much of a fan of Vegas buffets.  However, it was lunchtime, the gf and I were hungry, we had a $100 resort credit to use, and the ARIA is an upscale casino-resort.  So we figured the Buffet at ARIA would be a safe bet.  Unlike most other casinos, the Buffet at ARIA is not located just off or even near the casino floor.  Instead, it's on the second floor/Promenade level with several of the casino's fine dining restaurants.  The dining room is smaller than other buffets, yet open, well-lit by natural light coming in from floor to ceiling windows, airy, but with a weird, almost IKEA design aesthetic.  I could be very wrong about that last comment, but it was what came to mind when I entered the restaurant.    The Buffet at ARIA offered culinary representation from many of the more popular international cuisines. The buffet's major draw seemed to be the Snow Crab legs as evidenced by the crowd of diners that were picking over the crab leg offerings like vultures over a rotting carcass.  Sadly, the crab legs were spindly, with little meat, and mealy for what little meat was present.  The selection of sushi rolls also failed to inspire much faith in the kitchen as the rice lacked moisture and the fillings were largely flavorless, relying on wasabi and soy sauce to provide the entire flavor profile.  Despite these and several other misses, all was not lost on the buffet.  The Indian chicken curry was actually one of the best tasting chicken curries that I've ever had.  It seemed to possess with all of the hoped for Indian spice and didn't taste "dumbed down" for Western palates.  The Chili Verde was a successful offering as the chunks of pork were nicely tender and bathing in a flavorful roasted green chili and tomatillo stew.  The lunch buffet with tax for two was $53.  Unfortunately, the food wasn't quite up to the price tag.  Fortunately, even though the food was largely lackluster, service was spot on.  Our water glasses were filled with frequency and dirty plates never lingered on our table for more than a minute or two.    In the end, I only give the Buffet at ARIA 2 stars for food and value received, but added 1 star for the solid service.  Next time, I'll just stick to the Bellagio buffet or skip buffets altogether.

fZuoN0HW8rcqN4R5n8wmDw.text: One of the better tasting buffets that I have tried in my lifetime. They had a pretty good selection of food and desserts. If you see a dessert you like before you even started eating, just grab it!! I saw delicious looking creme brulee and by the time I went back after I finished my food, there were no more :(  I don't usually eat crab legs, but since I payed so much for the buffet I thought I might as well give it a shot. I liked how they had the legs cut open already so it was easy to pick the meat out with a fork. The meat was sweet and tender :) it was delicious with some lemon juice and butter! I'm glad I gave it a chance.  Had to pay around $36 for the Holiday Dinner price since I came here on Thanksgiving. Pricey. But way more worth it the Cafe Vettro located in Aria also.   I think the server for my table sucked. She brought us our drinks and everyone else at my table had a straw for their drink except for me. I asked her kindly for a straw and she handed me a straw that was in a Coke.... she handed it to me while it was still dripping with Coke and I just looked really disgusted as I grabbed it. She probably realized she shouldn't have done that after she saw my face and she quickly grabbed it away from me again. I don't know what she was thinking.

hmwHmNj_U2e_w2dExBgA9Q.text: Stay away from bottomless drinks. Service is really poor and hard to get people to wait on you.

QYu_We_SKyN19PrUfDI0rw.text: DO NOT GO. Go to the Starbucks and get a sandwich and I'm sure you will enjoy your meal more. This place is an epic waste. $35/person for brunch and horrible. If u need to go to a buffet go to wicked spoon at Cosmo but avoid this place like the plague. Everything was salty. The guy making eggs didn't know how to a make a sunny side up egg. Dim sum was horrible. This place was so bad even the cut fruit tasted horrible.

OGMJtlZabZCw94PFY2XrQw.text: Although slightly pricey and offering limited options, the crab legs and unlimited drinks made it worth it. Also, the bread pudding was to die for.

3b9OduZ-_QMEreMUGFuWwg.text: There was a long line for us to wait in to get in here so I had the assumption that it was going to be awesome.  For four of us it was $172 for our brunch adventure.   There were many items to choose from and I really liked the fact that there were labeled sections to the buffet with foods from around the world.  As most buffets, the food wasn't 100% hot and simply plated/displayed.  I think the shear number of options, it's worth checking out.    The service was nice and she kept our drinks full and our food plates removed.  I can't even begin to list all of the food I had for that meal because I tried as much as I could.  Overall, everything was decent.

iKZm2UktVFyfXw27p0aUhA.text: Very very disappointed especially considering how amazing the Aria is as a whole. We came down for breakfast and around 930 and even though there was practically no line we stood around waiting to be seated for nearly ten minutes.  From there came the strange and sadly disappointing selection of food. The eggs were top notch but past that is was all downhill. At 930 in the morning I'm not sure why there is more ethnic selections than breakfast food.   The two stars come purely off service alone once we were actually seated. Perhaps it's better at dinner but as a whole, we were highly disappointed and will not be back.

MX7seBzeIvaYKY3SWEarLw.text: I would give this buffet 20 stars if I could. One of the best buffets I have been to for only $30 for lunch. My friends and I were hesitant at first because we never heard of it, but was so glad to have walked in.   They have tons of options to chose from- all top quality/gourmet. My favorite was their seafood section, pork, and prime rib. Some top notch chefs work here. Our waiter was also super polite and provided excellent customer service. If you in Vegas and want to try a new buffet, I highly recommend this!

zBl-s2HTJ_U5vqZanK-VqQ.text: We've been told about The Buffet at Aria and we decided to try it. We loved! Big variety of salty and sweet options and very good quality. Polite staff and unlimited mimosa for a flat rate was something else. Reasonable price. Highly recommend.

photos.caption: Photo of The Buffet at ARIA - Las Vegas, NV, United States

SQcj29g8yjmt-BrlARRGKA.text: This buffet was not worth 50 dollars, the food was cold and not much to choose from expect more from a buffet that cost 50 dollars

V5YgAyqQV0Uaj2R-HJqjCA.text: The food at the buffet is great.  The problem is the wait time to be seated. It doesn't even matter what card level you are or if you even have a card.  The wait time is still the same....long.  Once seated you place your drink order and you better order two of them up front because it'll take you another 2hrs to get a refill.  The servers have to bus their own tables as they bring you your drink.

yHFP-_yMsjaB9QHyre6kBA.text: I ate dinner with the unlimited alcohol option.  The buffet room itself look quite nice, but for me there was missing some details that would make you feel more comfortable.   The choice of food is very big and you can choose whatever you want from American cuisine to Chinese one. The seafood was good, but hard to eat without getting dirty. All shrimps was in shells and with legs, the crab legs was so soft you could not open it with carb crackers, The taste was good though. The dessert choice was great, but it wasn't too tasty for me. I found there maybe 2 things that I really liked.   The service and staff was so so. Even though the buffet was half empty I was waiting nearly 15 min to get a table and then to be served.

xw8Bx67hZq1A5g68pJZn_g.text: The only thing keeping me from giving 5 stars is the price. Despite that, we enjoyed just about everything. They not only had crab legs but rock crab claws, all pre scored for ease of cracking. The setting was beautiful too.  They had a drink special $20 for two people to get unlimited drinks from an OK selection. Mimosas, rum punch, draft beer (they have Stella) and house wine and a few we didn't try. Good value, we got our moneys worth.

MKuEftlZxLqVCVVaPQ28Og.text: Ate at the Aria last night at $48.99 "Holiday Pricing" for Chinese New Year. None of other hotels were still charging holiday pricing so I'm not entirely sure why they charged a premium price and nothing really extra was offered in terms of food variety.  The selection of food was underwhelming. carving station had rotisserie chicken, prime rib and sausages, all overcooked and dry, italian section only offered pizza, Indian section offered vegetarian and meat options but lamb and chicken curries had no meat in them. I was expecting better seafood but all they had was cocktail shrimp, mussels and crab. The snow crab legs were tiny and overly salty.  Dessert options were also very limited (I've seen more variety at much cheaper buffets). While they did have some premium variety over normal buffets - duck confit salad, oysters rockefeller, peking duck, lamb, I wouldn't pay extra for the buffet at the Aria just for these options.  Lastly, the buffet was very understaffed, I was there for over an hour and saw my waiter twice. I had to wait 1/2 hour for soda and couldn't stand the wait for coffee. The buffet at the Aria clearly doesn't live up to the Hotel's rep. I advise shopping around, a lot of the other hotels have buffets with much more variety and better quality for a lower price.

HfhGMNIvdVcUgRLgBrJDNQ.text: You'll laugh- this buffet just blended into the other buffet places for breakfast. The food was fresh and hot and tasty .... But so was the other breakfast buffets we went to.  Maybe I was drunk the whole time and that's why they all blended together .

M3SwtsZZmrswMld5ihwL4g.text: Came here for breakfast one morning around 9 and the place wasn't too busy. I liked the views to the pool we had and open concept. The selection of food was great too. They had ample sea food early morning which was surprising. I stuck to eggs, potatoes, fruit and juices for breakfast. My daughter really enjoyed the waffles, mashed potatoes, and nacho bar. Service was nice and timely. I'd definitely go back.

0AWQp8-ZZLXObR9OrPKpWw.text: We had the gourmet buffet on Sunday and was expecting delicious juicy king crab legs. I was so disappointed the king crab legs were meager and the meat was very dry. How can you go wrong with crab legs? The Dungeness crab was ok but I didn't come for dungeness. The poke bar was decent as were the rack of lamb. The pasta bar was terrible they soak the pasta and the noodles are mushy. We had the two for one unlimited drinks but didn't drink much. The Bloody Mary was terrible as was the mimosa. We went for the value but the dinner costs $130 for two adults with drinks. I would definitely not return. I can see why value doesn't mean good.

XSCCmJPlCA4AbR8xpk_rzw.text: I'm not quite sure why the reviews for this restaurant aren't that great. The experience that we had was pretty good! The service was a little slow, however our waitress was really friendly. When we got there, there was no line so we didn't have to wait. We also had an express ticket but didn't need to use it.   As for the food, we thought they did a very well job with having foods from all over the world, & very fresh sea food.  All in all, our experience was great and will be glad to visit again.

8wpKwWaOVMGuHHhEnn_dsA.text: This was probably the worst buffet dinner I ever had: --  the boiled crab was very SALTY to the point of not edible --  the sushi choice was pathetic and the few choices they do offer was soggy  --  for some reason, they placed some seafood (e.g. poke) behind a barrier and you have to wait for someone to serve you --  Dim sum was burnt at the bottom because they were on the warmer too long and the vegetable was overcooked.  For $40+ per person, I will NOT recommend this buffet to anyone.

nIhONM2EJ5ETgy5WQ5snRA.text: Been sitting here for 30 minutes with no service. We've been asking staff, and their reply is "someone else will help you..." Plates stacking up, severely dehydrated. So disappointing as this used to be one of our favorite buffets in Vegas.   Would not come back.

EhYuJzTrlzUdTT0jONdguA.text: For about $50 after tip/tax, this is a terrible buffet in terms of food quality and selection. At first glance, it seemed like a normal buffet but when you start examining the food, you notice most things aren't fresh. The food was extremely salty which made me lost my appetite after the first plate. I drank half a gallon of water during that meal. Afterwards, half the group had stomachaches. Will never come back here again.

bXv8BUxoRY2x5C0WVj5CIw.text: Great buffet. Fare tasted pretty good. Diff assortment of ethnic foods. It's not crowded meaning no lines on a Sunday. We'll def come back!

lEkIYPSNF2e2Mra4CCRX4w.text: We stayed at the ARIA for a national meeting and my coworkers and I decided to have the brunch buffet at this place and we all walked out so happy with our decision. They had so much choices from ordering a poke bowl, making your own omelet, meditterenean, pizza, seafood with legit crab legs, salad bar, asian, breakfast food, everything! The dessert station was so good too wherein they had alot of mini pastries that are so good. They have gelatos that are really good as well and so many flavors! The staff were just so inviting and accommodating. The utensils were complete and your plate and drinks get refilled so often. There are also a variety of drinks found in the buffet area such as horchata, strawberry lime drink, etc. You have to get it though and pour in a shot glass size glass. They are so good!! There is a long line however so plan to arrive early. This is where I would retract a star and because the corn I had was dry probably because of the light that was over it. The $30 is SO WORTH IT and very affordable for this kind of buffet. Come with an empty stomach and you will be so glad you went here. It is conveniently located inside the hotel.

059sQ-p6csisn4QzzUYshw.text: This is our 3rd time to the  Arya buffet both previous times were excellent this time there was a good choice of food but most people come for the seafood I didn't see any steamed clams and as usual the crab legs are the big attraction this time they   Were very small and Had little meat in them instead of sweet snow crab that you would expect they were very salty so badd I went to the person in charge of the seafood and he said that it was the vendors Fault For that reason I can only give them 3 stars

CrPfHDBrwQnEdc6MrgxBUQ.text: Definitely has gone downhill from the last time we were here.  Good variety however, the quality of food and service leaves a lot to be desired.

kf2Gz_cZXkDrmYMPK04PCw.text: Well I can say it was the worst breakfast buffet I have ever had.The eggs were cold.the oj was like frozen watered down.the pastries were not as good as grocery store brand. the coffee was not hot,I was very disappointed since all the other foods in the hotel are high quality.The place looked like a school cafeteria ,a lot of quantity but no quality.they really need to improve this buffet.I will never eat there again.It's 34.00 for 2.

sON34kWUqVpuco2jJMSyCg.text: I was between giving this 3 or 4 starts, and settled on 4, just because I LOVE DESSERTS. That being said, here's the low-down.  Food: +Excellent variety of foods. You got your pizzas (I wanted to try the Margherita pizza, but no room!), your Indian foods (tandoori chicken and curry and basmati rice and such), your Chinese foods(which I think were done quite well! I guiltily enjoyed my chow fun and friend rice, even knowing how cheaply filling they were), little noodle cups(the green tea soba noodles with peanut chicken was my fave), sushi(not an awesome selection, but it's there), sliced and carved meats, king and snow crab legs already sliced in their shell(though they were just average), a selection of cold meats and cheeses, etc... +DESSERTS. I have an insatiable sweet tooth, so this really was the cherry on the cake for me. The chocolate-covered puff cereal/marshmallow clusters were simple and delicious, the creme brulee wasn't fancy but I still loved me some runny custard, and the Grand Marnier creme puff was beautifully decorated and awesomely edible, every part. What else...they had bananas foster, fancy schmancy whoopie pies, blondies, cobblers, cheesecakes...soooo many options! +Free red wine? I think I heard that right. It was offered to me, but I declined, so I can't say much about that.  Service: -Not great. Sat there for a little while after we were seated, and no one came so we just went to get our food. We were probably halfway through our first plates when we finally got our waters.  Other: +/- They automatically bring lobster to your table, even if you don't ask for it. Good if you like lobster(it's nothing exceptional, though. I found it to be dry, but not terrible), bad if you're already full by that time or not a lobster fan and then you feel sorry letting lobster go to waste. - Plan to get there a little early if you think you'll be hungry. This is not a walk-up-and-get-your-food buffet. There is a line, and you wait to be seated. They will also seat people who are behind you in line if they have tables for parties of that size. - $40 a person. In this case, buffet != cheap eats. I think the variety of food offered made it worth the price, but just be aware of this going in.  Overall: Expensive but probably justifiably so. Service not great. Variety was awesome, but quality of food varied. Not all great, but there were some gems in there, and if you're a foodie, it's pretty fun to try everything and find some delicious stuff.

K0KDaa5G2b613AonY49UDw.text: I booked a vacation through Southwest. that included a free buffet at Aria. I loved the rooms at Aria, but the buffet was terrible. If I eat at a buffet in Vegas, I usually go to to the buffet at Wynn, which is excellent. The prime rib at the Aria was more like a Sunday night roast, and the rest of the entrees were marginal at best. I thought the food and service was so bad that I would not  eat there again even if they offered it for free. Maybe that's the reason they included the free buffet as part of the vacation package! Really disappointed in the quality and service for such a nice hotel.

IsK8Mit2VtmmeRuHLk--6A.text: um no thanks. expensive and not worth it. don't waste your money on this buffet-- the food selection was boring and mostly flavorless in my opinion, I would rather pay the same price for one exciting meal at a restaurant. upside though...bottomless mimosas/champagne for an additional charge.

OSaP0FW97kNZvfzNHRdn7w.text: If Aria, a 5-star hotel, is going to offer a buffet, you'd expect it to be spectacular or at least up to par. Bellagio has it, so why not Aria, right? I  came here with my family yesterday--truly DISAPPOINTED! My mom took a bite of the cold cut meat and spat it out because it had a foul taste and smell to it. I saw the meat, but didn't get it because they looked like they had been sitting there for a good while. I was going to try granola with yogurt, but it had a film on the yogurt as if it had been sitting there for a VERY LONG TIME. My first round barely filled the plate because nothing looked really fresh. I am not a picky eater or a harsh food critic, but I am not going to eat something that looks like it had been sitting there from last night. The tomato salad looked like it had been sitting there for a good while, too. Management is obviously the problem and ARIA NEEDS TO TAKE NOTE OF THIS! WHAT IS THIS PLACE TRYING TO DO? GIVE US FOOD POISONING??? C'mon!!! If your buffet selection is not great, at least make sure that your food is fresh. I was at the curry section yesterday and they didnt even bother to empty out the old curry. Instead, they just threw more fresh ones on top. The old ones on the bottom will only turn bad, it's not going to make it more fresh with the fresh ones on top. The only best section of the buffet was the dessert section. Even though options were not many, at least they looked decently fresh.

OU6gKjdXFdhwzsMqB9cl5A.text: i really like this buffet. they have already sliced  opened crab legs. lobster and wine included in dinner! awesome selection!

HDSu6GWGcBFnnMPWloy1ng.text: For another city this restaurant might get a higher rating, but compared to other buffets in Las Vegas, the Buffet at the Aria doesn't match up. Especially compared to the Bellagio next door that has the same price for lunch and dinner, the Bellagio wins without doubt.  The main reason I went was for the oysters on the half shell, but beware: the oysters were unfresh, dessicated,  and had such a strong fishy taste that I was unable to swallow them. Also they looked as if no one had touched them on the ice which made them the more unfresh. The sushi was palatable though I suspect the Aria does not hire a real sashimi chef with the sashimi being unevenly cut.   The prime rib and the flank steak were good, although they were not seasoned particularly well to meet the standard already set by the Bellagio. As the newcomer on the block, the Aria does not make a case for itself; the Bellagio does a better job and has much more selection for the same cost. The Aria buffet resembles a cafeteria and the interior is somewhat claustrophobic.  The saving grace of this buffet is the beautiful presentation of its desserts, this could make it worth it if you are a dessert fan, although the selection is definitely less varied than that at the Bellagio.   All in all, the Aria was digestible (apart from the oysters), but it cannot compete in the competitive buffet scene of Las Vegas.

O3TBF5AxV4V4ykIO4haKqw.text: The Aria is one of the nicest casinos in vegas. I have lived in las vegas for twenty years now and have tried them all. I walked into the buffet and it was beautiful, especially where they sat us facing the pool and garden area. The silverware, glasses and the dessert plate where those of a gourmet restaurant. The shrimp where excellent and the crab legs where just ok. I got there for lunch at 3.30 and dinner started at 4.00, so i took my time to see what new food they would put out. The only thing that changed were the crab legs went from snow crab to king crab. The snow crab were much tastier as the king crab legs were very small and dried out. As i searched for food they had nothing much to choose from.The salad bar was very limited but the desserts were very nice. The service was very good. Lunch was 20.00 and if your into eating alot of real good firm shrimp it's worth it, but i will never return.

rma2Pszxa49x7lFipmYsIw.text: It was decent. They're not as accommodating as the Wynn though. I was with my cousins baby who can't eat a lot of things because of allergies. All we asked for was a banana and they couldn't give it to us. They said they didn't have any and that we weren't special. They had bananas foster in the dessert section so I'm pretty sure they have bananas. We went here for the breakfast buffet. The only thing cool was that they had gelato and crab legs for breakfast. But honestly, it was just blah.....

WXJj9nZXEG3d5lfjUSVGIA.text: Excellent buffet. My family and I went for the lobster/wine buffet on Sunday night. Got in with minimal waiting. I'm a red wine snob, so tried both red and white and opted for the Chardonnay, as the Malbec served was weaker in flavor. The lobster came quickly was served hot, tender and moist. The salads were fantastic... watermelon with jicama, tomatoes with figs, marinated mushrooms with garlic & peppers, and a medley of olives, cornichons, garlic & rosemary. Nice sushi selection for apps, but basic rolls, nothing unusual. Massive amts of crab legs with fresh lemon and drawn butter. The Asian green bean and beef entree was seasoned well and veggies crisp and flavorful. The lobster ravioli was delicious and very  gourmet. The tandoori chicken, naan and curry were great! The roasted veggies had pitty-pans (baby squash) which are pretty pricey at the market.The lamb was overcooked for my taste and difficult to get a rare slice.
