THE BAD:  First off, there the buffet line and stations are very utilitarian and remind you of a cafeteria - not a whole lot of good interior design went into designing this space and they wanted to seat us literally a yard away from the the entrance/exit with no barriers between the oncoming traffic. We requested another table and they were kind enough to oblige us.  However, getting to the food - there were long lines for the "seafood" section - in which case only shrimp and crab legs were served. Just as we were approaching to serve ourselves - the trays were refilled with literally ROCK HARD FROZEN seafood - inedible, crusty with ice crystals. Even once you let it defrost - it was waterlogged, soggy, mushy and tasteless.   There were two or three carving stations. One with an Indian-style (tandoori?) tri tip or a flatter-style steak where they'd carve you a single small strip and expect you to go on your merry way. The prime rib was cooked beyond well-done. The asian dishes were sub-par as well (wonton soup - the won tons were doughy, undercooked, and the kind with the super thick wrappers that you know no real establishment that caters to the Chinese would serve)  THE GOOD:  My highlight of the night was taking the tikka masala sauce (and passing on the dry sinewy chicken that soaking in it) and mixing it into bowls of basmati rice... mmm so good!!!! This literally saved my meal and stopped me from good-flavor-starvation. But definitely not what I should've paid for. The flank steak was wonderful with the garlicy/oniony topping. Desserts had a nice selection, gelato was passable, and pastries were what you'd expect them to be.

ZHv5DOMWUxODOEOzuVuepg.text: Came here after it was recommended for it's large selection of food, however we were left very disappointed.  For $48 dollars each, you get unlimited food, wine, and they also serve lobster tail. But after being seated, we realized there was a lack of staff, and we were getting pretty thirsty. We flag down a person who looks to be ranked higher, and explain that we'd like our server so we can get some soda or water, or wine even.  Finally, I take my receipt and I go to walk to the front to complain, because according to my receipt, I have been sitting here for 20 mins with no drink, no "hi i'm so and so" no nothing.  As i'm about to instigate, I notice a lady with what looks to be our drinks on her tray. So I went back and didn't complain. We got our drinks and then we went to get our plates for the buffet.  Everything looked really really good - presentation gets an A to A+ for the most part, however the 20 min wait for drinks should have been our first indication...  I placed a few items on my plate: tamale, white Indian rice, tandoori chicken, asparagus, potatoes, pineapple and cantaloupe, a slice of steak meat, and some pita bread.  All of it tasted either bland, bad, nasty, awful, or worse.  Round 2: pita bread, indian white rice, curry vegetables on top.  I want my $48 dollars back. I should have kept walking past the waitress lady and complained like I was doing, but I backed out because I didn't want to be the asshole in my group who complained.  Well, realize you need "bad guys" sometimes, who will point the finger and hold others accountable: This place took over 20mins to get us soda, and their food was so bad we all almost had to get McDonalds or something to cover up the nasty food we just ate.   Never again. NEVER NEVER NEVER.

fDm8k2wln9blZz1cJrqVRw.text: We ate here at least once every day for a week. A nice selection and what really made this place special was the smiling staff and superb service.

B-OKMYrES1tkwr7SBTdKMw.text: Food, service and seating (I will explain below) is BAD!!   Food: I am not a picky eater as my wife will attest, but the Aria buffet was inedible even for me. The crab legs were thawing out and were soggy. The lobster was rubbery. Curry chicken dry. Everything else tasted salty or bland.   Service: there was unlimited wine and despite ordering the wine when we sat down, we were halfway through our meal before we were served the first round, The dirty plates were not cleared from our table and were stacked up high before they came by (we were with a party of 8).   Seating: Our table and chairs were constantly vibrating and shaking. When we asked what was causing the vibrations, we were told that it had something to do with the air conditioning system below. The constant vibration along with the horrible food made all of us feel like we were sea sick.   STAY AWAY! ! !

cKVLXxVXGnzeawUtRGlK0g.text: they have a great variety of international foods, but the food was not delicious and wasn't prepared right.   Their Banh Mi (vietnamese sandwich) had there had way too much mayo, their noodles were way too hard and their fries were soggy. All their foods were way too salty too. Out of all the different types of foods they had, the only one I enjoyed was the Indian curry. it was really good with their garlic naan. :)

fmJ_LE2uJ81Z0-IQjbgYoQ.text: went agian this past weekend... for brunch its $27, with the champagne or bloody mary its only $5 more. worth the money!  also, this time, we were able to conquer and try all the desserts. :P

w2VI1r1uviaBr50xqh3hwA.text: I generally don't write on buffets,especially at Vegas since they have a set standard base on price paid. However i had to write this one during our stay at the SKY SUITES in ARIA, met a group of college friends for reunion, first thing we were force to pay a 18 -20% gratuity up front for party of 8 or more. The cost per person was about $36 Saturday lunch plus tips $6 ($42) and there was no line, i know why now. Food was mediocore at best, a step above circus cirucs of what i remembered. The snow crabl legs were 2nd tiered quality and size. We are paying for 1st tier pricing. The rest of the selection was average at best. Turly a bad experience and this was my 3rd and final time going to this place. Service was good but of course 20% for a buffet. DONT DO IT, go to the M buffet, TI or Bellagio, thos will be much worth it.

Y5-l4p0R8WDKlICCH6w8_w.text: I've only had breakfast and brunch here. Both times were pretty decent. The best thing I like about the buffet are that the staff are completely open to letting me peruse the food before I decided dining there.   I think this buffet is pretty standard run of the mill buffets. Nothing stupendous about it, but the food is definitely fresh and there's a decent amount of food to choose from. Perhaps my favorite thing there was the creme strawberries and bananas. I'm sure they laced it with coke. There is no other explanation to pay $50 so I can get in to eat strawberries and bananas.   The staff are friendly and wholesome. I say check out your choices of buffets before deciding to eat here, but you're staying in the hotel, this to me is clearly the most convenient choice.

3tFLMNWk-op6JhX9J1MjDA.text: Points for variety-- but nothing was done very well.. Not the place to go for sushi-- although the seafood was pretty good, fresh. Much better seafood restaurant options available in the Aria complex. It was satisfying food, but disappointing because I heard so much hype about Las Vegas buffets this was nothing special.

KnejRgI4g6UbBJuTM_1gLw.text: Good eats. Roughly $50 a person, but if you're into sea food. It's the place to be. Crab legs, oysters, mussels, and even lobster soup. Delicious! On top of that, their carving stations had quite the selection. The last two things that caught my attention were the deserts and their mac and cheese. Absolutely the best. Very flavorful.

a3WrcmqIQLRLKfH1obRXSg.text: Food was horrible over cooked and dry! Would not recommend ever! When we tried to speak to a server about some of the food that was burnt they just said ok and walked off. So we weren't sure if they did not speak English or just didn't care. For being such a pricey large buffet we were very disappointed . We should have gone with the hotel clerks suggestion and skipped this one!

6VVYZ2kuCb4p3b7T8e_CxA.text: I went to this buffet when it was newly renovated and I thought that it was a great buffet. The food was good and the service was great. However, when I went this past July the quality of the food was very disappointing. The crab legs were not steamed well as they were swimming in a pool of water by the time I got to the station, the prime rib was overdone and was told they didn't have anything that was on the rare side. However their service was still great as our waiter was very attentive and friendly and the pastries were still great.

htzoR43n1H5yOj6H-eD8IA.text: The best thing I can say is the staff. Some of the kindest, warmest, people I have ever met! However for an upscale property this buffet is pitiful. Every table had sausage soup display was not indicative of a facility of ur stature. Had to hunt for sauces no sugar free desserts.

o79BKdP__lFIb5qpnNyEaw.text: Came here for brunch because my boyfriend wanted to and saw the crab legs.  I really like brunch because it is a combination of breakfast and lunch so they have a lot of variety of food. Unfortunately, 1/2 of the food I got, I did not like. I normally love breakfast sausage, but the sausage here was really dry. The cocktail shrimp was soggy, the hashbrown was really really dry and flavorless, and so was this bread that had sun-dried tomatoes on it.  The food that was good were the egg benedict, prime rib, and crab legs, and the desserts. So you should just ignore everything and just stick with those three and have dessert.   The desserts that I had were chocolate cake, flan, and creme puff. They were all really good, but I think I like the chocolate cake the best. My boyfriend liked the flan and he also got himself oreo ice cream with m&ms, which was really good too.  I wouldn't mind coming back here, because some of the food here are really good, you just need to know what to stay away from....

photos.caption: Photo of The Buffet at ARIA - Las Vegas, NV, United States. boyfriend&#39;s oreo ice cream with m&amp;m
Photo of The Buffet at ARIA - Las Vegas, NV, United States. my desserts
Photo of The Buffet at ARIA - Las Vegas, NV, United States. yummy egg benedict

E7RmW8o7CQgAsQWK47EFnQ.text: All in all, I agree with the overall 3-star rating, which I classify as average, not terrible. Like all buffets, it's an easy way to satisfy a variety of palettes and sample some new cuisines you might have overlooked if you had to commit an entire meal to it. They do breakfast best in my opinion, and it's not *too* expensive for the variety.

BxUGmE_o14ZyQf6Vnp9uQw.text: Really Aria? Really?  We ate here on a weekday and not a weekend (where they have lobster) and my oh my was it ever disappointing.  $30 for a weeknight buffet, knowing what I know now, we would have went to M buffet or even RIO for half off local special.  BUT now we know, and knowing is half the battle (G.I. JOE!). You'd expect a lot more from a place like ARIA.   SUSTENANCE: Food was okay.  The problem was the selection, not a very large buffet. The night we went they had 2 slabs of meat , prime rib and beef brisket at the carving station.  The Prime Rib was a little dry and not as good as other buffets that serve that cut.  The brisket was a bit better and was very tender and delicious. They had a plethora of salads, i enjoyed the spicy shrimp and the orzo salad, not too bland and good flavor.  Crab legs were chilled and pre-sliced leaving you to do little work to get that oh so succulent crab meat.   TIP: You can have them steam your crab legs if you ask!  They had the typical fare for the rest of the buffet and though the selection wasn't that large to begin with you can tell they were at least TRYING to be a good buffet. There was a trio of Indian fare (chicken in curry and an eggplant dish were pretty decent), some Italian selections (pasta station w/ choice of 3 sauces - pomodoro, alfredo, and i forget the 3rd), Mexican station (gauc, shredded beef, umm I couldn't find tortilla shells), and a Chinese area (typical Chinese food - chow mein, orange chicken, etc).  Dessert was good.   Cinnamon bread pudding, red velvet whoopee pies, and carrot cake with a strawberry sauce were my fav's.   but still...  You'd expect a lot more from a place like ARIA.   AMBIANCE: Modern decor with bright colors and tiles on the wall.  A little plain and one person in our group even mentioned that it felt like we were eating at a hospital cafeteria. We all agreed.  You'd expect a lot more from a place like ARIA.   For $30, I would rather walk across the bridge to cosmopolitan and eat at Wicked Spoon Buffet for $5 more.  If you want to eat here just to "try it cause you've tried all other buffets" (the reason we ate here) then by all means go right ahead, but If you trust your fellow yelpers...skip this one. You'd expect a lot more from a place like ARIA.

mMExuhmCtwiJ2Z_ue_toUg.text: Came here because we were redeeming our myvegas rewards and it was free! That was the awesome part but when we got the for dinner it was alright. There was not that many choices for food and it was kind of disappointing since I thought Aria would have more for their buffet for some reason. They do however have iced and steamed crab legs so I was all for that. I suggest not getting anything from the Asian section but that might just be cause I live where there is dim sum every two buildings but it was very dry to me. Dessert section did not have a huge variety and for me it was overly sweet but the appearance was pretty. Everything else was pretty mediocre but the service was great and they were all very friendly and efficient! They had very few people working but they were all very attentive and made sure we had drinks and anything else we needed.

_d2jLg0BHgXTa9inkng1jg.text: Surprisingly good! I did not expect the buffet at Aria will be that great. Highly recommend the snow crab and prime rib. The desserts are also great! I had Bellagio today and I found Aria is actually better!

iYVhcMZJNKCDkm7zrJXtyA.text: I really wasn't impressed at all! So many people raved about this buffet and it was just ok. The food was bland, the service was great and that's why 3 stars not 2. The crab legs were so watery that the meat was falling apart and mushy so we waited for a fresh batch to be put and and it was the same way. The desserts were beautifully displayed but lacked good flavor!

p7zazhx8ozIC15f8LKcpWQ.text: Generally this place is more good than bad. This visit was the same. More good things than bad. They seem to have an issue keeping spoons and crab crackers on hand though.

x6dEWnnRf2paBjR7a1ULHA.text: I went for brunch on a Friday morning around 11am.  The line was super small and it only took us about 10-15 minutes to be seated.  We were a large group of 11 and they had no issues.  We also ordered the unlimited champagne with our brunch price.  The atmosphere in the place was very nice and open.  I liked how they really separated the buffet area from the tables.  This allowed for better movement.  After reading these reviews I was surprised to have the nicest waitress.  She was so kind and constantly checked up on us to make sure we had enough champagne.  She was such a sweetheart.  I wish I knew her name.  The champagne was good, and one friend got the bloody Mary and she seemed to enjoy it.  The food selection was much better than I thought it would be.  To start off they had crab legs, which I didn't think they would for a Friday brunch.  They were a good size and very delicious.  They also had bagels made to order where you could get smoked salmon along with some other spreads.  They had a carving station that had ham and brisket.  Some of my favorite dishes were the lentil curry, carrot ginger soup, pad tai, and spicy shrimp cups.  The desert selection was also very nice.  I'm not much of a dessert person but they had lots of gelato, cookies, bananas foster, cakes, and anything you could think of.  I was really happy with their ethnic food selection as well.    Overall I would definitely returns because of the reasonable price, great service, and quality of food.

gXbl79PS7f70kTLUuWVYYg.text: Starting with the hotel decor, this place is amazing.  You get two choices a) Buffet with coffee, tea, soda or juice, or b) Buffet with champagne or bloody marys. Obviously choice b is a bit more money but worth it.   There's food for everyone... salad, sushi, crab legs, pizza, breakfast, meats, Chinese... you name it, they have it. On top of that, they change what they offer depending on time.   The eggs benedict were delicious, so were the waffles. Sushi was good, fresh. Pizza was ok, but it usually is in all places you have them as a buffet, under a heating lamp.   One thing I fell in love with was the dessert section. I only had the flan, and the coffee shooter, could not eat anything else after seeing so much food, but there's so many of them and so beautifully decorated and presented. If you are a dessert person, do leave room for these, my friends and I all chose different desserts from each other and agreed this was the best part of the meal.   Staff is very friendly and attentive, always a good thing.   So, all you can eat, drinks, good service and, at a beautiful hotel = must try it!

pIDO3_SHZQdsQn_-ZFHokQ.text: Good buffet lunch but what's up with the Korean music? The cheesecake is to die for but skip the CAKE pops aka as CHOCOLATE WHIPPED CREAM pops!

photos.caption: Photo of The Buffet at ARIA - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of The Buffet at ARIA - Las Vegas, NV, United States

RRQgoPsqow0VZbCFfPUoUg.text: Went here for did-din with girls. The food was decent. Skirt steak was slightly chewy, but shrimp and salads were good. Definitely bang for your buck.  I would come back just for deserts:)

-QAh9y9M3BtpfI-C7dIVWA.text: Great buffet! I'm a vegetarian and there was more than enough great options. Dishes ranged from mild to spicy. Staff was very friendly and attentive.

CAz7YmYk4DKl9th9ykHD3A.text: This is number one buffet for me!!!When I go to Vegas, I always have dinner at this wonderful place. I couldn't find something like aria buffet in Los Angeles, that's why sometimes we go to Las Vegas only for dinner at aria buffet) . Good choice of medeterenian, italian food. Different types of sea food. Always fresh and tasty!!!

74Ax9NRhgJ4ePNr4g8NNpg.text: We stayed at the hotel and felt it was convos my to go to the Buffett. It was definitely very nice and the food was very good. They offered many options for gluten free too which I loved. However it was a bit expensive for breakfast and brunch I felt. Worth visiting Though

a3dk0BwyMAyjeh585G6cLw.text: The Buffet at the Aria is actually really good.  I would say that it's defiantly one of my favorites.  The crayfish was a little bland but everything else was superb.

gvYKB36rdrJ2fcHfjh6PmA.text: Within 60 minutes of eating at the Aria Buffet two members of our dinning party came down with food poisoning. we ate dinner at 6:00 PM and had only had plain bagels for breakfast that morning. Both members of our party were ill for the remainder of the trip and stayed in their hotel rooms. When we called early  the next morning to ask if others had become ill we were told nobody had called and they served over 2,000 people and there was no way we became ill from eating there. We don't know if others called after we did. But seemed odd that the "manager" could be sure that we did not get sick from eating there. He told me to call security and file a report. I asked him what good that would do my wife and he said he did not know but that was what we needed to do. No apology, no empathy. Keep in mind we paid $75 (per couple) for this meal and one would expect better than this.  As a result we will never set foot in another MGM property again. The situation was handled poorly.

omeVnwFDXuoisGPwoRIW1A.text: We REALLY liked this buffet. My husband doesn't usually eat from the buffet, but this one he took a chance on and LOVED it. They have everything from fresh crab legs to sushi. Fresh food is brought out regularly and the carved meat is to die for! I didn't give it 5 stars just because of the price. We had lunch which was the same price as dinner. However we were told that during dinner they bring out prime rib and better desserts.

yIcDsSSGki2xHhCBUAQxqQ.text: Our stay at the ARIA included credits at the resort restaurants, and after one of the worse flights to Vegas I've experienced that left us both famished & nauseated, we decided to head downstairs and try THE Buffet. btw, I love how that whole THE Ohio State thing has become a contest to see which player went to the one & only douchebag university. I can't wait for the Ivy League players to get into the mix.  Anyway, back to food: as with many buffets, you have to know what to select and what to avoid. Unfortunately some of the most appealing-on-paper choices are also the worst here: the crab legs, the Asian station, and the tandoori oven cooked naan bread should be avoided at all costs. What I personally liked the most were some of least popular options: the grilled vegetables, the quinoa and tabouli salads. The prime rib and steamed clams in a tomato base were also good.  My wife got the surf & turf which was cold lobster paired with a quality rib eye in a bernaise sauce. However, the majority of things we tried here were just not up to snuff. The service was very friendly & efficient, and we never had to wait long for anything.  Definitely not worth the money, but the variety of options, pleasant setting and service make it a good option if you are staying here and want to eat ASAP.

qhCbdHAA-ScgiZtEb4X70w.text: I've been to a lot of buffets, but this was by far the freshest. They have a wide selection of crab legs..king, snow, blue and dungarees. Also have oysters on a half shell. I'm a fan of Mediterranean food and there was a wide variety. If your looking for fresh and a healthier buffet might as well shell out the 45.00. They also have unlimited for an extra charge.

n6AGc7jdEwhFCZlio3_JWQ.text: Been here before and I wasn't impressed but since I was staying in the hotel it's convenient, but the same items as my last visit.   *Service: Not Welcoming!! The some of the staff was nice but most looked annoyed to be there.  On my second visit on my trip, it took me 15 minutes to have my server take our drink order & no it wasn't busy  *Decor: Cool & Modern!!   *Food: The food was good. Not overly impressed but still good!! Went 2 days in a row and some of the items I tried both days and they were somewhat inconsistent.  Recommend: I wouldn't!! I would only recommend to, if you're staying in the hotel and don't feel like going to another hotel.

c6wR_BdmhdmRsVkJUMKUHA.text: Food quality just poor. No flavor and temp of food is  Luke warm. Better buffet places are there and also overpriced.

7tGeXAHeRxpMb2xziKURUA.text: Hands down one of the best buffets my wife and I have eaten at. The carved meat selection, the variety of ethnic dishes, salads and fruits, and the flavor profiles all were very impressive! We ate here at lunch time, and we were surprised to see crab legs, cut for easy splitting. The macaroni and cheese may be the best I've ever had! There are warm desserts, gelato, cakes and pastries to top it all off, if you can even find the room for it! We highly recommend.

EAaw9rZvBdiOwTDXfC20Uw.text: I'm not a buffet fan, but Hubby wanted to try it out for brunch. Nice selection, kept clean and refilled and the waitress was really nice. Crab legs were hot and the desserts were the perfect size. Plenty of different kind of food to choose from.

qYLUSKUnJBClf7zX4O1yYg.text: While the entire buffet scene in Vegas have gone downhill over last few years, this one is especially BAD.    I came here to try their Sunday "Gourmet" Brunch.  Its 32.95+ tax but the it was a huge disappointment!  In Short, don't waste your money to come here.  The line was non existent when I came.  I felt it was not a good sign.  The foods were quite mediocre.  They have alot cutbacks for their brunch.  King Crabs are gone, snow crabs instead (Like Wynn).  FYI, King Crab only available on weekend dinner so I have been told. The quality of the crab is....crap.  Soggy and soft.  Lack of flavors.  Rest of the foods were non remarkable.  The presentations weren't good so did the taste of food.   Dry steaks, dry salads. Horrible Asian stations and their Italian station didn't look too good either.  Their desserts are one of their best tasting station to save this review from having 1* only.  I like their cheese cakes and apple pie but rest of them are just ...blah.  Save of your money and go somewhere else.  If you are on comp.  Try to venture other a la carte dining options in this hotel or other MGM properties.

NI8nGxGgrF9GHv03vrQRfw.text: We have been to Aria buffet before and really enjoyed it. However this time it was terrible. Everything seemed really salty and the food was not good at all. Last time they had ceviche and really good sushi but this time around there was barely anything that I wanted to eat.   I'm editing the review  since management was able to take care of it. The customer service was great.

yWfU5TVtECb4GKhh_9M6bA.text: I expected it to be much better - because at $40+ a pop for dinner I can go to a pretty nice place, thank goodness I had buy one get one free (myvegas).  Had we paid $80+ for two to eat there I would have rated it even lower.  The prime rib was good, sides were okay, lots of seafood/fish/etc. which I can take or leave.  Crab legs but the small ones that take a long time to crack and eat. They had a nice variety of different cultures, but not fine dining for sure. The sushi was nothing special even though it appeared there were staff making it fresh.  The deserts were average, the gelato was good and there were several flavor choices.  The way it is set up is very nice and easy to wander around along with being attractive, but I won't be going back, not for the price and the selection.  You have to pay to park here on top of the price of the buffet - they don't validate.  Parking is $9 & on up for anything over an hour - valet is $21.

SDkTR3zOnDrFZX6kYPJ7Rg.text: I went to the buffet with five friends and we all enjoyed this buffet.  Although it wasn't as big as other buffets on the Strip the food tasted really good.  We especially enjoyed the crab, ribs, and carrots with asparagus.  We were happy that the crab was warm instead of cold like at many other buffets.  The gelato was creamy and delicious too!

yKvkghRXitcjQPF_xCSn5g.text: My favorite buffet on the strip !!! This is by far the only buffet where I leave beyond full. I always make sure to wear leggings with a flowy top because by the time I'm done eating here my stomach is bulging lol!   This buffet has the same type of thing as every other; you've got a make your own pasta station, the carving boards, indian, mexican, italian, DID I MENTION CRAB LEGS? Whenever I come here I'm never disappointed compared to other buffets where I pay a lot more but the food is either really salty or bland. Service is always friendly & whenever we come back to the table there's always a refill waiting at the table !  One thing, just make sure you leave a jacket or some indication that you're coming back. We got up to get more food & they started clearing off our table like we were leaving. We had to run back & let them know we were still eating. This only happened once out of the 4 or 5 times we've been here but they were really busy that day so I just assumed they were trying to accommodate people asap.

kqbhMUpkEUxWCudima7Bow.text: Garbage would be better. Horrible food horrible service, I can't say one thing that was good. Spent $225 for 4 and we were just looking at each other's faces, had to leave within 10 minutes.   AVOID this place!

sG8vB84vyU5D1-4SqqlFkw.text: This is the review of our last visit on August 5th 2015. Aria is one of my favorite casino. The decor, the customer service are top notch EXCEPT the buffet.  First we had problems with our server, Wendy. She was MIA 95% of the time when we were there. Empty plates piled up on our table, drink never got refilled. It became very frustrating dining experience.  Food was hit and miss, it wasn't great but was not the worst. Some of the food tasted like it's been sitting there for hours. Salmon was good though. Other than that, some of the items never got refilled so we didn't have the chance to try it.   To be honest, this is the kind of service and food from aria. I do expect more from aria. As for now, we do NOT recommend this buffet to anyone we know.

RzsOAB4_PGjt2dtZKTulNg.text: COST: $22 for lunch  GOOD:   - desserts are better than Bellagio or Mandalay Bay buffets...seriously! The presentation, flavor and portions are the BEST!!   - lunch had no line.  - service - efficient, friendly   - variety of buffet menus including different ethnic dishes: Indian, Japanese, Chinese, American, Italian, etc  BAD:  - watery salty crab legs. Not Alaskan  - rubbery sushi  - saw a server putting things into his mouth when he thought no one was looking. very gross.  NEUTRAL:  - atmosphere matches the rest of the hotel - modern and hip, but looks a bit sterile, like a cafeteria.  Would I go back? yes, if i wanna stuff myself with the best desserts in town. Heck, $22 is worth it just for the desserts!!!

photos.caption: Photo of The Buffet at ARIA - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Aria Hotel Buffet - Feb 2010 - Desserts
Photo of The Buffet at ARIA - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Aria Hotel Buffet - Feb 2010 - Desserts
Photo of The Buffet at ARIA - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Aria Hotel Buffet - Feb 2010 - Desserts - sugar sculpture

tfBApeHKNJB4yP8quH3H5w.text: We ate at the Aria buffet since we were staying in the hotel (the other buffet we were going to try had a ridiculously long line).  There was no line at Aria.    The price over thanksgiving weekend was inflated (I do not recommend dining at a buffet over holiday weekends as the prices of most buffets are over-inflated and definitely not worth the price increase)  The food is comparably "fresher" than other buffets but the selection is very limited.   The buffet boasts the only tandoor oven at a Vegas buffet. I found the naan to have a biscuit like quality which is not to my liking. The tandoori chicken however was very juicy and succulent. Taste somewhat lacking though.   The other standout was the crab legs (fortunately served hot - I hate cold crab legs).   Seafood - slightly above par in all respects The pasta and salad selection was surprisingly decent.   Carvery - standard selection - preparation slightly below par Dessert selection - below par in all aspects.  Asian food - below par in all aspects.   You should go to this buffet if you hate waiting in lines and if they are charging their standard price.

RnTukGANHaDzUlttlTsEqg.text: This buffet was sad times considering the other fabulous buffets in Vegas.  Really, they're kinda in a hidden type area of the Aria, so maybe they're hiding out and when someone stumbles upon it they think, oh well, I don't know where I am anyway so let's just go in!  I love me a buffet, so going out to Vegas is exciting because it's like buffet country.  I barely picked up anything in my graze of the stations.  Nothing really looked that appetizing.  It's definitely a smallish buffet, but I'd still think quality over quantity for the mola you're shelling out.    The only good thing was the dessert bar.  I always enjoy a soft chocolate chip cookie and brownie.  So that kinda made things better, but not really.  If you stumble upon this place and you haven't eaten in days and you're starving it would be fine.  If you have the time to meander to anther... I'd pick that option!

rgKxJRO38Zi6z1nprcjXVA.text: What the hell, picky Yelpers! This isn't a 3-star buffet, it's better than that!  The buffet is bright and every food station (and item) is clearly labeled. Our server Catalina was very nice, attentive, and she shouldn't be working at a buffet because she was really good.  The food was tasty and they had 3 times the selection as Wicked Spoon. The Aria even had some sugar free and gluten free items.  This place is better than the 3-star review.

fYSa_iAUy2D6ge5ZMm2w9w.text: We were greeted by Yesenia, who was a sweet girl. Our waitress' name was Kelly, who was charming. After our meal, we asked one of the other waitress, Ruby(who had a kind smile), to get us the manager.  The managers name was Geraldine and she was respectful and was kind as well. We told her that we just had an amazing experience ate the Aria Buffet and our waitress, Kelly, was a really pleasant waitress. Kelly, aside from doing her duties, is such a gem to the restaurant. Her personality is exceptional and went past my expectations as a customer. In a short period of time, Kelly had built a rapport with us and made us feel extra comfortable. We exchanged small talks and we found out that aside from her working full time, she fosters kids,feeds the homeless and cooks for them on top of her medical challenges.  I hope that one day, she would get some type of help doing what she's doing or get some type of appraisal for her work ethic. She's a perfect example of a dream employee who leaves her personal challenges outside of work and perform very well at work till the last second of her shift. I am planning on coming back because of Yesenia, Geraldine, Ruby and KELLY. Thank you for the great experience, I wish that every restaurant worker had you guys' attitude and smile each day at work. And thank you for the amazing gelato!!

6abpk5I1bKceMrTU9GSInA.text: Welcome to Las Vegas buffet lunch is $23.99  that the price this day if you go at lunch and dinner is $39.99 !! But they taste the some of you have one buffets in Vegas you have it all !! The only thing is service and fresh food not frozen !

photos.caption: Photo of The Buffet at ARIA - Las Vegas, NV, United States

YRWCEngJVU-bdLWGi-aZJg.text: A great buffet. Our server explained the "bottomless" wine or beer that is only $17 per person. We had great rib rye, prime rib and crab legs. A huge pot of paella and a great sushi and seafood selection. They have Asain, Latin, Pho, Italian, Seafood, Salad, and soup atatipn, and then carving station. The carving was chickens 3 kinds, rib eye, roast beef and prime rib.   The experience was great and I can't understand the complaints about price. This is a classy buffet with top notch good foods! Sounds like people don't understand the difference between this and souplantation.

photos.caption: Photo of The Buffet at ARIA - Las Vegas, NV, United States

0KD18xWr6O7xySr7rBOE6Q.text: We had been to the Aria buffet a few times before today and wow did it NOT DISSAPOINT!!! Food was AWESOME (including an amazingly authentic menudo) but today the service was the star of the show! Alicia was our "sever" and although service is not usually a key part of a buffet today it most certainly was. Food was incredible.

photos.caption: Photo of The Buffet at ARIA - Las Vegas, NV, United States

IaRrEMt78iGvy0R-5zITyA.text: I have come here twice for brunch on separate trips.  The thing I like the best is that that they have a great menu of drinks you can order for a single price. You're not pinned down to mimosas. You can order anything off of the list! Rum punch is delicious.  I love that they have steamed crab legs + clarified butter.   I like that they have lots of things I want to try a little bit of, but...  I don't like that there's nothing (besides crab legs, of course) that I just think is amazing and want to keep eating more of that single item. Nothing stands out.  Their dessert area, while plentiful, still falls short of the gorgeous, decadent desserts that Wicked Spoon offers.   And in the neutral zone: staff. Very hit or miss. Some of the line staff is wonderful and kind, while others give you rude looks if you try to get their attention. Same thing with your dedicated server; sometimes there, sometimes not.  Out of all the buffets I've been to, Aria still ranks in my top 5, mostly due to steamed crab legs and the great deal on drinks!

photos.caption: Photo of The Buffet at ARIA - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Bottomless beverages- worth it

sN6y93kcnzwVVcQLxAfSOg.text: The buffet here is very good from the food quality to the selection everything is great! I been here twice now,  I always start off with a salad and then make my way to the delicious crab legs and king crab legs they have both.  They're macaroni is really good too, and I love how they have such a huge fruit and vegetable section. A huge upgrade from the buffet at Cosmo called wicked spoon .

photos.caption: Photo of The Buffet at ARIA - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Salad

9VmJtBeE_KulSnVi3FSSqA.text: This is the 7th buffet I've been to in Vegas in the last 6 years and it was the best so far. The tuna tartar is amazing. Best I've had. But I was disappointed there was no lemon flavored dessert. So only 4 stars.

photos.caption: Photo of The Buffet at ARIA - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Amazing tuna!!!!!!

95XX26rNWvPm8Nx8o5bG_A.text: For a $35 Sunday brunch, this place is affordable and a decent meal. However, I only thought the food was okay. I tried plenty of bad dishes here, and only a couple ones that I thought were actually good. The buffet definitely lacked variety. I felt like I was finished after just one walk through of the place.  I would recommend going to a different buffet like the Bacchanal at Caesars, although it's really expensive. We actually wanted to find a buffet that was good but not as expensive as Caesars, and ended up here.

-_sP8AWHg6YlbpPnn62jsQ.text: Worst possible buffet in Vegas!! Food is tasteless, the cocktails are watery and wont give you any kick even if you drink buckets of those! The worst part is the attitude of the staff. They are always in a nasty mood. Completely avoid it!!

yFFkAI7qO1TCnQM5vm1Fuw.text: Not good at all.  We went twice, once for dinner and once for lunch.  Both were not good.  First, we were probably the 12th people in line at 4:00 pm and it took them an hour to seat us. By this time we were already angry.  So many tables and sections were not being used despite the very long line behind us.  We couldn't figure out what they were waiting for.  For at least 20+ minutes they just stopped seating anyone.  Dinner started at 3 so what's the problem??   We had a 2 for 1 or we would have just walked away.  Many people left so they lost a lot of business.  Some were staying there and they weren't happy either.  When we finally got in the server was very nice but the food tasted like it was sitting there for an hour.  Will not be back.

TUgdtQYGltIO3sjM-p3JQw.text: Solid 3.5 rounding up to 4.  I used a MyVegas Bogo voucher for lunch at this buffet, so for $22.99 for two people you can't complain! We missed breakfast time's cutoff by just a few mins, so if you show up just before 11am you can get in for a few bucks cheaper ($19.99) and stay for the lunch items.  We came on a Monday so no line to pay or get seated. The buffet was already busy but there were still lots of tables available.  First plate: Saw the dim sum first, so got a sui mai and two har gow. Sui mai was a little dense, but the har gow was pretty good. The shrimp inside very plump. Got a piece of proscuitto and some mini mozzerella balls, both were good. There was a bowl of olives (and I love olives) but they were all too hard.  Then I turned and saw all this seafood! Snow crab legs were cut open for easy eating. The leg sections were actually pretty sweet. The body sections were more bland and watery. Peel and eat shrimp small but nice and plump. Green lipped mussels and smaller black mussels (green ones were better), and some crawfish (bland).  2nd plate: I didn't realize they had warm crab, crawfish, and other shellfish just on the other side, so I got those as well. I actually preferred the cold crab legs bc the warm ones were dried out. Same with the crawfish. They had green mussels in a lemongrass broth that was pretty good.  Then there were the standard CA roll type sushi. Not bad. The only one that had fish in it was the Philly roll.  On the other side of this island they have soups that they serve in Le Creuset cookware--fancy! I tried the clam chowder. Tasted good, but the problem is the pots don't heat up the soup as well as the traditional soup pots they use in buffets.  3rd plate: This was what I was waiting for at this buffet. The Indian food! The naan was really good; thin and chewy at the "point", and soft and fluffy at the "crust". The curries were pretty good but I could have liked them a bit more spicy. The chicken was my favorite. The basmati rice was nice and firm. I hate mushy rice. I'd pass on the dolmades and falafel. Dolmades was mushy, and falafel was too hard and dry.  4th plate: Finally I get to the carving station! The Portuguese sausage was my favorite. Probably all time favorite sausage, ever. It has a nice texture, with thin casing, and not too salty. The pork belly was very soft, but the skin was not crunchy. I didn't try the beef, but it was a huge hunk of beef and they called it a beef steamship.  I thought I needed some salad, so over to the salad bar. My favorite was the persimmon and pomegranate salad. I always thought I hated persimmon, so I decided to try it again. It's good! It's like a cross between an apple and melon. My mom used to force me to eat over ripened persimmon when I was a child and I guess that's why I thought I hated it. Still to this day I cannot eat over ripped fruit. This persimmon had a nice light crunch to it.  They also have small sandwiches, and I chose the grilled veggie one. I love eggplant. It had grilled eggplant, avocado, and caramelized onion. I just ate the insides with the Portuguese sausage and it was a great match.  5th plate: Now I'm about to explode. A slice of white pizza with spinach, where I added sun dried tomatoes and proscuitto. So good! The pizza wasn't even hot but the crust was crunchy! How do they do it? Even with all the oil and cheese, and even the very first bite that is usually the softest, soggiest part of a pizza was crunchy.  And had to get another piece of naan and some more salad. Love me some naan bread.  6th plate: Dessert I'm not a huge sweets person, so I really appreciate when places have creme brulee, panna cotta, and similar bc they aren't too sweet. No creme brulee, but they did have panna cotta. I didn't like the berry topping, but the custard was good. Bf said the cheesecake was a lot richer than usually but still good (too rich to finish though), and the mint chocolate ice cream was as you would expect. They have a ton of ice cream flavors, but no soft serve and no cones.  Overall, food was pretty good. Staff kept the place really clean. Food was always coming out. Our server was like a ghost. Everytime we came back to our table, our glasses were refilled and our plates were taken away. Def will return when I get another BOGO voucher.

photos.caption: Photo of The Buffet at ARIA - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Plate 6. Fruit and dessert.
Photo of The Buffet at ARIA - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Plate 5. Pizza and more naan.
Photo of The Buffet at ARIA - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Plate 4. Salad and Portuguese sausage and pork belly. Sausage was my favorite.

WsOKxXFWT2GOEOIp0xGJZg.text: Friendly service/ staff and I love the feel of the place. Unlike some old looking buffets, this felt like a nice restaurant only thing is you're pretty much getting your own food. I really enjoyed the beef short ribs( went back for it probably 3x) and of course ate as much Crab Legs that I could handle but leaving room for some gelato ( I got the Oreo one) super good! Would definitely come back. Oh! And if you play Vegas slots you can get a free buffets, me and my family each got our dinner buffets for free! But still would come back even if it wasn't free

PCJ0LzrondjFnst_k95IRQ.text: Still love this buffet. This time got a free MyVegas redemption. Went Thursday dinner. Only difference we noticed between weekday and weekend"gourmet"  dinner is they weren't grilling seafood in the middle and no creme brulee.  But prime rib, crab, shrimp still there  Note- no prime rib label but they have it.  Also: mac n cheese and naan bread surprising really good. Usually skip carbs in buffet but they're worth it But skip: watermelon lime juice, Thai tea, steamship beef  ***also only bad thing is the water tasted gross. Not sure what it was but bring your own or order soda

photos.caption: Photo of The Buffet at ARIA - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Flan and cannoli both good :)
Photo of The Buffet at ARIA - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Skip watermelon lime and Thai tea
Photo of The Buffet at ARIA - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Yum

uJyJAca8jWUAIEjuNWmzQg.text: As far as buffets go it is Ok.  Nothing that would make me want to do it again but glad we tried it once I guess.  We went on a weekend night when they had the all you can eat crab.  It was not that well done but OK.  It's cut funny and is hard to get out of shell and they didn't have the traditional tools to use so you just kind of have up on it.  There is a variety of cuisines like Mexican, Indian, Chinese, Japanese, etc.  A nice dessert selection and carving area with all kinds of meat.  Again, nothing I would go back to but not bad.

eUWskmLjfp4b7Z4k-rr0jQ.text: This place was truly horrendous. The food was bland, some salty and overall of poor quality. The beef was hard as a rock, the paella was bland. The pastries were sour and the gelato was quite frankly, disgusting. Save your money and go somewhere else. This place is awful.

9Ch2jVFcELPXw57x8OPvoQ.text: I was not impressed with the food here i am allergic to seafood and most of the selections were seafood, the choices that we not seafood were ok but for 40 a person i did not see the value in this buffet

mWDYHQveJrqWgaY4NCmg6w.text: 3 stars for food. Negative 10 for service.  Started off great. Server immediately took our drink order, cleared one plate and then totally ignored us for the next 2 hours. He kept walking by our table and avoiding eye contact with us. He serviced other tables that arrived but completely avoided us. We were nice and polite to him the entire time so we are baffled. This wasn't just bad service, it was NO service.  This lunch was supposed to be the highlight of our trip but it was the biggest disappointment.

photos.caption: Photo of The Buffet at ARIA - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of The Buffet at ARIA - Las Vegas, NV, United States

qNK6WSBfPUCCG4VzOFUnoQ.text: The food here is great. We literally ate breakfast and lunch simultaneously lol. The options for food is numerous and delicious. I recommend eating here anytime. The price is not bad but still a little up there. It is worth it.

EXopcPkw7GfgFmaT_hJUVw.text: I seriously love buffets. While my friends wanted to go to vegas for partying and drinking, all i cared about was getting myself to the buffet. I was told to try out the ARIA Buffet. This was our last stop before hitting the road and heading back to LA. The buffet has lots of options and I made sure to try a bit of everything during lunch hour.   Only thing I was disappointed with are the Egg Rolls, they're terrible! I loved the seafood. However, they don't have a sushi selection. I saw one type of sushi and it looked like california rolls. It actaully looks like their menu changes periodically, so I won't comment on what I ate.   Their waiter did a great job waiting on us. Kept our drinks filled, which was quite important for a group of hungover guys.   I thought the lunch buffet price was decent, considering how much I ate. I definitely ate more than what I paid for. No joke.

m2Z9uG2YytmRMZweYJaq3A.text: Good not great. Mostly bland food with the exception of the carved turkey that was really tasty.

eufpsQWoldKNB6wzzu4MYQ.text: I went to the breakfast buffet, which was $20. That sounds like a lot except if you go to the Aria Cafe, a simple breakfast food and a drink is almost $20. So the $20 for the buffet is pretty reasonable for the "neighborhood".  The breakfast buffet has the usual barnyard massacre meat items, most of which were pretty good. There are also lighter fruit/vegetable selections, cereals, etc., but you're in Vegas so live it up a little.  What a lot of people don't get about a buffet is that not all items have to be good and not all items you have to like. The worst buffet reviews are variations of, "The buffet had 115 items but I'm giving it two stars because the potato salad sucked!" Hmmm... So a buffet with 115 items of which you hated one item sucks? How is that worse than going to a regular restaurant where you order one item and have to roll the dice on that one item?  Anyways... This is a solid breakfast option in the Aria / City Center area.

photos.caption: Photo of The Buffet at ARIA - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Breakfast

4aTEp_Rposq6962AAICxdA.text: Having been dragged to yet another buffet, I was pleasantly surprised. The quality of the food at The Buffet at ARIA seems much improved (perhaps in inverse proportion to the food at the Buffet at Bellagio?). And, with the LOCALS DISCOUNT, the price of the Gourmet Dinner (Fridays through Sundays, 3 p.m. - 10 p.m.) was only $30, rather than $43.  When I ate there last Sunday night, the baked salmon entree was delicious. Could-have-been-served-to-you-in-an-actual-ARIA-restaurant-and-you-would-have-been-happy delicious. I was also happy to fill up on a tasty multi-colored beet salad, still-snappy green beans, and various other practically-healthy vegetable dishes.  I thought the desserts could have been better: the sugar free panna cotta was lacking, at the very least, sugar, and the cannolis, though properly made with lemon and without chocolate chips, needed more ricotta and less unidentifiable whipped ricotta substitute.  He of the highly unrefined palate (i.e., my other half) disagreed: he was absolutely delighted with his rice crispy treats and caramel corn.  Given that this IS a Las Vegas buffet, with the requisite hordes, I recommend arriving early or late to avoid the lines at the cashier and sitting along the outside windows to avoid the general fray.

kpuSQlGpf6qc2S1_kXckLg.text: It's definitely great food and atmosphere. Just make sure you eat the moneys worth cuz you will pay close to 100.00 for two people

wYx9lcBs-KSKWMdw44C42Q.text: The buffet was recommended by a colleague so I thought I'd give it a try.  They do well for the price considering unlimited snow crab (cold or hot), a generous carvery, and prompt refills on the drinks.  (I was afraid I might have to tackle someone to get my $16 worth of free refills on wine, bubbles or beer).    They do have some small portions (ramaken size) pasta, pho, and other dishes.  I stayed away from the bread, potatoes, and filling Mexican food to focus on the seafood.  The weak spot was the Asian food - was only so so.  There is a generous dessert area with ice cream and bite size deliciousness.

RuiP_6uiNlO_vu_3aySpmA.text: We stopped by at The Buffet at ARIA based on a recommendation and we were definitely pleased! The brunch here was $29.99 (+tax & tip) and we were happy to find that there was a little bit for everyone!  My favorites were definitely the breakfast selections .. cute little baskets with waffles & french toast!! I thought some of the other delicious items were the blueberry blintz, the side of mashed potatoes & gravy, and general so's chicken & fried rice. The dessert selections were delicious as well, especially the panna cotta!  The services was spot on during the time we were eating. We got drink refills in a timely manner, our plates were cleared off our table while we got up to get another plate, and for what we received, we thought the buffet was very fairly priced.  Although the line to get in was long, we thought it was worth the wait. This has by far been the best buffets I've been to in Las Vegas!

photos.caption: Photo of The Buffet at ARIA - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Desserts! -- Flan, Panna Cotta, Cheesecake, &amp; Smores.
Photo of The Buffet at ARIA - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Some of my favorites! -- French toast, mini waffle, &amp; blueberry blintz!

VwxpB5sNsxbJKWWpxkfM2Q.text: Not bad.     Wynn Wicked spoon Bachanal Aria  Sadly it was at the bottom of the buffets I went too.   But I would go back.

1Y9JXPSV1S2dhe0V35gnVQ.text: This review is for the visit on Dec 23th 2018. We waited for almost 2 hrs for the brunch, when it was our turn brunch hour had ended and automatically we were charged with dinner price ( which starts at 3 pm). We did not mind to pay dinner price hoping that the buffet would include king crab legs as some reviews had mentioned. Dinner buffet at Aria was disappointing, overpriced, very noisy as the music was loud. The seafood (shrimp, snow crab legs) were salty. There were no king crab legs. The poke station did not have tuna, nor salmon, it only had octopus. No raw oyster, just oyster rockefeller which was good but we were given only 2 oysters per visit. The pho/noodle station was ok, the broth could have been hotter. Overall, the aria buffet is inferior comparing to the buffet at Caesars in terms of quality, selection, space, atmosphere, will not recommend this buffet to anyone. The server was nice that is the reason for 3 stars rating

sgNeQVCl7Qvbzp7wNcZAuA.text: 90minute wait to be let in. Staff stated they are running short on waiters. $100 bills are walking away from this line.

ibsebr5DL9d9GhHu7fvk_g.text: Las Vegas is known for its buffets, so it was necessary that my friends and I go to a few while we were in town for a weekend.  The buffet from the day before ARIA was downright terrible - crappy service, little variety of food, and tasteless dishes.  So, the bar was set very low walking into ARIA.  Luckily, ARIA exceeded expectations!  There was such a better variety with my favorite part being the dim sum and Asian selections.  There was also a lot of delicious seafood options, deli, standard breakfast, among other sections. The low point were the desserts, which were a bit stale and flavorless.  Overall, though, glad we made it to at least one yummy buffet.

photos.caption: Photo of The Buffet at ARIA - Las Vegas, NV, United States

unrdku_KZunhEhEkhnoWRw.text: This buffet is okay. The service is wonderful, the staff seems happy to help. We got a discount here when we were staying at the aria, so we decided to visit. It is pricey without the discount though. The food was so-so, they were short on crab legs, and overall wasn't the best quality. The deserts and gelato were great though.

6hFGS8OPSQABQ6Aw2O7e1A.text: Our plan was to head to Lotus of Siam and on our way there, we found out that they were closed on weekdays between 2:30 - 5 pm. Damn. While heading back to the strip, we found out that Wicked Spoon was also closed between 2:30 - 5 pm and we passed on spending $60 each for Bacchanal. Instead we found ourselves back at Aria and decided to give the Buffet at Aria a try.  We missed the lunch cut-off at 3 pm by 20 minutes, so we paid the dinner price at $37.99 per head. The buffet's food area is not as comprehensive as Bacchanal, but still offered plenty of selection for indulging. If looking from left to right, they have Sweets, Asian, Italian, Pizza, Mediterranean, Tandoori, Latin, Carvery, and Diner. Two islands in the middle of it all have the Fish Market and Salad. I was pleasantly surprised with the seafood variety available: steamed crab legs, peelable shrimp, clams, mussels, seared ahi tuna, cooked salmon, seafood paella, sushi, and more. I was also pleasantly surprised that they have Coke Zero available from their offerings of Coke drink products!  Other than the seafood, I filled up on prime rib (so yummy with fresh horseradish too!), creamed corn, mac and cheese, and spinach dip. If you stop by the Salad area, they have fresh fruit juice and thai tea ready for dispensing. At the end of the meal, I was slightly disappointed with their desserts. While I enjoyed the oreo whoopie pie, tiramisu cup, cookies and Merlyn Monroe popcorn (white chocolate drizzled popcorn), their gelato and ice cream flavors were just okay. I usually like to end with a fruit sorbet, but they only had coconut and mandarin yuzu. Coconut - I'm allergic to, and mandarin yuzu - super tart. BF got the cherry cola and pistachio and loved the pistachio one so much - definitely get the pistachio if you can!  No discounts for Mlife members, but show your Mlife card to rack up points.

YD9k6V8TLHL-ADPn3bfvBA.text: Eek.   Went to this buffet two days in a row during a trip in Vegas. It drips with mediocrity. You'll notice they have SO MANY choices but none of them are executed well.  This buffet leaves you with a full belly but little satisfaction.  The mini donuts were fab. 2 stars. instagram: @glowrae

n8bU6GIE5RLhMMRub2jJ9Q.text: We came for dinner on a Thursday night and we were very impressed!! The quality is very good for a buffet! I would give it a 4.5 stars.  Came here 2 years and it was not good! I was informed that a year ago, they made changes to the buffet.  WOW... must I say what a complete change over! I think this is better than the Bacchanal and now and my new favorite buffet! Pork belly melts in your mouth and amazing chocolate gelato!! Everything is like gourmet home cooking... lots of flavor... my style!!

photos.caption: Photo of The Buffet at ARIA - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Chocolate gelato was amazing... so creamy!!
Photo of The Buffet at ARIA - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of The Buffet at ARIA - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Truffle scalloped potatoes... mmmm Both short rib dishes were nice as well!

SZF_QAFU-muR2Ptwi3xSJg.text: Three stars for a health reason. Having a serious nut allergy I have to ask what dishes to avoid. The chef was honest and stated I shouldn't eat there due to the risk of cross contamination and regular use of nuts in a good majority of their dishes. Refund issued and I appreciate the honesty and avoided ER visit. However, my wife suggested that they post somewhere that they frequently use nuts to avoid problems for other customers.

pHuWL_4qD59mMTDSzCGyJQ.text: Gluten friendly.  Dinner-Ask to talk to the chef, they will walk you through the whole buffet and tell you exactly what you can  and can't eat. I have been here in September for the past three years and the gluten free selection gets bigger and bigger. Pizza to order, pastas to order, they will make some of the dishes special for you without the gluten ingredients.  Meat and seafood selection great other great stuff as well. Dessert bar has several selections.  Service is outstanding,  food is really really good!

eLzI5roe92ilqGzeT1BcXQ.text: The line was long, and there was no express lane (VIP card needs to be purchased in advance). The seafood section was disappointment at first sight.   The staff at the entrance claimed to have oysters, but sure enough they were not the raw ones we expected. We had two baked oysters, and they were not cleaned properly and had so much sand inside. What was worse was they stopped providing more oysters after we took two. Same thing with the Jonah crab legs -- they just stopped bringing out more and pretend nothing happens.   Our waitress, on the other hand, did not make the experience better. We paid $19.99 for the all you can drink and ordered two cocktails. Okay, she took my order first doubting that I would like Bloody Mary, then 15 minutes later, she brought back THREE drinks. She explained that she understands that we will be drinking a lot very fast, so she brought an additional one in advance. Hm...not sure I really liked having the third cocktail with melted ice by the time I got to it, not to mention my desire wanting to try a different drink instead of having the same one twice.   The food in general was mediocre. For $47.99, we expected a better experience. Service was very minimal. Based on the (lack of) service, it almost seemed like the waiters had not been receiving proper tips for a long time and didn't expect to receive any. Not sure who to blame for this. We were at Wicked Spoon the same morning for brunch and had a much better time there.

MlfFr5ujrZPwP-hsAnRCfQ.text: I am not a fan of buffets in general. Typically there are lots of starchy items and many dishes are over salted. But, if you know the game, they can be very good. The Buffet at Aria is big but was at total capacity when we got into the line. We were still in line for more than an hour.  There was several different stations and many of them had a "made to order" window. The Italian window made fresh pasta dishes with shrimp or chicken. The Asian window had Mongolian bbq. The carving station had tri-tip, chicken, turkey, ham, and a couple of sausage choices. Then there was the seafood. Everything I tried was excellent with one exception. The paella was over salted.  The desert section was outstanding. The gelato and the chocolate mousse on peanut butter wafers that were also covered in chocolate were amazing.  Some odd stuff here. Spoons were an issue. There were no spoons on the table nor by the gelato. So to get a spoon, you had to go to the far side of the buffet to the far side of the salad section to a small basket of spoons. To get this information, we asked a server about spoons. She told us to ask our server to get them for us. Our server the told us about the basket of spoons. Being a very busy establishment, it took a bit. So our gelato was halfway melted by the time we got spoons to eat it.

nCwVJAvNFdJ8Kovk5a7D7A.text: Went here for breakfast at 9am this morning and was terribly disappointed.  I'm assuming it was a brunch setup as there wasn't a lot of breakfast items. At 9am, I'm not interested in seafood, pizza, etc. The items they had seemed to be missing something. For example, there was country fried steak but no gravy or biscuits. It was a huge let-down.

S7Qkf2F10xNCV7SO7QjH3w.text: Yummy buffet with all types of food to fit everyone in your group's tastes. We got there pretty late at night but everything still tasted fresh. Our server was awesome and was right on top of clearing plates and refilling drinks. The desserts are beautiful!!

UNUSWN9xjFHBM0beuNk6ug.text: Second Only to the Wynn and I Ate at ALL of the Main Buffets During My Stay  Ok I slept mainly at the Aria hotel but this does not affect my review of their Buffet. I five starred the hotel also as it deserves it!  The Buffet was dynamite, food was hot and selection endless, as well as quality of Aria Buffet food very high. Behind the steam tables MANY smiling faces! And quality protien foods meaning not 1001 ways to serve useless carbs as Bellagio seemed to do.  the chef was funny and enocuraged me to take some scones in my purse!  He said "everyone else does!"  ENJOY!  I am a high stakes player so next time I will bring a bigger purse!!!  Compared to all the other buffets, except the Wynn and Mirage-this was the brightest, easiest to attend and "happy" buffet in Vegas. Food was also HOT when it is supposed to be hot (Bellagio was cold and useless with the added insult of very pricey!) The selection at the Aria was also wonderful and recipes from every type of country featured you could think of.  I see some reviews rail the "staff." This is somewhat True but I did not focus on the staff--mainly the food, quality, variety and thoughtfulness put into their buffet. It is five star. I do agree their staff could all smile more...but their jobs probably very hard. I do agree Mirage Buffet was also dynamite AND EVERY person I walked into THANKED us for our business and let us know we were truly appreciated! And they were sincerely smiling. That stunned me.  If Aria could just get their staff to "fake it" or maybe pay them a LITTLE more to SMILE--it would be six star. Also keep in mind what just happened down the street. Many people were impacted by that. More so the locals that serve us and this may be heavy on their mind.

KgiA6U8q5Qu7FUQoxNisQg.text: Called to check pricing 38$. Spent 30 min getting here from Venician. When we were finally here the price went up because of "special holiday price" on December 21 to 49$. Called back to check the price again, they tell us 38$. And then apologize for "miscommunication."   Question: what are you doing there at restaurant booking if you don't know the price?  Lesson: you don't know the real price until you get there. No point calling.

LykmPuNTBdu1088SNC1RaQ.text: Only ok. Food wasn't that good or selection wasn't that much. Like wasn't worth the price. The mgm buffet was better. I just really didn't like it that much was a weird selection of food.

l3tTmW7SyjjdzSY2Upm9Xg.text: I am not a buffet fan since I do not eat a lot. I happened to book our stay at the Aria during a promotion for 2 free** buffets per day. I went for brunch one day and breakfast another. It was pretty good. You get what you pay for and IMO this buffet has some quality food. Fresh ice cream. great Indian food, yummy omelets, fresh fruit and more. I would recommend this buffet for meat eaters since there was a variety of choices to choose from. For a vegetarian? Only if you have a resort credit and vegans, forget about it.  The service was great. One of the best I've experienced at a buffet.  The waiters were nice and quick with drink orders and table clean up.

hzcNpfN-MCQhDDn4wTPVaw.text: Not sure what happened to this buffet, it used to be good, but now it was blahhhh.....

photos.caption: Photo of The Buffet at ARIA - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of The Buffet at ARIA - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of The Buffet at ARIA - Las Vegas, NV, United States

D-KXVBtHhhf1BR2RJNimQg.text: My group of three came here for the weekend brunch.  It wasn't super crowded when we got there which kind of worried me.  But since the dining room looked remarkably pretty for a buffet, I decided to hold off judgement until after I taste the food.  First thing I noticed...crab legs.  Pre-cut crab legs!  Less fuss, more yummy!  Points for that for sure!  I initially lined up for an omelette but the line got super long.  So I bypassed it and went with a meat theme. I tried the prime rib, bbq brisket, turkey, and roast pork, all fresh cut for me on demand.  In general, the meat was the star of this brunch today...something I did not expect for a weekend brunch meal.  I did eventually get the omelette later in the meal and it was worth the wait.  I liked how most or all of the buffet items were prepared gluten-free which is a very proud thing to boast.  However, in my attempt to avoid tummy filling carbs, I looked past the different unique flavored cream cheeses and bagels, pancakes, waffles, and wrapped fruit blintzes.  Even the eggs benedict looked tempting as well.  One thing that baffled me were the Asian hot dishes...like noodles and stir fried beef.  I wasn't sure how they fit in with the brunch theme...I didn't see sushi/sashimi which I would had gladly tried.  The price point of $35 in comparison to the regular weekday breakfast/lunch is quite steep.  My companions did try the bottomless bloody marys and were very satisfied with it but they weren't "wowed" by it.  All in all, 3.5 STARS for a pretty room with decent, but not great food selections near the Aria pool.

UBoE1Xpi_v4l0SIbAhmP9Q.text: After having experienced the Carnival World Buffet disaster the night before, we were a tad bit leary of buffets.......BUT, we had these complimentary passes to any MGM resort buffet, the Aria being one of them, so we could not pass up a "freebie."  Four of us ate an $80 meal for free.  That's good enough for me.  I was a bit leary also because I had read others' reviews, and I wasn't so sure it was going to be anything decent.  The Rio's World buffet was decent enough (for what I wanted), but there was just so much other BS that it was pretty unenjoyable for us.  Here, at the Aria buffet, we were pleasantly surprised.  I pretty much got cold foods like various kinds of ceviche, sushi, Thai salads, cold, poached whitefish, salmon spread.  The ceviches, in particular, were quite tasty, if not spicy, but I really enjoyed them all.  I didn't participate in their halved, ready to eat crab legs.  I had enough the night before.  I also couldn't muster up the desire to eat hot foods, then ultimately stuffing myself......so I didn't.  Plus, I had to save room for Jean Phillipe's pastries.....oh, hell YAH !!!  That was a MUST.  Unfortunately, for me, a pastry snob and baker in my own right, they were good, but they were NOT amazing.  Sorry, but they weren't.  I tasted the banana caramel cake, and it was just banana cake.  Couldn't taste caramel.  The apple rum raisin pie was overpowered by the rum flavored raisins......wasn't a fan.  The bread pudding was my favorite, that, I definitely liked.  I also tasted their strawberry gelato.......quite delicious and packing a strong strawberry punch.  The chocolate brownie was laced with too many walnuts......a turn-off for me.  The pecan bar was decent, but the cappuccino dollop didn't work with it.  Here's the other thing.......downstairs from the buffet is an actual shop of Jean Phillipe's pastries, and THOSE will dazzle your eyes.  THOSE were amazing to look at, and while I didn't get to try any (too full !!!), I would like to think they were better than was presented upstairs at the buffet.  I'd like to know why ALL of those items were not offered at the buffet.  That was a bit disappointing to me.  That being said, all too many times we have all discovered the oh so great looking food item LOOKS better than it tastes, so while I know to beware of the "looks can be deceiving" reality, I just don't know with the store displays...........those pastries are so impressive.  I would go back to this buffet again......maybe when I'm in a mood to try hot foods, perhaps more room in my stomach.  However, I would probably hold out for the Jean Phillipe Patisserie downstairs......gotta try some of those next time !!!!!  I think this place is 3.5 worthy, but all I can only select 3 on the scale.

photos.caption: Photo of The Buffet at ARIA - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of The Buffet at ARIA - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of The Buffet at ARIA - Las Vegas, NV, United States

ACf-gMIYdK7Nj-6S5PMBeg.text: I honestly don't understand how anyone can grouse about the buffet at Aria, unless they don't really like buffets in general. If you want a fine dining experience - go to Scarpetta or Guy Savoy. If you want an amazing buffet - it's at Aria.   I first went to the Aria buffet in October 2012 and by the time of my next visit in October 2013, it had been revamped. I liked it originally, but the re-do makes the experience even better. My friend and I visited for lunch, and the price was very reasonable - maybe $22? Complimentary beverages are served in classy stemless wine glasses and our cheerful server was all about making sure we stayed hydrated.   Of all the things I ate, the only bite I wasn't crazy about was a lone potsticker. That means I found the following things delicious: chicken salad, ham, macaroni & cheese, mashed potatoes, sushi (albeit the rice was a tad dry), antipasti, mushroom bruschetta, French onion soup, corned beef hash, gazpacho, crab legs, mussels, pecan tart, chocolate cake, coconut macaroons...and probably more things I can't remember.

k5ytVAAssLmUYQb9th1ReQ.text: A number of reviews NOT on Yelp rated this buffets as one of the top. I should have read Yelp reviews first. While it was good we felt it was just average. We follow Paleo diet so our choices are limited. They of course have the carving station, salad, and crab legs that we can eat. Some fish dishes were fishy, the mango salmon was very good and NOT fishy. It was pricy however they did have crab legs (warm and cold) for lunch and dinner. Shrimp was good. They had other shell fish but we didn't try any.

PQoHqN66zSzgF3HtRiuHSQ.text: For a magnificent hotel like Aria with such a presence in taste and style, the buffet is sadly disappointing. Sure, the quality of the meat and seafood seemed good but there wasn't anything spectacular.  We came away not feeling satisfied. The price at $50 is about right for a Vegas buffet. The standard offering of Chinese Mexican Indian Italian dishes are typical of most such format but nothing stood out. Service was adequate. The night we visited  the soups were lukewarm and not kept hot. The noodle station was left unmanned. We had to get someone's attention to serve us. Choices were confusing as the same noodles and soup bases were used for diners to create miso soup, pho etc. with garnishes. There was only a tiny number of sushi choices and frankly not very good. Overall it was not impressive. We know from our dining experiences elsewhere at Aria that it can do better.

hyIQzicp9I2NLuyvYETKsg.text: Not bad for $25.99! My family and I dined there on the last day of our Vegas trip and was pleasantly surprised by the selection and service.  Our server Linda was really nice and attentive.  We definitely enjoyed it there and would go back when in Vegas.

Mek9wmedsMyrSw6rE4a8Ow.text: Went for breakfast on a Monday morning after staying the night at Aria.    The good..Nice layout, located on the 2nd floor promenade, and it was reasonably priced (if you like the food)  The not so-bad..It's not as big as the other Vegas buffets I've tried.    Let's get to the ugly.. How can you screw up breakfast?!? Cold potatoes and eggs. Eggs benedict with no hollandaise, tasteless dim sum choices, dry waffles and pancakes, and the sausages.. ugh.  Seemed like we tried it all, and all were FAIL.  I felt a little guilty that I've wasted all that food.  But, my taste buds were not having any of it.  We ended up eating a pastry and gelato for breakfast.  A $30 meal for pastry and gelato.  Might as well just have gone to Jean-Phillippe.

pRXfsEP2mOuc4ctAS2nqPg.text: Steamed, hot snow crab with drawn butter is a winner! Having a choice of consuming hot or cold crab is a great idea. Must taste gelato flavors - mandarin yuzu, gluten free pistachio, pumpkin, peanut butter w/ chocolate pretzel are delicious! There are so many gelato flavors that I saw in the automated carousel but did not have a chance to try. Mini whoopie pies are delectable! Gluten free panacotta is yummy!

NBzHpEJP6xZU2w_aCCw9Wg.text: long line to get in....The draw of this buffet at first was the free champagne/mimosa or bloody mary that came with the price  Really liked the diversity in the food. You could get sushi, breakfast food,  crab legs!, BBQ station, pesto pizza, pork buns, NY steak. Great dessert selection as well.   Staff was friendly and attentive. Decor very pretty.  Overall, win-win.

EwA_FLacqRE9yJXmIMoV0A.text: The buffet overall is very nice and the staff is incredibly friendly. There dessert station has fresh gelato and great cookies. I do wish that there was just a few more options and fresh fruit available but overall the quality of the food is great.

vG6nPupVfxybaWcaQgbCpg.text: Bit of a disappointment. Since the hotel class is comparable to Wynn & Bellagio, I compare their Buffet to Wynn's & Bellagio's. For one, their pricing are almost the same. We came here for dinner. When you go and survey the place, it would look like that you will have alot of selection, but you don't. One section was serving Indian food, so one section was all Hummus, Baba ganoush and stuff. In short, just sauces.  I like and appreciate Chicken Tandoori, when I tried it, it was  dry, looks like it was over cooked. I went back to see if the other batch would be better... looked the same, so I did not bother. The Prime rib was okay. I tried their Italian section, I like their clam & Mussles soup. Their pasta selection was "lifeless".  Their dessert section is really good, but not enough to make me want to come back and pay that much.

photos.caption: Photo of The Buffet at ARIA - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Woo... Grand Marnier cream puff... Sloop Good!

8zv1Dpo_XTekUkMB_hBGWg.text: Used 2 for 1 dinner coupon from myvegas. Fantastic deal. Like the cold snow crab legs which are really fresh today. Dessert was great too. Chinese food section was a disappointment though and everything was like left overs-cold and dry. Service was ok as with any buffet.

zSAd4i-g4bO0I2A-4-GJWw.text: are you in vegas? do you want to eat till you drop or have to unbutton your pants? well, buffets are definitely the way to go! aria buffet on the other hand... well meh.. i've truly experienced better.  aria buffet... it's just alright. nothing too special! you would think that in such a fancy hotel such as aria the food would be great. i came here for dinner with my boyfriend. there wasn't a line. we got seated right away.  they gave 1 complimentary lobster for the boyfriend & i. the lobster was not that great to be honest. but i guess since it's a buffet and its complimentary i can't exactly complain. don't be greedy with the crab legs like i did, because i didn't want to waste food and made myself stuff it down. it wasn't that great either. i squeezed so much lemon on those suckers but still the lemon just didn't want to be on those crab legs.  snickers cheesecake wasn't good. i liked that they had gelato however it was limited in flavors. the cranberry juice here is like one of the best i've had! so i would highly recommend that!   gosh i grabbed a little of everything and i would have to say the chicken noodle soup and prime rib was the best. thank goodness the meal was free. i'm really glad we didn't have to pay for this meal because it so wasn't worth it.  i tried the sushi section. it was just okay. i can't complain because its a buffet. buffet sushi isn't ever truly that great. fish wasn't exactly fresh but wasn't exactly nasty. just tolerable.   service was decent. i would have appreciated the waitress having a little more of a smile on her face. she actually looked pretty mean.   if you're looking for a good buffet, i'll recommend planet hollywood!

photos.caption: Photo of The Buffet at ARIA - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Lemon cheesecake
Photo of The Buffet at ARIA - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Snickers mini cake &amp; chocolate covered chocolate lollipop
Photo of The Buffet at ARIA - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Orange sorbet &amp; strawberry gelato

JyP9q9Sot0Ti2fRdVUgpNA.text: It was my very first time here. Buffets are one of the great "entertainment" venue when in Vegas. Your stomach is a priority in a fun-filled city like Vegas because food can be entertaining. Great selection of various ethnic items like Indian, Italian, Asian, American. The ones I had were the oysters, flatbread pizza, Asian dim sum items and the my favorite the juicy pinkish prime rib. Eva our server has been a sweetheart. Kind and patient with a group of us who are 15 altogether. Food is what you come for. The service is what you come back for. Thanks Eva!

ti6La9yAO4uIxDWVXLrkog.text: Very saddened by the quality of food and the service once they offered through out the years they once offered is no longer apparent. Food was no longer tasty and quality of service and professional mannerisms no longer exists. Buffet at Aria was one of our favorite place to dine whenever we were in Vegas. Sorry but we must say bye Aria, you won't be part of our Vegas experience anymore .....

CfRxAV3sU7_M6gNkaGivPg.text: My first dinner here was very good.  The crab legs were delicious and the ceviche was very fresh and tasty.  All in all a very nice experience.
