VAWDFHMnNBQBR8724dvZAw.text: Definitely not worth the money. Not a big selection of food. And the quality of the food is mediocre. It's worth walking to Caesars Palace.

bpsM02n6hTkH4owWqAitAQ.text: like the food there. especially the sea foods. fresh and variety of dishes. i stop by for brunch each time i go to vegas and every time i am satisfied.

photos.caption: Photo of The Buffet at ARIA - Las Vegas, NV, United States. hot and cold crab legs

G8uISmxF1-HPm1Zkp1A6xw.text: Ridiculously long wait to get in -- one hour on a Wednesday night at 7 pm.  We would have skipped it entirely but we chose the 'buffet promo' when booking our Vdara hotel stay.  We thought it would be great to try the Aria buffet but it was very very disappointing.  It did have a nice selection, but almost everything we had was average or flavorless.  There were beautiful huge shrimp but they had no taste; same with the ceviche and sushi. The crab legs were tiny and dried out. The Indian selections were okay and the couple of desserts we tried were very nice.   However, nothing was outstanding and certainly not remotely worth standing in a one line and $47 pp.  Many cruise ship buffets do a better job than the Aria.    We had not been to a Vegas buffet in years and wish we had skipped this one.  The only real positive was that our server was very nice.

YByGlsAWFH_ms9OKIRlh_g.text: Not my favorite buffet in Vegas. The price was pretty similar to The Wicked Spoon but half the selection and quality. The service was also disappointing. The plates were still left on the tables after coming back and drinks were not refilled. Felt like a cafeteria.

XNwChPDmjsK0xMITH8TDFA.text: The snow crabs were very small and the stone crabs were frozen. This was an average buffet at best. Long line with mediocre service. The only thing that was really good was the corn and I'm NOT a picky eater.

gtBeg-e9noMJdxP2LnHYlA.text: My heart longs for King Crab legs!!!  Make sure to get a full plate of legs, then ask the worker behind the counter (there's usually 1-2 workers behind each station) to steam it.  The crab legs come out fresh and hot!!  I love that they make it really easy to eat so you don't have to work on getting the meat out.  They have a nice variety of food there, from Asian (noodles was bomb), Italian (pastas and pizzas), to meat (lamb and roast beef?), soups, and a nice selection of desserts.  All for about $30-something per person.  I like the atmosphere.  Everything is very open, very clean and comfortable.  Its not too noisy like other buffets in Vegas.  I was a little sad that I didn't get a chance to eat on Friday-Saturday, because there's a lobster special on those days.  Its a little more, but one day I will try it.

xQSSTh8DsOVnefVDPrFtzg.text: Lots of variety. Came in a little before noon and Chef Reinaldo Cruz came out and took all the time we needed to show us what was safe, what was risky due to cross contamination, and what was definitely not safe due to rues and binders. He also told us something new... Not only is the sushi rice sometimes not safe due to flour based vinegars but the seaweed paper (nori) can be unsafe as well as some manufacturers use wheat flour to coat the nori so they don't stick! Chef Cruz, thank you for the great info and your time. Gluten free dessert choices were excellent. For celiacs to be safe, you MUST speak to one of the chefs.

ZUFJyck8GyhcnIK88I1ohw.text: Came to Vegas last week and decided to try this buffet out since it's at the new Aria hotel. $29.95 for the brunch buffet!? Given that it was a "Holiday" buffet, I don't think it was worth the price at all. What was so special about the holiday prices? Perhaps it was the king crab legs and oyster bar, but those didn't even taste fresh.   I've got a few bones to pick with this buffet: 1. I wasn't impressed with the selection of food they had. 2. Items weren't filled up when empty and counters weren't wiped down.  3. Instead of placards that indicate what dish it is, they used a sharpie to write on the glass.   For what the hotel is, I think the buffet could have lived up to it. Aria is structurally beautiful and I love that its layout is eco-friendly, but the buffet simply sucks.

K5h-0so8kD7g1yZY4BLB5A.text: Nothing special, but nothing terrible either. Not worth complaining about when it's comped, but I would literally NEVER pay the sticker price.  If you like Prime Rib and Beef Brisket you won't leave hungry, although at a buffet that's not saying much.   Some times the crab legs are awesome, but most of the time they just look like absolute garbage. Same with the Pizza. They used to have the greatest pesto pizza ever, but not since the remodel, which is a real shame.  The overarching theme of this buffet is probably "unrealized potential." A lot of the food would be really good if made to order, but unfortunately they just make a ton of everything and leave it to sit and get soggy, burnt or otherwise go from great to gross.  The sushi, for example, is made using good fish, then put on a tray, covered in plastic wrap and left to sit in a fridge until the rice is hard and it's just garbage. Same with the burritos and the asian food. A lot of the issues would be solved, I think, if they just made smaller portions more often.  The guacamole, mashed potatoes, prime rib, basically anything that the quality doesn't go downhill when it sits out, are all amazing. Anything where the quality degrades though, expect it to be disgusting.  I just think this place is funny because they definitely have the potential to be a 5-star buffet, but they seem pretty content to be very mediocre.

uxRa9hW-qJhO-8udBeZpkA.text: This is most definitely one of the nicer buffets in Vegas. They offered anything and everything you could possibly want! Vegan sliders, to fresh crab legs, to gumbo, to dim sum... it was all there along with SO much more. Some buffets offer a good variety of food, but the quality just isn't there... that's not the case here. Every item I chose was excellent! The dessert station here was also a step above the rest. They even had gourmet flavors of gelato including oreo and caramel pretzel. Take that, vanilla!  I enjoyed the layout of this particular buffet as well. Many are located in the center of the casino property, giving them a cafeteria feel, where this one actually had windows surrounding the dining area with nice views of palm trees and the pretty landscaping.

yNCrKrTzurdw57qgsoIRYA.text: We only did breakfast but it was pretty fantastic for $14.95.   If you are staying at The Aria I highly recommend it.   LOTS of different foods were available and it was all good.

2HVGZBLNKqAG9bT56hwGSg.text: just to list off some things:  - great selection of food - not just great selection, but great quality for a buffet - great atmosphere and design. very contemporary. - attentive wait staff. people say that it wasn't as good, but our waitress was very observant of our table. drinks were refilled, and plates were removed with perfect timing. - DESSERT IS AMAZING! i love the coconut tapioca pudding shooter with candied mangoes. haha.  overall verdict: yes, YOU should try this buffet. if you like it, GREAT! if you don't, you can at least say that you've tried aria's buffet, and YOU can write a review on how much you don't like it. haha. enjoy!

ZSQTSqNOpalZfAyxWu23NA.text: I went during the week for lunch and the price was just as comparable to any of buffet. The only reason it enticed me was the fact that aria is a new hotel. The food was good and there was a wide variety and it was nice and bouggie but... it was okay overall. There is nothing different from all the other buffets I feel. they had crab legs for lunch and a cool dessert bar... but what buffet doesn't for that price?

RE40WZc9014RK7vcSLmU8Q.text: If you are looking to eat alot, drink all the non alcoholic beverages you want, and check out the hotties you might've danced with last night, this is the place to be. There was a lot to choose from-crab legs, shrimp cocktail, salad, prime rib, bacon, dessert, chinese food, etc. Service was great...our waiter was very attentive and made sure to keep our glasses full. Be sure to go around 2-3pm so you can get a taste of breakfast and lunch. Would I go again? Most likely....not the best meal I ever had in Vegas but definitely for the selection.

vyoc3PNSIXdg0xc6TYzhKQ.text: Lots of variety, but the food was surprisingly bland, especially the crab legs.  The prime rib was probably my favorite out of all the choices.  Service was miserably slow even though it wasn't too crowded.  Getting our drinks took 10 mins, but the refills took longer.  I felt sorry for the people who ordered the all-you-can-drink bloody marys.  The desserts were very pretty but everything that I tasted was dull.  I think next time I'll just skip the buffet and go out to any of the great restaurants in Vegas instead.

YbSw5hJXHBOIEpQ9gLz8ew.text: Food selection is minimal. They put out very small portions of everything therefore the food runs out quickly and is not replenished right away. I have eaten at Bellagio and Caesars Buffett and this place does not compare at all. The staff is not as friendly with the exception of our waiter Randy! Randy was AWESOME! He is the reason I gave it at least one star! Some of the foods stay in a pot on top of a warmer and just get hard. I ate some crunchy tasteless fried rice today... Yuck! Beat part is the oce cream and sorbet selections. The flan was good. The rest was tasteless! Extremely too pricey for the wack selection of food. Spend 3 more bucks and go to a better buffett. This one sucks!

vx6_y98AfydxHNTpUJ3Z7g.text: We read all the reviews online and had our doubts regarding the Buffet at Aria.  We were more than pleasantly surprised.  Very interesting and delicious items, including delicious jumbo shrimp in lobster sauce, all you can drink wine and many unique specialities.  However, the complimentary lobster was tasteless and rubbery.  The desserts were less than luscious.  But, overall a very solid buffet.  Definitely would return!

I1rA7PVyHQyGxiGrvTx5dQ.text: I ate breakfast and dinner and it's a huge dissappointment compared to the buffets at Wynne and Mirage which I have used numerous times. Food quality is good but selection very meager and boring. Salad bar has only one tub of lettuce, the other choices are very boring cheapo corn salad, carrot salad, and other filler types. Only 1 pasta, penne with generic red sauce. The standard crab legs are skinny lower grade than Wynn's. This place is totally out of synch with the opulent, spare no expense, state of art design throughout Aria.

j1kFYEjUM3f48qy_MzZJ0g.text: Came here on NYE for lunch buffet. It was holiday pricing so my meal with bottomless champagne was $36. I'm not complaining because it's Vegas and it was NYE afterall. However, the food didn't impress me all too much. The king crab legs were my favorite. Very meaty and cut for you so all you have to do is "fork" out the meat and dip it in that butter! Breakfast food and dessert are good too. But the other foods lacked a bit. The Asian section was pretty weak. Just typical fried rice and noodles, some kung pao chicken. Standard pizza. Prime rib was very salty and way too well-done. I understand Aria is still new, but I don't think it made a very good impression on my friends and I. I would only come back if it were around $20, which I doubt.

kmMNksfjbnw_sC3NtUzEsA.text: Please Tell me, you are not ready  to serve a full buffet yet ! Awesome architecture. People expect more than a prime rib and turkey roast.... Please take a walk over to the Wynn, you can use my $34.00 to buy a buffet with several entrees and hundred more combinations.   Desert menu is OK, but it doesn't make up for stale tomatoes in the salads, they had a pickled taste !  Complained to personnel, didn't even care.   If you are not ready, you should have opened in January.

xraqR5Vzk76_YrQAv9E2Gw.text: their strawberry shortcake is really good. but everything else is what you expect from a buffet.

1Q9jBBXIuQgXejIeJpnweQ.text: Pretty good food for the money-especially the deserts and bottomless wine.

-_eo01uxJlJ0uALhAby_xg.text: Vegas Bay-beeee!    Buffets and Smoke filled casinos and the newest is Aria.  So of course we had to at least try it right?    $19.99 for lunch. Ok it's new and bright and all pretty looking, but at 1pm the place was only about 1/2 filled. Strange for the newest buffet on the strip.    Onto the food. Salty. Bland. Salty. Bland. Salty. I couldn't even finish the piece of prime rib cause it was way too salty...plus the whole thing was cooked to what looked like medium-well and by the time they cut the piece off, the little bit of pink disappeared and it was a nice well done. blah.  I had to laugh at the chinese bbq pork...they had a carver cutting little pieces for people. Really?   The only thing I enjoyed was the hot & sour soup. Cause it had flavor and wasn't salty.  Saving grace for bad buffets is usually dessert. Not here. Again. No flavor in anything. Oh and most of the desserts are served on these pretty plates that are really bulky so you can carry maybe three of them at the most if you stack them right. It's a buffet for crying out loud, I want to be able to load up a plate will 20 desserts to sample :o)  Ok maybe I'm being harsh. I mean I did stay out until 5:30am drinking so maybe my taste buds were dead or something.  Of our group of 7, three thought the food was good. But they were eating things like chow mein and pizza and chicken.    The only thing I enjoyed about this place was the music playing. What's not to love about eating bad food while headbanging to Lady GaGa and Beyonce.

Mfz2IP0SBfB2_qJrWvs8aw.text: I think this place is a tad overrated- first off I went here for breakfast while en route to Mandalay for a convention. We show up- there are no signs that tell you where to line up when you're approaching from the casino level- by the time we saw that there was an actual "line" we'd been waiting and they felt sorry for us and let us through. The "server" if you'd call her that was bloody awful- she literally slammed my drink on the table- is Aria telling me that there isn't talent in Vegas that actually cares about customer service? Now on to the food- pancakes were hard - yuck and also no maple syrup- only berry toppings- WTF it's a brand new hotel not the Nugget! I would choose other places over this joint for the price.

w-V7U4F4lNPp8EKw5IcXsQ.text: Loved the food.  Lots of variety.  A much better than average selection.  A bit pricy.  Very nice atmosphere for a casino buffet - ask to sit by the windows.

kHzgzKRgtf4eVeeP4zNUfQ.text: Went there the other day for lunch with a co-worker. There is a lot of space devoted to the food but it seems half of it is taken up by cooking stations where nobody is cooking anything. There was a salad station where someone tosses your salad for you and a station where someone pours you some Miso soup. Seems like a waste of space. Overall there was not a lot of variety as each area had only 3-4 dishes to pick from. For me the best part of the buffet was the king crab legs, jumbo shrimp and the desert area. Not worth the price.

3COmkr91DeqdZZN0ME3AyQ.text: Boring! Have to say I was very disappointed. The selection was limited and the quality was just ok. For the price. I would rather have the Belagio or Wynn.

EEARwRlyBafF1P61haLcWw.text: After reading some of the other reviews here, I almost didn't go to this buffet which would have been a mistake.  Some of the points mentioned by the other reviewers while True, don't equate to a 1 or 2 star rating.  Yes, the shrimp was located a long way from the crab legs, the Asian items at this buffet are not the greatest, etc.  buth this place serves quality food.  I found the atmosphere to be dependent on where you are sitting.  The middle area is most pleasant with the dimmed lighting.  Sitting on some of the edges may make the place seem more cafeteria like.  The Food:  I ate the weeked gourmet buffet (which costs a bit more).  They had rack of lamb, leg of lamb, sucking pig, and many more great tasting  rare items.  Even the taste and quality of the none entree items (rice, potatoes etc.) was high.  The deserts here are exceptional.  They are exquisitely prepared on small desert trays.  I tried 5-6 different items, and they were all excellent.  They also had some gelato although the selection was not as great as at the Rio seafood buffet.    I'm only giving this four stars because I have not tried  the Bellagio.  I'd say the overall quality, value, and taste is  a bit higher than the Mandalay Bay buffet (which is also very good).  I returned to the weekend dinner buffet in January 2011.  The prices seem a bit higher, but they now give you half a lobster ($5 extra for a whole lobster) and house wines with your dinner.  The various entrees and side dishes (great garlic naan) are still excellent as was the service.  The desert selections were not as large as when they first opened.

c4JkzbyIMnmU0rgB2fPs1Q.text: A bunch of us were staying at the Aria so we figured why not give the buffet a try.  It was a monday night and the place was about 70% empty.  It's actually really refreshing to not having to wait in line for buffet.  I even had to wait in line for Orleans!  Anyway, -1 star because there were no discounts for children.  ARE YOU KIDDING ME!  How is it fair that both my 4 and 6 year olds have to pay full price!  Well, we're already there and were too lazy to go anywhere else.    The waitress came over and took our drink orders (20 people).  I asked about their special guava or passion fruit drink that my friend raved about when they first opened.  She said they stopped serving that because some people were allergic to it. ALLERGIC to guava? I didn't believe that BS. -1 star.   Now to the food.  Presentation were nice.  Cooked food look decent.  My favorite was the sauteed scallops and chinese broccoli.  Crabs legs were a disappointment. -1  They were not fresh and can't compare to M Resort or Wynn.  Sushi section looked very scary.-1  They should be ashamed of themselves for calling that sushi. Dessert section was really good.  Tried about 6 different ones and they were all excellent +1.     Looked over at my kids' plates and I saw the most expensive french fries and chicken nuggets I've ever paid for.  -1 star. Will not try this buffet again unless it's comped.

y1Pw3cmuGMRjk_FwNciBrw.text: Came here for lunch and it was good enough.  King crab legs were already cut in half so that was nice and convinient.  One guy in our party was pretty messed up and they didn't deny him entry which was nice.  They even got him something to drink while we were waiting in line.  Thanks.

1G7eayyAB02udHKBkKe3uQ.text: Less money but also less quality. We went to the Bacchanal buffet before this and this one did not match up. It is really a case of you get what you pay for! A positive experience overall, but not the best out there.

gWkyd6gZiRWxExc_oqAeqw.text: I will start off by saying... $84 for two Sunday brunch buffets and bottomless mimosas... holy shit!  We were told about the brunch by a good friend so we thought that we'd wait until Sunday before we left to indulge. We had checked out brunch pricing on Friday but didn't realize that there was such a significant price difference between Fridays brunch and Sunday's.  I am willing to pay a good amount for bottomless mimosas, but the bottomless mimosas were only $6 each.  Two brunch buffets $72?  Wow, shame on me for paying that.  What I will say is that we made sure to get our monies worth of that buffet and those mimosas! The buffet was well stocked but nothing too irresistible.  They had a little of everything... an omelet bar (a brunch staple), pancakes, waffles and French toast, all the eggs, bacon and sausage one could ask for.  The buffet had a salad bar, a little Mexican food, a little Chinese food, some sushi, and a touch of Italian.  The dessert bar was adorned with beautiful confections and various types of gelato.  The real star of the show were the crab legs.  Mounded high like fresh picked corn at a farmer's market, the crab was plentiful.  Served with drawn butter and lemon wedges, it was chilled and delicious.  The only thing lacking... a little crab fork. Our plates were cleared quickly and our server was friendly and generous with the mimosa refills.  We ate our weight in crab legs and drank as many mimosas as we could put away.  A solid 3 1/2 stars is what I'd give the buffet.  I may be back some day!

photos.caption: Photo of The Buffet at ARIA - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Get your monies worth, lots of crab legs and mimosas!!

4ERVDXijXR3ICxrFY0m48Q.text: It's not the Bellagio which in my mind is still the best buffet in town. But food was decent and pretty good selection! The Italian station makes one let's to order and it was perfect!

3FBe5K5TGh1KeD7guYlM0A.text: Maybe I just came at a really good time, but this was the best buffet experience that I've ever had in Las Vegas. There were no lines and there was an abundant amount of Crab Legs just waiting for me. Get them steamed and they're 100 times more tastier. That pretty much makes this place the great buffet it is.  It wasn't busy and about everything I ate was flavorful. Service was quick and the price was a steal ($20).  This is the buffet you should go to in Las Vegas. In the future, maybe this will change? Who knows. Oh well. At least for now, this place ranks the best in my book.

oAJz3fqQtZwP6KGTCxVVYw.text: A great selection with some hits and misses. If the food was only hot like it should be this place would be a solid 4 stars. The number one problem is most everything is cold or Luke warm. The pork dumplings, shrimp and crab legs are pretty good. For the price I think there are better choices. The server was on the ball and really took good care of us.

s6srGu1SyvUoCHr-5QPnnA.text: Starting off pretty pissed off because these six guys were able to cut the entire line by bribing the front desk person $20. And Aria's line person or the cashier were ok with it. When asked about it they were like "no they didn't give me any money, I didn't know they cut." Spoke to manager. Food is ok, generally its a crappier version of the M hotel buffet for more money. Service good. Line cutting horrible. Not worth the price, we were comp but it would have been $36 a person.  Definitely not worth it.

HmFsbvc_WS4SbmMgXPtMdQ.text: Decor = NEW nice and clean.  Good number of seating.  The food counter wraps the seating area.  It makes it easier to get food and not run into people (like Paris)  Service = Disappointed.  :(  Our waiter behave as if we owe him or something. poor poor service.   They will add 18% to your large table.  Food/Drinks = Lunch has crabs (all cut) :) Good amount of selection. Desserts look good.  Gelatos too!!!  yum    Value =  $15.99 breakfast M-F, $23.99? for Sat and Sun.  pp before tax/tips  Average for buffet in LV.  Kid Friendly =OK...  Recommendation = Try it if you are new in town.  Better than Paris but not as good as Bellagio's. :)

Pp9_FmwLIZt3emCww0Jh1Q.text: Wish I was there for breakfast / lunch. But hot dog! That craaaab was gooooood~! The first thing you see is the dessert on the left side. There's some really good cheesecake, a variety of ice creams, and a bunch of baked stuff that you just wanna attack first before getting towards the back.  They have a quaint selection of deli and a fair amount of MEAT in the back. Towards the center is seafood and salad and though there wasn't much of a selection for sushi, the rolls that were there were pretty good. You can also make your own salad and they even have blue cheese. (YUCK).  The one thing I was probably disappointed about that night was the tandori chicken. Otherwise, damn, that butter chicken and the naan...HELLLLLO~!   I think the quality of the food was pretty good though it can probably tear a whole in your pocket.

LzDDIBvkgedsWMXV7QhYAA.text: Ate here last night, and was surprised by the elevated "holiday meal" price. Selection of food was pretty good, though nothing tasted amazing.  Now for the bad news: my poor fiance got such terrible food poisoning he hasn't been able to get out of bed today except to stumble to the bathroom to throw up.    Needless to say we won't be going back, and I strongly caution anyone considering going!

0uypQM_EowSFRJCEincnYg.text: So Torn about this one!  This past weekend might not be the best indicator as I paid a $10 premium ($47.95) because it was Labor day weekend.  However, with the 37.95 price in mind, I'll do this review.  This really has only one competitor, and that is the Wynn Buffet.  Let's do a head to head with that.  Definitely a notch below bacchanal and Wicked spoons like others have mentioned.  Seafood -   The Wynn was lacking in this department.  Please see my other review.  Basically, cold king crab legs, not-so-fresh oysters, so-so sushi. The Aria did not do much better; however, they offered two types of crab legs including a cold and hot selection.  Match that with the cocktail shrimp and muscles... this round is by far in favor of the Aria.  There was a few other things but it escapes me right now. winner - Aria  Carvery -  The Wynn wins hands down - but with a catch.  They were able to serve the best prime rib i've had on the strip.  Of course, it is a little hit or miss, but the piece I received was perfect.   The Aria was terrible.  All the meats, sausages, chicken, "new york steak,"  and lamp were overcooked.  The cook, who i talked to, explained that the prime rib isn't cooked at the same kitchen and is kept warm under a heat lamp before being rolled out.  It explains the overcooked prime rib.  However, there was a surf and turf station so unique to the Vegas strip that it nearly pulls this one out of the gutter.  The sirloin steak is prepped separately and was THE BEST steak i've had on the strip.  Easily comparable to restaurant steak I've eaten in SF or downtown LA.   The dish alone, with the lobster topping is probably worth $15 alone.  If the prime rib was half as good as this, I'd be telling you to go to the Aria right now.  WIth that said, I don't think it was enough to pull a win over the wynn. Winner - Wynn  Variety -  Wynn had a decent variety.  I liked its unique salad creations, its variety of meats and of course its desserts.  However, it was still limited in uniqueness.  The aria had variety indeed.  It showcases indian cuisines which is pretty unique.  Their Nan bread is good and so is the humus.  There wasn't an abundance of things for indian food though.  The aria also displayed lobster bisque, tomato basil, and new england clam chowder.  I've had better clam chowder, but that's a different topic.  I would say it was on par with the wynn.  As mentioned in the carvery, the surf and turf station stands out prominently.  So for that reason, i'll give this round to the Aria. winner - aria  dessert -  Just go to the wynn.  Nothing really special at the Aria.   winner - dessert  VALUE-  Ok, so if I had 37.95 to spend... this is tough.  I would say the aria because I just expect so much more when I go to the wynn.  The service and decor is better at the Aria.  Everytime I left the table, my seat was cleared of all my previous plates.  That's impressive.  I'm also asked if I would like another "drink" every so often, at which point I am able to change my orange juice to a soda.  I don't often really like to keep drinking orange juice throughout the meal.  Is this really a 4 star place?  Not really, but there's enough people leaving 1 star on here that if I gave it a 4 it wouldn't hurt.  They're definitely not an AVERAGE (3 star) buffet.    Spend the extra $10 and go to wicked spoon :)

Y7xy3qOo0EOWIgsKzOtfCw.text: Food is ok...  Wide variety. Line can be long 20-30 minute wait and my advice is to order water with whatever you are drinking or ordee two waters... Getting your drinks can take a LONG time... A long long time...Not saying its bad, but I win't go back...Due to the time it took to get drinks at both a dinner and breakfast

i9BTGX0t4O5e_A9igeuMCg.text: King crab legs for the win! Almost every buffet on the strip offers some sort of crab legs but with different options on opening them. These are cut open taking all of the hard work out of it for you! Many other options from around the world including Italian, Mexican, Indian, Chinese and Japanese. Lots of vegetarian and gluten free options. The winner in the dessert area was the blood orange (sugar free) panna cotta. Service was great keeping your drinks refilled and plates cleared. Beautiful bright clean atmosphere and even an option for bottomless beverages for another 12.99 which includes beers, mimosas, sangrias, wine, Bloody Mary and bellinis!

photos.caption: Photo of The Buffet at ARIA - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of The Buffet at ARIA - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of The Buffet at ARIA - Las Vegas, NV, United States

e5MlaqUoaz_lVSEYR5K3iw.text: The Aria Buffet has a lot of selection but then all hotels do. The food seemed bland and too many items are pre cooked and just sitting under heat lamps or not at all in the case of the soggy waffles! I tried the omelet station and the omelet is okay, but the beef at the carving station was tough and grisly. I don't fault Aria but any mass produced Buffett item that sits under heat lamps for awhile. As for the employees there, one was quite rude to me when I asked if they were still serving breakfast. The guy basically lectured me to open my eyes and look around. Pathetic excuse for a hospitality worker. As for the price, $300.00 was a lot to pay for 6 persons. I feel the service and quality of food is better at the Aria Cafe to which we are there twice on my trip. My personal recommendation is to dine at the Aria Cafe instead. Fresher and better quality food and the service there is better with nicer servers!

HkFx2JK-1Aoad61aOQBZ0Q.text: Clean, modern look and decor  Food: Good variety which consists of japanese, italian, indian, and normal buffet fixings of barbeque, salad and veggies. Highlights are: vanilla gelato - SO GOOD! I had to go back for seconds. Grab some of the cookies (which were soft and yummy) strategically placed at the end of the table and you have a delicious combo of cookies + gelato :)!   I went for lunch with a few friends and liked the variety that the buffet offers. The crab legs were decent and the prime rib was juicy but lacked flavor. I also really liked the pesto pizza. There wasn't a wait when I came. I'd recommend it if you are in the area but don't go out of your way to come here.

aYRCW7AFM5bFyZmtBuh4DA.text: I'm no newbie when it comes to Vegas buffets - I've traversed Caesar's Buffet of Buffets twice. But for me, Aria's is the best! The day after I visited, I went to Bacchanal for dinner and spent the whole time wishing it was half as good as Aria  I spent an embarrassing amount of time playing and accumulating reward points on the MyVegas game so I redeemed some for a bogo offer on a breakfast or lunch buffet.   My boyfriend and I arrived around 10:15am on a Thursday. There was about a 5 minute wait. We opted for the unlimited beverages - choices included beer, mimosas, bloody Mary's, sangria, cranberry spritzer, etc. (much nicer than Bacchanal, where I had to stick to one drink!). Our waitress was super friendly (best service we had all trip) and most importantly, kept the drinks rolling!  There were a ton of choices for breakfast - traditional  options like eggs and bacon, assorted waffles , carved meats, congee, burritos, smoked salmon, made to order eggs Benedict, omelette station, etc.   We must've timed it very well as lunch items came out soon after. Lots of seafood options, including 2 types of mussels, crawfish, coconut shrimp, peel-and-eat shrimp, and fried fish. The best item, however, was the crab! I actually hate how some buffets split the legs and keep them chilled. Here, you could get them whole and warm! They did score some of the harder pieces to crack, like the claw, which was much appreciated.  After all of that and a scoop of green tea gelato, I was a happy camper, ready to gamble my savings away. I'm really over the hype of Vegas buffets, but I'll be sure to hit Aria every time I visit!  Pro tip: if you have a Visa Signature card and book your stay with Aria, you can get free breakfast buffets for 2 every day

0vUCiHpuqKCM60CgMQZ6pw.text: I broke rule number 1 of getting the bang for you buck at a buffet, I didn't do the full walk around before getting my plate! For $35 I had Saturday brunch at the buffet at Aria. Over looking the expansive pool area, the dinning room is filled with light, plenty of space, and amazing 80's music buzzing softly in the back ground. It might have been Hall and Oates' fault I broke rule number one, hearing "Kiss on My List" my feet where moving in the trajectory of the food. I hadn't even waited for my drink order before I was loading up on a plate of King Crab legs (and a small bowl of clarified butter)! I was at least smart enough to set the legs on the table and return for a fresh plate.  Amazingly juicy steak, fresh, thick cuts of smoked bacon, omelet bar, shrimp bar, benedicts, and bacon and banana bread, oh my! My plate, already teetering precariously on a precipice of spicy house potatoes, I could only stare in awe as I walked past the second half of the buffet (YES, there was a whole other half)!! Several different scrambles, bacon, sausages, gravies, another omelet bar, and an entire lunch section of asian inspired dishes including chicken congee!!! I didn't manage to get everything I wanted, but I tasted mostly everything!  All of the food was good, solid, and sometimes actually stellar, and way above par of ANY buffet I've been to in Vegas. The hash-brown balls were to die for. The table was already loaded up with flutes of champagne (Domain St. Michelle....not bad for all U Can Drink champagne!!)! and small containers of OJ if we wanted to mix (And we did)! Our waitress was AMAZING, witty, funny and fast. The drinks never stopped flowing, and we stayed there for OVER TWO HOURS!! I needed to sit by the pool for a nap afterward! I ate my $35 and then twice as much. This is my new default brunch spot in Vegas..FULL STOP!

E0p3CcPehyGvT5TpJQeouA.text: I was there this week the food was super freeh, I was actually amazed at how fresh!!! Definitely recommend if your in the area stop by, for the price you can't beat it! Amazing fried rice,  fresh crab legs!!! Gelato, amazing desserts!!

0seIsr6UagdXINxRHI6O2w.text: Hundreds of feet of food, but not a single green vegetable outside of the salad. I came here expecting one of the top buffets, and was disappointed to find it average at best, and over-priced. The crab is not fresh. The ethnic food is bland. They do have a very nice dessert section. But this is not up to par with Wynn or even Planet Hollywood or Paris buffets... And it is a long walk to get there.

sKsUCCGCN52_20ruS1aRcg.text: Overall, decent food and dessert variety. Much smaller in comparison to the buffet at the Rio. Service was good.

photos.caption: Photo of The Buffet at ARIA - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Sweets and more sweets

YKXcgcZAil_eW3ETNJQWiA.text: I really liked it. Pretty cheap considering the Hotel is a newer build. ($35 or less a person)  Came here for a Brunch after my friend's Wedding (Sweeet). Did not have to wait in line, just got seated and was good to go gorge myself.  What I ate: Crab Legs (Skinny side, but plentiful - I bring my A-Game with Shellfish) Chicken Sausage: Slightly sweet and super juicy - me likey Prime Rib: Stay away from - overcooked and dry Lettuce Cup: Slightly spicy, really flavorful Smoked Salmon: I like this a lot. Not overly fishy, moist and not too oily Breakfast Sausage: Ew, I didn't like this. :( Spicy Tuna roll: Meh, not mind blowing Veggies: A-Okay Flan: Not amazing, but good Snickers "Bar": GODDAMMIT THIS IS GOOD Peanut Butter Blonde: Too crumbly Smores Cake: Too much chocolate, not in a good way- Beautiful though Carrot Cake: Not too sweet, S'okay  Overall - I would probably come back. The price is right and the food was good.

SPT3Hw1RS_Px-CUAzCXAfw.text: One of the best buffets I've ever had in LV.  Our family usually come here for weekday brunch time and this time we came for dinner. We went on a Wednesday at around 4pm and the place was pretty empty and no line at all.  My favorite has to be the crusted salmon, crab, and the made-to-order pastas. Especially love their pasta! The guy making the pasta was so nice and even made a half-order pasta for me. The crab is kind of too salty for my tastes but with lemon it tastes pretty good. Dessert is also pretty amazing too. Was expecting some Creme brulee for dessert but they didn't have any his time. Also love the Thai tea drink here!  Overall had a better experience than any other time here at the buffet. Definitely wanna be back for dinner some other time we visit LV.

dhgu437Pceph5kmUnX9SSA.text: The buffet has amazing food! We were seated at a table we didn't like and kindly asked if we could move to a table close to a window and the waiter didn't get mad or look annoyed and she gladly cleaned a table for us and moved us even though we had already ate a plate. Thank you Catalina for the amazing service !!!

Tj9X2bO_BiMCzU7JbZ8dHA.text: It's like a 3.5.  Location, it's so much better than most.  It's on a floor above the casino so you're not going to be eating in a smoky venue.  Decor, it's newer and sleeker.  Selection of food, I could be wrong but it feels smaller than most but it's fine.  I didn't want more options.  At least the options here are unique --  like artichoke dip (which was bomb), poke (which was great), pho (which was adequate), paella (which was salty).  I think a lot of things could be salted less since there's salt and pepper on the table.  Desserts, I liked the popcorn.  Limited fruit selection in my opinion.  The ice cream looked good but it was really sweet, like added sugar sweet.  I would describe it as watery sugar and flavor.  Super sad the most about this because I love ice cream and it looked great.  Line, went at 12 and it was about a half hour wake on Tuesday, we were like 1.5 line away from the cashier.    Value, for a BOGO, it's decent.  If full price, I wouldn't be as okay.  Tip, mix the horchata with the coffee if you like horchata coffee which I do.

zhW_JOkC4c-Hs80fGboxYQ.text: Let me start off by saying I am a local. The Buffet at the Aria has been my go to buffet ever since it opened. I have recommended this buffet to a number of family, friends, and out of state visitors.  But after Mother's Day shenanigans that will NEVER happen again.  My family and I (7 adults $40.99 + 5 children $20.99) could have spent Mother's Day at ANY restaurant but chose to eat at the Aria, please remember that. To be harassed by the older male manager in the suit was unacceptable and unprofessional! If you're going to stand next to my family's table and continue to stare at us, the professional thing he could have done was speak and smile.  If everyone had as much customer service as the employees at the registers I would have given four stars. I guess they have so many tourist visiting they can care less about losing a loyal local customer. Remember today in 2019, word of mouth speaks volumes. Hope every mother had a wonderful Mother's Day!  If it wasn't for that creepy manager, my family would have had a perfect Mother's Day.

bVfAMRh1hz6WvseuxOFDZw.text: Great selection and lots of foods from around the world. Loved the seafood station with salmon, crab legs, shrimp and grits, seared tuna and steam claims to order.   The price is a little high but worth it if you want to experience a True over the top Vegas buffet.

photos.caption: Photo of The Buffet at ARIA - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of The Buffet at ARIA - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of The Buffet at ARIA - Las Vegas, NV, United States

9ahX-LsBUKCzid89p_p7_w.text: I ate there 8/14/2019. If you see a good 5 star review of this place it is likely fake...My experience was pathetic. Way over priced, my waitress was the worst I have experienced. She never helped me, never cleared off dishes, brought drinks 20 minutes late, I sat at a dirty table...The crab station was mostly empty with picked through pieces, junk. No shrimp, 2 guys behind the counter had bad attitudes, sushi there was dried out junk. No fish offerings. The carving station had cheap beef, tasteless..My bill was $44.00 and a ripp off..Never come to this place. I won't talk about the other foods, all mostly cheap stuff..Shame on Aria...

SeTXWp4lsJnElyBwHLlNBA.text: Yikes. My friends warned me not to eat here. I should've listened. Food was less than mediocre. I did like the poke bowl though. They had salmon, tuna, and eel. Quite good but not worth a return visit.

IcPcXIQnE6xqpjXxegBkWw.text: It is definitely one of the worst buffet I had in Vegas for this price. The seafood is definitely not fresh and I end up sick and not sure what to do... Wish can get $ back and maybe even sue them to find out what went wrong with the food.

kG-oiXl09kXMz5IEF2LK8Q.text: My problems I purchased all day pass for the buffet. This is the worst buffet in Vegas they keep the same food from the morning breakfast to the evening dinner without any refreshing. I was to give it zero star if it was possible check out theses pictures and you can tell how we suffer from that day. I will never go back again to This Aria buffet

Photo of The Buffet at ARIA - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Hummus
Photo of The Buffet at ARIA - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Non edible

af9AGhc62LkTTYT0wR5YmQ.text: This was our first meal in the Aria. We decided to do an early dinner at the buffet, and arrived around 4pm. After using a coupon for a buy one get one free, this brought the cost down to around $40 for two people. We had no wait and were seated promptly.  My favorite stop is always the seafood section. Most notable were the hot crab legs, the oyster and clam dishes that they cooked fresh for you, and the Hawaiian poke which also was prepared fresh. I would have rated this as a five- but it still is just a step below Bacchanal in its carvery area and the oysters were limited to oysters Rockefeller and did not include oysters on the half shell. The desserts were typical of a Vegas buffet with the exception of a staff member that spent much time at the gelato display setting up labels but not offering the full selection to patrons. Service was excellent, especially considering a change in staffing from lunch to dinner.  We will certainly go back to this excellent buffet and truly enjoyed the experience.

c0qF5FuptnHyZmxeGqjzhg.text: I have been here many times and always thought it was decent for the local price but tonight we paid a "holiday" premium of 48.99 a person. I am fine with that as long as the food is great but what a disappointment tonight.   No lamb Prime rib was well done Zucchini & other grilled veggies were undercooked Food was dried up from sitting too long Place was litterally empty at 530pm and sevice was nowhere to be found, drinks sat empty most of the time Waiter dropped my unused spoon and didnt bother replacing it so i got up and took one off another table Crab legs were the tiniest i have ever seen served there and i have been there around 30+ times Fried chicken should be called over cooked dried garbage chicken Sausages were dried and wrinkly from sitting too long Oysters looked so awful i am appalled they dare serve that at all  Come to think of it, nothing was fresh nor good tonight. Especially the waiter who seemed like he was having a really bad day. I sat in front of the desert area if that helps management figure out who was working. I noticed 3 tables where the waiter immediately picked up the reciept book to check for a tip and there was none to be found. Things need to change if you expect people to pay a premium and get old food and bad service with a hint of food poisoning. Especially charging "holiday" pricing when you don't offer anything special from any other day except a bigger bill.

GW7bGX-uT8RCJeqMrmg2-Q.text: Do not waste your time and money here... go to the BACCHANAL @ Caesar's Palace instead, it's worth the wait! With the Aria Buffet, still at least an hour wait, unless you're an MLife Gold and up, you get VIP entrance... Servers on the floor and Chefs @ the food stations were rude, looks like they're way understaffed, but they sure don't like their jobs... I'm a foodie and this is probably the worst place I've ever eaten at... Food did not taste right at all, too much salt on everything, including the crab legs, it's like dipped in salt. Deserts were tasteless. To top it all, their breads had fruit flies. Not sure how this is being tolerated by MGM-Service, Quality of Food, Safety. I'm absolutely disappointed!

7F08aNetk8-34hV7Vu1EuQ.text: This buffet was just ok, especially compared to other buffets on the strip. I wouldn't pay full price for dinner if I come back. I used a myVEGAS coupon for buy 1 get 1 free. I like the location on the 2nd floor of Aria. It's quieter up there away from the casino. The environment is family friendly and there were plenty of tables that had children. There is a special line for MLife members (Pearl and higher). This special line still took 15 minutes to be seated with 3 small parties ahead of us. There was a good amount of selection on the buffet. I felt like a good amount of the food I sampled was under seasoned. They serve unlimited crab legs, but only put out one pan at a time. It only took a handful of people to grab crab legs and they were gone. Then everyone else would stand around and wait (other Vegas buffets I've been to actually plate the legs for you in a line so this problem doesn't happen). My favorite item was the truffle potatoes. The desserts did not disappoint at all! I loved them all!  Service was overall good. Our plates were always cleared and our waters were never empty.

ykFp-67T8vHnewdofbrAyQ.text: The Buffet at Aria is one of my new favorites. It has a lot of the same food that the Bacchanal buffet has at Caesars but it's not as pricey. Caesar's has the fresh juice and the crepes made to order but if you don't care about those items I think the food is similar.  If you are a local there is a locals discount during the week which is about $30.00 a person . The good news about going during the week is they still serve crab legs during dinner and it isn't as crowded as the weekend.   I liked the fact that during dinner you not only get the crab legs but they can make you Pan Roast (seafood cooked in a red broth served with rice) to order. They only sprinkle a little rice in it but you can add more white rice it is near the Pho. Yes there is also Pho (Vietnamese soup) for those who love soup like I do especially in this chilly weather. The Pan Roast had a nice kick to it and it was super tasty but I think it could do without this pink and white seafood block they put in it though.  They also have a Cajun type of stew with corn ,sausage , shrimp that is pretty good too. Dinner and brunch both have creative salads to choose from. My favorites contained plenty of mushrooms, beets and grapefruit.  If you are there during brunch do me a favor and get a couple of little plates of the baby clams in the garlic sauce it is to die for!! Trust me!

photos.caption: Photo of The Buffet at ARIA - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of The Buffet at ARIA - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of The Buffet at ARIA - Las Vegas, NV, United States

7opCpWUQbqB0Atag_ykxOg.text: One of my favorite buffets on the strip.   I went when the Aria first opened almost nine years ago and my family was pleasantly surprised by the food as well as the atmosphere of the buffet in which won the hearts of my family.  This past week I'd re-visited the buffet to see if it was as good as I remembered and the Aria didn't disappoint!  I attempted the all-day pass that was offered and it made the whole experience pleasant. The lighting is all natural light, which is very comfortable to dine in a well-lit environment.  The food is always fresh with no food item that was disappointing.   Carving Station - Didn't try the prime rib or steak, but the pork ribs were very tasty, the sausages were also well seasoned.  Seafood - Fresh and fun to eat in mass, although getting "sweet" crab was a hit or miss.  Indian - Having Nan was amazing with different curry options Asian - Being Asian, I wouldn't take up space with buffet Chinese food, but the items they served were decent to satisfy an Asian food craving Desserts - The different options were delicious, although was disappointed with the ice cream selections with few fruity options.   Would definitely go to the Aria again and recommend the buffet as a cheaper but just as good option as any of the other buffet on the strip!

v490W2nDWBpza6DqwvKtGQ.text: This buffet was SO underwhelming. I was very disappointed at the quality of this buffet considering it's inside one of the nicer hotels in Vegas.   Luckily, I was able to redeem a 2 for 1 deal for dinner using points from the MyVegas app. Don't waste your money paying full price here!!   **This place is not worth waiting 1-2 hours!! Find another place to eat.   PROS:  -Good juices: Horchata and watermelon juice were pretty tasty -A bit cheaper than other buffets  -Our server was kind  CONS:  -Came here for an EARLY dinner. Lots of empty tables, but we had to wait a good 15-20 minutes to get seated. Not sure why there was a wait, but the people that were walking us to our seats were SO slow. I was observing them, and they walk at a snail's pace with absolutely no rush in seating guests standing in line.   -Many of the dishes were SO dirty. I had to find clean plates from the stack. The little juice cups were even dirtier. It was hard to find clean ones. So gross!!   -I've been to plenty of Vegas buffets, and this one is probably one of the smallest ones I've been to. The selection is not great!!! I usually eat till I'm dying full, but I barely ate anything while I was here. I know seafood is a huge selling point for buffets, but I felt like the seafood selection here was meh!   -The food did not have proper signs or was missing signs. I had no idea what was being displayed. I'm reading through the reviews, and I'm seeing that this is common here.   -I grabbed a small bowl of food that was sitting under some heated lamp, and it burned my skin. I don't know how people touch the dishes at such high heat. I had to ask the worker to put it on my plate for me.   TIP- Pay extra money and eat at Bacchanal at Caesar's Palace. This place is worth the money in my opinion.

y3Fixl3gcLiBPJICYAHhOg.text: This was the worst buffet ever. The food was just horrible. I was only able to eat from the salad bar and shrimp cocktail. I would not recommend this place :(.

m3DwbvpwhaiFDSJ6OgqJZQ.text: We came here for Monday lunch before our flight back to San Diego, and I was pleasantly surprised by the selection!  It wasn't a busy time, and we didn't have much of a wait. We paid and were seated right away.  I wish I had know about this place sooner. My whole family really enjoyed the variety. I had a chance to eat ramen, buttered clams, hot mussels, menudo, Dungeness, smoked salmon, dim sum, crab claws. Indian curry, and many breakfast items! In addition they had Thai tea and Jamaica juice that you can pour at your discretion.   For the price, I think it was well worth. I might even say I enjoyed this place more than the Wicked Spoon. It definitely had the flavors and selection of food I was looking for. Definitely check it out!

photos.caption: Photo of The Buffet at ARIA - Las Vegas, NV, United States

dJCunedNV92guTE14E8SeA.text: Soooo yummy!!! I've been daydreaming of the buffet even after visiting. It was $49.99 per person on memorial day because of the holiday. I believe normally is $39.99. They have a wide variety of selections especially when it comes to different cultures. My favorite was the seafood and the steak bar. I wish my stomach could have held more because I definitely would have eaten more.

photos.caption: Photo of The Buffet at ARIA - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of The Buffet at ARIA - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of The Buffet at ARIA - Las Vegas, NV, United States

8r5365EZMQ2XbCsJ7MflOQ.text: I am a regular and Aria and therefore a regular at The Buffet. To be very honest, it is NOT that great and very over-priced for the quality of food you get. Most of the time the food is not fresh, the options rarely change (I guess that's a good thing if you want consistency). Depending on which waitress you get, getting something to drink can take a long time. Another thing that bothers me is that they make you wait forever to sit down when you clearly can see half the place is empty. This tells me they are understaffed and can't seat everyone or nobody will get drinks. So to summarize: too expensive, low quality and mediocre service.   If you want variety, then try the buffet. If you want a good quality meal, then Aria offers up some awesome restaurants like Lemongrass, Javier's and Blossom.

gmvaSbAISRm8KmIDHl35Eg.text: Tried the Aria for the first time this trip and actually ended up going a second time because we were so impressed with it. The service was outstanding  (never had to ask for a refill) and the food was hot and full of flavor. Usually buffets have good to mediocre food but Aria was better then most (I've been to buffets at Bellagio, Wynn, and Caesars). The short rib with mashed potatoes is amazing, all of their meats were full of flavor and cooked perfectly, they had a salmon taco, paella, pizza  and sliders that were delicious, and their Mexican station was amazing!!!! I will say the desserts are better at the Wynn, but this is the best buffet on the trip overall right now.

_O78_2Rg4XlJIbkei8qXtA.text: Terrible buffet for the price! Scraps for crab, their so called king crab isn't even worth putting on your plate. The salmon was dryer than dry and all their beef that they served was cold and well done. This buffet should be $15.99 for the quality of food... we won't be back!

HRdwH5RW9_Qrph6ZLRCvOQ.text: Besides poor Asian dishes ,else all must try. Love their sea food ( fish market) , Salad bar & sweets. Very nice service. This was my first time here but definitely will be back for more.

photos.caption: Photo of The Buffet at ARIA - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Aria buffet/small parts of sweets. Yummy!!

LUU5AXONbqWi_Z2W49juEA.text: Ate there for breakfast. Seafood was very very old and partially frozen and inedible. I was concerned about getting sick it was so bad. . All food not ready to go at seven AM. They gradual roll out of food. Expensive -30.00.   While it was breakfast in an incredibly beautiful hotel, I was very disappointed. Some of the other restaurants were exceptional.

Ke7l7RsZlmyAWL96VU7yhw.text: We had a nice dinner here with four guests. We showed up at around 6PM on a Thursday and it was quite slow. I wasn't expecting too much from this buffet, but one of my favorite items, snow crab legs, were so delicious here. They have two varieties: steamed and regular (on ice). The steamed was very fresh with a hint of sweetness to it. I had so many crabbie claws it made my guests a bit concerned. But they were so good!! There's a huge pail of butter right next to it, which only added to the satisfaction.   I also had the mashed taters, succulent prime rib and pork carved offerings, in addition to the wide variety of deserts (gelato, cakes, cookies, cupcakes, flan, etc.). I didn't get to the fruits and veggies but the seafood selection was pretty good. The sushi was a little lackluster with the highlight being salmon nigiri. However, I'd come here again just for the crab legs (they also have king crab on ice), and maybe the $12.99 bottomless cocktails.

pPqTA9lOpwvRcICQn11jGg.text: Buffet was pretty good. Good prime rib, beef ribs were delicious,  pho was actually good. After taxes, its 40.00 pp. We arrived at 9:30 and was told the food would only be available til 10:15, so we had to grab our food fast. The kids were able to eat pizza and spaghetti with meatballs. These buffets need to serve hamburgers and fries for kids. Otherwise there is nothing for the kids to eat and yet we are paying full price for them.

photos.caption: Photo of The Buffet at ARIA - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of The Buffet at ARIA - Las Vegas, NV, United States

wsZnMyGWsUmkQhbvKs_OQQ.text: We went to Vegas hearing all about the grandness of the buffets. Perhaps we were expecting too much.  Instead, we came away highly disappointed.  Pros: The dining area was simply but tastefully designed. Access to food choices was ample. There were a number of food choices. The wait staff was friendly.  Cons: The attempt at ethnic foods fell flat, as the food choices per ethnic station were extremely limited (want Mediterranean? Hummus or tabouhlea (so)). The focus seemed to be on providing large amounts of seafood over any other line of food, and the sushi which I chose wasn't very good. Much of the food wasn't hot or even barely warm. Quite frankly, the salad was about the tastiest item I chose. I could get a larger food selection at Ryan's or other buffet food location. The price was astronomical for the quality and diversity received in return.  While we found the Aria hotel delightful, the Buffet? Not so much.

_Ld6616bmgPh_SGHUNcWzg.text: This is the Vegas buffet I have been to the most. Usually I'll go for brunch, but this time since I was staying at the Aria I decided that I would go for dinner. I went around 7pm on a Wednesday, and paid $37. I was in the fast lane due to a pearl card so only waited a couple minutes to enter. I seriously love this buffet. In the mornings they have pork belly that melts in your mouth along with a ton of delicious options. For dinner I enjoyed some great pizza, decent sushi, some prime rib, really good creamed spinach, some great salmon, and the winner of this buffet was the beef that they had at the Italian station. (not sure exact type). One of the only downsides that I can say about this buffet is that they have crab legs which although cooked well, they are not sliced and they don't give you crackers so you spend a long time trying to get the meat out of them. I was pretty full after eating the delicious selection so I only had a couple desserts: a piece of sugar free coconut cream cake and some flan. There is a nice big gelato wheel with several flavors on it which I did not do this time, but in the past I have enjoyed the peanut butter gelato, but it was not on the wheel this time so I guess they rotate the flavors.

7TFtZXdJ4BaDd0fvTiyf-w.text: I enjoyed the breakfast buffet tremendously. This was the first time I'd eaten at this buffet and was pleased. I felt it was a good value for money. For $19.99 one can enjoy traditional favorites such as eggs and bacon, along with fresh fruit, a variety of breakfast meats including pork belly, some seafood, and Asian options among others. I opted for hot tea to drink but for an additional $12.99 one can choose a "bottomless" drink such as mimosa. Overall, I really enjoyed my meal and recommend it to first-timers and veterans alike.

photos.caption: Photo of The Buffet at ARIA - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Giant buttermilk pancakes

qWOfGb2yHkdu-7t3oxlm1A.text: Paid holiday brunch price of $38.99 each.  The price seems overpriced given the food selection available.  Not many selection to choose from and quality is not there,  Prime rib and crab legs seem okay but cannot compared with some of the buffets I have been to in LV.  Will not go again.  Half of the place is empty and they still hold people in line to get in.  Cashiers seem very disoriented.

QwPZmBnFrJ5Zt_PxuxuApw.text: I'm glad we didn't pay. We got a free buffet with our stay. Good selection of food but most food was average. Ambiance was lacking big time!!  I gave  my husband a hard time for wearing a t-shirt. Turns out it was pretty casual. I had much higher expectations as it was the Aria buffet (was thinking of a previous visit to the Bellagio buffet). Service, while they came through in the end was chaotic and lacking to start. We won't be going back.

4DtSDPYIUu068DMHYxZCSA.text: Okay I'd like to think of myself as a fair person and so it is with pleasure that I update my 2 stars to 4 for this buffet because since two years ago things have vastly improved and every dish we tried was delicious.  Based on this experience I'd definitely go again.

ir01izL_pIIWbBlcCS09Eg.text: I love the ambiance Aria brings and that includes the buffet.  I expected nothing less in terms of food selection and quality and it did not dissappoint.  They have your typical breakfast selection which includes cereal, fruits, pancakes, oats and they brought it up a notch. You not only have buttermilk pancakes, you can choose to have carrot pancake. They also have additional sides such as nutella.  They're brunch also includes seafood such as shrimps, crablegs, mussels, and even crawfish. I thought it was great because you get the bang out of your buck @ 9am. (Yep, came from the gym to the buffet).   I also like how they have a bit of everything from Breads, Cheese, salad, Asian dishes, Omelet bar, desserts, you name it, they have it. Don't expect a wide array of menu in each dish though. I was sorta dissapointed they didn't have macarons but its not a deal breaker for me.  For 2 people, we spent $70 including tax. It was $31+++ per person. I didn't put 5 stars because their Sunday brunch didn't include a glass of champagne or mimosa. You can order it separately but it.

CYtAGOR9HbMNyFwC6-HLQQ.text: Came here for Memorial Weekend brunch with my guy, impressed by the quality of food and the mega-attentive and friendly service- Flor is a gem!  Breakfast options were out in full force, with stars being the smoked eggs benedict available made to order by the omelet station- very tasty! Also memorable were the smoked trout and lox, and I'm a big fan of peel-and-eat shrimp and the ones here were large and meaty  Appreciated that there were many healthy options available, including the salad bar, lots of fresh fruit, and various oatmeal/parfait/grits stations with additional toppings.  The charcuterie area was quite nice, too, with a variety of sausages and all of the components for an amazing cheese plate- three cheeses, two dried meats, dried fruits, candied walnuts and roasted cashews. Very classy!  Cool to see dim sum available- haven't seen this at other places but wish the selection was a little larger. Was able to have lamb shu mai, and two other mislabelled items, but there seemed to be quite a few baskets out but only a few different items.  Was a little surprised to see the carving station available at brunch- BF took advantage of the prime rib, lamb leg, and rotisserie chicken, all of which he said were great. I tried the Yukon gold mashed potatoes, which were like heaven. No exaggeration, they were amazing!  Dessert was also impressive- all made by Jean Phillipe, super tasty and beautiful presentation. Chocolate raspberry cake pop was the favorite, would have preferred other cake pop flavors rather than so many plated cake slices. Cookies were dry and crunchy, and I prefer warm and chewy, so I did not sample any. The round, spinning ice cream case was a hit with kids and adults alike.  I'm a firm believer in quality and would rather have fewer options that are better-executed than a lot of mediocre dishes out for the sake of variety, so this is a place I prefer over some others.

7jO18638FlMTN65OlWUGsw.text: Food was a 5/5, but our server Meraf really dragged down this experience. Every single interaction we had with her, we had to initiate or flag down another server to get her attention. Every time we asked for a refill she would yell one minute and scurry away. She didn't seem happy to serve us at all, and even sounded frustrated when she was interacting with my parents who speak English with minor accents. My mom, at one point, didn't want to even ask for napkins because she was intimidated by this server's attitude towards our table. Expected a lot better service - at least at the level of what MGM GRAND servers treat us. I would've asked to be moved to a different server's area had the Buffet not been packed.

AIdZtFKEDS9erX7nt1dahA.text: Ambiance: 4 - The place is very clean, nicely decorated. Very simple and modern. The tables are pretty evenly separated so that the people sitting next to you don't feel like they're having dinner with you! Honestly, it's a pretty nice space to have a buffet!   Service: 3 - Service was just okay; our server wasn't super fast or even super friendly for that matter. You could definitely tell that she was tired and just wanted to get the job done.   Food: 2 - While there was a nice variety of food, it wasn't cooked very well and didn't taste all that great. A lot of things were either dry or tasteless. Also, there was a lot of bread floating around, which I didn't like. I came here for food, not bread!!   However, I did like the crab legs, one Mediterranean dip, one Chinese steamed dish, and the strawberry gelato (probably the best thing on the menu)!!! But, I didn't like enough of anything to come back. Though, if you are looking for a really expensive cup of strawberry gelato and nice ambiance, this would be the place for you!

mFQgAfRPJl0iK5fxA4BQGg.text: The experience eating here is not pleasant, the person took us to the table I told her we want to chained table, she refused. There only 3 kinds of sushi served, with the price we paid I expected more. The Chinese food was salty, the noodle soup wasn't good. The fruit only watermelon, cantaloupe, pineapple and melon, nothing special. The waiter served slow, need to asked to filled up the water. I will never go back!

Photo of The Buffet at ARIA - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of The Buffet at ARIA - Las Vegas, NV, United States

b9Mf80odRBsVE2aousZuoQ.text: Worst buffet in vegas. Beyond overrated. I went when first opened. Had a free lunch. Everything was terrible. I almost choked , their mahi wasnt cleaned and deboned. Had all fish bones in it.  Never in my life and eating seafood coast to coast have I had that happen. Shows they had a chef that doesn't know what hes doing. Fast forward to may 2017. I had a free dinner buffet. No lie I  was in and out in 17mins. Everything was dry, and luke warm. Even the chicken soup was cold. Its supposed to be this big fancy buffet but food, preparation, and temperature of the food served doesnt match ambiance. I hate that I wasted thousands of my players points on this waste. Thank god I didnt waste 41 bucks here. I have had better meals at vegas buffets that were 10 bucks and food was prepared, served and kept heated properly.

WeGV3hB3vUJS49RVXBStow.text: Great buffet for gluten free eaters. A chef will walk the floor with you upon request and tell you what you can have! They will also make you a gluten free pizza upon request.   Their mashed potatoes are killer and their gelato section is amazing. Sadly they sometimes stick pretzels in them (for aesthetics or flavor, who knows?) which leaves some options unnecessarily unavailable.   5/5 buffet for gluten free eaters!

EvoX3vnMXSS3EV1NXPHt1g.text: We had good service and food quality was excellent.  Don't expect real Indian or real Arabic type of food there, that part is ok, you need to go to a real Indian restaurant or a real Arabic restaurant for that. Other than that, the food was fresh and the fruit was fresh and sweet.  The cakes were fresh and moist and the tiramisu was point.  The price for the dinner Buffet was 39$ and that's about the normal price for eating buffet on the strip. The Buffet prices have gone up a lot since 1989 when I moved here to Las Vegas.  Expect to pay more for the Buffets in the more pricer hotels and during Holidays.

photos.caption: Photo of The Buffet at ARIA - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Desserts carrot cake, tiramisu and cake lollipop
Photo of The Buffet at ARIA - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Eating plenty of crab legs, my hubby was too busy for the camera

6UdL0ylpTltKee9_ko1VIA.text: First time I tried this buffet and I loved it ! They have a variety of different foods and they all tasted so yummy ! Especially the seafood. We went on a Sunday and it was about 35 or 38/ea and they had a deal that was 19.99 for two people for unlimited drinks & yes that included alcoholic beverages too!! If you love crab legs I recommend getting a full plate because everyone's fighting for it. If you don't go early you will have to wait about 45 mins to an hour witch isn't too bad. But I definitely recommend this buffet one of the best

8pjKIJyg9a3IC-McNcloVQ.text: That one star is for the RUDE employee at the cashier named GABRIELA. She fought with us because we pointed out her mistake. I dont care about the mistake it can be corrected. But her ATTITUDE was unacceptable! We are a veer tower resident/owner and we like dining at The Buffet and never experience such a bad customer service!

TAaJH4kFIM78uuwEQwyYtg.text: AMAZING BOMB DOT COM! the lady was so nice came for dinner but got charged for lunch price so that's a plus! my most favorite was the seafood of course!!

5l6q-klMOr-G-NjRD-Pupg.text: Pretty good for the price $26 got a bunch of selections...crab legs, crab claws, cocktail shrimps (cocktail sauce was so good!), fish n chips, egg benedict...just to name a few...indian food, mexican food, vietnamese noodle soup, chinese food...dim sum section was disappointing but still ok...surprised to see roast duck...there were much more that I didn't get to try...oh remember to save room for desserts!

Photo of The Buffet at ARIA - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of The Buffet at ARIA - Las Vegas, NV, United States

RC633IGaO46rd66s3BVc2g.text: I was so sad that this buffet, according to all the pictures and hype was so pathetic. I'm a Chef and I know it's not easy keeping buffets looking great when your getting hit hard by the hoards but it was not that busy and after waiting in the so called "Invited Guests " line for over 35 min I was very dissatisfied and disappointed. I really wanted crab and prime rib but before I got to those favorites I wanted some other bites. I could go into detail and write two pages but needless to say everything was sub par. From the Asian to the desserts. The prime rib was well done and tough and tasteless  and the crab was Snow crab not even split sitting in a pathetic pan where the dogs fought over minuscule mutilated legs and claws. I felt bad for my wife. She was really looking forward to a great buffet. Take my advise avoid this at all costs. Try a real buffet like Bellagio or Bacchanal. These people or F&B Director/chef should be ashamed!!

nOn84QYUtm5XCmQDuzVAEg.text: Nothing was over the top here- some of the veggies and dishes too cold for my liking. But the crab legs are totally worth it!! Also did endless cocktails, beer and wine. Good value for $17, get in 3 drinks. I'm from MS, so I know good crawfish- I wouldn't grab some again. Sushi and fish dishes were good. Didn't try the pizza, but that looked tasty. Cinnamon bread pudding with vanilla gelato was to die for!

toumA52Rx_YokJ1IEXtxEw.text: I have to say this buffet was quite underwhelming compared to most of the buffets I have been to in Vegas. Granted, I'm comparing this to Cosmo's Wicked Spoon or Ceasar's Bacchanal, which can be a drastic difference. We had to wait an hour since we arrived around noon. There were actually plenty of space, but there were not enough servers, hence the long lines. All the food were typical American buffet, nothing special or super yummy. Even the international food were not as impressive either. Aside from the Mac & Cheese reminding me of my childhood days at Hometown Buffet, nothing really stuck with me. I would much rather spend a bit more money on a higher qualify buffet.

9TFgbx7YPF-3NdBDHFjwig.text: i came here for breakfast with family & friends and i gotta say that it wasn't the best buffet i've been to. however the large varieties of food they served such as: mediterranean, asian, tandoori, latin, etc, was really a surprise! i never been to a buffet with that many varieties of food! the variety of foods were great, but the foods weren't in their best quality. i would recommend this place a 8/10, because of the food quality, but the variety they serve is really amazing.

QeFk6-jxC40ii9DfO23KIA.text: We arrived at 7:35 waited in line for well over an hour. Finally got a table and went to the buffet. The pasta station ran out of clean pots so they used the same pot over and over again so the pasta tasted like everyone else's. I do not eat seafood and my pasta tastes like seafood, and they ran out of chicken for the pasta. There was food all over the floors. The chair I was sitting in was so unsafe and wobbly. The poor lady sitting across from our table had her chair break on her, the leg fell off and she tumbled to the ground. Nothing was labeled so if you have a food allergy you are on your own to figure out what it is you might be eating. Not worth the price or the wait.

NwtfqVSULAux9U0kKPo_WA.text: It should be a nice buffet spot if you're into seafood. Personally, meat was whatever, but the seafood were better than bacchanal buffet. The wait wasn't so bad when I went around 7pm before catching a show. The server was really slow on getting us drinks so I recommend getting two drinks at a time whenever the server comes over.

JvGo8vh9bvfRR1nXOCJ75A.text: The food was great! Very clean atmosphere. Kinda pricy but it's vegas you know. My only bad comment is our server, Sonny was extremely rude and very unwelcoming! If I wasn't such a positive person, I would have let him ruin my entire experience there.

MnkWcYf5XMBPqp0Wcop7_w.text: Completely average. Unless it's free (comps, MyVegas) skip this for something more worthwhile. If you piled all the casino buffets in the US into one list this would probably make the top third.  They did have a decent selection of meats at the carving station and lots of seafood choices.

yPmVK6QNi9cmt8j9r5bFvA.text: For $37 per person I expect a lot more.  Used to go here for fresh shrimp cocktail but this time I was very disappointed.  Also, the crab legs are so skinny and it was too much work to get some out to f it.   The only bar I really like was the desert.
