Do you really want to market yourself as the center of Las Vegas, when you can't do a buffet correctly?  Yeah you have crab legs, but even the Mcdonalds of buffets have them these days.    You may have already lost this one to Cosmopolitan.  Cheaper, and better.   I recommend trying out Wicked Spoon.  It's worth the extra walk if you're staying at Aria.

ZONBP6o4-F4dLknD1UB_bQ.text: We had a resort credit so we ate here twice on a recent trip.  The food is good, even very good at times, but the service the first meal was bad and there is nothing that makes the meal stand out.  I did not like how you start the line at the crab legs, where everyone and their brother is waiting to squeeze as much crab on a plate as possible.  I thought the sushi was good for a buffet, and the deserts were also delicious and came with many choices.  The buffet is worth the money if you come just before lunch and get the breakfast price (about $15) but get to eat both breakfast and lunch foods (this is what we did the second day and that meal was a four star meal).   I don't eat crab legs, but if you do you would probably rate this as four stars because everyone who was eating them seemed very happy and those things certainly are not cheap at a non-buffet place .

Wc9jdYWEXZwwMrDnhv0BgA.text: No line at 2p on Saturday, still pricey at $32 but it's aria. They still had breakfast out, which is fine by me because it was just a small section. Dinner and lunch menu items were out to enjoy. Same variety as other nice casinos. Love the music that they play, very adult contemporary. Quick to pick up our dirty plates, I put them on par though in general

Z7cgDWX2kIOsJDpTERfP4Q.text: Been up drinking for a while and need some buffet... well this buffet is pretty dam good.   king crab legs are served cold... but they are pre cut so easy eating.   sushi is nice to have but its not great.   The beef tendorline (or some other delicious part of a cow) and the glazed ham are amazing.   omletts and eggs and bacon and pad thai... guacamolie... hummus chips.. nann.. salsa, noodles, pre peeled shrimp ... buffet pizza... yea this place has pretty much everything you'd want in a buffet.  But i think what sets it apart form other buffets is the dessert.  Jean philipe cookies and cakes.  and Gelato.  With a total price tag of.... 20 comp points!

319zIYe_-4VweKQCVjcNuw.text: I had a wonderful experience here. I had the brunch which was only 16 dollars! chacuterie and cheese was great, shrimp, breakfast items, salads and dessert! All fantastic ;) plus it tasted great after a night of drinking

Uf0ArRa661hvnapd0Iodaw.text: Very clean place. Selection was limited but what they did have was prepared very well. Breakfast was good with the menu improving for dinner. Overall no complaints.

zIQyQPjlPGe9OkNtBJONog.text: We went for sunday brunch , i like the fact they open at 7am, i figure everyone still sleeping nursing late night hangovers. I was right at 7 am only a handful of us old folks in line. . The buffet was very limited and not many items. For about 25 bucks a head you should get more. The hot foods were mostly breakfast items what happend to the lunch part of brunch. Very sad. Everthing was fresh as it should be since we were their early. Still can't believe a beautiful casino , ' upscale" would have a brunch that was so simple. Spend a few more bucks and go to wynn, or bellagio.  Service was fine.

gsM0vyQWjPGzoANU3soO6g.text: I was there for mothers day buffets, Yummy, and double plus on crab legs already crack in half for you.

dG9UZHyAFliTfL2GMUDKAA.text: I haven't even left the buffet yet and I am starting this review simply because of how disappointing tonight's experience was.  My sister and I waited in line for 40 minutes to eat here even though they upcharged the dinner price for Labor Day weekend.  Cashier lady that checked us in did not look happy to be there and when I asked what my total was after she mumbled it she gave me a stern look and pointed to her screen like I was deaf or something.  Wtf?  Okay moving on to our table.  Waited for 10 minutes for server to come by and take our drink orders and no show so we decided to make our 1st rounds.  Food looks great in appearance.  Key word:  APPEARANCE.  Omg I kid you not 9/10 things that I grabbed were so salty it almost made me want to gag and throw up because it was uneatable.  Their Thai beef, tom yum soup, pho, gumbo, clams, barbacoa and almost everything else was basically seeping in salt.  It was disgusting.  So many of the food was not available and even after being there for half an hour and making several rounds they still were not available.  Let's talk about plates- or lack thereof.  Each station were missing plates and bowls!!  The girl bringing out new plates saw me wandering around and gave me 2 plates and said "you'll need an extra one just in case".  Like shit, are they just completely short or plates or does dishwashing take hours to finish a batch??  I found myself and a few girls waiting around the soup station for some small bowls to get soup.  WTH is going on??  Our server was terrible.  Made little to no visits so old plates were piling up and when we needed refills for our coke he heard us call for him, turned around to start directly at us and walk away without saying one thing.  I had to flag him down 10 minutes later to get some drink refills.  I was hoping dessert would be the saving grace yet the only thing I was looking forward to were the creme brulee and it was also "no longer available".  This was the worst $48 I spent on a buffet.  There is a place by my house in California that had infinitely better tasting food and service for less than half the price!  This was the most regrettable decision I've made on this trip.  Should have gone to the Bacchanal which was exceptional!

photos.caption: Photo of The Buffet at ARIA - Las Vegas, NV, United States. First dish lol

pnIM9ZCxgBj2yWNxiVeZRA.text: Wanted to try a Vegas buffet and ended in this place. I don't like waiting too long at Bacchanal.  Went here on a weekend dinner buffet which costs us 44 per person before tax.   Food selections not too overwhelming. Meat section has decent options for ham, prime rib and sausages.   Seafood- they have crab legs. Only thing we wanted.   They had an Asian section too. Not impressed with this section.  Desserts- cakes, cookies and ice cream are ok.   Service-fast and attentive   Overall, it's an ok buffet if you want to try one in Vegas. My expectations were quite high for food quality. It's just not there.

photos.caption: Photo of The Buffet at ARIA - Las Vegas, NV, United States. They called this Pho.
Photo of The Buffet at ARIA - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of The Buffet at ARIA - Las Vegas, NV, United States

ewX1Y6sVwtNUFKG3y6f11Q.text: We ate brunch with the all you could drink package. Our waitress kept those drinks coming too! All of the food was delicious. I really enjoyed the chicken Marsala and the cowboy steak. Highly recommend.

q3GE2WaLGZ-Ygm91mwySdg.text: My family and I enjoy coming to this place, we usually have really nice service unlike last night  I came to take my father out for his birthday and our service was why i gave this place 2 stars. It took our server a while to bring our drinks, and when i gave out the drink he didn't look pleased (i didn't want to be complicated so my father and i ordered the same drinks). My father and i finished our first round of plates and drinks so we went to grab more food and when we came back, everything was still there.  The server noticed and rushed to clear it off. There wasn't many people on our side of the buffet so we didn't know why so we decided to let it slide. After that our drinks were done and it was about 10 minutes until our drinks were once again refilled and the server even left plates we finished there for a long time. My father does enjoy leaving tips for our servers based on performance and this was a non-tip performance. I paid for everything so I was going to leave a tip but with the service, I did not enjoy it. The server seems unpleased with us the moment we came and was being polite to everyone beside us. Once we started to leave we didn't have many plates there and the food was cleaned off. My father said thank you and while i was grabbing my coat heading to go, the server shouted out thank you twice at me very furious  I understand if he was upset bc we did not tip him, but based on his service, my father and i were not satisfied. Especially when he snapped at me, and I'm a teenager. This was something I did not expect to happen at a place my father loved going to.

qh9ydMNbAs_TgFqvZBA0SA.text: Worst ever! will never come back , total waste of money . The food is limited and tasteless, nothing close to the price they charge . Shame !

KB_zpz4MQQlj4JcqtA2H3g.text: Yelp 100:7/100  The Aria buffet isn't bad. It's definitely good in some spots but not good in others. I don't go out of my way for buffets but Cosmo, Aria, and Wynn get a pass in my book.   I had a myvegas reward and ended up getting two lunches for 29$. They have a lot of other drinks besides soda so I ordered pineapple juice. They have an all you can drink menu to add for 16$ but who can really drink all of that? Especially when copious amounts of food are involved.   The steamed crab, mussel bake, and Asian food are some of the best. In my opinion the dessert fall flat except the gelato and some sugar free items. The elote needed more seasoning but the pork and leek cake had amazing flavor. They also have congee/ porridge and a variety of soups. They have mini pho and ramen in addition to a carving station. The beef Colorado has good flavor  and was tender. Pizza was just okay and the charcuterie was not quite as good as last time. I would maybe try dinner to see if it's any better but I'd stick to Asian dishes and seafood. The split crab is good but the steamed is even better and more flavorful. Interestingly enough this has become a stop, but I'd definitely try wicked spoon first.   No service complaints and plates didn't pile up.  A diverse selection of food including Mediterranean and Indian.

photos.caption: Photo of The Buffet at ARIA - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Thai tea and watermelon juice.
Photo of The Buffet at ARIA - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Sushi and kimbap
Photo of The Buffet at ARIA - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Pizza

b7mWsW53Mo81dug404EsYw.text: This is the second time I've been here. the reason I come here is the crab legs. They have both snow crabs and king crab legs. they use to put them both out at the same time but now they alternate them every 30 min. I just recently found out that you can ask the seafood station to cook the seafood a certain way if you like. For example, like you can get oyster and baked them with cheese or grill shrimp with cheese as well. They also have lots of different type of cuisine from all over the world. They also have great dessert! Overall, I think it rivals Bellagio's buffet and better than the other buffet on the strip!

yPisy1gUBeZTQooGVEpgkg.text: I went to this place to avoid further walking but I regret that now. I am hugely disappointed with the selection of food and price I ended up paying for it. There were limited option in vegetarian in fact no option with cottage cheese. Few of the meat options like oyster we're below quality.  Certainly below expectation from name like Aria. Would not recommend it even if you are staying in Aria... :(

-tRDuexMp8hN36YxqwJDnw.text: Good food, good seafood selection. I will totally recommend, better if the rates was low but   it was great food.

YU2t3K_sTGe5gUKIq4Gfjw.text: Food was pretty good considering it's a buffet; it isn't always fresh. Although it seems line they had a lot to offer, it really lacked different items.   Went three times and, every time (even during different times of the day), there was at least a twenty minute wait (that was in the short "gold" member line).  Service and overall moral of the staff consistently was disappointing even though we made every effort to be friendly and make their lives easier.   Ultimately, it was more of a convenience than anything that led us to return. I realize that it would've been more time and cost efficient to go somewhere else and that's what will happen in the future.   TLDR; had to wait a long time to be seated, mediocre food, and sub par service.

_DyLYIRFUZwohAlHQvSduA.text: Had breakast here since we stayed at the Aria. First, the cashier was cocky and did not make my husband and I feel welcomed (ps. They look at how much tip do you give). The foods were not great, it's just so so. The staff were stiff. I heard one staff were talking bad about a customer in her walkie talkie while walking. In addition to that, I think the buffet place itself was very unorganized. A lot of the food tags did not match with the food itself i.e. the food tag was duck confit, but it's actually fruity yogurts. They had sushi, but I think it was leftover from yesterday's dinner since the rice was not fresh, just like if you have kept it in the fridge overnight. The quality is way below other buffet places. Bellagio buffet is so much nicer in quality.  They have ice cream for breakfast though.

photos.caption: Photo of The Buffet at ARIA - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Mac and cheese or potato?
Photo of The Buffet at ARIA - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Oatmeal cookies that look like muffin.
Photo of The Buffet at ARIA - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Duck confit and steak tartare salad? Really? Those are strawberry and bluberry yogurts

dF9Ld11nj0jTuyfEAm2d4w.text: This buffet is exceptional. We went on a Thursday morning, we were seated immediately. Our waiter was friendly and helpful in selecting the best items at the buffet. I had an omelette, crab legs, fresh fruits, and carrot cake pancakes. I enjoyed the pancakes, they were really fluffy-maybe a little too sweet. But if you have a sweet tooth like me, then try it! I am a huge seafood fan and I was excited that I can finally try stone crab claws, but these claws were frozen. They were basically crab pops. Not a fan. I loved the fresh fruits and the desserts. The vanilla gelato is to die for.  The price for breakfast is $31 per person-i think. I guess it is a reasonable price for Vegas and being on the Strip. I definitely tried to eat as much to get my moneys worth. Overall, the restaurant is clean and it is very family friendly. Next time I am in Vegas I will return.

photos.caption: Photo of The Buffet at ARIA - Las Vegas, NV, United States

4n2mZ_It-C-gsMZDjsPNKw.text: Pretty solid. We went for the Brunch buffet ($31.99 a person). Not a crazy lineup but busy enough for things to be fresh.   The Asian food is atrocious so avoid it, and really your best bet is the American food/meat/baked goods/sweets. But it was satisfying enough and I didn't have any complaints.   We also grabbed two pitchers ($30 each) one of mojito and another of margarita. Really tasty and we'll made, still a tad too expensive, but vegas!  Would eat here again for sure.

photos.caption: Photo of The Buffet at ARIA - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Assortment of brunch goods.
Photo of The Buffet at ARIA - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Assortment of brunch goods.
Photo of The Buffet at ARIA - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Margarita and Mojito

pY1sYwi1wHXAKyAH6Ec7DA.text: Very salty and not very good. I was bloated and it was not great at all. The only thing was good was the desert. They need to work on their salt intake on their food.

bp5PFPO5oqBgUEULvr12Ow.text: This is my favorite buffet on the Las Vegas strip. So many choices and reasonable given the options. I love the shrimp and meat carving station. The desserts are yummy too!!

QRxQekPjVQ9tZZdeOiSnYw.text: 1 hr wait as a gold member and False advertising with snow crab pictures. It's an extra cost and subpar service.

nq51qqpQ-gGJvecrIKyF2w.text: I came here for brunch and it's not the best buffet I've been to but it's not bad either.   The buffet is known for its international buffet stations and has all cuisines you can think of including Greek, Mexican, American, Italian, Chinese, Korean, Japanese, Indian, and Mediterranean. I'm pretty sure I'm missing some cuisines but bear with me lol.  I was impressed with their seafood station. They have a huge selection of crab legs, several different types of shellfish, shrimp, fish, crawfish. I know I got my money's worth on just the seafood alone. The seafood is what makes this place shine!  They had a carving station but I was not a fan of their meat. Their steak was dry but flavorful. Other meat they had including the sausage, short rib, and ham were decent though.  The dessert station will satisfy any sweet tooth. It was one of the most expansive dessert selections I've seen at a buffet. I wanted to get one of each but won't fit on one plate! The dessert selection is on par with Bacchanal Buffet I'd say.  Like I said, it's not the best but I still come here for the variety of foods (especially the mountain of seafood!)

photos.caption: Photo of The Buffet at ARIA - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of The Buffet at ARIA - Las Vegas, NV, United States

SoRR55BimlY-IPRj70Ywlg.text: Now it might seem as though I'm highly favorable of most places, as my reviews are usually 3 or above. That my friends is unTrue. I am quite picky but adore great customer service and a terrific meal and giving the compliments were deserved. Which brings us to this evenings dinner @ The Buffet located inside Aria Resort. I will explain that my first two plates were full of crab legs ( meat plump and moist... And warm ).. Melted butter straight from some amazing hot butter stirring machine.. fresh wedges of lemon line my plate as I salivate.  My only complaint is that I don't have the skills to carry as many plates as I truly needed. Crab legs in hand, I manage to grab a stainless steel bowl of delicious shrimp and grits, a fish taco and proceed to walk. I couldn't eat fast enough and truly got primal on these crusteans. Absolutely no shame in my game as I refuse to give in to a silly crab shell .. they have crackers but not the handy slicer to ease the pain of getting to the gold which is that meat! Before I tapped out I managed to rally a delightful slice of prime rib with my choice or both ( thank you baby Jesus ) creamy and straight horseradish. Awesomeness in my mouth... Nose hair burning good. The only thing I didn't like was my bloody mary but who cares.... No matter. My favorite part of this experience? As I shovel my face full of this amazingness, butter shamelessly dripping from my hands, there is NOT one bit of seafood odor...  Sold best buffet so far. I highly recommend the seafood and steak, but if they can master those, pretty sure the salad/dessert/Mediterranean/and all other options should be superb. I ate too fast to take photos... That good.

photos.caption: Photo of The Buffet at ARIA - Las Vegas, NV, United States. grilled  chili&#39;s. So delicious. With that said, I bit half of this beauty into my mouth and instantly realized the error of my ways.

n-nKg5o7DPefNx0jcT0l0Q.text: Warm crab legs... so yum!!!  Seafood pan roast!!!  Depends on the day and time there will be a 2 hour wait...  worth it!!!

fnAPs7EGZfE_N0lX9sAfNw.text: We had high expectations for this buffet.  But it was just okay.  We were there for Brunch (11:30am).  Our Server was  nice. The selection was a lot smaller than I expected.  Great presentation on the fruit/salad section.  There were a lot of exotic fruits that you do not normally see in high end buffet (assorted berries, dragon fruits, papayas, Asian pears and etc).  Like the breakfast selection, specially the made to order waffle station (red velvet and regular).  Ordered regular waffle. It had a bubble like texture look.  Crunchy outside and soft inside.  It was delicious!  Best item in the buffet!  Unfortunately, some issues with labeling food items.  Three attempts for the BBQ Pork steam buns but keep getting a custard filling ones.  We notice several of the food items were a little heavy on the salt.  Also, very slow on refilling on several entrees.  Dessert was okay.  Best item on the dessert section was the square shaped macaroon cookies.

dc8j8kUeXCLv67lgC8GWZg.text: Well another Vegas buffet has let me down! I was here a few months ago, and it was awesome! The meats were flavorful, the ice wedge salad was ice cold and crisp, and most importantly the crab legs were good sized and ice cold! Now the meats are just ok, what they call Texas Brisket is a joke.. I live in Texas and I have way better brisket. The wedge salad was crisp, but not ice cold. And on to the crab legs... They have cooked ones, but i'm not a fan, they were small and hardly any edible meat in them, the cold crab legs were Dungeness, which i'm really not a fan of, they were small and the meat was rubbery, the old crab legs we had a few months ago, were snow crab, very tasty.. I guess they are getting cheap! I wondered why at 5pm when we got here there was no line at all, and now at 6:45, there is still no line on a Tuesday night. The service is still good and the desserts are good, but i was really craving crab legs on my trip to Vegas, i'll have to find another buffet now.. Thanks, Aria

L_hnbYH_bXwHCLxhU_gAmw.text: Went for the GFs birthday and was pleasantly surprised how quickly we were seated. Wait staff took great care of us, and the food was fresh, hot and delicious. I really dont get all of the bad reviews on here.  My only complaint, and its really not a complaint, is that the selection of items is smaller than most other buffets, but know everything they serve is outstanding.  Will be back. GF loved it.

gvK0jhcJU6sk59kqxCplnw.text: Just...WOW. A pricier buffet (we went for brunch) but worth every penny in my opinion. The staff was very friendly, and the selection of food was as delicious as it was plentiful. Waffles made, pancakes of all different flavors made for you...red velvet and carrot cake pancakes to name a few. The sweets were top notch (best cinnamon rolls I've EVER had) and of course your regular breakfast foods and lunch specialties (smoked salmon, salads, etc.). One of the "fancier" buffets on the strip I'd say. Will definitely try to return!

IK6P86sLoN47kIRTITtkMg.text: If you are going to spend $40 at this buffet, I'd suggest you can have a nice dinner like steak! The foods were average. Some of the servers behind the counter were not very friendly...like the ice cream section. When I asked the server what kind of flavor ice cream behind the front area (the some of the labels were missing and plus the clear lid was cloudy), the server was like standing there for a second and gave me an expression like "why are u asking me this? "  And not to mention the wait time was a bit long! There were quite a few tables but staffing was seem shorted. Bottom line the whole dining experience was not satisfied!

f5NNViQ1FHdBy2PmhinBag.text: It's not good foods. Does not worth for the price. Some foods are drying and too hard even it was 7pm Friday night. No fresh oyster even I called the restaurant just before I go and they said they have fresh oyster.  You should pay some more to go better buffet.

4oschUEDkWb0BpmLvGIF6g.text: Wow, been playing poker at Aria for years now and didn't even think of using comps and going to the buffet.  Only after my cousin's co-workers decided to go here during a conference when I finally decided to come.  It's actually a relatively good deal for about $40, you have various food stations with many ethnic choices.  It's too much to detail in this review and I'll go over what you should focus on (at least these are the items I liked).  The oysters in the grill station is a must. Don't like that they add breadcrumbs and a creamy sauce.  Of course, you can scrape it off.  The snow crab legs is a very popular item and for good reason.  When you see some available, by all means get it while you can.  The poke station is another good addition.  They have ample choices to make a poke bowl the way you like it.  You can even opt not to add the rice which will take up valuable space in your stomach.  Save some room for the gelato station, you will find a dozen flavors, and you should find one you like.

xtlDZeKd9mEu1ZPdZzMWnA.text: This was the best Buffett I've been too. Yes there is Bellagio and or the Bucannal At Cesar's. Both of those are tooooo expensive. I got the my Vegas rewards for buy one get one and two bottomless drink passes. Servers and cashiers could be nicer but the food made me forget about that. Delicious menu items from Asian to Thai to gourmet pizza. Mediterranean and gourmet deserts. I highly recommend it . For a regular price of $29.99 for lunch during the week, not bad!

646ksieDAPS1Rp42H2XqQA.text: Wanted to try a new buffet, and I have to say that I wasnt too impressed with the Aria buffet. We had to wait almost an hour to get a seat at around 11am. So we got the brunch menu.. they had the usual meats, pizza, bread bar, omelet station, asian food, and dessert area. Their food was just alright. Nothing really stood out.  But this buffet is cheaper than most out there... for brunch it was $28.99. You can also add bottomless mimosas for like $20. The waiters were really nice though and always attentive and cleared tables quickly and always got you what you needed.  Probably would not come back here, considering theres so many other better buffets on the strip!

nGM1VTb5UIGtGW7I2A2zLA.text: My husband and I went yesterday for brunch buffet at 11:30 am. The line was horrendous, so we got into the Mlife Premier Member line and I tipped the cashier. I tried giving him $40, but he would only take $10 and processed us through with no wait. At $40 per person, I expected great quality food but was very disappointed. It was definitely catered toward Asian cuisine, which I don't typically mind, but everything was way too spicy. Tony, being a meat and potato guy, couldn't find plain mashed potatoes. Everything had cheese or thick cream and egg added.  The only reason I'm giving 3 stars is our server Alfredo who is amazing, hostess Hope who is also amazing and the desserts! You must have the ice cream!! We probably won't go back unless we're comped.

photos.caption: Photo of The Buffet at ARIA - Las Vegas, NV, United States

a1Qtrua7sfhtIBRVjill7g.text: We did the All Day Buffet on a Thursday for $60 which is a steal when you think eating on the strip you are spending around $20 a meal anyway. We went four times throughout the day, and were able to avoid longer lines, which was a plus at lunch and late dinner (9pm). Omelette Bar accommodated and made boiled eggs upon request. The steamed Oyster Rockefeller could have be cleaned a little better but they were decent.  Plenty of crab legs available at dinner and great dessert choices throughout the day. The waiters and manager Dara were quick and attentive throughout the day. Definitely recommend, this buffet over some of the others on the strip.

-08HLOvFN8MfpH0CASVw7A.text: We had weekday dinner, so a lot of the items especially seafood are lagging, but for the price it is appropriate.  Aria's ethnic varieties and taste are all pretty impressive. The famed Indian oven wasn't one of them unfortunately. I really like the Mexican carnitas, even the Chinese section has this weird beef noodle soup are OK. Desert was as good as you see from the photos, good varieties and well like.   Only thing was seriously lacking of seafood, not even the dungeonous crab, which even are expected for cheap buffets.

8yBVzPZEE6WjA0zEewut9w.text: I'm calling Aria the best overall Vegas buffet in my opinion. They recently started offering $20 alcohol unlimited drinks for two people.   They also have two complimentary drinks that will absolutely knock your sox off: THAI TEA and HORCHATA if you don't know what those are, you better do some googling.   In the past year I've visited these buffets and here's my analysis:  Caesars Bacchanal: most selection, most expensive, and they change up seasonal items.  Wynn The Buffet: most decorative, best presentation, good place to impress guests.   Cosmo Wicked: best dessert items, good food quality, and the top item for me is bone marrows.   Bellagio and Paris both were underwhelming. Especially Bellagio was over priced, dark, and food was on par with country buffet.    Aria had the best balance between ambience and quality. Another perk of being MGM Pearl member and above is to skip long buffet lines. Mlife forever!

photos.caption: Photo of The Buffet at ARIA - Las Vegas, NV, United States

fVi6xdmj-FmOqjM_1lPrrw.text: Not the best on wide selection of food but many were quite tasty and hot. They do pay attention to keep it clean and filled. Buffet has a nice carving station for meat lovers. For $20, you have quite a few options of bottomless alcoholic beverages. Definitely worth it if you want a few drinks!   The dessert section is a bit lackluster for my sweet tooth but overall not a bad buffet experience in Vegas. Around $50 gourmet weekend dinner. Sounds about right for the Vegas price tag.  Lots of crab legs and nice big shrimps. Poke bowl station also did not disappoint. Lots of interesting cuisines to try. Stay away from the oysters unless it was just a bad night for them when we went. It was not cleaned well and did not look tasty (They were ordered).   Great service and staff!

2fcoTTV1XjzBrlWmMQ5c5g.text: After a pretty mediocre experience at Bacchanal, I'm not sure why I'd bother going to a lesser reviewed buffet. I guess I'm just a glutton...for punishment.  The food had a few tasty spots, but mostly was just uninteresting. The majority of the staff seemed to aggressively hate their lives or were bothered to do anything (which is strange since the concept here is that most stations required staff assistance). The guy dealing with noodle soup bowls was throwing around bowls all loudly and throwing cilantro sloppily over the countertop missing most of the bowls. It seemed like an intentional production to show how beneath him he thought this was. Hard to explain, but it was kooky. Even those that weren't rude seemed baffled or new, for example the woman making poke bowls clearly had never done it before. I saw server once, to bring drinks, never again. Aria is a fancy place so the lack of professionalism and quality was strange.  The positive though was the dessert station had a lot of good options and the African American guy working there was noticeably friendly and seemed to really like to interact with customers. A noticeable difference from the rest of the staff. I see many reviews I think are lauding this guy as being cool while the rest are sucky (many day he used to work at carving station if this is same guy). So if management is reading this, please give him a raise and try to actually train the rest of people who really don't seem to care to be there.

FE9exPFua9dyCW-z0Xp7Aw.text: Our first time in In-casino buffet. EXPLOITING the visitors is best description. A $15 buffet such as Zen in So Cal, Home town buffet are 10x better than this. The fish section has no fish (they should at least change the name). I felt guilty wasting food but no option because no quality and taste. 1 star because Service was decent. What these people are doing is not a fair business just exploiting people. These businesses should not exist. For such crappy place they have 40 minutes wait and not sure why when there were so many empty tables. Please DON'T Go.

FnVjBKPZ3LepZtmGGroUJg.text: Food is excellent.  Variety is AMAZING!  Hubby and I had passes for any MGM buffet and we preferred Aria over Bellagio.  The seating is a real hassle though!  Very disorganized getting people to their seats.

WIJfFKjD27q1yRxeqCFGQA.text: Wow totally loved this place, probably top 5 best buffets in Las Vegas! So much variety- just in the dessert isle you can get lost! My favorite was the Indian food, and the pizza- I've been here both for lunch and breakfast- best time to go is during the morning, but regardless I'm sure you'll find something you'll love and you won't be able to stop eating! They also had a pasta section, meat, Mexican, sushi and poke bowls (so good), Asian, salads... and the list goes on!

_qN6koOpPcxyRHpzNy7GOw.text: Inside the Aria in the second floor is The Buffet, one of Vegas infinite buffets.  At about $40 per person, it's a pretty good deal for the variety and convenience when you happen to stay here.  There were a huge selection of foods from different areas (Chinese, Indian, Mediterranean, etc). The seafood was a definite must, like the crab legs, assuming you're okay with getting a little messy.  The desserts were pretty extensive which offered over 10 flavors of gelato.  Note: some items were mislabeled, so don't always trust what you read.

photos.caption: Photo of The Buffet at ARIA - Las Vegas, NV, United States. First plate of food :)

ff_UTNVNWT1jboakahRKDQ.text: Amazing brunch w a huge selection! I just wish they served the tandoori section before 1 pm.

OVl7HfXpY5X5Z7kjTD7DJg.text: This buffet on this day satisfied the HUNGER.  A premium price but hey when you have all you can eat premium seafood... I get it. The choices are endless. The tastes are decadent. From pizza to soup to salad bar to my all time favorite the Gelato and dessert station! I walked out of here about 10 lbs heavier and I am ok with that. Our server took plates and refilled drinks as needed. They do have a bottomless alcohol package you can add to the buffet. I declined as I was already feeling good.  The carving station definitely got my attention with the ribs! Wow pretty delicious. I will return when I am in Vegas again.  Thank you for satisfying my hunger! Respectfully, Bryan  Oklahoma City

photos.caption: Photo of The Buffet at ARIA - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Crab legs done
Photo of The Buffet at ARIA - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Crab on deck

tjVXbRYiCM2IGLD9gPnWeA.text: After my slightly traumatic experience at Buffet of Buffets, I was really hesitant about going the The Buffet at Aria.  But all my friends were going, what was I supposed to do?  I was actually pleasantly surprised by this place.  The food was very good!  And for $25, not too bad for brunch.  Favorites: -Fresh cut slab of honey bacon -Steamed King Crab Legs with Hot Butter -Jumbo Cocktail Shrimp that were fresh not frozen. -Flan  -Chicken Congee -High quality green tea  Negatives: -Servers seemed to hate their job and were really slow and inaccurate about bringing you things like drinks. -Duck salad was so salty it was inedible. -Not enough room in my tummy for seconds after I had tried everything.

81FE6YlkaeK42ZzhbNe25Q.text: Okay I have decided to write a review on a buffet that is so-so.  Not sure if I am being fair with this as I generally do not enjoy buffets...any place that I have have to wait in line or watch people mull around with plates of food in their hands while they "sample and eat" at various food stations does not appeal to me.  Needless to say The Buffet at Aria has vastly improved from its original days.  Clean, open dining area seen from the hallway makes it feel spacious.  The individual food stations were small while the portions were also small...nice!  Better than a huge stainless steel tray and a spoon where you scoop up your portion size. I think this is better so that you will eat smaller portions and more variety.  It was nice to see a seafood station that is part of their regular menu...nit some special Only on Friday or the weekend.  If you like buffets and are with friends or family, I would suggest giving this one a shot however if you're looking to be impressed there are others that are far better than Aria....

Qx2LE6AZ8aqS6kEUZ7dORA.text: This hotel is suppose to have a upscale feel to it, and with that you would expect a decent if not really good buffet.  This buffet lacked variety, the meat carving station served mostly fatty parts of the meat, crab legs were okay but always picked over and broken into pieces. Wasn't impressed by anything there, and I love buffets!

RzsIZ7iFLOUO4ldW90mFUQ.text: Save your money and go to hometown buffet, it's the exact same food. Seriously disappointing. Had to come here by default since wicked spoon was closed.

DI-g20LP5-lySgP6gzYdZg.text: $30 for brunch buffet is a decent price relative to the $60 charged elsewhere on the Strip. Selections were standard, nothing special.

P7ElJcTmsmA3fOEcVuFhFg.text: I wouldn't recommend this buffet. The customer service is terrible. It's tough to eat at a buffet without a single water refill.  Also, I got a pretty serious case of food poisoning soon after. I'm quite certain that the shellfish was the culprit.  On the positive side, the selection was very good.  Not a great experience overall.

Z82y6kuzisIChWrzbcgP4w.text: We went the day before the actual opening and was pretty excited to try a new buffet that will try to compete with Ceasars......Too bad it didn't come close.  Cons:  - Majority of the hot dishes were cold, not warm but actually cold even though some of them were brought out fresh - Nothing really stands out to make it unique - Price for what was offered  Pros:  - Sushi was pretty good compared to buffet sushi - The nan breads were great - King Crab legs  I most likely would never come back unless they get their act together. It was a pretty horrible experience for Day 1.

eT5J2WDxMmw3gOx7ICQuLQ.text: A solid buffet. Nothing amazing, but good variety and quality. Take a local. They get a 25% discount (plus free parking)

sGUUaNJ3x8kXOu5KHmavOQ.text: Hands down better than any of the standard buffets.  Yes, it's a little pricier than others, but it is well worth it.  The food is good quality, and plentiful.

r81ThIATQqt4_eQUjzMz0Q.text: Like eating at your college dorm, but expensive.

fJPmeA-ioN-a9W_G1HHMag.text: I had Black Friday breakfast with the family at the Aria Buffet.  It was the most over priced and crappiest buffet I've had among the 4* hotels.  The food  had no freshness in it and the service was the worst I have seen again among the 4* hotels.  Servers were no where to be found.  It took 20 mins to get drinks and servers were bussing their own tables.  At  those prices, stale foods, and shitty service, go to the Bellagio!

F3e4lFKS8g-JlGtnK0WppQ.text: It's an okay one, but overpriced. Went there the day before Christmas Eve, and paid about $50 for the dinner. The lamb was good. Steak and crab legs weren't bad. For desert, I liked their chocolate peanut butter cake. But the oysters were not fresh. I tried one only and I believe it gave me a stomachache. For $50 I would expect something fresh and won't make me sick.

vm5_PlkGI-I1U3uxs4RBhg.text: I definitely wanted to try a buffet while in Vegas and this one was decent priced but not insane like a couple other huge Vegas buffets. Holiday pricing was in effect so that was a little surprise. We went at brunch and had a little wait to be seated. The 2 hour stay restriction is enough to sit and digest after eating. Some dishes were cold by the time I stated stuffing my face. Corned beef hash was not good. Tons of variety! I was excited to see curry and naan and it was very good. I was not impressed with the Asian food. Gelato was very good! I was full by the end but nothing too special. I will try another famous buffet when I' in Vegas next.

cfXUwqtCniiicsPdYUTokA.text: This is my second favorite buffet in Vegas. Really good brunch. My favorite is Wicked Spoon at Cosmopolitan. There is no line and all kind of family omelette and quiche making shenanigans.

po492YXz_Gu7fhmwU9Xc9g.text: Checked in with some friends at the Buffet at ARIA. It  is a gourmet all-you-can-eat with variety of selection, from American, to Asian and Italian food. My favorite are the grilled lobster and scallops and limitless mountains of fresh Alaskan King Crab legs. They have fresh salad and delicious dessert. The place was clean and the waiter was so patient and friendly. Overall it is highly recommended.

7tRGYu3ZHPLPh5T4T71Z3w.text: If you head to the Buffet at ARIA, bring your stomach for sure.   The line is always pretty long unless you have a pass from the hotel (basically I wouldn't consider it worth standing in the regular line, with how long it generally looks...), and it's really not very cheap. The service is pretty nice, though. The waiters and waitresses are pretty attentive with refilling drinks, which is nice. Drinks like soda are included in the price, and the price of alcohol isn't too bad.   Walking into the buffet, the first thing that's noticeable is the decor - it's a stunning room, with a gorgeous view of the pool. Plenty of natural light comes in during the day, and you can still see outside at night. It's a really lovely view, especially if you're seated by the window.   The food isn't bad, but it's "quantity over quality" for sure. Most things are good, with a few exceptions that are great. Very few of the options I've tried have every really been bad, necessarily, just not amazing. Unfortunately very little of the lunch/dinner foods are really exceptional. One of the great features is the variety. The buffet sets up different stations, including Asian, Mediterranean, Indian, Italian, seafood, and traditional American fare. There are areas with cheeses and olives and meats, and you can find sushi and crab legs and all sorts of other things. Basically if you try one food and don't like it, there's bound to be something else you'll enjoy. It's a great chance to try some new things, and it makes for a fun meal if you've got adventurous tastes.   On one of our trips we were there for Christmas, and the buffet had a special where they offered a lobster with the meal for a small added fee. That was definitely a mistake - it was very dry and chewy, and not even worth the small amount extra.   Where the buffet shines is in the fact that the desserts are absolutely fantastic. My one regret every time I've gone is that it would be ridiculous to try everything, so my friend and I got in the habit of getting different ones and sharing so that we could try as much as possible. They're beautifully presented, with decorated plates, cute dishes, and stunning designs, and they always taste absolutely wonderful. They also have gelato options. The sweets are definitely on par with the other bakeries and dessert shops in the building.

EbOa83-cb87KTmhrHD6dyw.text: This is one of the better buffets.  There is a good mix of food and it's always been clean.  Remember it's buffet food.  The boss loves the crap legs.  She looks forward for just this.  I literally watched her eat all she can it.

Tcj6aLylkaejjHYi_QUMGw.text: To me buffets for the most part are the same, same Food options, same taste, so I may not be a huge buffet goer, it was just okay,  and pricey if you have an appetite your winning but if not it can be a waste

VSRKGUhDyqE6FYgESZW7Jw.text: We at here after eating at the Bellagio the day before .... Not very good.. one of the servers touched the crab legs with no gloves, the food was so random, scrambled eggs were not done...so all that said. ..not worth money.

vbxirQV80o2xo8CXntSjwA.text: I really like the food but I honestly think it is a bit pricey. I went to the Wynn buffet, way better taste and just a bit cheaper. Customer service is aweful, but again, it's a buffet.

OvEu1TWyWqXIRxlYz5wspg.text: Great selection of good. Food is cooked and displayed well. Good lighting & good music playing. I would definitely come back.  My only complaint is that it took about 7-10 minutes for us to put in our order for regular drinks. Outside of that, we had a good experience.

LUkffll5IqzdYdQLc8gvtA.text: The food selection was great. I went twice for breakfast It was rather expensive but the food was  good and I would go back .  There is a long waiting time for a table and I was down for breakfast at 7.30 am and the wait time was  still almost an hour til I and my wife got a table if not for the long wait time I would have given 5 stars

zrpBy1E2gT9AkmnzwCtVDg.text: Free buffet for breakfast came with my room booking.  Sure beats the hell out of a Marriott continental breakfast in Anytown, USA.  I am usually pretty skeptical about buffets, but wow do I love the higher end variants that appear to be rather sanitary.  Since I am a hefty fellow, I do not take the task of adequately preparing for a buffet lightly.  You have to know what I am talking about when you fill up after eating only two, two and a half heaping plates.  It's very dissapoining.  Think about how much you are leaving on the table (look at me, droppin a pun).  Meanwhile, think about a lighter dinner the night before, and even if you drink, resist the urge of a big 3AM meal.  I did just this, and woke up around 8AM and mentally prepared myself for a 10AM feast.  Meditation, some slots, USA today, perhaps some of you more fit folks might get an early morning workout in (me, not so much, that's just silly talk).    If you are famished by the time you check in with the cashier for the buffet line, congrats, you have properly prepared for your breakfast.  The service was very good - friendly and attentive.  The food selection is quite overwhelming, with different ethnic stations surely adding to the experience.  While I won't put the experience quite on par with the Wynn buffet, it will absolutly get the job done.  I dont need to list every station, but I think my plates consisted of various concoctions of eggs, belgian waffles, pizza, yogurt parfaits, donuts, Indian naan, latin style eggs and tortillas, gellato, asian dumplings, and all kinds of other fun stuff.  Lots of different seafood offerings as well.  So overall, it's a great comped breakfast, but at thirty something dollars a person, I'd probably consider taking a walk to Denny's if I had to pay for it.  That said, if I was feeling lazy, I'm sure the thirty something dollars is relatively cheap compared to regularly priced restaruants at the hotels.  So go on, grab that special someone, and treat them to the romantic meal of a lifetime.  **bonus** I didn't see people taking pictures of their plates and the food stations in order to post them on various social media sites.  Which made me happy. Because, please reach out to me and let me know why in the name of {Insert chosen diety here} to people feel the need to do that?  **Bonus 2** Just to show you how serious I am about my buffet eating:  Upon returning to my table I found my table cleared..I asked the waitress and she apologized and said, that I had finished a few plates and a couple of dessert plates so she thought i was done.  i said it was understandable and put my next round of two plates on the table to continue my meal.  I had such a smile inside, because even for a buffet waitress, who probably has witnessed gluttony like you can't possibly imagine, I somehow baffled her.  I guess it's a good time to tell you that Adam from Man vs. Food is my personal role model...

j8CroQ2I26yOjqnd2UXBhA.text: We have been to all of the buffets on the strip over time.  I will tell you that for the price and quality, this is one of the best!  Clean, fantastic quality of seafood and so many other items to choose from if you are not a seafood person.  GREAT buffet!

sbaC4_L7_mm4AvKEbYsiTg.text: Best buffet in this area, plain and simple. The coffee is great. They bring you a glass of good OJ as soon as you sit.  I suggest the scrambled eggs, chorizo, 2 types of breakfast sausage, corned beef and hash is excellent!  Bacon, sausage gravy, ham, omelettes, EGGS BENEDICT, shrimp, cookies, muffins, and lastly, home fries!  Coming from NJ, the "Land of 1,000 Diners", you won't be disappointed at this buffet! Very spacious, Nice scenery and courteous, fast staff, this place is worth going too.....  In fact, I'm going back tomorrow morning!

K_OyKrFekEVeWbSIrrP1hA.text: Terrible.  Overpriced and the food is close to inedible.  The "eggs benedict" were a runny mess smeared on my plate. Noodles were gross.  All the food was flat and shapeless.  It probably didn't help that I stood 30 mins in line for no apparent reason since there were plenty of empty tables in the place.

GQl3X0f1-E_8iLJUzI_mRg.text: The Buffet at Aria was nice. I went there for lunch. It was 24.95 for Sunday Brunch, but we stayed at a M Life venue and was able to have $20 covered by the hotel. Thus, $4.95 plus tax and tip is pretty darn good. Ask for the deal.   I enjoyed the crab legs which were pre-sliced. I first tried it cold with melted better. Then I had the crab legs steamed slightly and that was much better because you could taste the sweetness. The cocktail shrimp was good as well. The eggs Benedict was yummy. The chicken soup was pretty good. The desserts were yummy. The rest of the was only okay.

WWfuNgotNl7Ofjq0FuNXtg.text: Food was kind of bland to me. Wayyy too spendy. My boyfriend did enjoy their seafood selection though and the bottomless drinks were nice.

Q9huxd_VZzF_aNEnSQh60w.text: If I could leave two different sets of stars I would. In terms of a buffet there are great options, excellent food quality and even better service from the very attentive staff. However, because this is Las Vegas I felt it should be a little better. Perhaps offering options that aren't available at every other buffet on the strip. It cost $80 for two of us to dine at night. We arrived at 8:45 and I know they closed at 10, but one of the employees said food would be out until 10:30. What she meant was the food already cooked would be out, but as the night went on dished offered on my first time around were gone. By the time I hit the dessert station at 9:40 there were only 4 varieties of Gelato left and very few options for the 1-2 bite desserts. People were walking in at 9:30 and I felt bad for them. I don't think there will be a next time for us here at the Aria Buffet, but if there was I would definitely come earlier. Our number 1 buffet of choice on the strip is the Wynn and 2 Belagio, for your taste reference.

TbVgH06F2FYRN7pUM7x5dw.text: Wow! This breakfast was amazing. I loved the french toast fried sticks, the pastries, and everything else. Breakfast is $18.99 and well worth it!

p5UT5GckAH9CHLL1ZBfJtg.text: Pricy, $35 & gave me diarrhea for two days. Suffering in the bathroom with pain. One of the reasons why I am vegan now. No need to eat expensive diarrhea food when I can do it for less than $10 at McDonalds! Unfair comparison. I had McDonald's food many times and only gave me a one day diarrhea not two.

QS2vhh97-_RDUGJuytYLNQ.text: For a buffet located on the strip, The Buffet at Aria is pretty good and reasonably priced ($29.95 for weekend brunch as of August 2014).  However, they don't offer a vast selection compared to Bacchanal.

photos.caption: Photo of The Buffet at ARIA - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of The Buffet at ARIA - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of The Buffet at ARIA - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Crab legs

J6r_0ZuaTgHyJfusSDx0ow.text: The design and layout of the food was very nice.  With that being said, there weren't a whole lot of options considering how much we paid to get in.  They have some of the cheesiest mac and cheese I have ever had, but other than that it was just OK.  I would rather spend my money on a different restaurant.

F0gxmDCuYB3dtWBEIgn3yg.text: Disappointing. Came in at 4pm expecting to be able to eat right away and was surprised to find a line--ended up waiting over 20 minutes to get in. The food selection was limited and there was not a single stand out item. Asian and Italian food were salty and overcooked, Mexican food seemed like it was out of a package, seafood was mediocore... Overall, the price didn't justify the quality at all. You would be better off spending $10 at a nearby burger joint.

ZpXKBpnLJOT2GS751PqM0Q.text: This is absolutely not a quality buffet. First off, food quality was very bad. Most of the food items were too dry or either too salty. Second, there was a limited selection. Yeah they had seafood, Mexican, Asian, etc. but selection was still very very limited compared to other hotel buffets in the surrounding area. Save yourself some time and money and goto Bacchanal buffet in Caesars Palace or Mandalay Bay.

vG-Szy2wSXFTkNZGkufWYg.text: Great gourmet food for the money, and a really wonderful dessert selection.  The weekend dinner is a bit expensive - $38 / person which includes drinks, a small lobster, and endless king crab and snow crab legs.  If you arent crazy about drinks and lobsters, try weekday lunch which is about $25 and probably one of the best value buffet considering quality of the food.

ey_m8g7vRXNA0ERyxrkIiw.text: Ok, the buffet was a lil pricey for brunch and bottomless mimosas = $38. So for that amount of money I expected champagne to be flowing like crazy but NO, they said they ran out of champagne...WHAT?? We asked for a refill and they said yes at first and avoided our table. Ok we were kind of loud and obnoxious but who isn't in Vegas? Then a lady came and told us they ran out after about 20 min. All we wanted was one more refill...so lame.   The food was delicious though despite the crappy service. They had a huge variety of meats like prime rib, pork, ham, sirloin steak. They also had sushi, chinese, and a great breakfast. The mash potatoes with country gravy was to die for. The dessert was bomb, they had regular/sugar free gelato and a million different cakes. The food overall was really yummy, not so sure about the service.

DJ4GtRLMVFQhNIYlCeZkOg.text: I love the hotel, but the buffet is the worst buffet on the strip. I was excited when I saw that they had crab legs, and at $45 per person, I was expecting some great food. The food turned out to be below average, and the service was my highlight of the evening. Our waiter was beyond rude, and his sarcasm lost himself a good tip. The prime rib was the best thing on the menu, but if you want more value for your money, I would try any of the other great restaurants at Aria.

Ly9VRe9BlZJdpyhG3MiMyg.text: I travel to Vegas 2-3 times a year and one of my favorite buffets USED to be the buffet at Aria but no more.  Something has changed with the quality of the food - it is now the quality of a cheap Chinese Buffett. The quality and the variety of the food has changed so drastically, there must have been some huge management change.  When the claw of a crab leg is no bigger than a teenager's thumb, time to find a new buffet.  Goodbye Aria buffet, let us know when you get rid of the management that has ruined the quality and the reputation of this once great buffet.  Adding king crab does not make up from or the gourmet delights that were available in the past.  Not worth the money.

AuSVQ0ZVC4uAdpWsv8IKSw.text: Delicious! Get the fettuccine alfredo! Fantastic spot to eat after a night of partying.

P734ReRlgp2iwq9y9XfKmg.text: For a buffet in a nice hotel such as Aria you would expect a little better in selection for a weekend lunch. They really lacked a variety of food selection! Service is also a bit slow. Several tables in our selection had to wait quite a long time to get any drinks. To be honest, I'd probably not eat the buffet here ever again. There are many other better choices available.

ToMlusAeYjdk_zjX_Ei3OQ.text: I have to agree with Herbie H. Review. I love the Aria but they have to take their buffet up another notch. The selection was so so and the taste was lacking. It also gave me a school cafeteria feel that I hated so much back  in highschool. So that's why I give this place a sorry 2 star.

0BMy46FHnGfmynGASPQ7xQ.text: God, Make sure to skip this one, they started pretty good but now is just not worth to go here, go to the Cosmopolitan or anything else, even those cheap ones at Terrible's....I don't know, they don't have variety, food is not that fresh and ONLY the dessert section is worth it, but this should be a $20 buffet. :(

T9G8NpunRql-LEG9AW9grQ.text: I LOVED THIS BUFFET, pretty funny because its buffet food, but this was delicious buffet food. I ant say enough good things about the biscuits and gravy, very classic. This is a great deal, if your staying at the Aria a must!

p2Xk0Dy1UvZ0X3ykrJcTag.text: This was a no brainer for me. My girlfriend had been in las Vegas the previous year and they had not yet opened this buffet (closed for refurb I do believe) so she wanted to try it. Our servers name was Sonny and he really lived up to his name. He had a smile he was attentive and upbeat the entire time. It can really make or break your dinner experience even if it is buffet . He made our experience there that much more enjoyable and wonderful. The food was Amazing. Hot crab legs on the dinner buffet and already cracked for you so all you had to do was scoop out the meat. A variety of shrimp and so much more to choose from. Their labeling system was a little different for foods. Instead of being on the glass over the food it was on chalkboards on that strip of the bar above all the foods. Very inventive and cute. Dessert bar was amazing. Everything about this buffet was well worth it. I will def be back for this one. A huge shout out to Sonny.....Thank you for making our experience the best yet at a Vegas Buffet

iYladEtCT3EPhQWaG80iPA.text: came here for sunday brunch and enjoyed the food, price and location.  the selection was good with the usual breakfast delights, such as design-your-own omelettes, eggs benedict (YUM), french toast, bacon and other choices, such as crab legs, shrimp, sushi, roast beef (YUM), pizza, etc etc etc.   The gelato bar is the BOMB!   they change around the ice cream favors within the hour or so.  love me some butter pecan gelato... DELISH.  for the price i paid for brunch, i was thoroughly satisfied.  as for the customer service, our first waitress was quick and friendly (though she did miss up a few drinks.. but no biggie).  i will definitely be back!

3pkSUGnxkSXLSFgjUSWyVw.text: Food was just alright. Nothing special. Service was ok. King crab legs were frozen. Carving station chef needed attitude adjustment. Overall probably wouldn't be back for how much they charge.

BeGZpopjvVi9X_H27Q2cDQ.text: Excellent.  It has indian food (good for vegetarians). They make a salad in front of u whixh is good cuz they can properly toss it

Fik_k7zemkO_5DHJj6RQJA.text: This place sucks. Food is ok but the people sucks. I had three empty plates but kickin it on the table waiting for someone to take it. They walked by me five times on my second plate. I should have went to the bigger buffets

TH6pAaMTD2_oGWZGhLgXyw.text: Went at around 3 PM and stayed until 4:30 to get both brunch and dinner food.  The food was not very good.  Alot of it "looked" good, but when i tasted it, I was always dispointed.  Honestly, the best thing was the mac and cheese.  The sushi was terrible.  The pizza was OK.  The cook to order pasta was pretty good.  The fish and chips were pretty good.  A cheese station was pretty good.  The eggplant rotini thing was not good.  The desserts were terrible even though they looked amazing.  The "Indian" food was not good at all.    The salmon was terrible - it tasted like they cooked it in a s hitton of butter but it still had no flavor except for the butter.  Go to Bellagio.

7IXy-Y9DsUYVNhS1sWm3OQ.text: I loved the curry chicken, garlic naan, and portugese sausage at this buffet. The desserts were also great - cheesecake, gelato (with a variety of toppings) and delicious cookies. This was all at the lunch buffet for $20, which was a really good deal compared to some of the other buffets (the only downside being that there was no prime rib).

cB1LkFDfTE6rHedJiQMbjA.text: This was cool to try once but I doubt I will ever go back.  I was lured in by the promise of crab legs and beautiful desserts but what I got was luke-warm crab legs that were small and picked over during my entire two-hours there and the desserts looked gorgeous but were not that good.  I found a few items I really enjoyed such as the charcuterie but I can get those at most fine dining establishments around the strip.  Bottom line is you get a variety of items to choose from but for the price you are paying you could get one great meal anywhere on the strip that isn't dried out, sitting under lights for hours, and seriously sub-par.  I'd rather pay $50 for one meal that is like ambrosia every bite.  Excellent service btw.

S6kwEDnVM7Aubmqk1ST2TQ.text: The restaurant is clean and the quality of the food was good.  We ate at two other buffets over labor day weekend and this was probably the better of the three.

uu-AgvUafV7k0loyR08dLA.text: We ate at the lunch buffet on Saturday. Had to wait about 30 mintues to get in. Overall, I think the service was mediocre and the food was average.   When we sat down, the waiter took our drink orders right away, but he vanished until after we'd already finished our first full plate of food. We later asked for refills, but he totally forgot. Dirty plates also took a very long time to clear.  We were excited, at first, when we heard there was unlimited crab legs. However, the quality of the crab legs was only so-so - you can tell that they just pulled them out of the freezer. They did have a nice mix of breakfast and lunch items, and I tried a little of almost everything. However, nothing really stood out in my mind as being really good (I didn't go back for seconds on anything). The best part, in my mind, was the cheesecake for dessert.  I'll spend my $30 elswhere for lunch next time.

zs46371FosojQ_PplXEeqg.text: Most simple but yet tasteful cleanest buffet ever. Yes they do lack alot of variety of food unlike other buffets but Arias buffet has quality unlike other ones.

2Jh9F8P2kfSCZMocIc-3ig.text: straight to the point.. omg this place sucked.   * $33 per person Sunday brunch. i had hotel credit thank gawd. * for real now how can u mess up on salmon sashimi? * sushi selection was small.. tuna, eel, and other vegetable rolls * the strawberry gelato was melting before they served it to me * getting soda takes forever.. the lady took my Sprite and i didn't see it until a long time later * crab legs are alright.. cut in halves.. nice that i don't have to work for it * parfait was sour? why..  that's about all i had.. i was tired of wasting food and the disappointment.. so i stuck with crab legs until the end.  ps. the big boy handling the cut meat had gloves on.. the same gloves he used to grab a whole bunch of tip from the omlette bar thing.. he shoved the tip under the counter and resumed meat cutting. never changing his gloves. health code violation?

Tav0KXfjm7s8qDUecoxXaA.text: The food was really good.  We caught the tail end of lunch and got to try the dinner menu.  Totally different selections which was nice.  We ended up staying there for four hours chatting and eating away.  I was sooo stuffed.  The desserts were totally a hit and miss.  There was also an awkward view of the pool from the dining area.

D7TUiHKsPgelJZt_MS9ReA.text: The buffet here is nothing to talk about. There's not a lot of good food and it's expensive. Just because it's in a new hotel doesn't mean the price should be above most places. Definitely experienced better buffets at other hotels.

bPK57YBGQtLkV_xvn2EGGg.text: this is probably my 2nd favorite buffet in town. i love the fact that you can get endless alcaholl for 12.99 more. it offers a couple beers. wines and even 1 kind of champagne. love the food. the pizza with the fried egg on top was amazing.. very kid friendly

yDcZtQkyb9CpmIqV_beuyQ.text: Mostly ham, cheese, and bread. Most of the other food I probably could cook my own self. =(

6KpO-TM6OwCODtpHI2jqbg.text: Food was good.  On weekend dinner they have all you can drink wine.  For bottomless wine it was decent, the only problem was that the server only refilled my glass once and I had to ask her to do it.  Service was just meh.  Be warned: if you have the shrimp, you will have to pull off all the crap yourself.    Ambiance was just OK.  I would go to the Wynn or even the Bellagio before I'd return to this buffet.

__VE-EItiwJUSagmFXTKcg.text: Went here for lunch.  Everything took forever.  There were lots of tables but they don't seat you right away.  The drink cups are so small and they don't refill  them right away.  Also they don't refill on the food either.  Lots of empty food trays.  There is one guy at the dessert area and they were completely out of dessert but he remain on the ice cream station not refilling any dessert.  Update:  That night I had really bad food poisoning.  Ugh!!!

BY3_TgS9ekHGZg7LQk4cZg.text: IMO this is an overpriced buffet with not a lot of selections(at least for me). I don't eat a lot of seafood so I can't comment on the crab legs which seems to be a major selling point for them. The carving station is not my cup of tea coz its "juiced up" animals, spiceless junk and lacking any flavor, in my opinion. I cannot see how people eat this without hot sauce or spicy salsa. The Italian, Chinese, Mexican and Indian sections, plain and simply suck with limp veggies and poorly flavored meat.   The only positive about the buffet is the dessert section, which had a great selection of desserts. I usually dont eat dessert but I had the vanilla gelato and strawberry cheesecake which were very good.

UW-68-mFZxonpgv1X8TvZQ.text: We decided to try The Buffet because it was in the hotel we are staying at. This is my 3rd time in Vegas so I've tried loooots of casino buffets...and I was really disappointed with this one.   First off, it looked like a food court.   Now let's talk about the food. They had various types of food - Asian, Italian, Mediterranean, American, and Indian. But the selection was very limited. The Italian section consisted of some cheeses, deli meats, a conspicuous make-your-own-pasta station and a few vegetarian options. The pasta station would have been great...if anyone could see that the sign says you can make your own pasta. If they couldn't see the sign, it just looks like a glass wall you walk right past. The seafood section was meh - the cocktail shrimp was good, the mussels were not good, and the crab legs were tiny little things. Not worth the effort. The only good thing was the prime rib. Tender and juicy, add some gravy, creamed corn and mashed buttermilk potatoes and you've got the 2 stars for this review! The fruit was good - small bite sized pieces which I appreciated. And the dessert bar... Oh how could you mess THAT up, Aria?? I had the cheesecake, coconut macaroon and the flan. The flan was good, the macaroon was too coconutty (do with that as you will) and the cheesecake was overwhelmed by the blueberry sauce ontop.   Basically, go spend your money at Bellagio or Caesars.

zk6RPJam2icqqR2ynDIdUQ.text: Great service Great food!  One of the best buffets in Vegas not to busy on a Wednesday night! Fish Market had great Snow Crab. The salad is fresh and I loved the Kale and Cranberry section! All you can drink for 13.00$ great deal! A+

AvytWR08-oJLhstb346ijQ.text: This is definitely in the top 10 buffets of Vegas. I went for Sunday brunch and it was fantastic. t's only $29 for the brunch and an additional $12 for unlimited cocktails, beer, wine and champagne. Anything you could possibly want to eat was there for you. I really enjoyed the crab legs, dumplings and extensive carving station. If you plan to buffet it in Vegas, this is a good one to try. The line was short too!

7kaziAZsPiVY9X9gyun42A.text: This is an awful buffet.  Aria, you should be ashamed of yourself!   The Chinese chicken salad was 'off'- like it was left out too long.  The 'complimentary' lobster was freezer burned and tough. The prime rib was overcooked and rubbery (what did they do? Cook it, freeze it, then zap it in the microwave?)  Beautiful surroundings, terrible service (could have used another glass of wine after that meal.) Not worth the price, even if it's free.  Check out the Cosmo buffet, Spice Market at Planet Hollywood, or the Bellagio for a better gourmet buffet experience.

Jl9AYY72OncDF4KE8QIMZQ.text: Average buffet. I ate at 4:00 pm and a lot of the food was dried out or showed signs of having sat for a long time. I had a 2 for 1 coupon so two buffets for $40 seemed fair. If I had paid the full $40 each I would have felt ripped off

kIV7AIDzIJpCcz7_gaOrdA.text: A large group of us had brunch here on a sunday afternoon.  The price ($23) wasn't bad for a hotel buffet on the strip, and was a much cheaper option than any of the other restaurants inside Aria.  We had 10 in our group and didn't have to wait very long for a seat, which was a blessing after a long night of clubbing/drinking, etc.   The king crab legs were plentiful and meaty and the salad bar had fresh blueberries and blackberries along with all the other veggie goodies.  The belgian waffles were soft and fluffy and the breakfast burrito was surprisingly tasty (i think it was chorizo and egg).  The prime rib was delicious and the garlic naan was good too.  An entire side of asian dishes wasn't what I expected for brunch, but they had a lot of options.  I only tried the chinese broccoli, peking duck and the dim-sum.  I made the mistake of putting plum sauce on my peking duck, and it was horribly salty.  The duck in the steamed bun would have been okay by themselves.  The dim sum wasn't bad.  Good chicken noodle soup too.     Their desserts were so pretty it's almost hard to eat them...almost.  The strawberry shortcake was delicious, as was the caramel flan.  The strawberry bread pudding was decent, and when mixed with the bananas foster, it was really good.  I remember trying about 2 other types of cakes they had out on display...one chocolate opera and what I thought was blueberry cheesecake (instead, I got tricked into getting a lemon-y cake of some sort with blueberry sauce!)  One of my friends asked for tea, and the server brought him a wonderful lavender Earl Grey tea....yet, when another friend in our group asked for tea, he was brought an herbal tea that tasted like bad potpourri and perfume. :(  If you ask for tea, make sure to ask what your options are.   Overall, I thought this buffet was pretty good for the price.

photos.caption: Photo of The Buffet at ARIA - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Strawberry shortcake...and my dino

YBZx4CR2r6zRuZ0KJcUdmA.text: $22 for a buffet in vegas. Im in!! loved the modern, chill aura they had. nice staff. not too fancy or over the top. had a good amount of food. not too much. i liked it lot. didmt leave overly full, but the meal was totally worth it..  the creme bulee was delish.

Q88yzu6MTvSCQZpxDOgSHA.text: Buffet on Thursday for brunch from 11-4 is about $25 each. Definitely recommend calling for prices because it's not listed on their site. We got there with the end of lunch food still out. The brisket with BBQ sauce was very good. If you get there at 3:30 ish... Not much to choose from for food. Crab legs were not so big. Sushi was all dried out. When 4pm comes around the new food comes out. The shrimp cocktail is now in 2 piece shooters. Still good. The salad shooters are good to try. The prime rib was good. Everything else was okay. The desserts were awesome. Recommend the butterfinger ice cream. The strawberry shortcake was tart but tasty. The tiramisu was great. Snicker cake was yummy. Overall not bad but like all buffets, a little pricey.

photos.caption: Photo of The Buffet at ARIA - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Strawberry and butterfinger
Photo of The Buffet at ARIA - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Strawberry shortcake
Photo of The Buffet at ARIA - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Tiramisu

IFEq5e_hJW1LN9Sw8Shhaw.text: Okay, after reading a lot of recent reviews with people raving about the buffet at The Aria (not all on yelp), I convinced my bf to come here instead of Bellagio buffet.  Boy, I kind of regret it. I came here after walking eons on the strip just for the buffet and the line should've been the first indication that this place wasn't that great. For a Sunday afternoon, the line for brunch was short. So short that it made me feel silly for rushing to get to the buffet in case there was a long wait (like Bellagio, for instance.) I guess we should be thankful that the line was so short so we could promptly be seated, but the problem was, we want to get seated quickly for buffets that exceeded expectations. For a mediocre brunch buffet here, it didn't surprise us that the line was short.   First, let me discuss the selection of food. Yes, there is a variety of cuisine available, from Asian to Italian to Mexican to anything. Breakfast food was also an option, like danishes, muffins, french toast, etc. But the problem was, the selection was small and the quality average! You can basically see everything they had to offer with one glance. The meat, steaks, etc were tough and dry and some foods were plain bad (chow foon - too salty). We were not impressed with the quality of options there. Everything just tasted okay-to-acceptable, with only a few that were exceptionally great (if you were to go, I suggest eating the cracked crab legs with the clarified butter, the seamen's stew, the sugar-free coconut cake & coconut gelato.) It's not what I would pay good money for - though to be fair, this is probably one of the cheapest brunch buffets around. You get what you pay for, I guess, but I didn't come here because of the cheaper price (~30 pp.) I wanted to be wowed, dazzled and impressed by an authentic Las Vegas Sin City type of buffet experience that would forever change and rival my meaning of good food. I read great recommendations for this place and thought this would be it and even condescendingly judged those who gave this place bad reviews as chumps. Well, guess I'm the chump now.  On the other hand, the service was spectacular. Our section's waitress did a fantastic job taking away plates when needed and being so considerate and attentive to our needs. She had some really cute hair clips in the front, which made her easily identifiable, not that we needed it since she was so attentive so we made sure to give extra tips. She made the experience a lot easier to swallow, but average food is average. Can't lie about that.  If we ever go back to Vegas, we will not be coming here again.

2TAtoWbCziIzlzFQNzSO8A.text: Sorry Aria, your no Wicked Spoon.  The food selection is tiny for Vegas standard however the quality is close to Bellagio & Wynn. That is until you get to dessert, OMG.  If i had to give out an award to best dessert, I'd give it to their pastry chef.  It is that good.  Even their sugar free taste amazing and you can not tell it's sugar free.  Aria gets Best dessert when it comes to buffet. Their service is slow. It felt like They were under staffed in this department.

photos.caption: Photo of The Buffet at ARIA - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Banana cream pie cake

s1cEg2zUmynH3kzUO9NZ7w.text: One of my favorite buffets! The hubby & I always load up on the crab legs & prime rib here A+ Desserts selection is never disappointing either, great ice creams, macaroons & chocolate cakes..a sweet tooth lovers dream!

rh4ztS0uzj3VsSpldaKURw.text: My first time here was WAY better. I guess things can change for the worse over time.   Seriously, what buffet doesn't have ham? I thought that was a requirement at Vegas buffets. When I came here the first time, they had this delicious honey baked ham and a coconut macaroon for dessert! It was one of the best macaroons I've ever had. Now, the only thing I like is their prime rib and that's not even that great. For $40 per person, I expected more. I mean, I'm not asking for fireworks, but at least put some more effort into it like you did before. VERY disappointed.

En5S-8_kB_yxzrAvrpaM9A.text: I'm gonna be really frank about buffets.   Wicked Spoon at the Cosmo  The Buffet at the Wynn  Studio B at the M  are the top 3 in my book. Now Aria isn't a bad buffet place great service nice selection of foods. But I wouldn't really consider anything very gourmet here. All the food are staple foods the cocktail shrimp are not the highest grade compared to the above 3 but it's better than your hosh posh mix of janky buffets. The nice thing about the Aria that I did enjoy was that after the nice meal the walk around the mall next door was perfect to walk it off sorta speak.  The desserts in here as well were a-ok but nothing spectacular compared to the above 3. I got comped 2 buffets for staying at the signature so it wasn't really terrible considering I didn't pay. It's the same price nearly as the other buffets as well so consider this before actually making it out here.  If I'm near here I guess I'd hit this up since it's not terrible and meets the standard of buffets in Vegas!

a6THL5KUhpeC5Uk30xNQhA.text: What happened to this place ??? The last time I came here 2 years ago, I was in love, but now this place has gone downhill. It's horrible the food is gross. It makes the Japanese buffets look like 7 stars. Avoid at all costs. Don't believe me just ask to walk and look.

86cgVh5KTN6hB4w7HfzLdA.text: This is my favorite buffet on the strip. The wait to get in is always long but to me it's worth it. I love the seafood station and the meat and cheese station. There is honestly so much to choose from that it's hard to decide. The layout and decor is also very nice. I keep coming back because there are so many quality options and it's really worth the money.

Lrv4KLL7frosaJWNwip3Bw.text: Man, i'm not too sure of why there are so many reviews saying the food is poor to mediocre at best...but i guess to each his own.    We got there 10 mins before dinner time so we paid the lunch price...we also had no wait in line and the amount of people in the buffet was comfortable.  No running into people with ur plate or waiting to serve yourself!  I'm a BIG buffet person and normally I only like 30-50% of foods at a buffet, but this buffet was just delicious to me!  There's just something about having different types of edibles all around you as far as eyes can see that puts a smile on a face.  Its a very clean restaurant.  Decor was really modern and light colored which made for a better appetite in my opinion.  Their food presentation was on point, made it real inviting and appetizing, there was no mess anywhere.  Items were constantly being refilled with fresh replacements.    Prime Rib - the piece i got was very rare and fatty.  A+  however it wasn't as juicy                        as i was hoping, easily fixed with some au jus and salt/pepper. Crab Legs - legs/claws were served cold and sliced open for convenience..they                       gladly steamed mine and it was delicious, moist and sweet + some                       drawn butter, i was 100% satisfied! Beef Stroganoff - Kind of a rare dish for me to see at a Vegas buffet but i was                                        happy nonetheless.  It had great flavor and was loaded with                                 mushrooms.  Parmesan Asparagus - served cold and was cooked perfectly, had a slight                                             crunch and was delightful.  I also really don't see too                                            much asparagus at buffets so it was a very nice surprise. Creamed spinach - was AWESOME!   Loaded MashedTatos - AWESOME as well.  It had lots of green onions and                                             cheese.  There were a bunch of other little items that were really great.  The only items i felt needed a little work on was getting more of an asian selection.  I mean it wasn't the best, but was better than other chinese food at other hotel buffets.
