S7YK3Rp79cjtKzYQs1mJoQ.text: I stayed at Aria 9.27.17 this past week.  I ate at the buffet for dinner and breakfast the following morning.  I'm a little disappointed in the quality of the food.  My waitress was awesome both days... the food not so much.  Again, I'm not a fan of buffets so I'm a little biased.  However, most of the food was under heat lamps and was still kind of lukewarm.  For the price, I'd rather sit at a traditional restaurant and enjoy a prepared meal for two.  Fortunately these meals were comped.  So again, not gonna complain too much.  Just give a review; my opinion if you will.

ukqaj3w-DUcQKHeJKopzGg.text: I was very under-welmed.  Its a smaller buffet, especially for vegas. Not much of a wait to get in and the food wasnt awful.  Service here however was horrible!! I tried to order drinks but nobody came by, only sign of a server was a small glass of water that never was refilled. Dirty plates and flatware would disapear but flatware was never replaced. I just kept grabing one from another table.  As for the food  there were warm crab legs but no crab tools and so much went to waste, sushi was a joke, why even bother, and its so sad to say pizza was the high light!!!

TjqXuHWHaE2u89Ext9SFaQ.text: My favorite things about the Buffet at Aria were that it was not as pricey as Bacchanal and it had Tandoor section. I take away one star because the tandoor section did not have a chef/cook to make Naan Breads!  Each section is organized and labeled and the food was delicious. There were many dishes to choose from for Vegetarians too.

fUhYtcLxk1NSR2Ra8lEYFA.text: So let me start off most of the food was AMAZING. My husband said the fried chicken was a little dry and one batch of crab legs was a little salty.  Now why a 1 star rating. I'm in Vegas celebrating my 30th birthday I came with my husband and friends. There was a group of 9 of us there for Brunch. When we arrived we we helped quickly we had 8 of us get the 2-for-1 bottomless drinks. Our hostess sat us quickly and was very polite. Then our server Catalina was the worse possible server. When we went to get food my sister was the first one back to the table. She asked if she could start off the table all with mimosas. Catalina told her she couldn't until she checked all our ID's first off how would we buy bottomless drinks without having our IDs checked. So when the rest of us sat down she checked ONE persons ID and then just gave drinks to the rest of us so what was the point of saying that. She could have said everyone has to be sitting down to order drinks (if that's even the policy). Then once we had our first round it took her forever to bring us the rest of our drinks and forever to come around and clear our table. We had to ask the hostess three different times to send our server over.   Now if it was busy I would completely understand. There were two other tables sat in our area with only two people at each. We saw her standing around tried waving her over with no avail. Now we had a group of nine. By default my mother also told me to always leave a tip of 20% when you have a large group but take off money every time there is a service failure. We all left a 10% tip on the way in when we paid but after the crap service we got we didn't leave the other 10% cash tip. We made sure to tip the cooks though, again the food was awesome.   We probably will come back and request to not be seated in her area

J89Qle--lIuMmIiz95qM4g.text: Overall very good selection of all kinds of foods. It was a bit pricey at $59 for dinner but I did go on Thanksgiving and they did offer Turkey and all that so that might explain it. I pretty much loaded up on meat and crab legs but don't forget to grab some cheesecake for desert! I wouldn't mind coming back, I just wish it was little less expensive.

photos.caption: Photo of The Buffet at ARIA - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Lamb ribs, Chicken Tandoori, Cowboy Steak, Prime rib, and Lamb shank!

pmg3uF8yfCE0KzCels8iag.text: Pros: relatively affordable for a buffet, lots of options and ethnic food, great service  Cons: food was good but not amazing   Came here with a group of friends on a Friday night and the food was good overall but there were some misses. They have Asian dim sum, a carving station, Indian food, seafood, and a large dessert bar.   Highlight of the meal was the best naan I've ever had- crisp outside, soft inside. It had the perfect amount of garlic and salt to make your taste buds sing.   I was very disappointed by the desserts. They were beautiful and there was an amazing selection, but the taste wasn't there. The creme brulee and ice cream choices (like chai tea) somewhat redeemed it.   Overall, a solid Vegas buffet to bring your friends and family too. It's worth trying but I'd probably explore a different one next time.

photos.caption: Photo of The Buffet at ARIA - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Desserts!
Photo of The Buffet at ARIA - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Revolving ice cream belt
Photo of The Buffet at ARIA - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Cake options

ki4Fx1bH0lYl7U5dnn6g_Q.text: ***Lunch Review*** We came to The Buffet at Aria for lunch on a weekday. Maria was our server and she did a great job. We used a MyVegas voucher for a BOGO, you have to get it from the MyVegas App, then go to MLife desk and they added it to my MLife card. I asked the cashier at The Buffet to open a ticket for me to tip our server with a credit card because we did not have cash.  About the food, they have several stations for international food, salads, desserts, etc. They had big sea food option with crab legs, Louisiana boil, sushi, ceviche etc.  Some of the stations were not open until dinner time, I believe they open them for dinner around 3:40pm.  This was a good deal, specially with the BOGO offer.  They do have a separate fast line for customers with MLife Pearl and above, or MLife Mastercard cardholders.

XoXfUOFwwQM4GIUcw7cJ7A.text: Second time at the buffet, the first one on November was excellent, great food and service, the second one last Thursday (June 6) and service wasn't good, employees with bad actitude and food 3/5

asdxFCJT2DQFN5p4x9ufUQ.text: I've actually been coming here for a few years even before I finally moved to Vegas, so I've seen the minor changes they've had over the years. I think it is about time to write a review.  Parking - MGM properties rolled out their paid parking. It's annoying but I guess there's not much I can do about it. I wish they could validate for eating there or something but anyway..  Came here on a Fri night around 6:30pm, there was no line to get in but the place was only around 40-50% capacity which was actually kind of surprising - as it's usually even less than that during peak hours.   Our server was Maryann, she was wonderful to deal with. She always came by every several minutes to check on us and was very friendly.   As far as food selection/quality compared to the other resorts, this place is probably closer to a 3.5 star. The other 0.5 star they earned from me is from the good service we've consistently had.   The good-if you come fri-sun for dinner, they usually have king crab legs and oysters. Quality is generally acceptable as long as you don't come too late in the day. The meat carving section is also usually pretty good - definitely get the prime rib if you're a fan.   Worth a try-I always find myself eating the Indian food- the naan bread, tandoori chicken and the curries always find their way to my plate. Their dessert section is small compared other buffets but still acceptable. They have their famous spinning wheel of gelato/ice cream as well as little different cakes and such. I usually find myself ending the meal with a cake pop and some coffee.   The not so good-the Asian food is a joke. I'm sorry. The "sushi".. Is very sad looking. The fruit selection is almost non existent. The cheeses look like they've been out for too long and the pizzas are always kinda dried up.  They used to grill large shrimps and scallops in the middle but I think they pulled the plug on that.   In summary, come here for the king crab legs and oysters on the weekend if that's what you're into.  Or if you like to sample little bits of each kind of cuisine.  If it's not your thing then I suggest you go somewhere else.

photos.caption: Photo of The Buffet at ARIA - Las Vegas, NV, United States. A little bit of everything
Photo of The Buffet at ARIA - Las Vegas, NV, United States. This is how I Vegas

2eVZ94fohUZTbqYZUYuhBg.text: Total disappointment.  Went soley for the crab legs being sliced lengthwise...well  they weren't!  So sad, definitely will not go back.

wqOONctbB-Dje27mrZXa1g.text: There is an exponential improvement in menu selection and food quality. Read my 2010 review. This is now a better value than Bacchanal. The king crab on weekends and snow crab on weekdays is a winner because it is served hot and in small batches to maintain quality. Real drawn butter accompanies the simply steamed or spicier chili flake Cajun versions of delicious crab. Naan bread was delicious in the Indian section and went well with the chicken curry. The ham and pork belly at the carving station were tender and not salty. I recommend the pork belly it's guaranteed to make you as fat as you desire. Red velvet pancakes were delicious and the Nutella was warm and flowing decadently.   Service was excellent and a shout out to Herbie our server who was on point and considerate during every stage of our meal. If you get him you are lucky.   Bring your M Life card to wait in the shorter line.  Like an idiot I forgot mine and had to wait about 25 mins. I didn't cut the line like some mofos who pretended they don't speak English but that's because I'm classy like that. Aria buffet is now on my list of good buffets. Don't tell anyone because the lines will get longer.

9elf7mh1-Rzp6X_8do-g3w.text: No need to waste your time and money here. Food is awful and very salty. Service is good ;however, food needs to upgrade. Very limited selections and nasty Asian food. Had Christmas Eve dinner here today and so disappointed with food quality. What a waste of money and time!

oSJUTYsnx4rSVUKBu3CjKw.text: We went during memorial weekend and they raised the price to 52.99 per person. Food was good, but not worth the almost $60 per person. The crabs legs were the main attraction and they were sweet and delicious, but you would wait in line for 10 mins for a couple crabs legs since everyone would pile their plate with them and you would have to wait for them to bring more out. The meat at the carvery was decent, but sone meat like the char boiled steak was over cook and dry. This buffet is not worth the $60 I paid, if it around $35-$40, I would give it 4 stars instead.

WuBLfvhX1mJ3mdMD5uR79Q.text: Out of all the Vegas buffets I tried, this was probably the best as far as entrees. The night I went they had an amazing salmon dish and a short rib dish that was sooo good. About to drool just thinking about it... Desserts were a bit lackluster but okay.

k5cdR-JTllUskWue7y2vSA.text: Service is terrible. I'm writing this now after waiting an hour with half the tables empty (see picture). On a Monday for brunch. While I was holding my 8 month old in my arms the whole time. As a guest staying at the hotel and on their "fully automated" room dashboard stating that waiting time for the buffet is 10 min.

photos.caption: Photo of The Buffet at ARIA - Las Vegas, NV, United States. After waiting an hour in line we were seated in the half empty brunch area.

wMWB1FQQxdBLDpwSE-jM_Q.text: The only reason why I am giving 2 stars because my waitress has been wonderful. Other then that it's a 1 Star buffer. First of after I paid, I had to wait 35 min to be seated when half of the restaurant was empty. That does not make sense at all. Secondly, the food is terrible. The meats were dry and the rest tasted like microwaved. Absolutely nothing was special about this place to me. Next time I will spend little bit more money and head to the Caesar's Bacchanal Buffett.     Update: I gave another try at Aria Buffett with my wife and this time it was excellent. I really appreciate Stephanie going above and beyond. Thank you.

P9M4qkFki1awJJDWyc0c8A.text: They have a really great buffet, especially given the price you pay. Lunch was delicious--would definitely go back and recommend to others. Desserts included gelato, which was really good! There's also good variety, not like some of the other Vegas buffets.

CLvNCZuernkVNzBN8evCng.text: Stayed at Vdara and tried to stop in there on Saturday morning. We could see through the window that only 1/3 of the tables were taken. Waited 20 minutes in line to pay. We saw people cuing up for then getting in. The guy at the counter said it would only be a few minutes. 20 minutes we decided to ask for our money back. They told us they needed to get a manager. 10 minutes later a manager drops keys off and the lady at the counter gives me my money back. No apology or anything. Very strange and very poor customer service. This whole time there were only 8-10 parties in front of us. For almost $40 a plate you'd expect better service. It's a bummer because the rest of our experience was great.

IzoucqsJGUZPO84G9az61A.text: My family was looking for buffet and this place was the cheapest. The price is reasonable. My 8y/o daughter was free and that's a good thing cuz she eats small portion.

ABXMedrOTOkkUR8qqmT95w.text: Great breakfast buffet.  Lots of selection and great quality.  From traditional breakfast items to Mexican, Indian, Asian, etc.  something for everyone.

lTgVwOTetmU4JH3LSwJggQ.text: Absolutely horrible service! Came with large law enforcement group for annual softball tournament. Approximately 20 if us. They didn't even bother sitting us together and instead everyone was scattered. No one bothered to bring water or provide a drink list. Instead after 20 mins a rude waitress brought us warm beer! I said I didn't ask for beer and she rudely snapped back it was included in the meal. Whatever. I then asked for a wine list. There is no Sauvignon Blanc. This is Vegas for Gods sake. The place looks like an airport eatery, actually much worse. The food was awful! There is a lot of variety all of which are tasteless and frozen tasting like most have stated in other reviews. I cannot believe this place charged us $75 per person! I wouldn't pay $20 for this horrible establishment. I only gave it one star because the crab was decent. With SO many fabulous restaurants in Vegas do not waste your money here!! You'll be better off eating fast food.

ro_2b_1cif_PVgRdz9qPjw.text: Two things to note about my rating.  First, it's a rating acknowledging this is a buffet.  Second, we went to the breakfast buffet.  Aria's breakfast buffet is one of the few buffets worth visiting.  Lots of great options with many unusual offerings (like a variety of humus or red-velvet pancakes).  Had crab claws that were very good.  I shelled a bunch for my friend.  And if you're looking for something really good, have them make you a crab omelet.

sLOh125IQKZU0565Bt1rrA.text: You come here for the crab legs. Pre-cut, all-you-can-eat and delicious. Keep in mind people are typically clamoring for them so you may need to be patient. My first two rounds all I got we're smaller legs because that was all that was left...slim pickings. The third time, however, I waited patiently for the fresh batch of crab legs and was handsomely rewarded. Totally worth it!  Everything else was either just ok or a pass. I tried thier baked salmon (good), clams (gross), new zealand green-lipped mussels (ok), shrimp (good) and eel (eh). For dessert I had cheesecake which was ok and caramel macchiato which wasn't what I expected. I didn't like it.   Moral of the story...it's all about the crab legs. Lesson learned.

ypt4kVS7F7h8JgbFWJwnWw.text: Simply inedible. Seafood sitting around. Guys at the next table talking about defecating and guns. The only good thing was the refund. Praying I don't get violently ill.

0DJnKzekbVspqs9wFwrtlw.text: Good food and they have a locals discount! Service wasn't that great, our server only came once and was never to be seen again. I had to flag down our workers there to give us refills.

9uJndktR6BL6opNCUTNX7Q.text: The food was all good nothing out of the ordinary for Vegas buffets but my only complain is that some of the items are cold when they are supposed to be hot and the guy that serves at the carving station isn't very friendly kind gives off the cafeteria lady vibe!! The waitress on the other hand was a sweet heart and very attentive a must try is the grilled cheese random huh? Oh and the Mac and cheese is probably the best I tasted in a long time!!!

bD3MuRr7FDBjr5TsMF5i0w.text: I'd only give this place a good review if the buffet was offered for 25 bucks. Unfortunately, they are offering this rather crappy buffet for 52 dollars a person. We had to wait for an hour, and they offered no reservations. There were many problems with the food. For one, the crab legs were not what the pictures displayed them as. In the pictures, they are advertised as king crab and snow crab. The crabs actually offered at the buffet were cheap, tasteless crabs that are quite frankly not good. The selection was minimal. The beef was probably one of the few good things, but even then it was served cold. The shrimp were clearly thawed, and the noodles in the noodle soup were not up to par. The sushi used cheap quality fish that I doubt was sushi grade. There was A very limited selection as well. Every thing we ate was clearly low quality. And on top of all this, They are charging 52 dollars! Go to wicked spoon or any other buffet and you'll have a better experience.

wNjm9IUZn1DSF-s9bDm94g.text: First, the service is amazing. Our waitress kept our drinks full (we purchased the 2 for 1 unlimited drinks), we drank the rum punch all night on her recommendation. The crab legs were disappointing though, they weren't kept hot and therefore it was almost impossible to get the meat out which resulted in lots of wasted food. The salad bar was great, everything was super fresh. I can't say I'd go again paying regular prices, but the myVEGAS reward for buy one get one combined with the drinks costing $60 for two people made it worth it.

vQJu6jTWJ9vuSJFkL2GBVQ.text: This buffet has your typical fare but the crab legs are overly salted and not very fresh.   The Asian station is pretty decent with a lot of options which is far bette than just a Panda Express style spread,  including higher quality dim sum and pretty good ramen.  The carving station -- stay away from the steamship but do get the charred steak which is quite tasty

GxufqkzDKRzYQWkf0lSz_w.text: After reading many of the reviews below I must conclude that most of the reviewers do not have much experience with Las Vegas buffets. I have lived in Las Vegas for 9 years and in my opinion the Bellagio and  the M are far superior.

IsJz_9o977OYhAddkyVc5w.text: It sucks to have the server, Ms. Maria. Never came by my table to refill "water." I asked the others twice, but they said Maria will be taking care of the refill. Then waited more than 30 min, she still didn't come by. I had to walk myself to bar area and asked a gentlemen to refill the water for me. Shame on you that I was charged $36 for the brunch but didn't get any service from the beginning to end. Finished meal with first water cup.

p7ldxh4kj58QokxtluPGKg.text: I visited 4 buffet's while in Vegas and this one was THE BEST one! Sadly, I went the day before I was to leave, cause I definitely would have gone back if I had more time. I will be back next year!

photos.caption: Photo of The Buffet at ARIA - Las Vegas, NV, United States. This plate of beef, southwest corn, and mashed potatoes was worth the price of admission alone!
Photo of The Buffet at ARIA - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Delicious seafood!
Photo of The Buffet at ARIA - Las Vegas, NV, United States. The pizza was great!

K83mOWTKv2ro02XDRLUUVQ.text: Expected more!  Ribs were dry, steak dry, chicken over done and dry.  What happened to the crab legs????  Had dined there when it first opened it was great.  This time around very subpar.  Quality not there anymore..  service - well hostess ruined that for us. Aside from that we entered from mlife VIP line only to wait over 30 minutes to get in.  Meanwhile other line was much faster would have gotten in sooner if we lined up there.  When we told hostess we were waiting over 1/2 hour and we would miss our show she told us we can just get a refund or wait up to 2 hours!  It was not even full. Lots of empty tables! Excuse me who are you talking to like that!!??!!??  Will never eat there again!

O4HeIZd9HIqkAwu9dE_nSQ.text: We had a party of three and showed up around 11:00 am on a Monday. It was not a great experience. Most of the food looked old and stale. Most of the food tasted old and stale. There were things I wanted to try such as the big meatball but when I looked at it, it just looked sad and had been sitting there forever. I just couldn't bother to try it for the sake of my own health. The mexican food station was awful, old and dry. The indian food station looked like slop and I couldn't touch that either. The "crab and shrimp" in the seafood station were slim pickins but, if you love muscles they have an abundance of them! I don't know why they started throwing all three of them in together. People just sit there and pick all the crab and shrimp out and leave the muscles. If you're going to be that stingy with them, then just don't bother putting them out at all. It's just not cool. One star for the desert station and gelatto. Do yourself a favor and find another buffet that isn't as expensive as the Aria buffet. ANY one will be better! Blech my stomach is getting upset just thinking about that place!

TZDCqgzdYxZyzVQXNI_IBQ.text: I searched high and low for the best buffet in Las Vegas, and I would have to say that the Aria Buffet is on point.   The best time to come here is about 30mins before breakfast ends and lunch starts so you get to pay the breakfast price, but also get to partake on their delicious lunch. Also it's only 16$ to add bottomless mimosas or beer to your buffet experience and this is the cheapest compared to all the other buffets in Las Vegas, well according to my research anyway...lol  I really enjoyed the quality of food here at Aria. Everything tasted super fresh and delicious. It was easy for me to over eat here because I literally had to try everything.   The wait staff here is also super friendly and they are really on it to bring you your bottomless beverages.

PIjF6sGHRq3YtnnkjASbcA.text: Our first buffet when we arrived in Vegas this trip. We hadn't been to this one before and were excited to try it out. There was a line since we are not M Life members or VIPs, but the line moved at a reasonable pace.  If you do buffets, you know what it's like that first Vegas buffet - your appetite is limitless and you want to eat it all. And ate it all we did. Every. Single. Station. (Except crab legs and pho soup because we don't like those things).  There is something for everyone here. There are even delicious roasted on the grill veggies at the carving station. Chips and dip. Little mini salads. Many foods from around the world.  Like most buffets, it is not super amazing. Like the Naan bread was heavy. The dim-sum taste was mediocre at best. I wished they had a steamed pork bun and they didn't have it. The tandoori chicken was adequate.   The desert section was great. I should have saved more room for this. I wanted to try them all. I almost did but not the pink meringue which supposedly was do die for. The gelato was great and I tried 5 flavors. I wish I had some of the apple pie. Bread pudding isn't my thing so no for that.   Anyway, if this were the 2nd or 3rd buffet I ate at in Vegas, I would have given 3 stars, but since it was the first one and I was so hungry and I ate everything and my stomach had room still and felt happy and well served here - I am giving it 4 stars.   I know the reason why I am fat now is partly because it all started here.

11EGnZu8JpM8hQg94rsIhw.text: Some of the best variety ive seen in Vegas. Nice small portions to try a lot of different items. Friendly service. 20 bucks for all you can drink for two also! Some of the sushi was a little stale but overall the food was high quality even for the few international pieces I didn't care for.

zMnOWcPmo7f9zrIGeiiiyQ.text: I was excited to try this buffet out because it was new and being inside Aria I thought it would just as good as the Bellagio Buffet. The buffet is very pricey just like all other buffets in 5 star hotels but not all live up to the hype such as this buffet. Although it looked very nice and chic, it didn't have large selection compared to Bellagio and Bachannel Buffet. My shrimp cocktail only came in small cups with one shrimp inside. They didn't have a a shrimp pile like most buffets just a small dessert size cup with one shrimp and some cocktail sauce. The king crab legs were very good and so was the rest of the food, I just wished they had a wider selection of food but the dessert section kinda made up for it.  They had a lot of different kinds of cakes with my favorite the key lime pie and the occasional cheesecake, gelato, fresh fruit and warm baked cookies. Restroom is located right behind the dessert section so it beats walking outside of the buffet.  The buffet is located in the 2nd level of the casino right next to the Zarkana theater, Gold Lounge, pool and the hotel elevators. Buffet overall was not bad but I had better.

LvcDZJ-UR3Hc0dlGu5WYmw.text: If you can switch the credit they give you at the hotel for this buffet, do yourself a favor and do so! This buffet has pleanty of choices and none live up to quality. So simply avoid... They do have some seafood which is nice, but overcooked and flavorless! Sushi... Simply awful! So all in all, my worst meal at Vegas.... Wont come again!

yk1nm32-rUk6gwOx9Rb6bQ.text: Not so bad ,however is not the best food. quality is good ,variety not so bad. For those who really enjoy sea food the selection is very good  I've been in almost every buffet in Las Vegas  And this is not the best  Although they have a bottom less wine for 12.99  I've had better, not my taste I guess the selection of food change over the years I was impressed with the pictures I saw but not anymore

photos.caption: Photo of The Buffet at ARIA - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Fresh shrimp Alfredo
Photo of The Buffet at ARIA - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Sushi and pork
Photo of The Buffet at ARIA - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Seafood jambalaya was good

kbl8DzOs9ONdU2Lq2MVOmQ.text: Hadn't been to a buffet for years in Vegas, so I was trying to round up everyone to go to the Wynn buffet.  Unsuccessful because these guys were staying at Vdara, so they had the resort credit.  Fine, whatever, I'll give it a shot.  I can say...pretty good.  Not quite Wynn, but up there.  Before I get to the food, it's important to note how spacious and clean this place is.  There are those buffets that look so ghetto that you really can't feel comfortable pigging out.  This is not one of those buffets, so rest assured that's not a problem.  They space out the food by various kinds of cuisine: Chinese, seafood, meat section, sushi, etc.  Here's the important stuff: king crab legs, rack of lamb, prime rib.  As long as you have those big three, then I'm sold immediately.  Just grab a plate of king crab legs, grab some warm butter, and go to town!  They also have a BBQ beef and pork ribs too, which are a nice change-up from the big three.    Aside from that, don't waste your time on sushi.  It's just standard fare and quite unappetizing if you ask me.  The dim sum here was pretty bleh, but the roasted duck leg and Peking duck was pretty damn awesome.  Raw oysters were also ftw.  And their truffle mac and cheese...this is probably the best thing in this place for real.  I typically stay away from carbs when I come to a buffet, but for truffle anything, I'll always make the exception.  My only gripe is that the shrimp wasn't already shelled, and that's why I can't give it a 5.  Come on, I don't have the time to waste on shucking the shrimp!  Barely made it to dessert, but their cheesecake is pretty good.  They have a pretty nice assortment of desserts as well as gelato.  Of course if you actually make it to dessert, I commend you.  Also have fruits, which has a purpose that I don't really have to make further mention of.  I still wanna go back to Wynn buffet but this was pretty good.

w2-bb8W_ZBscJFb-nGBbzA.text: My colleagues and I stayed at the Aria during CES and had two lunch/brunch meals at this buffet. It was a great compromise when none of us could agree on one type of food -- I'm especially hard to please because a lot of "celebrity chef" restaurant options don't have vegetarian options. The buffet was reasonably priced (for Vegas) at around $24 a person with the option to add unlimited alcoholic beverages for $12.99.   There were never any waits for tables, although we went at slightly off hours, and the food was always fresh. Buffets have always scared me because people are gross and covered in germs, but everything was clean and an A health grade was displayed (s/o to my fellow germophobes). Some of the things I tried that were quite tasty:  Make your own baked potato bar Naan and tandoori vegetables mashed potatoes yams with marshmallows kale and pear salad purple cauliflower cheese blintz (A+) Brussels sprouts gelato  mac and cheese ...  I'm too embarrassed to continue this list. #gluttony

gZSDPTD7ddjTL7NcCCDCqw.text: We had a coupon, otherwise it would have made me crazy to pay $33 for dinner at a buffet.  There were plenty of selections but as in any buffet when food sits around, it's just not cooked to order and some of the selections suffered.  We didn't have to wait to be seated, the decor was nice, light and open but we won't go back.  If we want buffet, we'll go to the Bellagio.

q91QeOztGLeL8h_gW7N_zA.text: A for effort on variety. The taste of the food however was whatever, I could've went to a cheaper buffet and been happier. I sampled from each genre and it was like ok to fill you up but by comparison to the real thing, completely lack luster in flavor.    The wait time was horrendous on a Thursday for lunch at 11 for almost 45 minutes and there were plenty of tables  open. It's like they held it up to avoid people getting back in on the breakfast price.  Speaking of, avoid the scrambled eggs, it seriously tasted like powder eggs (ick)!   Service- The staff however were very nice and attentive. Constantly removing plates and getting drinks refilled fast, filling up food as soon as it got close to empty.  But I would say the price is fair for what the other top tiered hotels charge by comparison. So if you want to check off that new LV Strip hotel buffet on your list of to do's...go for it / why not? Just don't expect to be blown away.

8n5mxdmTykFdCSkh5sqJOw.text: I was in Vegas the past few days, and had the choice for a comped dinner buffet at Aria, or a lunch buffet at Bellagio. After reading reviews for both, I chose the dinner buffet at Aria, and I was not disappointed.  First, let me say this: I did not go to this buffet to eat gluttonously. Instead, I took small portions of several items (6 trips, which I will explain in a bit) so I could sample more items.  I added on the bottomless alcohol package for $12.99 and paired different drinks with different "rounds" of food. I will notate which drink I had. I had one beer, one Pinot Noir, and one Champagne. I also had a glass of club soda, which I used to cleanse my palate between items.  And yes, I took notes while eating dinner!  Round 1 - Stella Artois Beer ----------- * Truffle Mac & Cheese - I'd never had truffles before and I love mac & cheese. This was delicious. The sauce was light, and not overpowering, and the truffles were tasty! * Jasmine rice - This was from the Asian section. It was good - not dry at all. * Prime Rib w/ Creamy Horseradish - a bit dry for my liking. * Meatball w/ Marinara and Parmesean - I had two of these - and they were so good. The marinara sauce was a bit spicy, which was a nice and welcomed surprise. * Multigrain roll with cranberries - I thought this was a standard multigrain roll. When I bit into it, I saw there were cranberries. Bonus!   Round 2 - Stella Artois Beer  ----------- * Carnivore Pizza slice (pepperoni, sausage, bacon) - It had been sitting out for a bit, and was a bit cold. * Pineapple Sausage - This was from the Asian section - quite tasty, I liked the fact the pineapple was mixed in with the sausage. I'd never tried anything like it before. * Chicken Pot Stickers - Cold, hard, and stuck together. Very disappointed. * Vegetable Pad Thai - Good, but not a lot of spice/flavor. But good. * Beef w/ Veggies - Similar to a Mongolian beef, w/o peppers. Was a bit cold. * Provolone Cheese - Wow, these were pungent!  Round 3 - Stella Artois Beer ----------- * Beef Steamship - Like the Prime Rib, this was a bit dry. Perhaps I should have tried the au jus (in retrospect). * Lentil Orzo - Cold pasta salad - orzo, lentil, and tomatoes. Freaking delicious! * Portugese Sausage - One of my most favorite items all night - spicy, tender, and delicious.  Round 4 - Pinot Noir - Parducci, Mendocino City ----------- * Clams - I tried clams for the first time....and I liked them!! * Sirloin Oscar - Served with crab meat, bernaise sauce, and asparagus. This was grilled to order and was the highlight of my meal. Great char and flavor on the steak. I got mine Mid Rare+ (between MR and M). The Bernaise sauce was phenomenal. The crab was delicious as well!  Round 5 - Pinot Noir - Parducci, Mendocino City ----------- * Pork Belly - Nice crispy skin, very tender meat. * Chorizo Rope Sausage - Hello flavor explosion! Spicy and tasty! * Au Gratin Potatoes - Very good - mild flavor, not overly cheesy.  Round 6 - Prosecco Champagne - La Marca, Veneto, Italy ----------- * Red Velvet Whoopie Pie - Nice tender cake, great cream filling. Nuts on top. * Creme Brule - nice glaze, but too creamy inside for my liking. * Coconut Macaroon - Nice toasted outside. I could've eaten so many of these! * Brownie - Rich, chocolatey - it's a brownie! But seriously, this was wonderful. * Oreo Gelato - One word: divine. * Cinnamon Crunch Gelato - The show stealer of the desserts. Oh. My. Gosh.  Regarding drinks, the Pinot Noir was really good for being, what I assume, to be their house Pinot. The champagne was delicious as well. In fact, I will be looking to purchase a bottle of both the Pinot Noir, and the Champagne later this week if I can find them.  While some of the carved items were dry, I will admit I did not use Au Jus, and I can only imagine the difference that would have made. There are so many choices here: Italian, Latin, Indian, Asian, Deli, Seafood, Carvery, Desserts, and much more. I did not even remotely try everything on the buffet, nor could I, as I would not have been able to eat it all. But I will try more items the next time I go back.  Do yourself a favor, and have dinner at the Aria buffet the next time you are in Vegas. Despite some of the items being cold, the service was outstanding. This place gets a solid 4.5 stars from me.

5oQpmbITiFcTWfHOHa9mNA.text: One of the smaller buffets in terms of overall selection in Vegas. Too much seafood, they are definately catering to there Asian clientel here. Not worth the $42 for dinner in my opinion.

cNhpcANoL1ybeY2f1kHTNg.text: A wide variety of shell fish! The most I've seen on a buffet, even had crayfish (crawdads)! Everything I tried I liked, but one can only eat so much! It was a nice thing to see a good amount of vegetables. I really loved the gelato carousel! I've never seen anything like it. Desserts were ok....could have been more cakes on it. I tried the panna cota and it was rich and creamy. I've had better flan though, needed more caramel taste and a bit more smoother, not thick. Place looked very clean, staff friendly and easy with conversations. Never had to ask for a refill, she was always there replacing my empty or near empty glass. Overall, I would recommend this buffet! Nice and relaxing.

ZT29JcEgqAHS7jgAj1ju9w.text: This buffet was such a huge disappointment. Yes they serve crab legs, but I've had better crab legs at Red Lobster. They are really skimpy and you have to fight to get the meat out of them. Also the buffet is really small and doesn't serve much more then crab legs, I kept looking around hoping to find something else. The rest of the food looked really unappetizing and the worst thing is that the food was cold. I would never go here again and I felt completely ripped off.

1P-xaa9PckXjfomk3zAQgQ.text: Food was good, but service was super bad! We were there with a large group on 5/31/18 for a graduation. I asked for water and sprite for my two kids. The server never came back with the drinks. So I asked the other server and she asked if the other server took our drinks order, I said yes but she never came back with it. One of the servers came back later with a pitcher of sprite, however she didn't bring new glass for my 2 kids. So I decided to drink 2 glasses of waters that were on the table so that I could pour my kids their drinks. Also, the service at the carving station was also poor. It's like the customers are a nuisance to servers, they were rude and very unpleasant! If you're going to work in customer service, you might try to be nicer to people. I had higher expectation from this buffet considering its reviews and location. But I'll be sticking to M Resort Buffet as the service staff there are way more pleasant!!!

4FzYh3KVRx2Am5s125FkYg.text: Not really impressed with this buffet. We ate here twice and neither time warranted more than 3 stars.  Arriving after 11am, we had to ask for waffles and cereal, as they stop serving them at 11. The staff did go to great lengths to get us what we asked for, thus deserving the 3 star review. The waitress, however, was slow and inefficient. She brought me coffee and forgot to leave a cup after it took forever to even arrive after getting our drink order. She didn't refill our glasses at all. The buffet itself is sort of a let down. The food is decent and it's limited. It served its purpose in a pinch, but we won't be returning.

6ebsAMYU7IZwIxenGdpImQ.text: I usually don't eat at buffets, but this one was great! Crab legs, oysters, shrimp, you name it! Has food from major Asian regions, and a great meat section. I suppose he weekend dinner rate of 40 plus dollars  is standard. Would come again! Friendly waitress as well!

3sI-wUJMPThK0dWn-2_9TQ.text: Slow!Slow!SLOW! I am a Platinum M-life member and there is a dedicated line for M-Life guest. Tonight wecwaited almost 15 minutes in this line because the cashier was doing whatever it was that she was doing! The regular line ended up calling me over after she saw how disgruntled I was from waiting in my line. It wasn't even but 2 guest ahead of me and that's the sad part! I guess I expected more because the name ARIA holds. I've been to this buffet at least 3-4 times and I can honestly say that it's never consistent! It really just depends on the visit. Tonight I finally decided to go ahead and give my general consensus of what I think about this particular buffet. It's probably at the bottom of my top buffets and slowly moving off my top list completely!  to go to with the WYNN being at the top followed by the Cosmopolitains buffet. Here's why.. I think that for $39.99 a person the quality of meats and seafood could've been much more better. I know they can do better because I've had better here! The crab legs have two different options.. Both cold and hot.. Neither one of them were worth my time or up to par for me tonight.. The warm ones barely had any crab meat inside and the cold ones had the worse "fishy" taste to them which in result turned me completely off! They market these "endless" crab legs all over the place like they are something to write home about..more like write home and tell them how worthless they are is more like it! I headed to the meat carving station and went with the beef ribs and the center island station was preparing sirloin steaks at your request. The ribs were so dry I had to soak them in bbq sauce to save the day. The steak was Probably was the best part of my visit. I feel like there could've been more and for $86 and some change for two people I left with a bit of dissatisfaction that's for sure. Took forever for refills on drinks! And To leave an even more bitter taste in my mouth I got home to only find out that the cashier over charged me for the buffet an additional $39.99 and although yes she reversed it she could've at least told me there was an error! I had to call the next morning the find out the explanation for this charge. Manager explained she didn't see the charge but from what I explained she could only imagine that the cashier already reversed it and because it was the weekend I wouldn't see my money until Monday..smh go figure! That's the slick behavior I DONT like. Watch your credit card statements would be my advice! On the bright side we walked over to see Zarkana so if you see seeing the show this is an okay option to dine at last minute before the show..

Photo of The Buffet at ARIA - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Beef Ribs..Cream Corn.. mashed potatoes.. Sirloin steak
Photo of The Buffet at ARIA - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Dinner buffet for 2

aDfiG2VZhWWmmfDNh4e5Qg.text: I was very impressed with the buffet at Aria. Great variety of ethnic foods. I especially liked the Sunday brunch buffet, great variety of breakfast items, all their pancakes are delicious, they had about 3 different kinds. Everything is so fresh and yummy. Of the desserts, the bread pudding was by far the best. Only thing I wasn't so impressed by was the service, but ultimately didn't matter too much in a buffet setting.

P3YIdYF9QgKJuVyp77T01Q.text: I wasn't sure if I wanted to eat at the buffet here because of the mixed reviews.  But we decided to since it was so cheap.  $14.95 for breakfast, we would have been lucky to get a breakfast that cheap at Encore!  I wasn't even able to finish my one plate but I really liked my made to order omelet with cheese, spinach, bacon, & mushrooms.  They had about three different kinds of sausages, crispy bacon, and assorted cold cut meats & cheese.  The cute little waffles weren't bad either.  I seriously cannot do buffets anymore, my tummy ain't what it used to be.  But the breakfast buffet here is alright, there's probably a better one or two on the strip, but you can't beat the price.  The hashbrown balls kind of had a funny taste to it.  Half of the fruit I sampled were sweet.  The apple crepe was just okay.  And on my way out I finally got to meet Janice C. for a few minutes as she was in line with her family.  Yay for Yelp buddies in Vegas!    The made to order omelet station and the bacon were yummy, these were the hilights of the buffet for me since I didn't eat much.  Loved the vanilla like scent lingering throughout Aria as well.  The price is right and the wait was pretty minimal.  This place wouldn't be number one on most people's lists, but in my opinion for breakfast it's not bad at all.

photos.caption: Photo of The Buffet at ARIA - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of The Buffet at ARIA - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of The Buffet at ARIA - Las Vegas, NV, United States. My first &amp; only plate.

GKCCiVIM32CCC7hHCfc-rg.text: It was okay typical buffet in Vegas. The food was not bad but it didn't wow us away. We did like a lobster mac and cheese they had.

2BZ-Pz1QPR0vL3f8BWNEHg.text: Not nearly as good as the buffet at the Bellagio. Nice open layout, but very limited food choices. If you come later, be prepared to get leftovers at the desert station.  The food was tasty, however it seemed small for $40 bucks!!! Plenty of crab legs for all the greedy people who come here to eat for 2 hours!! Be prepared to wait at least 30 minutes to be seated.

gime-9LGq6odk5u3AjKneg.text: Came here on a Saturday night and we waited in line for about 30 mins or so. A good thing about coming here for dinner on the weekends is that they serve unlimited wine!  Plus each person gets half and order of lobster! The lobster came out piping hot and they added a mustard dipping sauce which was good. ( I stuck with butter and lemon)  The food is pretty decent here. The quality of food is great.  They make their portions in smaller batches, which was nice. There is a cold, hot, carving, middle eastern, italian, sushi and american stations.   King crab legs were already halved for us which were more easy to eat!! nom nom nom! I must have ate 2 plate fulls of them suckers! Prime rib was really good not dry at all. Chicken curry was not spicy on bit. The fresh naan and garlic naan was AWESOME! Add a little mint julep was the perfect condiment. The desserts were good. I enjoyed the cream brulee, chocolate covered strawberries and gelato. Oh and if you are a coffee drinker, order a cup of joe. My friends claim its one of the best they have tasted.  Service was slow. We had to ask for them to clear our plates and even that they took long. Selction wise its not as grand as the one in the Rio but quality wise its super good. I can't complain. I just came for the crab legs :)

0oPKXewsvRztzVZg4n8JZw.text: We went there right before 11 am so we paid breakfast price for lunch which really good deal($15/pp) Nothing special about the food but the desserts were awesome! We tried one of everything.

photos.caption: Photo of The Buffet at ARIA - Las Vegas, NV, United States

JjwigDHRj8jOffWPm3ka9A.text: Went there for a Saturday brunch.  Had a good a variety of food, which, for a casino buffet, was very good. the  crab and prime rib was fresh, and having both breakfast and lunch available was convenient for my appetite.  No complaints and left feeling I got my money's worth. Would definitely return.

8bEvTl5yWQHBfDyqQejwEg.text: Great option (although it is pricey) for gluten free or other food allergies. Chef Ray came out and gave me a very thorough tour noting which items were safe, which may have cross-contamination, or were dishes to avoid.

GNh_xEnmQjDD6aKdbgxwYA.text: went here for brunch and they failed me.  it was overpriced food that tasted like cardboard! they couldnt even make it up in their service department.  FAIL

photos.caption: Photo of The Buffet at ARIA - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of The Buffet at ARIA - Las Vegas, NV, United States

N7qLZSxANb1L5Cvfn1xhbQ.text: Ouch, such bad reviews here. Why????  Came here for lunch on a Monday afternoon. Prices were $20 a person.  I was VERY surprised that they had crab legs and jumbo shrimps. They even had Prime rib available. WOW! For $20? Did I get a discount?  I had the same exact food at Wynn's dinner and paid $45 a person. Yes, Aria didn't have that much, but that's why they charge people $20.  My meal was good, the decor was nice, something different. I like the lighting the most. Service was good and fast.   They had Chinese food, Dim Sum, didn't try it, why would I? I can get the real stuff at home. The desserts were good. My favorite was the counter that was ice cold, to keep the desserts chilled.

0XQzZYXuBwpv9u4vgLenaA.text: So after seeing the horrible reviews on yelp, we were hesitant about the buffet but since we were staying at the Aria we just decided to try it out. We went for dinner on a Saturday evening and were very pleasantly surprised!    GOOD (my favs): Lobster tails, prime rib, chocolate covered strawberries  BAD: Service  - I notice that none of the reviews mention the LOBSTER so i assume that's new, but that made it all worthwhile.  Without it, I'd probably agree that this buffet might not be the best bang for your buck in vegas. They also had crab legs, shrimp, and mussels.  - Prime rib was really good. They had flavored skirt steak as well along with several other meats (pork, roast beef... don't remember all)  - Took FOREVER for our server to take away the plates.  They just had ONE person waiting on our table so it would take a while for her to get around to all the tables.  They should just have anyone passing by take away the dirty plates but they only had our ONE server do it. That was our only complaint. My husband also thought the lighting was too bright (like a cafeteria) but i didn't mind it.  - True that they don't have a bunch of different pastas or "filler" dishes that many other buffets may have but they have the important stuff (meats & seafood) that I look for.  Bottom Line: Worth it for the Lobster & Prime rib.

pUPacmpLIjwwY7q9mkJR1Q.text: Very long line at 1240 pm on a Friday even though only half  the place was occupied. Started at the snow crabs and the first plate in the stack had a hair on it and the second two had bits of food. Very unappetizing. The snow crabs were cut in half so no special tools needed but there was hardly any meat. The sushi, of which I tried 5 different rolls, was all not tasty. The roast chicken was good but the server was rude. The mashed potatoes were completely white and I think might have been instant. What was delicious...the pizza with home made crust, the salad bar, ham and roast chicken and the peach and berry cobbler. Also the waitress was very friendly and attentive.

sxGbO0fYVHTTlSIlyOQBgw.text: HORRIBLE HOSTESS'  and MANAGEMENT!!!!!  I visited the Aria buffet this monday (march 21st) and I was so excited because I love the hotel and had the best service all 3 days that I stayed there! I had never been to a buffet in Las Vegas but made sure to make a point to visit one this time around. I really wish I would've gone to the buffet at the Wynn beause the reviews for it are stellar!  My girlfriends and I arrived at the buffet around 130pm for lunch the price was great about $23 and the cashier was friendly. There were maybe four people ahead of us so there was no wait and there were tons of open tables. After paying they had us wait there at the register for the Hotess to come and take us to our table. After about 10-15minutes of waiting there were about 10-15 people lined up behind us all paid and waiting on the Hostess. By this time we are asking the cashier 'what's the hold up?" and "why is it taking so long to be seated?" The sweet lady (shikieko) who took our proof of payment was getting flustered because we weren't the only customers questioning the wait. Another man in line offered to go and find the Host for her because she expressed that she couldn't leave her post. After a few minutes more of complaining from all the customers waiting Shikieko ran off to find the Host who were no where in site. They came strolling out in a pair (one was named Kirly, she was especially RUDE) without any sense of urgency and still chatting to one another as they approached us. At this point a friend of mine was was pissed and requested to speak to the manager. The manager took a minute to come out as well so when she came we were all already at the buffet rushing to get food because we were on our way to the airport. Once we got to our table the manager (Brittany) was standing there. She started by saying "Did you all want to speak with a manager?" We replied "yes we did we are not satisfied with the service we recieved at the front counter! The Host are not friendly and have no sense of customer service or urgency we have been waiting for nearly 15 minutes to be seated and there are several tables available" Before I could finish she replied "oh well they came as soon as they could they were busy clearing tables, but ill talk to them". Before I blurted out BITCH what fuck is your problem you owe us a damn apology!!!!! My gf stepped in and said "Tthey were no where in site and a 15 minute wait is just unacceptable when there are several free tables. It's not busy in here and they could have thanked us for waiting, apologized or something!" Brittany replied "oh ok well ya I will talk to them." We also brought in a cake with us. We had no intentions of cutting the cake there our plan was to grab a cocktail at a lounge in the Aria and cut the cake there. Brittany made sure as she walked away from the table to say "oh by the way you all can't cut that cake in here!" We were extremely pissed at this point.  So we conitued to eat, but the food was nothing spectactular. They had a a few dishes from several different cuisines (Italian, Mexican, Japanese, American, seafood, roast beef, and a pasta bar) Im a vegetarian so I wasn't impressed. I had a a few avacado rolls, vegetable rolls, mixed green salad, corn on the cob, french toast and tofu salad. Believe it or not the best thing was the damn french toast everything else I tried was so mediocre. So after we ate we decided to cut our cake and offer our sweet server Shikieko some she decilened; but wecontinued to nibble and left the rest there in hopes the manger would see!!!!  DON'T GO HERE THE MANAGER IS BEYOND RUDE SO WHAT CAN EXPECT FROM HER RAGEDY ASS EMPLOYEES!!!!!!  Really sad my stay at the Aria ended this way!

nXXY_2tFynxySh_EflD0XQ.text: We have been to many buffets in Vegas and this is one of the worst! The crab legs are a joke! The rest of the food is barely edible. The best thing was the salad which does not say much! Go to Caesars Buffett. Much better!

0p_3J-Q-CQqy4LqVVjDVWg.text: Yum!!  Pros:  Unlimited wine (I had some 8 plus glasses! cheap but yummy, and unlimited, so who cares??), super friendly service (everyone was so sweet) and delicious food. Also, as a vegetarian, I had no trouble finding anything to eat! I even feel like I got my money's worth (35 something pp for dinner).   Cons:  While there were veggie options, I had to ask about a bunch of things (like soup) to find out if there was any broth or anything in it. And no one knew! Not only that, they didn't really offer to find out. I just skipped them all, but it was a little strange that they didn't know! Also, dessert was a little lame. Granted, we didn't get to dessert until they were almost closing the buffet, but there was only one kind of ice cream out (butterfinger...bleh!) and none of the plates we tried tasted worth the calories. The cobbler was good, but sort of the tail ends.   All in all, I loved it, but it would have been nice if they had more than two options for wine selections (i.e. substitute beer/champagne). Also, my fourteen year old sister cost the same as the adults drinking! That was sort of lame. I love the Aria, though, and I would be down to go back to this buffet for a different meal!

xcXoU1psVFenfdsr5nLhaA.text: There's a reason why Aria's buffet is one of the only buffet's in Vegas in which you do not have to wait in line.  Like most Vegas buffets, they feature foods from many different cultures: Asian, Mexican, American, etc. The quality of the food is subpar, especially when you're paying 35 dollars for brunch. The only customized made to order items were the omelets. There was not much quality food selection for the price. The only really expensive thing were the crab legs. If you want to get your money's worth eat like 2 dozen crab legs. However, there are 2 redeeming factors. 1) the desserts. Their dessert selection was great (though Wynn's buffet is better) They also had plenty of options for people restricted to low sugar diet. They were all well plated and delicious. 2) the service. The service was great. We had drinks right away and our server always replaced our beverages before they were empty. This was very helpful since we were very dehydrated after a long night drinking.

Hg5mmRZt1K2-0nwS6py2dA.text: I'm not a fan of buffets in general.  I just can't eat my money's worth.   I found the buffet to be pretty good value for the money you spend.  Seems like the strategy is to focus on quality than large selections (plus for me).   I spent my time eating crab legs, oysters, shrimp (ie. the expensive stuff).  Some of my friends got the meat (they said the prime rib was salty but other meats were good) and I tried the cake desserts and I thought they were horrible.    All in all, for the $40 range for dinner, I think it's top 3.

c-SwbMEaHbAL7qiBTP7HaQ.text: So I went there with a group of friends that had been to  different buffets in Vegas before but since it was my first time there I have no basis for comparison, so have this in mind when reading the review.  1) price: 45$ for lunch, would have been 75$ or something if we went half an hour later, it would have been dinner, we went there before but we ate from both tables :) 2) the queue: horrible, about one hour and something 3) food quality: acceptable, a few of he items like the big lamb that was there and the chef cut you the number you pieces you wanted, that was too raw, not cooked enough for me and I guess many others that were there, but the desserts were YYYAAAMMMMM  The next time I go to Vegas I will go try other ones, probably that will give me better view for aomparison.

UwGY9c6Ci_aPY5SBkGvuTg.text: Very pricey, but very good.  I suggest having a welcoming stomach, your hangover may prevent you from enjoying it to the extent that it costs.

RbGLzR0dyoYHi0Vc5ec3ZA.text: Horrible buffet! Not a really big selection. You would think since the buffet is inside Aria it would be at least decent but I was wrong. Don't waste your money here.... I would've been a lot more happier if I just got a burger from McDonald's or something!!

yx3CGKQDajFmkw7MhN-1DA.text: Went for breakfast. Cheaper than eating in the cafe. Everything gluten free is labeled as such, amazing! Gluten free choices are basic though- eggs, bacon/sausage, potatoes and fruit. Food was just ok.

TcpYU-ND90wouQkimVXgog.text: We went to the Buffet at  Aria on a Saturday night.  The food was pretty good. You get a lobster, and all you can eat seafood, crab legs, soups, etc. It is one of the better buffets you can go to.  This review is boring - the Buffet at Aria is boring compared to what it could have been. That's all.  Bottomline: This buffet is worth it for the price (almost $40), but if the line is as long as it was for us (about 1 hour), you might as well go somewhere else.  I had the Studio B Buffet at the M Resort for lunch that day, and although this is a good buffet, this buffet doesn't compare.

ZRFVI54u3z6UzH-_lLU0-w.text: Don't trust my review because I got a buzz off the bottomless bubbly.  JK  Went with a group of 6 on NYE and there was a bit of a wait, no biggie. Also, the price was $36 for NYE with the champagne so it was def on the steep side....darn holiday pricing   - Crab legs were awesome because they were cut it half so you didn't have to pry the legs open to get the meat   -The prime rib was way too salty, it was weird.  I would normally go back for another round but it tasted odd -Belgian waffles made me LOVE Belgian waffles -Dessert was amazing - mango panna cotta, carrot cake, strawberry short cake, a gelato stand!!  Overall pretty good but not sure I would come back to this buffet

-yqj0qhNB4j2naie3GP7CQ.text: The Buffet is always clean and I like their food. ..we come here everytime we're in Vegas.

ZMBYtiWJsf4-YQqns785qQ.text: This was the only buffet we tried (first time visitors) so we don't have anything to compare it to in town. It was nice and at $40/pp reasonably priced. The variety is small but great tasting, and I could have eaten the Na'an all night. The husband enjoyed the brisket. Everything was clean and bright but a bit too cafeteria style for my taste. Overall I wouldn't go out of my way to eat here but if it's convenient it's a good option.

MZkl8n3cChC6jH0X-FWzTg.text: Visited for Sunday brunch.  Paid $53 for 2 people. Not bad for 5 start hotel buffet.  Pleasantly surprised.  They had crag legs, typical american breakfast items, chinese (they have Congee!), mexican, italian, meats, sushi (not the real sushi with raw fish, just vege roll types), deserts, fruits, and etc.  Decor wasn't as nice as Wicked Spoon but food was better I think.  And more items too.  I saw the sign that you get whole lobster for 2 and unlimited wine for dinner buffet.  Not a bad deal.  I'd recommend this place.

j2OELKiaS44MHz6E3KFJzw.text: When we arrived for breakfast there was a line, took about 15 minutes. Although, when your hungry it feels like forever. The food was good, it was an upscale buffet with ceichve, prawns, and oysters on the half shell. They had food latin, Indian, Chinese, and American food too. The best part about their buffet is the endless drinks, for 12.99 all you can drink. We chose mimiosas it was brought to us in wine tumblers, filled to the brim. Lots of champagne with some orange juice, perfect! After three we were feeling very good, could have stayed there all day.

1abTBno3Wmcgle9YsJ9PaA.text: I feel like this buffet was nothing too special which made me sad. The Aria is such a pretty hotel with other nice places to hang out and eat and this was just less than what I expected. I should've taken my 30something bucks and just gone back to the spa and brought a pastry from Jean Phillipe with me. I was underwhelmed - the spread is not exciting at lunch. I guess I expected something new, special. This hotel buffet could have been in Vegas 5 years ago, and this hotel just opened last year. The saving graces for me were three things: the fried rice - that was very good and not drenched in soy sauce or greasy; the cooked to order pasta bar, which was delicious; and the dessert table which was pretty and I had two creme brulee.  I wouldn't come back here. Take a 20 minute walk over to Wicked Spoon.

Be2Lj32bmWk40I-PdBS8Ow.text: I had the Breakfast Buffet here on my last day in Vegas.  It's a bit pricier than what I wanted to pay for breakfast ($23 + tip), but if you're hungry enough in the morning, it can be worth it.  They have virtually every breakfast item you can think of (omelette station, corned beef hash, eggs benedict, yogurt, fruit, crepes, etc.)  But what was surprising is that they also had food normally associated with lunch/dinner.  They had decent-sized crab legs and the largest, peeled boiled shrimp I've seen!

photos.caption: Photo of The Buffet at ARIA - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Breakfast buffet plate
Photo of The Buffet at ARIA - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Entrance to the Buffet

4_BIzrikv1bc2JAubDnKkQ.text: Probably a 3.5. I like the short line for Pearl members. Buffet itself is small and limited, the choices are ok but not great. Prime rib was delicious but fairly common at buffets. Nothing special here really. Spend a few more dollars and go next door to Wicked Spoon at Cosmo instead

HBAQJRIonsoC_eYBq76XMQ.text: I had Thanksgiving dinner here with family and friends. I was a little worried about coming here with all the "not so good  reviews" on yelp but,  it was actually good.  REAL good. Prime rib was tender and juicy, crab leg was on the small side but, its ayce. turkey was juicy and not dry, ham was wonderful, sushi was fresh, especially the salmon and tuna rolls. They also had a good variety of desserts and gelato. Thier Har Gow and Siu Mi was pretty tasty. Service was awesome, my plates were gone by the time I came back with my seconds and thirds.  The seven of us came out to $399 and our group was abt 25 people, Kids were regular price, no discount or half price.  I woulda given them 5 stars if they were in the low to mid $40's and kid half price and not $57 p/p tax and tip included but, it was still worth it especially when some1 in our group had VIP status and we waited less than 15 mins and bypassed 200-300 people..

photos.caption: Photo of The Buffet at ARIA - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of The Buffet at ARIA - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of The Buffet at ARIA - Las Vegas, NV, United States

N92-Bliybd8O4OkFS0WUBg.text: Dined here for the brunch buffet and it was just alright.  First off we had to wait in line for about half an hour which wasn't too bad as the line moved fairly quickly.    The worst part was that the dining room was only about three quarters full and if they had filled the entire room there would only be a line about half as long.  (And you would think that they would want to run at capacity as it was a Saturday afternoon.)  Another bad thing that they did was to not even have the table set when they sat us.  So our hostess showed us to our table which had no glasses, no cutlery, nothing at all really on it.  So we decided to go check out the buffet line and even after getting our food we arrived back to find the table as we had left it.  And this was about 10mins after we had first been seated, still no way to eat our food.  So we went to an unoccupied table and took the cutlery off of there.  Well now on to the food.  This food was not spectacular at all, and you think it would be from this beautiful upscale hotel but it was just a letdown.  The crab had no taste and was just bland.  Even adding salt and butter didn't help this crab.  It tasted like they may have killed it three times over.  It is hard to even remember anything spectacular on the buffet line.  What can I say this place was passable as a buffet but for the price definitely will not be back again.

T6C2CMESyW1vsb6-JpEfeA.text: I just read in the Wall Street Journal that Aria has reduced their Buffet budget by $200,000. This explains the drastic difference of the food quality from the opening week to months later. online.wsj.com/article/S...

E8YSfZCb9m5fRElaEAhrxg.text: My wife and I have stopped eating at buffets because we no longer fill our plates and return 2, 3 or 4 times. So often, the price seems too high for the amount of food we end up eating and we don't like feeling stuffed.   After visiting the Buffet at Aria, we realized our approach was mistaken.   We paid our $29.99 per person and took the tour around a very well stocked buffet with foods of all kinds, including Salads, Meats,  Italian, Chinese, Indian, Japanese, a very well stocked Dessert bar and more. We carefully selected only small amounts of each food we sampled, which allowed us to try more foods without overeating.  What a wonderful surprise. All the foods were fresh and tasty. The prime rib was simply divine.  And the banana  foster dessert was addictive.    We ended up enjoying a wide variety of foods, did not walk out stuffed, and - the best part - ended up paying much less than most of the other restaurants we visited on this trip.   Yes, we'll stop here again on our next trip.

ePArw20xeIwJFIvjNkuyng.text: I'm pretty confident that the Aria buffet has solidified my idea that big name Vegas buffets totally aren't worth it.  A friend of a friend suggested that, "Duuude. the Aria brunch buffet is sick brah, for real." So we wrangled up all 11 of the troops and dragged our butts across the street, in the rain and cold, up and down those annoying Vegas hanging walkways...only to pay $30 for a barebones sad-ass buffet.  Ok, heads up here. These people charge an automatic 18% gratuity on parties larger than 9. Don't get hosed like we did and split your group in half. All they're going to do is push together two tables of 5! Why are we tipping them anyhow when we're doing all the footwork of bringing the food to the table? Be careful, they'll also try to con you into buying the champagne brunch...they don't tell you that the alcohol is an extra $7 charge.  Food was kind of on par with Mc. Donald's. Textures were off, proteins were crazy dry. Hash browns suck...and were chewy. And don't you dare touch that sushi! Day old sushi does not a buffet make! The only thing i thoroughly enjoyed was the lovely fluffy waffles and maple syrup.   Okay, let's be serious here, Aria: you can't slap the label "GELATO" on tubs of generic ice cream. Don't you dare put nuts in apple pie, either! BLASPHEMY!  I feel cheated. I feel like this should get zero stars...but it should get a Bonus star for having a gorgeous hotel to walk through to compensate for a less-than-stellar experience.

BjD5ve-Sq1uHQFg_p79Vrg.text: Stay Away Stay Away Stay Away!  There's literally 10 better buffets within a short distance.  I have NO IDEA how they could have come up with such a lousy buffet at such an expensive property but, shazzam, they did it.  Just not good.  The only reason I don't give it 1 star is because I reserve that for places that are nearly or actually inedible.

aiesnwrb-z2cXQURPQE1vw.text: Brand new but super confusing, with too many complicated and unappetizing offerings. Took me three fricken rotations through the stations just to find the bacon and eggs benedict were not to be found. Super dissapointing for $20 breakfast!

wms7kSG5e-bq9wl0lZYTzQ.text: Having hunted through the Wynn Buffets on several occasions, I felt compelled to reach out to something new... Aria does a really nice job for the price (28$), and I really can't see why people hate; perhaps the timing? Our party arrived in the evening, when I believe the Buffets are firing on all cylinders.   Food was fresh, desserts were incredible (OmFg actually!), and unlike the complaint from some about the lack of King Crab Legs, there were actually stacks and stacks of our fine decapod crustaceans!  We left more than satisfied and glad to have tried something new for a change... In Vegas, it's so easy to gravitate towards the familiar and what works. Hunters and Gatherers join in on a feast at Aria!

UJ9ZkBqsINQBEP9C24hacg.text: Came on the Saturday after thanksgiving so they added around $8 to the price. The quality of the food was good, but not a wide range of food. They only had well done prime rib, and the dessert selection was all muffins and breads, no gooey concoctions at all. No pies or cakes!  I was  very disappointed in this buffet.

p1DeFy5hGA7i7YFIQnSYMA.text: Unfulfilled and dissatisfaction would probably best sum up my experience Sunday night at the Aria Buffet's signature "gourmet dinner". It is unfortunate that a property such as the Aria would fail to have a buffet that matched it's elegance and stature.  Expect to pay around 37 dollars for  Sunday night's special gourmet dinner (I'm assuming the price is the same for Friday and Saturday nights as well).  I found the selection to be rather limited ... for this price I expected much much more.  Prime rib was decent ... though it was immediately canceled out by the second-rate lamb sharing it's carving station with.  Crab legs were decent but certainly nothing to write home about ... the rest of the selection were pretty mediocre at best.  Certainly not enough fresh fish selection the likes you would expect at say the Bellagio.  The gourmet dinner also included wine which is a nice touch ... unfortunately the only red available is a Merlot (and as you guess ... I'm not really a huge fan of the Merlot ... but I'm  not holding that against them - it's the thought that counts).  The dinner also provides for "one Maine lobster" per person .... however, I was not told that this "Maine lobster" would be a teenage lobster at best.  In fact, I'm pretty certain that this lobster had just got done asking it's parents for it's first iPod Touch before being plucked from the ocean's floor and served at my table.  Had I known in advance I would have spared his life and came back for him a year later.  The buffet did have some delightful naan bread (Aria boasts the only tandoori oven available at a Vegas buffet) ... however the curry that accompanied it was a bit pedestrian.  The lone bright spot for me was the dessert - it was certainly the highlight of the entire meal.  I feel horrible writing such a scathing review for a meal that I didn't even pay for (it was comped by the hotel ... though later returned to the casino via the craps table).  However, for the price they are charging I feel that there are certainly much better options available.  Picking this buffet is like getting two face cards in black jack only for the dealer to beat you by having 21 - you expected to win ... but in the end ... reality kicks in.

_Xg4c77fywZmMuVSxHFTzw.text: There's nothing so spectacular here that warrants a really great review. The food was mediocre - definitely not what I expected from such a new, and excitingly modern hotel. Crab legs were cold, and nothing really jumped out and screamed "FRESH!" To me. However, they do have moscato d'asti on the "all you can drink" additional option (for $12) - so I was able to get my money's worth out of that. I'm disappointed I paid full price for the dinner buffet. Rookie mistake. I wouldn't return.

DTS8T1ZuLQWz-c43vtpxXw.text: SO disappointed. In Vegas last few days, wanted to do one nice buffet (without breaking the bank!). I did a lot of research on multiple sites. I was with 2 companions who are gluten free, so wanted to make sure that they had enough choices. Many Yelp (and other) reviews mentioned this buffet as one that had a lot of gf options; general consensus was that the food was good. Neither was True.    First of all, if you're going within the next couple of weeks, beware - the price is NOT what's listed on the website, dinner Mon-Thurs $36.99.  Yes, there's an asterisk that says that prices may vary during holiday weeks - maybe it was there last week and I just missed it, but I sure missed it. So it was quite a shock to hear that 3 buffets with the "unlimited pour" (alcohol) came to about $215. Of course we could have left, but it was after 9:30 at night, we were very hungry, and my elderly relative just could not walk any more (you have to walk through what feels like a mile of Aria to get to the buffet).  So okay, it will be our big splurge meal.  Wow, what a mistake.  There were a few items that were good, one or two that were okay, and quite a few that were not good at all. Nothing outstanding.The service was good, our server was attentive and friendly, but it didn't come close to making up for the food. - Beef (steamship) and shrimp were good - Clams (tiny manila clams) were fine, mussels were not so good. Crab legs were, well, buffet crab legs. - Salad bar wasn't huge, but was fine. Pre-made salads looked great but were mostly pretty bad. - Vegetables - tasteless - Salmon and baked chicken - dry and tasteless - Leg of lamb - grey and hard, not a great flavor - Mashed potatoes - how do you mess up mashed potatoes? By putting in WAY too much salt (and we are a group that likes salt!); they also looked dried out, like they'd been sitting there all night - Crawfish - horrible. Inedible. I spit it out.  - Desserts: meh. Nothing particularly great. Creme brulee was okay. Gelato was okay, but it's not self serve so you can't take tiny amounts of several to see what you like. - Gluten free options: My mistake perhaps, but when I hear that a place has gluten free options I don't think that means they have rice and salad. Of course those are gluten free, duh, but I expected more. There is gluten free pizza, if you ask for it; the pizza guy seemed quite taken aback by the request but made one for us. It was fine. Woo hoo. Gluten free desserts were gelato (some flavors, others had pretzels or cookies or whatever), creme brulee, and I think a chocolate mousse. That's it. We asked the lady serving gelato if any desserts were gluten free. She was clearly trying to help us but clearly English was not her first, second or any number language. Her response was "spoons on table."   Oh well,  It was a fun trip anyway.

OPr-iNJxPF9xHAyDbsBtrA.text: Given free dining credit upon check in & high recommendation from the front desk, we decided to give Aria Buffet another try since it is 're-opening' on the 2nd day. The staff that seated us promised that 'the new buffet is much better than the previous one'. However, it is still the same as before & nothing special.   The cons:  1) Food were mostly warm, very close to cold 2) Selections are still limited with 'nothing special'.  3) Not enough servers. Plates were not collected promptly compared to other buffets on the strip 4) Our silverware were cleared as we were done when we were only 1+ hour into brunch. We returned to our table with most items cleared.  5) Dessert bar were empty most of the time during brunch. I'm talking about 10-11 am when ppl started to come in.  6) Super plain Asian food selection. They were only serving fried rice, fried noodles, and some other small plates.   Not likely to come back & I'm sure most users that ate there before will feel the same. Still selections are too limited for the $$$.

4bgGw-nAAvlrE4YdrSjxLQ.text: Overpriced buffet.  We decided to go to the Aria buffet because we were staying the Vdara and there are no restaurants at the Vdara.  We went on a Friday night and got scammed on the price.  For 2 people the buffet cost over $90.  They told us it was the gourmet buffet.  Evidently gourmet means king crab legs and oysters even when the everyday buffet has snow crab legs.  Serious disappointment.  All buffets on the strip are the same; same food, same prices.  Go to Freemont Street to get a buffet at a better price.
